Ben Nevis 45 Year Old 1966 (cask 8193).palate: Spiced and warming. Notes of clove-studded oranges, peach juice, toasted oak and honey.
Ben Nevis 45 Year Old 1966 (cask 8193).name: Ben Nevis 45 Year Old 1966 (cask 8193)   Directors' Cut (douglas Laing)
Ben Nevis 45 Year Old 1966 (cask 8193).notes: wood, oak, peach, walnut, toasted, bread, butter, toffee, cocoa, honey
Ben Nevis 45 Year Old 1966 (cask 8193).nose: Very rich and sherried, with notes of treacle and dates. Hints of sticky toffee pudding and walnut loaf, raspberry jam and a dusting of cocoa.
Ben Nevis 45 Year Old 1966 (cask 8193).note categories: wood, fruits, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Ben Nevis 45 Year Old 1966 (cask 8193).description: Just look at how marvellously dark this whisky is. Regard it! This was distilled in 1966, before a 45 year maturation in sherry wood. It was bottled by Douglas Laing for their Director's Cut range, and there are just 119 bottles of it in the world…

Laphroaig Select.palate: The peat is there, but it's taking it easy and letting the bright notes of lemon, green apples and mint stand out. Darker baking spice notes develop further on.
Laphroaig Select.name: Laphroaig Select
Laphroaig Select.notes: oak, lemon, spice, peat, smoky, barley
Laphroaig Select.nose: Classic, medicinal peat notes up front, supported by citrus-y, chocolate-y sweet notes and soft barley.
Laphroaig Select.description: For the Laphroaig Select, the Islay distillery has taken whisky from a number of different types of cask, including Oloroso Sherry butts, white American oak, Pedro Ximenez seasoned hoggies, Quarter casks and first fill bourbon casks. Quite a "selection", wouldn't you say? A laid-back addition to the Laphroaig core range of single malts.

Mackmyra Midnattssol.palate: Warming oak, coffee bean and golden syrup. Floral notes develop on the mid palate, with citrus bringing some brightness along the way.
Mackmyra Midnattssol.name: Mackmyra Midnattssol
Mackmyra Midnattssol.notes: wood, oak, citrus, lemon, spice, bread, vanilla, floral, coffee, honey
Mackmyra Midnattssol.nose: Oak spice, pear skin and vanilla fudge. Light grassy hints, lemon peel and lightly-toasted bread with a lovely layer of honey.
Mackmyra Midnattssol.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, vanilla, flowers, coffee, feint
Mackmyra Midnattssol.description:
The Midnattssol single malt whisky from Swedish distillers Mackmyra is initially matured in Sherry and bourbon casks, as well as casks made from Swedish and American oak. It is then finished in casks which previously held wine made from birch sap. Yes, we're rather intrigued by this too!

Midnattssol, if you were wondering, translates to 'Midnight Sun', a natural phenomenon that can be observed in Sweden.

Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old Feis Ile 2012.palate: A hugely spiced, rich palate with notes of sultanas, malt, cedar wood potpourri, butterscotch and gingerbread.
Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old Feis Ile 2012.name: Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old Feis Ile 2012
Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old Feis Ile 2012.notes: oak, wood, cedar, pepper, smoke, nutty, almond, butterscotch, honey, salt
Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old Feis Ile 2012.nose: Spiced and intense nose with dark, rich honey, sherried peels, salted, smoked almonds and dry oak. Malty and nutty.
Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old Feis Ile 2012.note categories: wood, spice, earth, nuts, vanilla, feint, mineral
Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old Feis Ile 2012.description: A superb and very rare 12 year old Bunnahabhain at natural cask strength, matured in an Amontillado sherry cask. This was bottled especially for the 2012 Feis Ile (Islay Festival) and there are just 346 bottles!

Tamdhu 21 Year Old 1990 Old & Rare (d.palate: This is a sherry-bomb in the palate with lots of dense dried fruits, chocolate and spice fighting for supremacy.
Tamdhu 21 Year Old 1990 Old & Rare (d.name: Tamdhu 21 Year Old 1990   Old & Rare (douglas Laing)
Tamdhu 21 Year Old 1990 Old & Rare (d.nose: Rich dark chocolate sauce with berry compote followed by a hint of spent sparkler.
Tamdhu 21 Year Old 1990 Old & Rare (d.description: This is a twenty-one year old sherry cask bottling of Tamdhu selected for Douglas Laing's Old & Rare range. Tamdhu is one of the principal ingredients in the Famous Grouse blend. Tamdhu has been mothballed for a few years however production is thought to recommence sometime in 2012.

Aberlour 17 Year Old Single Cask (mast.palate: Toffee syrup first with vanilla, and then the lemon comes through again, fresh juice but also lemon curd. The end offers floral notes of heather and wildflowers.
Aberlour 17 Year Old Single Cask (mast.name: Aberlour 17 Year Old   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Aberlour 17 Year Old Single Cask (mast.notes: citrus, lemon, vanilla, caramel, toffee, floral, salt
Aberlour 17 Year Old Single Cask (mast.nose: Lemon citrus with fresh hops, grapefruit and green apples. Not what one would expect from a 17-year-old whisky.
Aberlour 17 Year Old Single Cask (mast.description: Aberlour 17 from our single cask range, this is a wonderfully zesty whisky that's full of surprises. Part of an outturn of 265 from a specially-selected bourbon cask.

Glen Grant 17 Year Old 1995 The Octave.palate: Malt-driven, thick, fruity palate, based on creamy barley, with a  big whack of stewed fruits and honey.
Glen Grant 17 Year Old 1995 The Octave.name: Glen Grant 17 Year Old 1995   The Octave (duncan Taylor)
Glen Grant 17 Year Old 1995 The Octave.notes: fruit, lemon, fruity, pepper, spicy, spices, barley, creamy, honey, lead
Glen Grant 17 Year Old 1995 The Octave.nose: Spiced, creamy nose with juicy barley malt, pepper, stem ginger in syrup, maple spices and lemon juice.
Glen Grant 17 Year Old 1995 The Octave.note categories: fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, feint, mineral
Glen Grant 17 Year Old 1995 The Octave.description: Spicy, complex Glen Grant finished in smaller, octave-sized casks from Duncan Taylor's wonderful Octave range. This was distilled in 1995 and aged for 17 years before bottling as a single cask.

Nikka Whisky From The Barrel 3 Litre.palate: Full-bodied and punchy. There is plenty of winter spice and toffee, a little caramel and vanilla and a good mouthful of fruit.
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel 3 Litre.name: Nikka Whisky From The Barrel   3 Litre
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel 3 Litre.notes: wood, oak, fruit, fruity, spice, vanilla, caramel, toffee, flowers
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel 3 Litre.nose: Medium-body with good balance. There are notes of cut flowers and fresh fruits, spice and a little oak.
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel 3 Litre.description:
Strictly 1 Per Customer!

Want to know how to elicit gasps and exclamations of "Wow!" from a room full of whisky lovers? Bring out a 3 litre bottle of Nikka Whisky From The Barrel. That's right, 3 litres of this incredible, powerful blended Japanese whisky, complete with a wooden stand, a pipette to measure out 4cl of the stunning whisky and a Nikka-branded bag (not pictured). Despite holding six times more whisky than the regular bottles (six!), it still comes presented in a charming square-shaped bottle. It was released in celebration of Nikka's 80th anniversary in 2014.

Glen Scotia 12 Year Old (new Bottling).palate: Sweet, full palate with soft peat and dried peels. Quite woody.
Glen Scotia 12 Year Old (new Bottling).name: Glen Scotia 12 Year Old (new Bottling)
Glen Scotia 12 Year Old (new Bottling).notes: woody, peat, smoky, barley, floral, herbal, honey
Glen Scotia 12 Year Old (new Bottling).nose: Spiced, slightly smoky nose with hints of old ropes and dry herbs. Sea air, smoked barley and honey.
Glen Scotia 12 Year Old (new Bottling).description: Produced at one of Campbeltown's three distilleries, this is a new, smartly packaged version of the classic Glen Scotia 12. It comes at higher strength than before, and as such offers a great deal more flavour.

Bowmore 15 Year Old Feis Ile 2011.palate: Big and rich with notes of cocoa, spices and smoke. Quite sooty and intense, with some chocolate-covered raisins and toffee apple.
Bowmore 15 Year Old Feis Ile 2011.name: Bowmore 15 Year Old Feis Ile 2011
Bowmore 15 Year Old Feis Ile 2011.notes: plum, raisin, apple, spices, smoke, walnut, butter, toffee, cocoa, salty
Bowmore 15 Year Old Feis Ile 2011.nose: Sweet and sticky with notes of sherried peels, dates and walnuts. A little toffee, cocoa and smoke, with hints of salty butter and rye spices.
Bowmore 15 Year Old Feis Ile 2011.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, mineral
Bowmore 15 Year Old Feis Ile 2011.description: Made especially for the 2011 Feis Ile, this Bowmore was aged for 15 years and finished in a sherry cask before bottling at natural cask strength. A release of just 500 bottles. Very rare!

Penderyn WRU Grand Slam 2012.palate: Thick and sweet, spices, green, biscuity. Custard.
Penderyn WRU Grand Slam 2012.name: Penderyn WRU Grand Slam 2012
Penderyn WRU Grand Slam 2012.nose: Sweet, medium body. Herbal, vanilla, sweetness, resin, sultanas, toast. Over-ripe grape.
Penderyn WRU Grand Slam 2012.description: Bottled especially to celebrate the Welsh Rugby Union and the 2012 season. This is a marvellous whisky from Penderyn, beautifully packaged and full of flavour.

Evan Williams 2000 Single Barrel.palate: Rich and balanced, quite mono dimensional, but superb as the notes of cinnamon and vanilla mingle with a gorgeous delivery of smoky corn and sweet oak.
Evan Williams 2000 Single Barrel.name: Evan Williams 2000 Single Barrel
Evan Williams 2000 Single Barrel.notes: oak, fruit, cinnamon, smoky, oat, vanilla
Evan Williams 2000 Single Barrel.nose: Supple with all sorts of fruit, mixed cereals, with lots of sweet oats and corn. A touch of menthol, and those classic notes of char and vanilla.
Evan Williams 2000 Single Barrel.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, cereal, vanilla
Evan Williams 2000 Single Barrel.description: An incredible single barrel bourbon from Heaven Hill, Evan Williams 2000 vintage is a beautiful whiskey, which Malt Advocate rated with 95 points! Amazing.

Bowmore 8 Year Old 2001 (adelphi).palate: Creamy sweetness, oily, peaty, fruity, grassy, ash, cool smoke.
Bowmore 8 Year Old 2001 (adelphi).name: Bowmore 8 Year Old 2001 (adelphi)
Bowmore 8 Year Old 2001 (adelphi).notes: fruity, smoke, barley, creamy, butterscotch, hay
Bowmore 8 Year Old 2001 (adelphi).nose: Peaty, oily, soapy. Very interesting, peppermint, coastal notes, barley and cut hay.
Bowmore 8 Year Old 2001 (adelphi).note categories: fruits, earth, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, flowers
Bowmore 8 Year Old 2001 (adelphi).description: A release of 583 bottles of cask strength 8 year old Bowmore, bottled by Adelphi. This was distilled in 2001, and matured in cask number 1126 - a refill butt.

Craigellachie 12 Year Old 2000 The Oct.palate: A thick, creamy vanilla-laden palate with notes of cocoa, tropical fruit, porridge oats and spice.
Craigellachie 12 Year Old 2000 The Oct.name: Craigellachie 12 Year Old 2000   The Octave (duncan Taylor)
Craigellachie 12 Year Old 2000 The Oct.notes: fruit, pepper, cinnamon, peppery, spice, oat, creamy, chocolate, toffee, violets, cocoa
Craigellachie 12 Year Old 2000 The Oct.nose: Notes of cinnamon, grist and pepper. Hints of chocolate, toffee apples and parma violets too.
Craigellachie 12 Year Old 2000 The Oct.note categories: fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, coffee
Craigellachie 12 Year Old 2000 The Oct.description: A 12 year old, 2000 vintage, single cask Craigellachie from Duncan Taylor. This was bottled at natural cask strength for the Octave range of whiskies finished in smaller casks for increased maturation…

Dalmore 1978 Sherry Finesse.palate: Very fruity and full-bodied, it clings to the palate with oily, rich notes of vanilla spice, coffee beans, almond oil, black treacle, thick malt and sherried peels.
Dalmore 1978 Sherry Finesse.name: Dalmore 1978   Sherry Finesse
Dalmore 1978 Sherry Finesse.notes: citrus, fruity, spicy, spice, almond, creamy, vanilla, toffee, coffee, honey
Dalmore 1978 Sherry Finesse.nose: Sweet, creamy nose with notes of honey, peppermint, coffee, bananas, coffee beans and buttery toffee. A little almond, pear drops and citrus too.
Dalmore 1978 Sherry Finesse.note categories: fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Dalmore 1978 Sherry Finesse.description: A staggering 1978 vintage from Dalmore, aged for over 3 decades in Gonzalez Byass sherry casks, and especially created by Richard Paterson. Beautifully packaged too, this is a rich, fruity, full-bodied Highland malt.

Tomintoul Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.palate: Caramel sweets, Garibaldi biscuits and cinnamon.
Tomintoul Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.name: Tomintoul   Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Tomintoul Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.notes: pepper, cinnamon, marzipan, barley, creamy, caramel
Tomintoul Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.nose: Light and inviting with creamy marzipan and barley.
Tomintoul Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.description:
Ah! Another single malt from That Boutique-y Whisky Company with a cocktail recipe on the label! This time, the recipe comes from the truly excellent, award winning Bramble Bar in Edinburgh, courtesy of featured duo Jas Scott and Mikey Aikman.

Not only can you use this Tomintoul to create the cocktail suggested but there is even a Voucher on the back that can be redeemed at Bramble for a Free Drink, expertly mixed before your very eyes by one of their highly skilled barmen! Cool, eh?

A release of 172 numbered bottles.

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, blended malts, blends and bourbons from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Auchentoshan 32 Year Old 1973.palate: Dried fruits, but there is a lurid, dark sweetness to them, barley. Coppery oaked quality, almost rusty.
Auchentoshan 32 Year Old 1973.name: Auchentoshan 32 Year Old 1973
Auchentoshan 32 Year Old 1973.nose: Honey and sultana. Something vinous creeps in and with it green fruit.
Auchentoshan 32 Year Old 1973.description: A very rare Lowland whisky from Auchentoshan, just 480 bottles of this 1973 vintage, sherry matured single malt, were released. Packaged in an exquisite bottle, complete with a smart presentation box.

Glenfarclas 1952 Family Cask Release III.palate: Thick, creamy and nutty with notes of clove-studded oranges, grilled grapefruit and chocolate malt. A touch of oily, fresh espresso, sherried peels and date & walnut cake.
Glenfarclas 1952 Family Cask Release III.name: Glenfarclas 1952 Family Cask Release III
Glenfarclas 1952 Family Cask Release III.notes: oak, orange, fruit, apple, zest, pepper, spices, smoke, nutty, almond, walnut, creamy, chocolate, vanilla, cocoa, coffee, espresso, roasted
Glenfarclas 1952 Family Cask Release III.nose: Almond and walnut on the nose, with hints of apple crumble, vanilla, oak and stewed fruits. A dash of cocoa, black pepper and freshly roasted coffee beans, alongside just a smidgen of gentle smoke, some orange zest, Angostura bitters and elderflower.
Glenfarclas 1952 Family Cask Release III.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee
Glenfarclas 1952 Family Cask Release III.description: The third release of Glenfarclas' 1952 Family Cask. George S Grant comments on how fresh this whisky has remained, despite having spent 55 years in a single hogshead! A delicious whisky offering up all sorts of chocolate and orange notes!

Glenfarclas 1982 Family Cask Release V.palate: Fresh flowers, vanilla. Creamy and rich. Apple peels, nutmeg, golden syrup, pear juice.
Glenfarclas 1982 Family Cask Release V.name: Glenfarclas 1982 Family Cask Release V
Glenfarclas 1982 Family Cask Release V.notes: apple, spices, nutmeg, creamy, vanilla, custard, flowers, coffee
Glenfarclas 1982 Family Cask Release V.nose: Creamy and sweet. Lots of vanilla and custard greeting the nostrils, hints of coffee, lattes, fudge and doughnuts.
Glenfarclas 1982 Family Cask Release V.note categories: fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, coffee
Glenfarclas 1982 Family Cask Release V.description: Glenfarclas' 5th release of the 1982 Family Cask. This was filled into plain hoghsead nunber 633, which was bottled on the 4th May 2010, and there was an outturn of 216 bottles.

Glenlivet 1943 Private Collection (gor.palate: Oak furniture, sweet embers and burnt raisins.
Glenlivet 1943 Private Collection (gor.name: Glenlivet 1943   Private Collection (gordon & Macphail)
Glenlivet 1943 Private Collection (gor.notes: wood, oak, fruit, raisin, fruity, spices, leather
Glenlivet 1943 Private Collection (gor.nose: Fruity and sweet with rich wood spices.
Glenlivet 1943 Private Collection (gor.description: This Glenlivet was aged for an extraordinary 55 years in a refill sherry cask (cask number 120). Distilled in 1943, during the war, and unsurprisingly chosen by the directors at Gordon & MacPhail for their Private Collection range.

Lagavulin 12 Year Old (2011 Release).palate: This is very tangy and takes me right back to my first visit to the distillery on a freezing cold day with the weather ferociously setting in. Oily and smoky, like a log fire in winter. Hints of cocoa develop.
Lagavulin 12 Year Old (2011 Release).name: Lagavulin 12 Year Old (2011 Release)
Lagavulin 12 Year Old (2011 Release).nose: Very smoky with bonfire toffee, cold wood ash, smoked game and treacle.
Lagavulin 12 Year Old (2011 Release).description: An utterly fabulous on-going annual release of Lagavulin, from Diageo's Special Releases. 2011 sees this cask strength monster offering up oodles of complexity thanks to its maturation in refill American oak casks.

Fettercairn 19 Year Old 1995 Single Ca.palate: Sweet palate entry, with nougat, then into gorgeous dark raw honey, with great mouthfeel. Very impressive.
Fettercairn 19 Year Old 1995 Single Ca.name: Fettercairn 19 Year Old 1995   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Fettercairn 19 Year Old 1995 Single Ca.nose: Tahini, sliced banana and fresh, sweet broccoli all play their part as well as a rock-like mineral note (cairn?). Something darker is lurking beneath the surface too.
Fettercairn 19 Year Old 1995 Single Ca.description: Distilled 25th October 1995, this Fettercairn single malt whisky was matured in a single cask for over 19 years, having been bottled 25th March 2015 with an outturn of 133 bottles. A great example of the distillery's unique character, with perfectly balanced Sherry influence.

Royal Brackla The Royal Jubilee Comme.palate: The spices continue with additional woody notes of walnuts and pecans. A chocolate butterscotch sweetness.
Royal Brackla The Royal Jubilee Comme.name: Royal Brackla   The Royal Jubilee Commemorative  12 Year Old 1999   Old Malt Cask (douglas Laing)
Royal Brackla The Royal Jubilee Comme.notes: woody, orange, zest, cloves, spicy, nutmeg, spices, hazelnut, marzipan, walnut, chocolate, mocha, butterscotch
Royal Brackla The Royal Jubilee Comme.nose: Spicy - nutmeg and cloves in particular, with marzipan, crystallized peel and orange zest.
Royal Brackla The Royal Jubilee Comme.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, vanilla
Royal Brackla The Royal Jubilee Comme.description: A 12 year old Royal Brackla, this is part of Douglas Laing's Old Malt Cask series. This particular release was bottled to celebrate Queen Elizabeth II's Diamond Jubilee. One of just 250 bottles.

Mortlach 1954 Rare Vintage (gordon And.palate: Pineapple cubes, pear drops, raisins and some peppery oak notes.
Mortlach 1954 Rare Vintage (gordon And.name: Mortlach 1954   Rare Vintage (gordon And Macphail)
Mortlach 1954 Rare Vintage (gordon And.nose: Sweet sherry notes appear right at the start, followed by peppermint and a subtle beeswax aroma.
Mortlach 1954 Rare Vintage (gordon And.description: Distilled in January 1954 and bottled in November 2012, it's safe to say that this Mortlach single malt Scotch whisky is just ridiculously old. It spent over 50 years maturing in a sherry butt. Bottled by Gordon and MacPhail for their Rare Vintage selection.

Ledaig 32 Year Old 1972.palate: Quite smooth and well-balanced. There is a fullness and depth with notes of exotic fruit salad; guava and pineapple with hints of lemon marmalade and winter spice, ground ginger and cinnamon.
Ledaig 32 Year Old 1972.name: Ledaig 32 Year Old 1972
Ledaig 32 Year Old 1972.notes: wood, fruit, lemon, pineapple, cinnamon, spice, peat, smoke
Ledaig 32 Year Old 1972.nose: Full and rich. There is a gentle peat note with dry wood smoke and boiled sweets. Hints of estery fruits and menthol and iodine.
Ledaig 32 Year Old 1972.description: A cask strength single malt from the Tobermory distillery, distilled in 1972 and finished in Oloroso Sherry butts. Ledaig is the name for peated whisky from the distillery on Mull, the name is pronounced 'led-chigg' and Ledaig releases are always well-received.

Auchroisk 1999 Managers Choice.palate: Fruity and rich with tangy citrus zest, lemon drizzle cake, boiled sweets, Calvados and truffle.
Auchroisk 1999 Managers Choice.name: Auchroisk 1999   Managers Choice
Auchroisk 1999 Managers Choice.notes: oak, pine, citrus, fruit, lemon, fruity, zest, coffee
Auchroisk 1999 Managers Choice.nose: Tropical and coconut-y with notes of peppermint, malt, sweet sherry and oak. A little pine and tangy fruit.
Auchroisk 1999 Managers Choice.description: A 9 year old, cask strength, single cask Auchroisk from Diageo's Managers Choice range. This was distilled in 1999 and aged in a single sherry cask (number 11323) for 9 years before bottling in March of 2009. A release of 642 bottles.

The Glendronach 21 Year Old Parliament.palate: Golden Syrup, soft, juicy raisins, tangy oak notes, peach, cherry blossom, cocoa and honeydew melon.
The Glendronach 21 Year Old Parliament.name: The Glendronach 21 Year Old   Parliament
The Glendronach 21 Year Old Parliament.notes: oak, wood, cedar, lemon, apple, peach, cherry, raisin, fruit, pepper, earth, smoke, walnut, chocolate, cocoa, espresso, lead
The Glendronach 21 Year Old Parliament.nose: Soft smoke and lemon juice, cedar wood, apple peel, toasty oak, soft earth, date and walnut cake and a hint of freshly made espresso.
The Glendronach 21 Year Old Parliament.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, coffee, mineral
The Glendronach 21 Year Old Parliament.description: A 21 year old Glendronach released in 2011, and aged in a mix of sherry casks (Oloroso and sweet Pedro Ximenez dessert sherry). The result is really very good indeed. Interestingly enough, this whisky has no political associations. It is, in fact, named "Parliament" after the collective term for a group of rooks - and there is a Parliament of Rooks living in the trees near GlenDronach...

Glen Moray Centenary Port Wood Finish.name: Glen Moray Centenary Port Wood Finish
Glen Moray Centenary Port Wood Finish.nose: Red wine gums and purple jelly babies leading to stewed red fruits.
Glen Moray Centenary Port Wood Finish.description: A port wood finish from the Glen Moray distillery in Speyside. This was finished in Port wood casks and celebrates the distillery's centenary.

Cragganmore 25 Year Old 1988 (2014 Speci.palate: Vanilla, younger green wood notes, dried mango. Fairly creamy (especially with water) with some juicy malt towards the end.
Cragganmore 25 Year Old 1988 (2014 Speci.name: Cragganmore 25 Year Old 1988 (2014 Special Release)
Cragganmore 25 Year Old 1988 (2014 Speci.notes: wood, oak, mango, apple, spicy, nut, nuts, creamy, vanilla, caramel
Cragganmore 25 Year Old 1988 (2014 Speci.nose: Green wood, apple stalks, shaving foam, juicy melon, crushed nuts, mint, dark caramel.
Cragganmore 25 Year Old 1988 (2014 Speci.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, vanilla
Cragganmore 25 Year Old 1988 (2014 Speci.description: It's been a little while since we've seen a Cragganmore in the Diageo Special Release line-up, so we're very happy to see this Speyside single malt was picked for the 2014 squad! This 1988 vintage Cragganmore was aged in American oak casks for a lengthy 25 years before being bottled with an outturn of 3,372 bottles.

Auchentoshan 21 Year Old.palate: Oily, nuttiness. Dry and rounded with sugared peels.
Auchentoshan 21 Year Old.name: Auchentoshan 21 Year Old
Auchentoshan 21 Year Old.notes: citrus, fruity, nutty, nuttiness, floral, honey
Auchentoshan 21 Year Old.nose: Soft and supple. Dry grass. Fruity notes, a citrus edge and a very floral honey.
Auchentoshan 21 Year Old.description: A 21 year old single malt, triple distilled and aged in second fill sherry casks, though nothing is lost to the power of the sherry. This bottling stands as the flagship for the core Auchentoshan range.

Braeval 20 Year Old 1994 Single Cask (.palate: Robustly spices with clove and nutmeg, joined by oatcakes, golden barley and freshly-harvested peaches. Oily and mouth-coating. Touches of poached pear appears after a minute or two. A very subtle whiff of smoke too...
Braeval 20 Year Old 1994 Single Cask (.name: Braeval 20 Year Old 1994   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Braeval 20 Year Old 1994 Single Cask (.notes: fruit, lemon, peach, clove, spices, nutmeg, smoke, oat, barley, toffee
Braeval 20 Year Old 1994 Single Cask (.nose: Nutella on toast, gooseberry jam and a little bit of lemon curd. This goes on to develop hints of toffee pennies, crumbly oat cakes, cured meat and a sprig of leafy coriander.
Braeval 20 Year Old 1994 Single Cask (.description: We've only gone and bottled a rather stunning 20 year old Braeval single malt as part of our Single Cask Series! You may know this distillery as 'Braes-of-Glenlivet', though it officially changed its name in 1994 - which just so happens to be the year this whisky was distilled. The refill bourbon cask it matured in was filled in December 1994 and opened in May 2015. Just 108 bottles were produced, presented at 54% ABV.

Linlithgow 28 Year Old 1982 Cask 2202.palate: Rounded and pleasantly sweet, with tart apples, apple blossom, and sour apple sweets. What a whisky! Good malty backbone on this one as well.
Linlithgow 28 Year Old 1982 Cask 2202.name: Linlithgow 28 Year Old 1982 Cask 2202   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Linlithgow 28 Year Old 1982 Cask 2202.nose: Floral and fruity, with Granny smith apples, olives and hazelnut. A touch of malt, and cedar develop.
Linlithgow 28 Year Old 1982 Cask 2202.description: Distilled on the 5th October 1982 at St Magdalene in the Lowlands, this was aged for 28 years in wine treated butt number 2202, before bottling by Signatory on the 15th June 2011. A release of 351 bottles of cask strength whisky, packaged in rather handsome decanters.

Tomintoul 36 Year Old 1977 (cask 3691).palate: The luxurious sherry notes, rich and full, are balanced well with hints of tobacco and oak spices.
Tomintoul 36 Year Old 1977 (cask 3691).name: Tomintoul 36 Year Old 1977 (cask 3691)   Vintage Single Sherry Cask
Tomintoul 36 Year Old 1977 (cask 3691).nose: Seductive fruitcake, brimming with sultanas, nuts and a sprinkle of spices.
Tomintoul 36 Year Old 1977 (cask 3691).description: Following their 1981 Vintage Single Cask, Tomintoul have dug out an even older single malt whisky, this one coming from April 1977! After a lengthy maturation in a sherry cask, the whisky was bottled in May 2013, without chill-filtration or colouring, with an outrun of 312 beautiful bottles, which come in rather handsome presentation boxes.

Balblair 35 Year Old 1964 Lost Bottlin.palate: Lemon drizzle cake and fresh zest too. A lovely malty core provides a solid backbone for this medium-bodied dram. Baking spices appear.
Balblair 35 Year Old 1964 Lost Bottlin.name: Balblair 35 Year Old 1964   Lost Bottlings Series (master Of Malt)
Balblair 35 Year Old 1964 Lost Bottlin.notes: oak, lemon, zest, pepper, spices, bread, creamy, cream, vanilla, violets
Balblair 35 Year Old 1964 Lost Bottlin.nose: Sweet vanilla and cracked black pepper. Hints of freshly baked bread, cookie dough ice cream and seed cake. More than a hint of lemon juice too.
Balblair 35 Year Old 1964 Lost Bottlin.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, flowers
Balblair 35 Year Old 1964 Lost Bottlin.description: This is an extraordinarily rare Balblair from our very own Lost Bottlings Series - a range of whiskies from a bygone era of whisky production. This was distilled in 1964 before a 35 year maturation. It was bottled at cask-strength in August 1999 and it offers up a hugely zesty, malty flavour.

Writers Tears Pot Still Blend.palate: Honey develops on the palate. Mellow notes of vanilla and golden malt. Green apple skin, caramel and a hint of oak.
Writers Tears Pot Still Blend.name: Writers Tears Pot Still Blend
Writers Tears Pot Still Blend.notes: oak, citrus, fruity, apple, vanilla, caramel, honey
Writers Tears Pot Still Blend.distillery: Walsh Whiskey Distillery Co Whiskeys And Liqueurs
Writers Tears Pot Still Blend.nose: Soft and sweet with thick honey spread on granary toast. Hints of citrus peels.
Writers Tears Pot Still Blend.description: Writers Tears is a light, sweet Irish whiskey made using a mix of single pot still and single malt whiskies, resulting in oodles of honey'd, fruity notes. Wonderfully easy to drink, it would make for a great introduction to Irish whiskey for folks new to the spirit. No writers were harmed in the making of this whiskey.

Dalmore Valour 1l.palate: Chocolatey and rich, with treacle and malt loaf. Despite all this decadence, it still shows off some lightly qualities with golden barley and a touch of nutmeg.
Dalmore Valour 1l.name: Dalmore Valour 1l
Dalmore Valour 1l.notes: orange, raisin, nutmeg, cinnamon, barley, toffee
Dalmore Valour 1l.nose: Crumbly shortbread drizzled with toffee and dotted with plump raisins. Deeper notes of candied orange peels.
Dalmore Valour 1l.description: A travel retail release of Dalmore single malt Scotch whisky, which is matured in a mix of two types of first fill ex-bourbon casks and Oloroso Sherry butts, then finished in port pipes from the Douro region in Portugal.

Glen Garioch Batch 1 (that Boutique Y.palate: Ginger Nuts, orange zest and buttery barley.
Glen Garioch Batch 1 (that Boutique Y.name: Glen Garioch   Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Glen Garioch Batch 1 (that Boutique Y.notes: orange, fruit, lemon, fruity, zest, pepper, nut, nuts, barley, toffee, honey
Glen Garioch Batch 1 (that Boutique Y.nose: Thyme honey, shortcrust pastry (with a little apple-y mincemeat inside it) and lemon peel. White pepper, toffee and a touch of stock but still fruity. Buttery notes develop.
Glen Garioch Batch 1 (that Boutique Y.note categories: fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, vanilla, feint
Glen Garioch Batch 1 (that Boutique Y.description:
We all know Ryan Chetiwardana is a bit of a wizard when it comes to cocktails (to put it lightly). He was even on the label of That Boutique-y Whisky Company's bottling of Auchentoshan single malt Scotch whisky, mixing up a delicious drink! However, no amount of mixology magic would be able to send him back in time to 1977 to see Glen Garioch heating their greenhouses with excess heat from distillation. So how has the SipStir Superstar done it?

Well, take a look at Ryan's ride parked out back. He's only gone and borrowed the titular time machine from H.G. Wells' The Time Machine! But to what end? Is he there to get the Glen Garioch tomatoes for a dimension-busting Bloody Mary, or simply to find out if Bowmore got the idea for heating a swimming pool with distillation heat from the Highlands distillery? We may never know.

Batch 1 of Glen Garioch is a release of 284 bottles.

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, blended malts, blends and bourbons from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Glenallachie 6 Year Old 2008 Single Ca.palate: Fizzy apple and some of those bits of peach you get in yoghurt. Meaty oak and allspice on the tail.
Glenallachie 6 Year Old 2008 Single Ca.name: Glenallachie 6 Year Old 2008   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Glenallachie 6 Year Old 2008 Single Ca.notes: oak, apple, peach, allspice, barley, leather
Glenallachie 6 Year Old 2008 Single Ca.nose: Waxy gingersnaps, new leather and suede. Sweet apple and Jelly Tots develop, with water revealing more fragrant blossom notes. Multigrain crackers.
Glenallachie 6 Year Old 2008 Single Ca.description: It's not very often you get to see Glenallachie as a single malt, so of course we went ahead and bottled some as part of our Single Cask Series! This is a 6 year old Glenallachie, matured in a refill Sherry cask from December 2008 and bottled in April 2015. Just 92 bottles were produced.

Longmorn 19 Year Old 1992 The Coopers.palate: Malt core with notes of pepper and sherry. Hints of candied peel, dates and figs.
Longmorn 19 Year Old 1992 The Coopers.name: Longmorn 19 Year Old 1992   The Coopers Choice (the Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Longmorn 19 Year Old 1992 The Coopers.nose: Rich notes of dried peels and hints of gingerbread. Malty.
Longmorn 19 Year Old 1992 The Coopers.description: This is a rich, sherried Longmorn from the Vintage Malt Whisky Company's Coopers Choice range. It was distilled in 1992 and aged for 18 years in hogshead number 48461 before bottling in 2011. Very good stuff.

Longmorn 15 Year Old 1996 Rare Auld.palate: Strong, very lemony and oaky, fizzy and green. Sauvignon blanc, plus a little vanilla from the oak but not that sweet.
Longmorn 15 Year Old 1996 Rare Auld.name: Longmorn 15 Year Old 1996 Rare Auld
Longmorn 15 Year Old 1996 Rare Auld.nose: Green at first sniff with lots of oak, apples, kiwis, lime, grapefruits, green tea, and hints of cedar box and shoe polish. More and more tannins, freshly broken limestone. This is quite wild.
Longmorn 15 Year Old 1996 Rare Auld.description: A Rare Auld Longmorn from Duncan Taylor. Cask strength and non-chillfiltered with a wild, mountainous character. This is an interesting dram and no mistake.

Ben Nevis 10 Year Old.palate: Gentle dryness. Toffee. Looming omnipresent are solid peat notes with a bitter sweetness.
Ben Nevis 10 Year Old.name: Ben Nevis 10 Year Old
Ben Nevis 10 Year Old.notes: orange, peat, nutty, chocolate, caramel, toffee, coffee
Ben Nevis 10 Year Old.nose: Fresh and quite dry. A supple greenness with soft leafy notes with a rich fruitiness. Hints of orange and Seville marmalade with a light vinous character and nutty undertones.
Ben Nevis 10 Year Old.note categories: fruits, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee
Ben Nevis 10 Year Old.description: 1996 saw the release of the entry level Ben Nevis single malt, this 10 year old exudes some beautiful coffee, chocolate and toffeed peat notes, a firm representative of the Western Highland style.

Millstone Peated.palate: Peaty, oily palate entry. Youthful vanilla and spice notes. Hints of toffee and honey.
Millstone Peated.name: Millstone Peated
Millstone Peated.notes: oak, spice, peat, smoke, creamy, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee, honey
Millstone Peated.nose: Creamy, malty aromas with hints of mixed peels, soft smoke, vanilla and butterscotch.
Millstone Peated.note categories: wood, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Millstone Peated.description: This single malt is aged for over 5 years in small American white oak barrels, as well as bourbon and sherry casks. A great Dutch single malt from Zuidam.

Laphroaig Cairdeas Ileach Edition.palate: Really oily, with huge peat smoke mixed with creamy, buttery sweetness. As you hold it in the mouth, foam banana sweets develop, with hints of chocolate and apple strudel. It tastes exactly like a sweeter version of the pungent smell at the distillery; there’s that wonderful savoury peat smoke from the maltings; some seaweedy/slightly medicinal tones (which drift in from the beach); and slightly dry salt air.
Laphroaig Cairdeas Ileach Edition.name: Laphroaig Cairdeas Ileach Edition
Laphroaig Cairdeas Ileach Edition.notes: fruit, apple, peat, smoke, creamy, chocolate, vanilla, salt
Laphroaig Cairdeas Ileach Edition.nose: Good level of sweetness on the nose. We get Gipsy Tart dressed with TCP (not a recommended dessert), some light fruit, perhaps a hint of stewed pear and vanilla. Hints of sooty smoke, and maybe even some lychee and menthol too, and just a soupcon of perfume.
Laphroaig Cairdeas Ileach Edition.description: A special version of Laphroaig Cairdeas (pronounced "carchase"), the Ileach edition is named in reference to John Campbell, the whisky's creator. John is the first ever Islay-born Master Distiller at Laphroaig. He used Maker's Mark bourbon barrels in the creation of this, and bottled it at natural cask strength.

The Macallan Sienna 1824 Series.palate: Raisins and dried apricots, ripe greengages, frozen currants.
The Macallan Sienna 1824 Series.name: The Macallan Sienna   1824 Series
The Macallan Sienna 1824 Series.nose: Noticeably bigger than Gold and Amber, orange peel, vanilla sugar and hot cross buns.
The Macallan Sienna 1824 Series.description: The third darkest and third most expensive bottling in the no age statement, sherry matured 1824 Series from The Macallan. Sienna is a naturally occuring pigment, referring not only to the hue of this expression but to the fact that The Macallan's whiskies are all released with no added colouring.

Van Winkle Special Reserve 12 Year Old.palate: Soft with gentle spices, charcoal, cinnamon bark, hints of cold coffee and honey.
Van Winkle Special Reserve 12 Year Old.name: Van Winkle Special Reserve 12 Year Old
Van Winkle Special Reserve 12 Year Old.notes: spices, cinnamon, butterscotch, caramel, coffee, honey
Van Winkle Special Reserve 12 Year Old.distillery: Old Rip Van Winkle Whiskey Distillery
Van Winkle Special Reserve 12 Year Old.nose: Butterscotch on the nose, with soft sweetness and Demerara sugar.
Van Winkle Special Reserve 12 Year Old.description: This bottling of Van Winkle Special Reserve was aged for 12 years, it received a Gold medal at the 2008 International Wine and Spirit Competition, bottled at 90.4 proof, this is a smooth, mature whiskey.

Smith's Glenlivet 1974 (gordon & Macphai.palate: The palate is reminiscent of fresh sliced apple and a hint of struck matches with a little spice in the background.
Smith's Glenlivet 1974 (gordon & Macphai.name: Smith's Glenlivet 1974 (gordon & Macphail)
Smith's Glenlivet 1974 (gordon & Macphai.notes: oak, fruity, apple, pepper, spice, butter, chocolate, violets
Smith's Glenlivet 1974 (gordon & Macphai.nose: Red cox apples fried in butter followed by notes of rose water and parma violets and warm sherried oak.
Smith's Glenlivet 1974 (gordon & Macphai.description: This is a 1974 Glenlivet bottled by Gordon & MacPhail of Elgin as part of their Distillery Label range.

Ardbeg 1998 Single Cask.palate: Thick and oily with notes of fresh espresso, hot milk, aniseed and winter spices. Some cloves, nutmeg, and a touch of vanilla, leather armchairs and old books. A little icing sugar, and a big whack of fiery peatsmoke.
Ardbeg 1998 Single Cask.name: Ardbeg 1998 Single Cask
Ardbeg 1998 Single Cask.notes: wood, zest, cherry, plum, raisin, fruit, orange, cloves, spices, nutmeg, smoke, milk, vanilla, espresso, leather
Ardbeg 1998 Single Cask.nose: Intense and very rich with notes of golden syrup, gingernut biscuits and tar. Hints of cigar smoke, sultanas, rum and raisin icecream and cherry liqueur chocolates develop, with more than a suggestion of hot wood embers.
Ardbeg 1998 Single Cask.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Ardbeg 1998 Single Cask.description: An extraordinary whisky from Ardbeg. This is one of those ultra-rare expressions, which really come around once in a blue moon. This was distilled on the 14th September 1998, before it was filled into refill sherry hogshead number 2763, where it rested for 11 years before bottling on the 5th November 2009. A release of 270 numbered bottles, signed by the distillery manager, Mickey Heads.

Craigellachie 14 Year Old 1997 Old Mal.palate: Soft calves leather, juicy barley, cinnamon and gingerbread, a little butterscotch and pepper.
Craigellachie 14 Year Old 1997 Old Mal.name: Craigellachie 14 Year Old 1997   Old Malt Cask (douglas Laing)
Craigellachie 14 Year Old 1997 Old Mal.notes: apple, pepper, cinnamon, nutty, hazelnut, barley, butterscotch, toffee, herbal, leather
Craigellachie 14 Year Old 1997 Old Mal.nose: A nutty, malty nose with hazelnut, barley sugar, cinnamon and stewed apple.
Craigellachie 14 Year Old 1997 Old Mal.note categories: fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, vanilla, flowers, feint
Craigellachie 14 Year Old 1997 Old Mal.description: A single cask Craigellachie distilled in December 1997, aged in a refill hogshead for 14 years and bottled by Douglas Laing for their Old Malt Cask range in February 2012. A release of 354 bottles.

Blair Athol 12 Year Old 1999 Sherry (cas.palate: Nutty and rich, caramel, rose petal jelly and malt. Hints of nutmeg and pepper.
Blair Athol 12 Year Old 1999 Sherry (cas.name: Blair Athol 12 Year Old 1999 Sherry (cask 8767)   Provenance (douglas Laing)
Blair Athol 12 Year Old 1999 Sherry (cas.notes: fruity, pepper, nutmeg, cinnamon, spice, nutty, cream, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, toffee
Blair Athol 12 Year Old 1999 Sherry (cas.nose: Full and fruity nose with notes of cinnamon, hints of chocolate malt and spice.
Blair Athol 12 Year Old 1999 Sherry (cas.description: This was distilled at Blair Athol in Winter of 1999, before a 12 year maturation in a single sherry butt before bottling in Winter 2011 for Douglas Laing's Provenance range.

darkness dailuaine 15 pedro ximenez cask.palate: The rich meatiness you hope for from Dailuaine is present here alongside nutty dates and rich spice.
darkness dailuaine 15 pedro ximenez cask.name: darkness dailuaine 15 pedro ximenez cask finish whisky
darkness dailuaine 15 pedro ximenez cask.notes: fruit, spice, nutty, nut, nuts, hazelnut, barley, chocolate
darkness dailuaine 15 pedro ximenez cask.nose: Chocolate drops and freshly harvested cereals. Nuts, barley sugar and deep, subtle dried fruit depth.
darkness dailuaine 15 pedro ximenez cask.description: It's easy to get lost in the dark, but it's even easier to get lost in the Sherried goodness of this Darkness! bottling of Dailuaine single malt. Before it was bottled, it was given a finishing period of 3 months in specially coopered, first-fill 50 litre casks that previously held Pedro Ximénez Sherry. These casks boast greater surface area to volume ratios than your average hogshead or butt, allowing for more Sherry notes to work their way into the whisky, which is what Darkness! is all about.

Springbank Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whis.palate: Creaking, spicy oak to the fore with a development of salted butter and sweet plumes of peat smoke and stewed fruit.
Springbank Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whis.name: Springbank Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Springbank Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whis.notes: oak, plum, fruit, spicy, peat, smoky, smoke, butter, caramel, honey, salt
Springbank Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whis.nose: Oily, smoky nose with a surge of beautiful heather root and soft peat embers. Plenty of honey sweetness too.
Springbank Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whis.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, feint, mineral
Springbank Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whis.description: A truly staggering bottling from That Boutique-y Whisky Company, this one was sourced from the Springbank distillery. It offers up all the classic oily, coastal flavour you'd expect, and even comes with a superb graphic-novel-style label featuring Caskstrength.net's Neil and Joel operating Springbank's old Porteus Mill. Batch 1 is a release of 274 numbered bottles.‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Paul John Brilliance.palate: Chomp Bars - lots of chewy caramel and chocolate here. Picks up from lively spice along the way, with a little bit of waxy orange peel on the mid palate.
Paul John Brilliance.name: Paul John Brilliance
Paul John Brilliance.notes: orange, apple, berry, spice, barley, butter, chocolate, caramel, molasses, salt
Paul John Brilliance.nose: Good core of juicy barley. Ryvita with salted butter. Cinnamon-dusted-red berries, with a little green apple skin following it up.
Paul John Brilliance.note categories: fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, feint, mineral
Paul John Brilliance.description:
Produced by John Distilleries in Goa, India, the Paul John range of single malt whiskies (named after their Chairman) represents a move into premium spirits for a company who are already big players in the Indian molasses 'whisky' market.

Made using Indian 6-row barley from the Himalayan foothills, Brilliance is matured in bourbon barrels for 3-5 years before bottling at cask strength. (As with Amrut, the tropical climate cause greater evaporation, around 12-13% a year, but in turn they show very well at younger ages.)

Mackmyra Brukswhisky (the Swedish Whisky.palate: Vanilla cream, custard even and more fruit. Red berries, boiled sweets and rich, warming bourbon.
Mackmyra Brukswhisky (the Swedish Whisky.name: Mackmyra Brukswhisky (the Swedish Whisky)
Mackmyra Brukswhisky (the Swedish Whisky.notes: oak, citrus, fruit, apple, berry, spicy, smoky, cream, vanilla, custard
Mackmyra Brukswhisky (the Swedish Whisky.nose: Fresh, delicate fruit aromas with vanilla pods. Raspberry bushes, citrus.
Mackmyra Brukswhisky (the Swedish Whisky.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla
Mackmyra Brukswhisky (the Swedish Whisky.description: Mackmyra's core expression is a light Swedish whisky matured primarily in first fill bourbon barrels but also includes whisky aged in Sherry and Swedish oak casks too as well as some smokier malt, which all adds to the complexity.

Dufftown 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 8232).palate: Spiced and deep, with sherry, aniseed, liquorice, honey, toffee apples, rhubarb crumble. Charred oak.
Dufftown 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 8232).name: Dufftown 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 8232)   Directors' Cut (douglas Laing)
Dufftown 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 8232).nose: Dark and spiced. Prunes, dates, figs, potpourri, butterscotch, sherried peels, rhubarb.
Dufftown 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 8232).description: This was distilled at Dufftown in March of 1982. It was aged for 30 years in a single sherry butt (number 8232) before bottling in March 2012 for Douglas Laing's Directors Cut range. A release of 189 bottles…

St. George Breaking & Entering Bourbon.palate: Oops, I've spilt a whole mess of maple syrup all over my breakfast now (ha, they'll never know I did it on purpose!) as well as chilli and freshly sliced ripe banana. Dee-licious!
St. George Breaking & Entering Bourbon.name: St. George Breaking & Entering Bourbon
St. George Breaking & Entering Bourbon.nose: Breakfast whiskey this, blueberry pancakes with hot butter and maple syrup! Cola cubes too, rye, green banana and salted plantain tortilla chips.
St. George Breaking & Entering Bourbon.description: Criminally good bourbon from St. George Spirits in California. Their Breaking & Entering Bourbon is made with whiskey sourced from rickhouses in Kentucky, "liberated" by St. George distillers Lance Winters and Dave Smith. After sampling nearly 400 barrels, they produced an absolute belter of a blended bourbon. They didn't distil it, but it's a fair cop that they're honest, and their skills as blenders more than atones for the barrel heist!

Arran Batch 4 (that Boutique Y Whisky.palate: It opens with white grape, citrus and pineapple, which is swiftly joined by some rather powerful spicy malt and cinnamon. Cake icing (and a good chunk of cake too) gives balance on the mid palate.
Arran Batch 4 (that Boutique Y Whisky.name: Arran   Batch 4 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Arran Batch 4 (that Boutique Y Whisky.notes: orange, citrus, pineapple, spicy, cinnamon, spice, creamy, vanilla, herbaceous
Arran Batch 4 (that Boutique Y Whisky.nose: Buttered hot-cross buns with plenty of sultanas, Refresher Bars, a little bit of rye spice and a whiff of coastal air. A drop of water brings creamy vanilla to the fore.
Arran Batch 4 (that Boutique Y Whisky.description:
The fourth batch of Arran single malt Scotch whisky bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company is another delicious island dram from the distillers on the Isle of Arran!

The label once again features the artist, Emily Chappell, and a friend stranded on a desert island after an ill-fated kayaking trip. It seems like they've been there long enough to start making the island feel like home, as they've gone and put up a Christmas tree! However, not even their Christmas cheer and cries of help to the Waverley cruise ship can deter an intrepid eagle, who seems intent on swiping their whisky!

Batch 4 is a release of 1,270 bottles. 

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, blended malts, blends and bourbons from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Kilbeggan 8 Year Old Single Grain.palate: Sweet, smooth vanilla before spicy oak comes in. Touches of menthol and coconut ice.
Kilbeggan 8 Year Old Single Grain.name: Kilbeggan 8 Year Old Single Grain
Kilbeggan 8 Year Old Single Grain.notes: oak, fruit, lemon, spicy, almond, toasted, milk, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, honey
Kilbeggan 8 Year Old Single Grain.nose: Lemon sponge, honeyed cereal, vanilla and a little caramel. Toasted oak, banana and tropical fruit. Fairly light, but full of flavour - very nice indeed!
Kilbeggan 8 Year Old Single Grain.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Kilbeggan 8 Year Old Single Grain.description: Kilbeggan 8 Year Old is a stunning single grain Irish whiskey from the Cooley Distillery (you may have previously known it as the Greenore 8 Year Old). A phenomenal expression, with plenty of honey, vanilla, tropical fruit, almond and spiced oak notes - highly deserving of your shelf-space.

William Larue Weller Bourbon 2013.palate: Nutty and sweet. Honey smoothness alongside dried fruit hints and that irresistible vanilla.
William Larue Weller Bourbon 2013.name: William Larue Weller Bourbon 2013
William Larue Weller Bourbon 2013.notes: plum, fruit, peppery, spices, nutty, vanilla, leather, honey
William Larue Weller Bourbon 2013.nose: A relaxed nose, which is surprising given the abv. Plums, leather and a whiff of grassy tobacco.
William Larue Weller Bourbon 2013.description:
STRICTLY 1 PER CUSTOMER

Part of Buffalo Trace's 2013 edition of their Antique Collection, The William Laure Weller Bourbon doesn't fail to make an impression. Bottled at "barrel proof", a tremendous 68.1% abv, it's the strongest William Laure Weller yet, and it still ripples with powerful vanilla and spices.

Reference Series III.palate: Thick with loads of chocolate covered dates and a few raisins. Chewy, herbal and meaty too. Quite fantastic, basically.
Reference Series III.name: Reference Series III
Reference Series III.notes: orange, raisin, pepper, peat, creamy, chocolate, vanilla, toffee, herbal, cocoa, coffee, leather, molasses
Reference Series III.nose: Creamy with a little cut grass and pepper quickly give way to fresh orange peel, vanilla, malt loaf, coffee bean, calves leather, rich toffee and molasses.
Reference Series III.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, coffee, feint
Reference Series III.description:
An incredible blended malt. And that's not all! It's also the third and final 'control' whisky in the fascinating Reference Series, where extensions (III.1, III.2 etc.) then showcase different additional ingredients and techniques. This will allow you to refer back to the original whisky and appreciate exactly how specific changes (finishes, the addition of peat, chill-filtration etc.) affect the liquid in your glass. (That, is all.)

Reference Series III is made up of over 50% incredibly well-aged single malts, supported by more youthful blended malts for balance and vigour.

Read more about the Reference Series here on our blog.

The Macallan 1965 Speymalt (gordon And.palate: Smooth dark caramel and cocoa. Eucalyptus. Orange bitters.
The Macallan 1965 Speymalt (gordon And.name: The Macallan 1965   Speymalt (gordon And Macphail)
The Macallan 1965 Speymalt (gordon And.notes: oak, orange, fruit, raisin, vanilla, caramel, cocoa, espresso
The Macallan 1965 Speymalt (gordon And.nose: Deep and refined with partially dried fruits, still sticky. Espresso, Corinth raisins, vanilla and rich mahogany.
The Macallan 1965 Speymalt (gordon And.description: Distilled in 1965, this Macallan was matured in a first fill sherry butt and bottled under Gordon & MacPhail's Speymalt label. Extraordinary stuff.

Bladnoch 13 Year Old.palate: Juicy, estery with limes and lemon. Seville marmalade, spicy.
Bladnoch 13 Year Old.name: Bladnoch 13 Year Old
Bladnoch 13 Year Old.notes: citrus, lemon, spicy, spice, oat, barley, floral
Bladnoch 13 Year Old.nose: Rich and pungent. Notes of barley, oats, citrus. A little pink grapefruit, rose petal, grassy.
Bladnoch 13 Year Old.description: Big, fresh citrus notes with spice. A surprisingly rich bottling at a more unusual age. This 13 year old release from the Bladnoch distillery has been bottled at cask strength and exhibits some real power.

Lark Single Cask Whisky.palate: Big and bold, with plenty of sweetness, and a curious, oily peat which builds to a crescendo atop chili, toffee apples and malt.
Lark Single Cask Whisky.name: Lark Single Cask Whisky
Lark Single Cask Whisky.notes: oak, fruit, pepper, spicy, nutmeg, cinnamon, chili, spices, peat, smoke, vanilla, toffee
Lark Single Cask Whisky.nose: Very malty, spicy nose, with big notes of dried fruit, especially dates, figs and sultanas. A touch of nutmeg, cinnamon and black pepper heat, with a suggestion of smoke.
Lark Single Cask Whisky.description: An incredible whisky, even at young age, Lark single malt is produced in Tasmania, and is aged in small 100 litre "quarter" casks, to proffer an increased maturation, before bottling as an unblended, single cask whisky. This was awarded a silver medal at the 2011 World Whiskeys Masters.

allt a bhainne 12 year old 2000 provenan.palate: Thick, barley-led, biscuity palate. Notes of soft herbs and spices, with more of that honey. Fragrant and nicely balanced.
allt a bhainne 12 year old 2000 provenan.name: allt a bhainne 12 year old 2000 provenance douglas laing whisky
allt a bhainne 12 year old 2000 provenan.nose: Fresh, herbal nose with hints of honey sweetness and a little morello cherry.
allt a bhainne 12 year old 2000 provenan.description: This is a 12 year old, single cask Allt-á-Bhainne from the Provenance range. It was distilled in the Summer of 2000 before a sherry butt maturation. It was bottled in Autumn 2012, and boasts a fresh, malty style, typical of the distillery.

Millstone 8 Year Old French Oak.palate: Rounded and full with creamy fruit, toffee and spices. Some buttery hints, a touch of salty butter and maybe some smoke.
Millstone 8 Year Old French Oak.name: Millstone 8 Year Old   French Oak
Millstone 8 Year Old French Oak.notes: oak, fruit, cloves, spices, nutmeg, smoke, butter, creamy, toffee, salty
Millstone 8 Year Old French Oak.nose: Christmas spices fill the glass, with hints of toffee apples, nutmeg, cloves, a touch of bitter marmalade and a little butter.
Millstone 8 Year Old French Oak.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Millstone 8 Year Old French Oak.description: The Zuidam distillery in the Netherlands has unique stills with a very high surface contact area due to their size. This was matured in French Oak casks.

Amrut Portonova.palate: Fruity and intense with tropical fruits, redcurrant jelly, baked bananas and cinnamon.
Amrut Portonova.name: Amrut Portonova
Amrut Portonova.notes: oak, fruit, fruity, berry, pepper, cinnamon, allspice, toffee
Amrut Portonova.nose: Fruity, chocolate-driven nose with syrup, toffee and a hint of coconut, pepper and allspice. Red berries too!
Amrut Portonova.description: A very interesting little whisky from Amrut, this is unpeated and aged in American oak bourbon barrels before a finish in port pipes, especially imported from Portugal. Lovely stuff!

glenfarclas 50 year old single cask for.palate: Very fresh, especially considering its age. Great ‘Farclas notes of calves’ leather and overripe grape, with a big hit of tomato stems (not what we first came up with, but for legal reasons it’ll have to do), and wood varnish.
glenfarclas 50 year old single cask for.name: glenfarclas 50 year old single cask for the chaps at master of malt whisky
glenfarclas 50 year old single cask for.notes: wood, apple, pepper, butter, leather, musty, saltiness
glenfarclas 50 year old single cask for.nose: A wonderfully intense array of sherry notes, but it has a great youthfulness to it, and it offers up huge notes of pear, cantaloupe melon liqueur and apple peel. After a time in the glass rancio notes develop, and it reminds us in many ways of a very good, old cognac, but with considerably more depth. Come back to the nose and you’ll be greeted with mouthwatering suggestions of seaside saltiness.
glenfarclas 50 year old single cask for.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, feint, mineral
glenfarclas 50 year old single cask for.description:
We’ve teamed up with the guys over at Glenfarclas to bring you this absolutely stunning single cask, 50 year old whisky. This is one-of-a-kind bottling, as evidenced by the bottling number "decanter 1 of 1". 

This bottle was Specially selected by George Grant for the chaps at Master of Malt. Distilled and bottled by J & G Grant.

Glencadam 1990 Connoisseurs Choice (go.palate: The palate is sweet with notes of vanilla, cinnamon and nutmeg.
Glencadam 1990 Connoisseurs Choice (go.name: Glencadam 1990   Connoisseurs Choice (gordon & Macphail)
Glencadam 1990 Connoisseurs Choice (go.notes: nutmeg, cinnamon, spice, creamy, vanilla, tulips, violets
Glencadam 1990 Connoisseurs Choice (go.nose: This Glencadam is particularly aromatic with notes of tulips and violets with further notes of basil and oregano.
Glencadam 1990 Connoisseurs Choice (go.description: Glencadam is located in the Eastern highlands and was briefly mothballed betweem 2000 and 2003. This whisky was distilled in 1990 and bottled in 2009.

Hibiki 21 Year Old.palate: Oak, dark cherry and sweet caramel notes, buttery with a wisp of smoke and some wood spice.
Hibiki 21 Year Old.name: Hibiki 21 Year Old
Hibiki 21 Year Old.notes: wood, oak, cherry, lemon, spice, smoke, nut, nuts, vanilla, caramel, toffee
Hibiki 21 Year Old.nose: Sweet, caramalised nuts, some lemon acidity, blackcurrants and pears with vanilla, dark toffee and rich sherry spice.
Hibiki 21 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, vanilla
Hibiki 21 Year Old.description:
Strictly 1 Per Customer

Hibiki 21 was named World's Best Blended Whisky at the 2014 World Whiskies Awards and was awarded 96 points in Jim Murray's 2014 Whisky Bible. Dr. Whisky says it's 'Unbelievably balanced, and dangerously drinkable'. So basically, it's pretty good stuff!

fettercairn 23 year old cask 1374 1989 c.palate: A touch of manuka honey and stem ginger, pralines, nutmeg and allspice. Thick barley malt core.
fettercairn 23 year old cask 1374 1989 c.name: fettercairn 23 year old cask 1374 1989 celebration of the cask carn mor whisky
fettercairn 23 year old cask 1374 1989 c.notes: lemon, zest, nutmeg, allspice, barley, honey
fettercairn 23 year old cask 1374 1989 c.nose: Hints of dried strawberry jam and lime zest. Beeswax. Malty.
fettercairn 23 year old cask 1374 1989 c.description: This was distilled at the Fettercairn distillery on the 31st May 1989. It was aged in hogshead number 1374 before bottling for the Carn Mor range in August 2012. A release of 187 numbered bottles.

Auchentoshan Virgin Oak.palate: A fruitiness follows on the vanilla sea alongside the nutmeg. Orange buoys bob up and down, sharp and fresh.
Auchentoshan Virgin Oak.name: Auchentoshan Virgin Oak
Auchentoshan Virgin Oak.nose: Pockets of spicy nutmeg float upon a calming vanilla.
Auchentoshan Virgin Oak.description: Placed in brand new oak casks right from the start, Auchentoshan threw the dice and won with their new Virgin Oak release. Instead of maturing in a cask that previous held sherry or bourbon, like most whiskies are, they did something different and have luckily created something stunning.

Tullamore D.e.w..palate: Good body with notes of sherried peels and spice, granary toast with butter and honey, grains and vanilla cream.
Tullamore D.e.w..name: Tullamore D.e.w.
Tullamore D.e.w..notes: fruity, spice, butter, cream, vanilla, caramel, toffee, honey
Tullamore D.e.w..nose: Fruity and biscuity. There are gristy notes with caramel and toffee sweetness and plenty of peels.
Tullamore D.e.w..description: The 'D.E.W.' in Tullamore D.E.W. comes from the initials of a General Manager at the Tullamore distillery in the later 19th Century, named Daniel E. Williams.

Tormore Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisk.palate: Caramelised orange peel, with hints of fresh lime and grapefruit in support. Sliced apples and more of that golden barley core. Good body.
Tormore Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisk.name: Tormore   Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Tormore Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisk.notes: orange, fruity, apple, almond, barley, caramel
Tormore Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisk.nose: Steamed marmalade pudding and flourless orange cake made with crushed almonds. Apple peel and juicy barley.
Tormore Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisk.description:
Well if it isn't a new-look batch of That Boutique-y Whisky Company's Tormore single malt. The distillery lies in Speyside, on the edge of Cairngorms National Park which is home to some of Britain’s highest peaks. Hence why the label features a big ol' hill, or ‘Torra Mhòir’, if you will.

This is a release of 103 bottles.

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic novel-style labels.

Linkwood 26 Year Old 1984 Cask 5266 (ade.palate: Thick, malty core with toasty oak, a little coffee, caramelised sugar and toffee apples.
Linkwood 26 Year Old 1984 Cask 5266 (ade.name: Linkwood 26 Year Old 1984 Cask 5266 (adelphi)
Linkwood 26 Year Old 1984 Cask 5266 (ade.notes: oak, plum, fruit, fruity, berry, caramel, toffee, coffee
Linkwood 26 Year Old 1984 Cask 5266 (ade.nose: Rich, fruity nose with cooked apples, plum and dates. Malty, biscuity, with hints of oak.
Linkwood 26 Year Old 1984 Cask 5266 (ade.description: Another superb cask strength Linkwood from Adelphi, aged in cask 5266, with a much lighter hue than cask 5269. This was distilled in 1984 and aged for 26 years before bottling in 2011 with an out-turn of 113 bottles.

Glenfarclas 1984 Family Cask.palate: Rich and fresh. Toffee, oak, hay. Barley, zesty fruit.
Glenfarclas 1984 Family Cask.name: Glenfarclas 1984 Family Cask
Glenfarclas 1984 Family Cask.notes: oak, citrus, fruit, fruity, barley, toffee, hay, honey
Glenfarclas 1984 Family Cask.note categories: wood, fruits, cereal, vanilla, flowers, feint
Glenfarclas 1984 Family Cask.description: Distilled in 1984, this was matured in plain hogshead before bottling in 2007 as part of Glenfarclas' Family Cask collection.

Springbank 30 Year Old 1965 Lost Bottl.palate: Rich, very intense palate entry with cinnamon and cloves to the fore. Quite coastal, with sweet plumes of smoke and cooked fruit.
Springbank 30 Year Old 1965 Lost Bottl.name: Springbank 30 Year Old 1965   Lost Bottlings Series (master Of Malt)
Springbank 30 Year Old 1965 Lost Bottl.notes: plum, fruit, cloves, cinnamon, allspice, smoky, smoke, chocolate
Springbank 30 Year Old 1965 Lost Bottl.nose: Oily, smoky nose with hints of soft sherry and a touch of dry red wine. Blackcurrant, cooked plums and allspice.
Springbank 30 Year Old 1965 Lost Bottl.description: This is an incredibly rare and impressive Springbank from our Lost Bottlings Series, which scored 95 points from Jim Murray in his 2014 Whisky Bible. The range represents the very rarest in whiskies, bottled many years ago. In the case of this one, it was distilled in 1965, aged for 30 years and bottled in October 1995. A stunning malt from a bygone era.

Arran Premier Cru Sauternes Finish (haut.palate: Thick mouthfeel, a good helping of spice and sherried sultana. Spirity oak clings most vigorously.
Arran Premier Cru Sauternes Finish (haut.name: Arran Premier Cru Sauternes Finish (haut Peyraguey)
Arran Premier Cru Sauternes Finish (haut.nose: Not quite what one expects. There is a grassy, countryside quality with grape, but one bereft of the botrytis.
Arran Premier Cru Sauternes Finish (haut.description: This cask strength from the Isle of Arran distillery comes from a release of just 312 bottles and has been finished for 9 months in a Premier Cru Sauternes cask from Chateau Clos Haut-Peyraguey.

Tullamore D.e.w. 12 Year Old Special Res.palate: Light and soft with hints of gentle spices (nutmeg, allspice), a touch of honey and creamy fruits in yoghurt.
Tullamore D.e.w. 12 Year Old Special Res.name: Tullamore D.e.w. 12 Year Old Special Reserve
Tullamore D.e.w. 12 Year Old Special Res.notes: fruit, spices, nutmeg, allspice, creamy, cream, honey
Tullamore D.e.w. 12 Year Old Special Res.nose: Scones with clotted cream and vinous strawberry jam, sultanas, dates and digestive biscuits. Linseed and honey.
Tullamore D.e.w. 12 Year Old Special Res.description: Originally launched for the travel retail market, this 12 year old Irish blend is full of sweetness and sublimely smooth.

Peaty, Sherry Cask Finished Blended Malt.palate: Earthy peat develops smoke, cinnamon and cereals, balanced by boiled sweets and chewy raisins.
Peaty, Sherry Cask Finished Blended Malt.name: Peaty, Sherry Cask Finished Blended Malt Whisky (batshit Mental Ideas)
Peaty, Sherry Cask Finished Blended Malt.notes: raisin, fruity, cinnamon, peat, earthy, smoky, smoke, coffee
Peaty, Sherry Cask Finished Blended Malt.nose: Bonfire embers and smoky bacon crisps, with a touch of maple syrup. Notes of sponge cake, fragrant cereals and fruity coffee follow.
Peaty, Sherry Cask Finished Blended Malt.description: A batch of fantastic peated blended malt whisky, finished in a Sherry cask. Perhaps not the most Batshit Mental of all the ideas in the range, but certainly not something you see every day!

Tobermory Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.palate: Rich, biscuity palate entry with a very fresh, coastal quality. Slightly oily in delivery with hints of baking spices, berry fruits and malt.
Tobermory Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.name: Tobermory   Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Tobermory Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.notes: pine, fruit, fruity, berry, peppery, spices, allspice, spice, butter, cocoa
Tobermory Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.nose: Peppery, fruity aromas. Hints of cocoa butter, pine needle and allspice. A touch of chocolate-coated cranberry.
Tobermory Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.description:
This is the very first batch of Tobermory single malt whisky from That Boutique-y Whisky Company. It's a stunning cask-strength dram with a wonderful cult graphic-novel-style label inspired by the children's BBC television show Balamory - famously filmed in the town of Tobermory!

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

This is a release of 200 numbered bottles.

Port Ellen 24 Year Old 1979 Cask Stren.palate: Tarry old ropes and beeswax. Hints of lemon curd, honey, allspice and cardamom. Rich oak and a thick plume of oily wood smoke.
Port Ellen 24 Year Old 1979 Cask Stren.name: Port Ellen 24 Year Old 1979   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Port Ellen 24 Year Old 1979 Cask Stren.notes: wood, oak, citrus, plum, lemon, allspice, peat, smoke, butter, honey, salt
Port Ellen 24 Year Old 1979 Cask Stren.nose: Coastal, aromatic nose with hints of lime peel and fresh herbs. Tangy notes of citrus, allspice, soft peat smoke and tar.
Port Ellen 24 Year Old 1979 Cask Stren.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, feint, mineral
Port Ellen 24 Year Old 1979 Cask Stren.description: This was distilled at the Port Ellen distillery on the 16th November 1979. It was then aged for 24 years in sherry butt #6773 before bottling at cask-strength in October 2004. This is a release of just 541 numbered bottles from Signatory's Cask Strength Collection.

Nikka Whisky From The Barrel.palate: Full-bodied and punchy. There is plenty of winter spice and toffee, a little caramel and vanilla and a good mouthful of fruit.
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel.name: Nikka Whisky From The Barrel
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel.notes: oak, fruit, fruity, spice, vanilla, caramel, toffee, flowers
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel.nose: Medium-body with good balance. There are notes of cut flowers and fresh fruits, spice and a little oak.
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel.description: Whisky from the Barrel is one of the greatest value for money whiskies in the world. An incredible dram from Nikka, so much power! We can't recommend this enough.

Tobermory 10 Year Old.palate: Quite sweet and light. There are notes of acacia honey and a soft oak, the smoke and peppers thereof rise gently with a touch of dried fruit and peel with a cinnamon note.
Tobermory 10 Year Old.name: Tobermory 10 Year Old
Tobermory 10 Year Old.notes: oak, fruit, pepper, cinnamon, spice, smoke, barley, toasted, butter, herbal, honey, salty
Tobermory 10 Year Old.nose: Quite light and fresh. There are notes of barley sugars and toasted cereals, hints of winter spice and a soft oak with notes of salty melted butter and ground ginger.
Tobermory 10 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, cereal, chocolate, flowers, feint, mineral
Tobermory 10 Year Old.description: A gentle, affable 10 year old single malt from the Tobermory distillery on the Isle of Mull. Now at the higher strength of 46.3%...

Scallywag.palate: The sweetness surprisingly retreats, revealing nutmeg and cereal. Vanilla comes in near the end. Cinnamon too, giving it a prickle of spice.
Scallywag.name: Scallywag
Scallywag.notes: oak, nutmeg, cinnamon, spice, peat, vanilla
Scallywag.nose: Sweetness jumps up like an excited puppy. Icing sugar, sultanas and candied ginger. A few hints of grain here and there, but sweetness steals the show.
Scallywag.description: Big Peat's gone and got himself a trusty sidekick in the shape of a dapper Fox Terrier wearing a monocle! Scallywag from Douglas Laing is a vatted malt made from Speyside whiskies, including Mortlach, Macallan and Glenrothes. Many of the whiskies used in the small batch release come from Spanish sherry butts, giving Scallywag a fab sweetness that's balanced by some "mischievous" bourbon cask whisky also in the blend.

Laphroaig Triple Wood 1l.palate: Dry and medicinal, with exotic spices, perhaps even some turmeric. The palate is surprisingly savoury at first, with what John described as “dry dampness” (taste and it’ll make sense!) - think musty wood sheds and hints of moist autumnal forest floor. The sherry notes are there too, but rather than being the big Christmas pudding flavour one often expects from Oloroso-aged whisky, we are instead treated to a much more restrained iced fruitcake, graced with hints of Laphroaig’s classic smoke.
Laphroaig Triple Wood 1l.name: Laphroaig Triple Wood 1l
Laphroaig Triple Wood 1l.notes: wood, oak, fruit, zest, spices, smoke, almond, walnut, butter, vanilla, toffee, molasses, musty
Laphroaig Triple Wood 1l.nose: Molasses and oily toffee. Dates, walnuts, notes from the Maker’s Mark barrels (vanilla, toastiness, sweetness etc). We got oodles of butter, zest, cool wood smoke, almond, and passion fruit.
Laphroaig Triple Wood 1l.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, feint, mineral
Laphroaig Triple Wood 1l.description: A 1 litre bottle of Laphroaig's marvelous Triple Wood, this was bottled for the duty free market. Triple Wood starts off in a similar manner to Quarter Cask, in that it's matured in bourbon barrels, and then transferred to quarter-sized casks. It is then matured in Oloroso sherry butts. The results are delicious!

Bruichladdich 1984 Redder Still (22 Year.palate: Full, thick mouthfeel, sweetness, spicy oak. Tart berries, spices, becomes something quite hot. Juicy.
Bruichladdich 1984 Redder Still (22 Year.name: Bruichladdich 1984 Redder Still (22 Year Old)
Bruichladdich 1984 Redder Still (22 Year.notes: oak, fruit, berry, spicy, spices, nutty, nuttiness, walnut, milky, coffee
Bruichladdich 1984 Redder Still (22 Year.nose: Full, cooked fruit, stem ginger, fruit. Milky coffee. Esters, jam on buttered toast.
Bruichladdich 1984 Redder Still (22 Year.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, coffee
Bruichladdich 1984 Redder Still (22 Year.description: This bottling from Bruichladdich has been so-named 'redder still' for its scarlet hue, this single malt is a limited release of just 4,080 bottles, distilled in 1984, it has attained its colour from the Chateau Lafleur Pomerol wine cask it was finished in.

Bushmills 1608 400th Anniversary.palate: Full, round palate with marzipan, peels, sherry, thickness.
Bushmills 1608 400th Anniversary.name: Bushmills 1608 400th Anniversary
Bushmills 1608 400th Anniversary.notes: fruit, fruity, berry, earthy, smoke, marzipan, vanilla, floral
Bushmills 1608 400th Anniversary.distillery: The Old Bushmills Whisky Distillery Company
Bushmills 1608 400th Anniversary.nose: Rich, warm. Plenty of floral, sherried notes. Slightly earthy, berry fruits, vanilla and a hint of smoke.
Bushmills 1608 400th Anniversary.description: A very special edition of the Bushmills 1608 blend, this commemorates the distillery’s 400 year anniversary. Jim Murray awarded the blend 94 points.

Amrut Herald.palate: Spicy notes develop on the palette against a voluptuous background of malty caramel sweetness. This is mouth filling stuff.
Amrut Herald.name: Amrut Herald
Amrut Herald.nose: Typical Amrut sweetness on the nose with lots of vanilla and caramel.
Amrut Herald.description: An interesting experiment from the chaps at Amrut, who shipped four bourbon barrels 5,000 miles from Bangalore to the remote German Island of Helgoland to finish their maturation. The result is a more complex Amrut and one that fans of this innovative distillery will savour.

Laphroaig 14 Year Old 1998 Un Chillfil.palate: Malty and rounded palate, with linseed oil, hints of TCP, dark chocolate and apple strudel, with a development of burning rubber.
Laphroaig 14 Year Old 1998 Un Chillfil.name: Laphroaig 14 Year Old 1998   Un Chillfiltered (signatory)
Laphroaig 14 Year Old 1998 Un Chillfil.nose: A curious mix of orange blossom, coal tar and creosote on the nose. Hints of cinnamon, black treacle and stewed apples.
Laphroaig 14 Year Old 1998 Un Chillfil.description: A beautiful Laphroaig from the Un-Chillfiltered collection from Signatory, distilled on the 12th May 1998, aged in hogsheads 5562 and 5563 and bottled on the 30th May 2012. A release of 664 numbered bottles.

Wemyss Winter Spice 1982 (teaninich).palate: The palate is fresh and vibrant, which belies its age. A grassy, herbal note fades to reveal mint, sweet spice and cloved oranges.
Wemyss Winter Spice 1982 (teaninich).name: Wemyss Winter Spice 1982 (teaninich)
Wemyss Winter Spice 1982 (teaninich).notes: fruit, cloves, spicy, cinnamon, spice, herbal
Wemyss Winter Spice 1982 (teaninich).nose: Very spicy, bursting with cinnamon, ginger and cloves, followed by revealing notes of sweet candied fruits and demerara sugar.
Wemyss Winter Spice 1982 (teaninich).description: A spicy and warming Teaninich  bottled at cask strength (44.4%), without colouring or chill filtration, by Wemyss Malts.

Smooth Ambler Contradiction Bourbon.palate: Rather buttery indeed - think buttered toast with a fresh cup of coffee on the side and you're on the right track. More dried fruit and a subtle vegetal note on the mid palate.
Smooth Ambler Contradiction Bourbon.name: Smooth Ambler Contradiction Bourbon
Smooth Ambler Contradiction Bourbon.notes: fruit, raisin, almond, hazelnut, butter, vanilla, caramel, coffee, honey, salt
Smooth Ambler Contradiction Bourbon.nose: Salted caramel brownies (yum!), honey dipped almonds and hazelnuts. Moves on to sultanas and raisins soon after.
Smooth Ambler Contradiction Bourbon.note categories: fruits, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint, mineral
Smooth Ambler Contradiction Bourbon.description: A bourbon of two sides from Smooth Ambler. Their Contradiction Bourbon is made with a blends of two whiskeys - one is a rather young wheated bourbon distilled by Smooth Ambler themselves, the other is an old, rye-rich bourbon that the distillers have sourced (as they do for the Old Scout range). An intriguing release for those interested in the art of distilling, and for those who just simply love a tasty bourbon too.

Uisce Beatha Blended Irish Whiskey.palate: Fresh cream, malt toast, hints of char from the bourbon casks.
Uisce Beatha Blended Irish Whiskey.name: Uisce Beatha Blended Irish Whiskey
Uisce Beatha Blended Irish Whiskey.nose: Clean notes of vanilla, toffee, malt and white chocolate.
Uisce Beatha Blended Irish Whiskey.description: A blended Irish whiskey, made with Irish single malt and grain whiskeys matured for at least four years in ex-bourbon American oak casks. Uisce Beatha, pronounced "ish-ka-ba-ha", takes its name from the ancient Gaelic for "water of life".

Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Sherry Ca.palate: Gloriously oily and mouth-coating, with intense but balanced notes of rum-soaked raisin and charred oak. A touch of leafy, forest air.
Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Sherry Ca.name: Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Sherry Cask   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Sherry Ca.notes: oak, raisin, clove, spices, peanut, herbal
Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Sherry Ca.nose: Powerful notes of chewy raisin, burnt sugar, campfire embers and chocolate-covered peanuts. Touches of tobacco deeper within, revealing herbal undertones. A drop of water will bring out its perfumed, malty core.
Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Sherry Ca.description:
You know how you love Bruichladdich single malt, yeah? We agree with you. It's excellent. That's why we've gone ahead and bottled a stunning 12 year old Bruichladdich which has been matured in a first-fill Sherry hogshead from June 2002 to November 2014 for our Single Cask Series. Glad we're on the same page.

Not only does this bottle house the cracking Islay whisky, stopping it from floating away into the ether, this bottle comes presented with an innovative, air-tight glass closure, stopping the chance of cork taint affecting its flavour as it would a bottle of wine. Nifty, eh? Not only that, they're also just generally pretty cool looking. Win-win. 

These glass closures are experimental and we're looking for feedback on them - head over to our blog to leave your comments!

A release of 86 bottles.

Penderyn With Tasting Glass.palate: Thick and sweet, spices, green, biscuity. Custard.
Penderyn With Tasting Glass.name: Penderyn With Tasting Glass
