Penderyn With Tasting Glass.nose: Sweet, medium body. Herbal, vanilla, sweetness, resin, sultanas, toast. Over-ripe grape.
Penderyn With Tasting Glass.description: A smart looking tasting Penderyn tasting glass, made by Glencairn. This comes with two miniatures of Penderyn Welsh single malt.

Sullivans Cove French Oak Cask.palate: Jelly babies and a little more white pepper dominate the palate entry with cinnamon and a lick of fresh cut grass developing.
Sullivans Cove French Oak Cask.name: Sullivans Cove French Oak Cask
Sullivans Cove French Oak Cask.nose: Melted dark chocolate and red wine gums open up a big fruity nose. Hints of anise, white pepper and coconut.
Sullivans Cove French Oak Cask.description:
Strictly 1 Per Customer!

This Aussie whisky comes from the island state of Tasmania. When they are not being harassed by the Tasmanian devils they produce some of the best whisky being made south of the Equator at this moment. The whisky in this bottle was finished in French Oak Port Casks for a fruity flavour.

Speyburn 8 Year Old 2004 Provenance (d.palate: Fruity and toffee-rich. Vanilla fudge, black pepper and apple peel.
Speyburn 8 Year Old 2004 Provenance (d.name: Speyburn 8 Year Old 2004   Provenance (dougas Laing)
Speyburn 8 Year Old 2004 Provenance (d.notes: fruity, apple, pepper, allspice, spice, almond, vanilla, toffee
Speyburn 8 Year Old 2004 Provenance (d.nose: Ground almonds and buttery toffee. Thick malt, allspice and vanilla.
Speyburn 8 Year Old 2004 Provenance (d.description: This was distilled at the Speyburn distillery in Autumn 2004, before an 8 year single cask maturation in a sherry butt. It was bottled for the Provenance range from Douglas Laing, oddly in “Winter 2013” – which, as of the time of writing, is in the future.

English Whisky Co. Chapter 9 20cl.palate: Sweet and very rounded, almost a hint of white chocolate. Very interesting smoke, has a lovely heat to it, reminds us of striking up a match, so thick and creamy, and very, very malty. Notes of vanilla, and butterscotch angel delight.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 9 20cl.name: English Whisky Co. Chapter 9 20cl
English Whisky Co. Chapter 9 20cl.notes: nutmeg, peat, smoky, smoke, creamy, chocolate, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee, coffee
English Whisky Co. Chapter 9 20cl.nose: Oily and quite robust. Smoky bacon. Hints of sticking plasters, some toffee. A sort of Caol Ila nose, nice gristy sweetness. A touch tropical with a little papaya and coconut ice, then a hint of nougat.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 9 20cl.description: A peaty little treat from the English Whisky Company - this is a 20cl bottle of their Chapter 9 peated English single malt whisky. It was distilled back in December 2010 and bottled in February 2014 at three years old.

Penderyn Portwood Cask Finish Pt26.palate: The palate is rich with steeped red fruits and lighter notes of pineapple and mango.
Penderyn Portwood Cask Finish Pt26.name: Penderyn Portwood Cask Finish Pt26
Penderyn Portwood Cask Finish Pt26.notes: wood, oak, berry, fruit, pineapple, fruity, mango, spice
Penderyn Portwood Cask Finish Pt26.nose: Rich tropical fruits and a deep vinous quality offset with a little wood spice.
Penderyn Portwood Cask Finish Pt26.description: This Penderyn has been finished in ex-Port pipes to give it a fruity flavour and this limited release Single Cask bottling has been bottled at cask strength and packaged in an American Oak box for a smart effect, charming stuff!

Cragganmore 20 Year Old 1991 Cask 1157.palate: Rounded and thick, with vanilla to the fore. This is not unlike a kind of alcoholic custard in fact, with more than a suggestion of apple strudel and stewed rhubarb. In the glass it becomes quite woody, and almost vegetal, with a hint of chamomile tea with honey in it.
Cragganmore 20 Year Old 1991 Cask 1157.name: Cragganmore 20 Year Old 1991 Cask 1157   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Cragganmore 20 Year Old 1991 Cask 1157.notes: woody, oak, orange, apple, zest, spicy, cinnamon, vanilla, custard, cocoa, honey
Cragganmore 20 Year Old 1991 Cask 1157.nose: Toasty and soft, with lots of sweet malt. Gentle oak, which offers up notes of cinnamon and vanilla.
Cragganmore 20 Year Old 1991 Cask 1157.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, vanilla, coffee, feint
Cragganmore 20 Year Old 1991 Cask 1157.description: A 20 year old single cask Cragganmore. We absolutely love this, it has just the right amount of sweetness, and just the right amount of maturity. Distilled on the 8th March 1991 and bottled in March 2011, this is a refill hoggie-matured Speyside whisky, with an outturn of 274 bottles. Non-chillfiltered, with no artificial colouring. Just pure, unadulterated deliciousness!

Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.palate: Rich, soft and sweet oak with custard. The mouthfeel is like silk, and Preston Van Winkle likens this to a classic Cognac, and we reckon he’s onto something. The maturity, smooth/oily feel of this on the tongue, coupled with musty fruitiness sum up what we love about a decent XO, this is sublime.
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.name: Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbon 20 Year Old
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.notes: oak, fruit, peppery, spices, walnut, chocolate, custard, musty
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.distillery: Old Rip Van Winkle Whiskey Distillery
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.nose: Stewed fruits on the nose, sweet spices, oiliness, white chocolate, walnut.
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.description: Incredibly old for a bourbon, this bottling of Pappy Van Winkle’s Family Reserve was aged for 20 years and retains a beautiful sweetness, a perfect digestif bourbon.

Nikka Taketsuru 12 Year Old.palate: Sweet and oily, apple cider, cinnamon sticks, buttery toffee, almond, salty butter, custard.
Nikka Taketsuru 12 Year Old.name: Nikka Taketsuru 12 Year Old
Nikka Taketsuru 12 Year Old.notes: plum, apple, cinnamon, almond, butter, creamy, cream, vanilla, toffee, custard, floral, coffee, salty
Nikka Taketsuru 12 Year Old.nose: Floral and balanced, with notes of plum jam, cut herbs, rhubarb pie, vanilla ice cream and cold coffee.
Nikka Taketsuru 12 Year Old.note categories: fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, coffee, mineral
Nikka Taketsuru 12 Year Old.description: The 12 year old variant of Nikka's incredible range of blended malts, named after the company's founder, Masataka Taketsuru. Very good indeed.

Miltonduff 18 Year Old 1995 Single Cas.palate: Rich red fruit, blackberry, and reduced red wine and port. Very big indeed.
Miltonduff 18 Year Old 1995 Single Cas.name: Miltonduff 18 Year Old 1995   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Miltonduff 18 Year Old 1995 Single Cas.notes: fruit, fruity, berry, nutmeg, cinnamon, chocolate
Miltonduff 18 Year Old 1995 Single Cas.nose: Richly rounded. Rotund even. Red berries (especially Redcurrant), chocolate sauce and the merest suggestion of cinnamon and nutmeg.
Miltonduff 18 Year Old 1995 Single Cas.description:
Summer pudding from Speyside! This Master of Malt single cask bottling of Miltonduff is so fruity it must count towards one of your five a day! Don’t quote us on that though because we’re not medical men, for all we know whisky might not be as good for you as fruit and veg.

If you like berries and port then you’ll like this whisky. If you don’t then we feel sorry for you because those things are really nice.

Glenfiddich 29 Year Old 'spirit Of A Nat.palate: Vanilla ice-cream dusted with sweet, spicy cinnamon. Deeper notes of beeswax and luxurious polished leather.
Glenfiddich 29 Year Old 'spirit Of A Nat.name: Glenfiddich 29 Year Old 'spirit Of A Nation'
Glenfiddich 29 Year Old 'spirit Of A Nat.notes: oak, fruit, spicy, cinnamon, spices, vanilla, leather
Glenfiddich 29 Year Old 'spirit Of A Nat.nose: Beautiful dried fruit notes with rich oak spices drifting up wonderfully.
Glenfiddich 29 Year Old 'spirit Of A Nat.description:
STRICTLY 1 PER CUSTOMER

In December 2013, four brave servicemen and women who have been wounded while serving in the armed forces will set out on an awe-inspiring 335km race to the South Pole. Glenfiddich have proudly sponsored the team and released the 29 year old 'Spirit of a Nation' whisky in their honour.

A UK exclusive, this single malt Scotch whisky comes from a refill sherry cask, laid down in February 1984, which was selected by Glenfiddich's Malt Master. It was finished in a special cask that has toured the UK, appearing at four events in support of the Walking With The Wounded UK South Pole Challenge team. Good luck messages for the servicemen and women were written on the cask itself. 

Just 200 bottles of Glenfiddich 'Spirit of a Nation' have been released. Glenfiddich will be donating all the profits from these bottles to Walking With The Wounded. Two bottles are being taken by the Walking With The Wounded South Pole Challenge team on their journey, one of which will be auctioned to raise even more money for the charity.

Mortlach 17 Year Old 1995 Un Chillfilt.palate: Clean, fruity palate entry. Cooked banana, butterscotch, apple peel and allspice.
Mortlach 17 Year Old 1995 Un Chillfilt.name: Mortlach 17 Year Old 1995   Un Chillfiltered (signatory)
Mortlach 17 Year Old 1995 Un Chillfilt.notes: woody, raisin, fruity, apple, allspice, almond, butterscotch, honey
Mortlach 17 Year Old 1995 Un Chillfilt.nose: Woody, fruity nose with hints of marmalade and Corinth raisins. Ground almonds and stem ginger. Hints of honey.
Mortlach 17 Year Old 1995 Un Chillfilt.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, vanilla, feint
Mortlach 17 Year Old 1995 Un Chillfilt.description: This was distilled at Mortlach on the 5th July 1995 before a 17 year maturation in a pair of hogsheads. It was bottled for Signatory's Un-Chillfiltered collection on the 20th November 2012. A release of 752 numbered bottles.

Aberlour 15 Year Old Select Cask Reserve.palate: Heavy vanilla and more honey-dipped raisins. A little hint of almond and orange peel.
Aberlour 15 Year Old Select Cask Reserve.name: Aberlour 15 Year Old Select Cask Reserve
Aberlour 15 Year Old Select Cask Reserve.notes: orange, citrus, raisin, fruity, almond, vanilla, honey
Aberlour 15 Year Old Select Cask Reserve.nose: Masses of sherry influence. Plump raisins and thick honey.
Aberlour 15 Year Old Select Cask Reserve.description: A 15 year old Aberlour single malt, usually found on mainland Europe but some of these tasty rascals have drifted out to our little island. Matured in a mixed of sherry and bourbon casks, lending fruity sweetness to the whisky.

Glenmorangie 18 Year Old Extremely Rare.palate: Tinned citrus, lychee, very creamy, honey.
Glenmorangie 18 Year Old Extremely Rare.name: Glenmorangie 18 Year Old Extremely Rare
Glenmorangie 18 Year Old Extremely Rare.notes: oak, citrus, berry, spice, creamy, honey
Glenmorangie 18 Year Old Extremely Rare.nose: Creamy honey and Greek yoghurt, grapefruit, exotic spice, berry compote.
Glenmorangie 18 Year Old Extremely Rare.description: A wonderfully creamy and thick 18 year old dram, matured for 15 years in ex bourbon casks before being finished in Oloroso sherry casks. An exquisite, tropical-fruit driven Glenmorangie.

Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask Release VII.palate: Fresh, spicy, rich palate. Surprisingly fresh, as notes of freshly cut hay, tangy green oak and vanilla. It becomes creamy, with hints of spotted dick with hot custard.
Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask Release VII.name: Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask Release VII
Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask Release VII.notes: oak, orange, fruit, apple, zest, spicy, creamy, vanilla, toffee, custard, hay
Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask Release VII.nose: Sweet and thick. Syrupy notes of sticky toffee pudding, vanilla and fresh, homemade fudge. Just delicious. Hints of apple, a little touch of ginger and orange zest.
Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask Release VII.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, flowers
Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask Release VII.description: The 7th release of Glenfarclas' 1971 Family Cask. This was filled into sherry butt 140, where it rested until bottling in 2011. An outturn of 468 bottles.

White Bowmore 43 Year Old 1964.palate: Full. Pine and hickory. Sugary sweet, vanilla and honey, soft peat.
White Bowmore 43 Year Old 1964.name: White Bowmore 43 Year Old 1964
White Bowmore 43 Year Old 1964.notes: oak, pine, fruit, fruity, peat, smoke, vanilla, honey
White Bowmore 43 Year Old 1964.nose: Tropical fruit, gentle smoke. Guava, juicy papaya, faint peat. Perfumy, vanilla lurks.
White Bowmore 43 Year Old 1964.description: Just 732 bottles of this 1964 vintage Bowmore were released. Part of a trio from that year, this one with the moniker 'White', was named after the lighter colour that bourbon maturation tends to produce.

1776 Straight Rye Whiskey.palate: Orange zest, heavy rye bread and subtle oak influence.
1776 Straight Rye Whiskey.name: 1776 Straight Rye Whiskey
1776 Straight Rye Whiskey.notes: oak, orange, zest, pepper, spicy, cinnamon, clove, bread
1776 Straight Rye Whiskey.distillery: James E Pepper And Co Whiskey Distillery
1776 Straight Rye Whiskey.nose: Big, spicy wafts of rye, with hints of clove and cinnamon underneath.
1776 Straight Rye Whiskey.description: 1776 Straight Rye Whiskey comes from the James E. Pepper brand, a name that has long been known in the American whiskey world, though not as much recently as it was in the early 1900s. Happily, the 1776 brand has been relaunched and the James E. Pepper legend lives on! This straight rye is made with a mash-bill featuring 90% rye and has been bottled at 50% ABV.

Strathisla 1970 (gordon & Macphail).palate: Marzipan and Christmas spices with a lick of vanilla.
Strathisla 1970 (gordon & Macphail).name: Strathisla 1970 (gordon & Macphail)
Strathisla 1970 (gordon & Macphail).nose: Burnt Christmas cake, rum-soaked raisins and demerara sugar.
Strathisla 1970 (gordon & Macphail).description: Strathisla is one of the oldest operating distilleries and is a key component in the Chivas Regal blend. This 1970 vintage Strathisla was bottled by Gordon and MacPhail of Elgin as part of their distillery label range.

Macallan Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whis.palate: Pear juice, hints of sweet Normandy cider and allspice. Thick, biscuity malt, a little toasted barley and vanilla ice cream.
Macallan Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whis.name: Macallan   Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Macallan Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whis.notes: fruit, fruity, pepper, allspice, spice, barley, toasted, creamy, cream, vanilla, caramel, toffee
Macallan Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whis.nose: Rich, malty nose with hints of toffee apples, brandy snaps and a hint of treacle. Rich notes of winter spice, pepper and cooked fruit.
Macallan Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whis.description:
The third batch of That Boutique-y Whisky Company's Macallan is a rich, malty whisky, featuring a wonderful graphic-novel-style illustration of a handsome giant looking with curiosity at Macallan's Curiously Small Stills, which are actually very large indeed!

Batch 3 is a release of 245 numbered bottles.

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Arran The Devil's Punch Bowl Chapter II.palate: Vanilla, mixed nuts, juicy prunes, dried papaya and chocolate liqueurs.
Arran The Devil's Punch Bowl Chapter II.name: Arran The Devil's Punch Bowl Chapter II (angels And Devils)
Arran The Devil's Punch Bowl Chapter II.notes: wood, fruit, spices, peat, earthy, nut, nuts, chocolate, mocha, vanilla, caramel, cocoa
Arran The Devil's Punch Bowl Chapter II.nose: Dried fruit and wood spices with notes of mocha and tobacco leaf.
Arran The Devil's Punch Bowl Chapter II.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee
Arran The Devil's Punch Bowl Chapter II.description:
You ever dram with the devil in the pale moonlight? Well, here's your second of three chances in this unholy trinity of releases, part of Arran's Angels & Devils series.

Chapter II was created from 27 casks by Master Distiller James MacTaggart, 17 Sherry casks, 6 unpeated bourbon casks and 4 peated bourbon casks with vintages ranging from 1997 to 2004.

Sazerac Straight Rye 18 Year Old Whiskey.palate: An initial astringency is surprising after the sweetness of the nose, but it soon becomes clear what the game is here, as under-ripe banana that arrived first is elbowed out of the way by its caramelized, almost Barbequed bigger brother. Astonishing layers of complexity begin to develop.
Sazerac Straight Rye 18 Year Old Whiskey.name: Sazerac Straight Rye 18 Year Old Whiskey (fall 2009)
Sazerac Straight Rye 18 Year Old Whiskey.notes: oak, cherry, spiciness, spicy, cinnamon, nut, hazelnut, toasted, caramel, leather
Sazerac Straight Rye 18 Year Old Whiskey.nose: Huge and powerful sweet Rye on the initial nosing gives way to cinnamon toasted brioche, leather, and more than a hint of Maraschino cherry. A really huge hit of oak follows, somewhat vinous with it - we were reminded of a barrique aged chardonnay. There’s something slightly medicinal lurking somewhere - a hint of Iodine perhaps? Definitely not out of place amongst the other huge aromas given off by this whiskey though. A slight suggestion of Coconut right at the tail end.
Sazerac Straight Rye 18 Year Old Whiskey.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, vanilla, feint

Glentauchers 15 Year Old 1996 Dimensio.palate: Apricots, raisins, smooth toffee and slight maltiness.
Glentauchers 15 Year Old 1996 Dimensio.name: Glentauchers 15 Year Old 1996   Dimensions (duncan Taylor)
Glentauchers 15 Year Old 1996 Dimensio.nose: Apples, pears, trace of birch wood and eucalyptus. Some sherry notes.
Glentauchers 15 Year Old 1996 Dimensio.description: Glentauchers is known to be a key ingredient in the Ballantine’s and Teacher’s blends, but this is an interesting single malt that deserves more exposure.

Auchentoshan 14 Year Old Cooper's Reserv.palate: More fruit than the nose - plenty of raisins, figs and juicy orange. Well balanced with thick vanilla, nuts and a hint of oak.
Auchentoshan 14 Year Old Cooper's Reserv.name: Auchentoshan 14 Year Old Cooper's Reserve
Auchentoshan 14 Year Old Cooper's Reserv.notes: oak, orange, fruit, raisin, nut, almond, nuts, hazelnut, walnut, creamy, milk, chocolate, vanilla, toffee
Auchentoshan 14 Year Old Cooper's Reserv.nose: Diced almond and crushed hazelnut, drizzled in toffee sauce. Touches of orange oil and fig rolls.
Auchentoshan 14 Year Old Cooper's Reserv.description: This 14 year old Auchentoshan single malt Scotch whisky was released for travel retail and bestowed the title 'Cooper's Reserve'. The whisky was drawn from a selection of Spanish Oloroso Sherry casks and North American Sherry casks, resulting in a flavour profile brimming with sugared almonds, dried fruit and creamy vanilla.

Hibiki 12 Year Old.palate: Crushed almonds, stewed fruits, clove-studded oranges. Sherried malt and a subtle core of oak.
Hibiki 12 Year Old.name: Hibiki 12 Year Old
Hibiki 12 Year Old.notes: oak, orange, citrus, plum, fruit, apple, cinnamon, almond, honey
Hibiki 12 Year Old.nose: Juicy marmalade with real chunks of orange, cooked apples dusted with cinnamon, thick honey and plum wine.
Hibiki 12 Year Old.description: An exquisite 12 year old blended Japanese whisky. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.

Brora 30 Year Old (2007 Release).palate: Soft diesel notes, cereal sweetness, spicy. Buttery, waxy. Seaweed.
Brora 30 Year Old (2007 Release).name: Brora 30 Year Old (2007 Release)
Brora 30 Year Old (2007 Release).notes: oak, citrus, fruit, spicy, peat, smoke, vanilla
Brora 30 Year Old (2007 Release).nose: Fresher and sweeter than the 2006 release. Citrus, vanilla, stewed fruit, soft peat, farmy. Stemmy and coastal.
Brora 30 Year Old (2007 Release).description: Just 2,958 individually numbered bottles were released. This Brora 30 year old was matured in refill American and European oak casks and was released in September of 2007.

Caol Ila 25 Year Old 1978.name: Caol Ila 25 Year Old 1978
Caol Ila 25 Year Old 1978.notes: woody, wood, apple, peat, smoky, smoke
Caol Ila 25 Year Old 1978.nose: Gentle sweetness, fresh. Wistful smoke, soft peat, a little fruitiness. Apple wood dries in a smokehouse.
Caol Ila 25 Year Old 1978.description: The oldest official bottling from the Caol Ila distillery, this 25 year old Islay single malt was released as one of just 6,000 bottles, distilled in 1978 and bottled in 2003 at cask strength.

Famous Grouse 16 Year Old Double Matured.palate: Sweet fruit and vanilla notes continue, but vibrant hints of cinnamon and nutmeg spice develop at the centre, adding depth and warmth.
Famous Grouse 16 Year Old Double Matured.name: Famous Grouse 16 Year Old Double Matured
Famous Grouse 16 Year Old Double Matured.notes: fruit, spicy, nutmeg, cinnamon, spice, vanilla, caramel
Famous Grouse 16 Year Old Double Matured.nose: Poached pears, runny caramel and Victoria sponge cake (sounds like quite a yummy dessert!).
Famous Grouse 16 Year Old Double Matured.description: The Famous Grouse 16 Year Old Double Matured blended Scotch whisky is a limited edition release which has been finished in a combination of first fill Spanish Sherry casks and first fill American bourbon casks. This limited edition release comes handsomely presented, with a design produced by renowned illustrator Vic Lee.

Johnnie Walker Blue Label Signature 1l.palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass and a good hit of malt.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Signature 1l.name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label Signature 1l
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Signature 1l.notes: oak, cedar, citrus, plum, fruit, berry, spice, smoke, chocolate, toffee, floral, honey
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Signature 1l.nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice and citrus.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Signature 1l.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, feint
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Signature 1l.description: A very rare one litre bottle of Johnnie Walker Blue Label, this is a duty free exlusive and comes with a little letter in which you can send your signature off for analysis (which is super cool).

Balvenie Founders Reserve With Bar Stand.palate: Medium-bodied, malty palate with intense spice and Demerara sugar. Pepper, creamy barley wine and fruit.
Balvenie Founders Reserve With Bar Stand.name: Balvenie Founders Reserve With Bar Stand
Balvenie Founders Reserve With Bar Stand.notes: fruit, peach, pepper, spices, allspice, spice, peat, smoke, barley, creamy, toffee, honey
Balvenie Founders Reserve With Bar Stand.nose: Peach nectar and manuka honey. Hints of allspice, burnt sugar and toffee apples. A vague whiff of peat smoke.
Balvenie Founders Reserve With Bar Stand.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Balvenie Founders Reserve With Bar Stand.description: This is an incredibly rare bottle of Balvenie Founder's Reserve - a legendary 10 year old packaged in a Cognac-style bottle. Bottled in the late 1980s, this rare edition even comes complete with a bar stand.

Glencraig 33 Year Old 1976 Cask Streng.palate: Honey, Scotch tablet, allspice and dense stewed fruit.
Glencraig 33 Year Old 1976 Cask Streng.name: Glencraig 33 Year Old 1976   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Glencraig 33 Year Old 1976 Cask Streng.notes: fruit, spicy, allspice, creamy, coffee, honey
Glencraig 33 Year Old 1976 Cask Streng.nose: Treacle tart, golden syrup, oatcakes and toast.
Glencraig 33 Year Old 1976 Cask Streng.description: Glencraig was distilled at Glenburgie using their Lomond stills before they were removed in 1981 and production of Glencraig was ceased. The Lomond still was invented as an answer to the increased demand for Scotch whisky following the shortages of the war years. It had the bulbous shape of the traditional pot still but instead of an elegant lyne arm on top, it had a coffee can shaped top with three rectifying plates. The idea was that it was easier to assemble and the finished product would be more rounded and less oily than malt whisky tends to be.

Ardmore 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 8020 Old.palate: Oily, spicy palate with big notes of wood smoke and pepper.
Ardmore 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 8020 Old.name: Ardmore 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 8020   Old Malt Cask (douglas Laing)
Ardmore 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 8020 Old.notes: wood, pepper, spicy, allspice, smoke, barley
Ardmore 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 8020 Old.nose: Wood ash and hints of smoked meat. A little gingernut, barley and allspice.
Ardmore 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 8020 Old.description: This was distilled at the Ardmore distillery in February 1996 before a 16 year maturation in a single cask (a refill hogshead). It was bottled for Douglas Laing's Old Malt Cask range in February 2012, and there are just 315 bottles available.

Braeval 10 Year Old Cigar Malt Old Mal.palate: Huge chocolate delivery, develops with big vanilla sweetness and sherry. Peppery, tangy and very fruity.
Braeval 10 Year Old Cigar Malt Old Mal.name: Braeval 10 Year Old Cigar Malt   Old Malt Cask (douglas Laing)
Braeval 10 Year Old Cigar Malt Old Mal.notes: wood, fruity, apple, peppery, chocolate, vanilla, honey
Braeval 10 Year Old Cigar Malt Old Mal.nose: Aromatic and sweet on the nose. Thick Black Forest Honey, great malt notes, blossom, apple wood.
Braeval 10 Year Old Cigar Malt Old Mal.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Braeval 10 Year Old Cigar Malt Old Mal.description: A delicious sweet Speyside whisky, this was distilled at Braeval and aged for 10 years in a sherry butt. They bottled this as a "Cigar Malt" - a whisky that pairs perfectly with a cigar.

Glen Moray 12 Year Old.palate: The palate is creamy with a little winter spice and a green herbaceousness.
Glen Moray 12 Year Old.name: Glen Moray 12 Year Old
Glen Moray 12 Year Old.nose: Clover honey and cereal grain with a fresh gristy character.
Glen Moray 12 Year Old.description: Glen Moray is one of only a few distilleries who still malt their own barley on site and it remains a classic Speysider despite much of its product being used for blending purposes.

Hakushu Bourbon Barrel.palate: Creamy and thick with banana split, butterscotch and barrel char upfront. Hints of smoke, alongside melon and pineapple. A little allspice develops.
Hakushu Bourbon Barrel.name: Hakushu Bourbon Barrel
Hakushu Bourbon Barrel.notes: lemon, fruity, pineapple, allspice, peat, smoke, oat, creamy, milk, butterscotch, toffee, honey
Hakushu Bourbon Barrel.nose: Creamy and sweet, some lemon drizzle cake and black forest honey, a litle coconut milk and buttery toffee. A touch of cooked banana and guava too.
Hakushu Bourbon Barrel.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Hakushu Bourbon Barrel.description: The much anticipated Hakushu Bourbon Barrel sees the gently peated Japanese whisky aged entirely in first fill bourbon barrels. This has resulted in a great deal of creamy sweetness -  absolutely delicious!

Laphroaig Triple Wood.palate: Dry and medicinal, with exotic spices, perhaps even some turmeric. The palate is surprisingly savoury at first, with what John described as “dry dampness” (taste and it’ll make sense!) - think musty wood sheds and hints of moist autumnal forest floor. The sherry notes are there too, but rather than being the big Christmas pudding flavour one often expects from Oloroso-aged whisky, we are instead treated to a much more restrained iced fruitcake, graced with hints of Laphroaig’s classic smoke.
Laphroaig Triple Wood.name: Laphroaig Triple Wood
Laphroaig Triple Wood.notes: wood, oak, fruit, zest, spices, peat, smoke, almond, walnut, butter, vanilla, toffee, molasses, musty
Laphroaig Triple Wood.nose: Molasses and oily toffee. Dates, walnuts, notes from the Maker’s Mark barrels (vanilla, toastiness, sweetness etc). We got oodles of butter, zest, cool wood smoke, almond, and passion fruit.
Laphroaig Triple Wood.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, feint, mineral
Laphroaig Triple Wood.description: An incredible new release from Laphroaig. This was originally launched for the duty free market, and it is a tour de force from the Islay distillery. First off, they mature this in bourbon barrels, before transfer into quarter casks, and a third maturation in Oloroso sherry European oak butts. Astonishing with oodles of peat smoke and sweetness.

Singleton Of Dufftown Sunray.palate: Soft stewed apples. Thick honeyed texture and taste, with a hint of malt in the background.
Singleton Of Dufftown Sunray.name: Singleton Of Dufftown Sunray
Singleton Of Dufftown Sunray.nose: Vanilla and honey, apple and blackcurrant - two great pairs working well together. Grassy honey then dehydrated apple with cinnamon moving into strudel with some dark, syrupy blackcurrant.
Singleton Of Dufftown Sunray.description: One of two no age statement single malt Scotch whiskies released in 2014 for the Singleton of Dufftown range (the other being Tailfire). Sunray takes its name from a type of fly used for salmon fishing, but there's nothing fishy about this yummy expression. Aged in American bourbon casks, it's the smooth brother to the vibrant Tailfire.

Glenfarclas 1986 Family Cask.palate: Rich, sherry. Candied fruits, stem ginger, Christmas cake. Port.
Glenfarclas 1986 Family Cask.name: Glenfarclas 1986 Family Cask
Glenfarclas 1986 Family Cask.nose: Rich, sultana. Honey, unlit pipe tobacco.
Glenfarclas 1986 Family Cask.description: In Autumn of 2007, Glenfarclas released the Family Casks. This is the 1986 vintage from the range, matured in a refill sherry puncheon (cask 3434). This was bottled on the 1st March 2007, and it's part of a release of 521 bottles.

The Glendronach 14 Year Old Sauternes.palate: The cream becomes custard with the citrus zing of sweet wine slicing through followed by red apples and sultanas.
The Glendronach 14 Year Old Sauternes.name: The Glendronach 14 Year Old   Sauternes Finish
The Glendronach 14 Year Old Sauternes.notes: citrus, fruit, lemon, fruity, cream, chocolate, custard
The Glendronach 14 Year Old Sauternes.nose: Big fruity notes of rhubarb, strawberry, lemon meringue pie and whipped cream.
The Glendronach 14 Year Old Sauternes.description: Glendronach finished in premier cru Sauternes casks, released in 2010.

dailuaine 27 year old 1983 single cask m.palate: Oily and very spicy. This oozes complexity and sweetness, with a big hit of honeycomb, gingerbread and Golden Syrup. Also, stunning notes of barley and a hint of something vaguely dessert wine-like. There is a gorgeous development of oak that appears with hints of vanilla, and rum and raisin.
dailuaine 27 year old 1983 single cask m.name: dailuaine 27 year old 1983 single cask master of malt whisky
dailuaine 27 year old 1983 single cask m.notes: oak, raisin, spicy, spice, barley, vanilla, honey, musty
dailuaine 27 year old 1983 single cask m.nose: Lots of musty ginger spice and a hint of motor oil, which meld beautifully with classic old Speyside malt and honey on buttered burnt toast.
dailuaine 27 year old 1983 single cask m.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, vanilla, feint, mineral
dailuaine 27 year old 1983 single cask m.description: A beautiful Speyside malt which we bottled on the 14th July 2011. This was distilled at Dailuaine on the 2nd November 1983, and it was aged for 27 years in a refill sherry hogshead, which had an outturn of just 231 bottles. This is one of the sweetest sherried Speyside malts of this age that we’ve ever tasted – it’s really quite something. It was even awarded a Silver medal at the 2011 Malt Maniacs awards!

Yellow Spot 12 Year Old.palate: The palate is equally fruity with a substantial body and a velvety texture.
Yellow Spot 12 Year Old.name: Yellow Spot 12 Year Old
Yellow Spot 12 Year Old.nose: There are masses of fleshy stone fruit on the nose, especially peach and apricot with hints of sherried dried fruit and Bourbon cask vanilla.
Yellow Spot 12 Year Old.description: This is the second addition to the 'Spot' range of Irish whiskies, which contains the famous Green Spot Pot Still Whiskey. The Yellow Spot is a single pot still Irish whiskey which has been matured in three types of cask: American Bourbon cask, Spanish Sherry butts and Spanish Malaga casks for a sweeter flavour.

Inchmurrin 15 Year Old 1996 Cask 28 (sig.palate: Citrus, gooseberry, quince, toasted oak, freshly baked bread and mint.
Inchmurrin 15 Year Old 1996 Cask 28 (sig.name: Inchmurrin 15 Year Old 1996 Cask 28 (signatory)
Inchmurrin 15 Year Old 1996 Cask 28 (sig.notes: oak, citrus, toasted, bread, butterscotch, herbal, hay
Inchmurrin 15 Year Old 1996 Cask 28 (sig.nose: Cut hay, hints of tequila, grape skins, a touch of butterscotch and malt, acetone.
Inchmurrin 15 Year Old 1996 Cask 28 (sig.description: Inchmurrin is the name of one of the various styles of whisky distilled at Loch Lomond. This particular expression was distilled on the 18th November 1996 and was aged in refill butt 21 for 15 years before bottling on the 14th December 2011. A release of 832 numbered bottles.

Penderyn Madeira Finish 35cl.palate: Thick and sweet, spices, green, biscuity. Custard.
Penderyn Madeira Finish 35cl.name: Penderyn Madeira Finish 35cl
Penderyn Madeira Finish 35cl.notes: fruity, spices, creamy, vanilla, custard, herbal
Penderyn Madeira Finish 35cl.nose: Sweet, medium body. Herbal, vanilla, sweetness, resin, sultanas, toast. Over-ripe grape.
Penderyn Madeira Finish 35cl.description: A single malt that sums up Penderyn's house style. This is matured in bourbon barrels before a finish, unusually for an core expression, in Madeira wine casks. Fruity and creamy.

Glenrothes 40 Year Old 1970 The Octave.palate: Big, rich and spicy palate, offering up oily notes of toffee, walnut, mushroom, truffle oil and pine resin. A core of thick, syrupy malt.
Glenrothes 40 Year Old 1970 The Octave.name: Glenrothes 40 Year Old 1970   The Octave (duncan Taylor) 41.6%
Glenrothes 40 Year Old 1970 The Octave.notes: oak, pine, apple, spicy, walnut, caramel, toffee, honey
Glenrothes 40 Year Old 1970 The Octave.nose: Minty, spiced, apple crumble, caramel, malt, oak and a little apple peel.
Glenrothes 40 Year Old 1970 The Octave.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, vanilla, feint
Glenrothes 40 Year Old 1970 The Octave.description: This was distilled in 1970 and aged for the majority of its maturation in standard-sized casks, before being transferred into very small octave-sized casks for a finish. The result of this is an incredibly spicy, rich Glenrothes.

Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (6th.palate: Barley malt and dessert wine, summery notes of drying hay and sweet spices. A lovely dash of peppermint oil and a little ground ginger. Something like bourbon oak yields creamy vanilla and a dash of hot, powerful white pepper.
Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (6th.name: Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (6th Edition)
Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (6th.notes: oak, allspice, pepper, spices, cinnamon, spice, barley, creamy, vanilla, hay
Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (6th.nose: Biscuity, toasty malt with warm, rich notes of allspice and freshly grated cinnamon. Mellifluously sweet notes of mature oak, gilded with wine-like sophistication. Beautifully inviting and full of old school Speyside class.
Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (6th.note categories: wood, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, flowers
Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (6th.description:
We are overjoyed to present the sixth edition of our thrilling thirty year old single malt Scotch whisky from a secret Speyside distillery. Bold, elegant and satisfyingly complex, the sixth edition continues the tradition of our thirty year old bottlings being utterly stunning.

"Like opening up an old herb and spice cupboard and the last reverberations of a hundred cakes and stews made many years ago come quietly drifting back..."- Jim Murray (95 Points)

The Macallan 12 Year Old Sherry Oak.palate: Medium-body and quite firm. There are notes of hot pastries and marmalade, sultanas and peels with a developing sweetness from the barley sugar.
The Macallan 12 Year Old Sherry Oak.name: The Macallan 12 Year Old Sherry Oak
The Macallan 12 Year Old Sherry Oak.notes: wood, oak, fruit, apple, barley, floral
The Macallan 12 Year Old Sherry Oak.nose: Crisp and sweet. There are notes of sultanas and fresh apple blossom. There is a defined floral note with a beautiful Sherry, calvados emerges with a tropical fruit note and golden syrup.
The Macallan 12 Year Old Sherry Oak.description: A sherry wood matured 12 year old from Macallan, a superbly balanced affair, one of the best of its age group.

Highland Park Dark Origins.palate: Sweet, fragrant peat emerges with nutty melted milk chocolate and a little orange alongside some pastries.
Highland Park Dark Origins.name: Highland Park Dark Origins
Highland Park Dark Origins.notes: oak, orange, spicy, cinnamon, spices, peat, smoke, nutty, cream, milk, chocolate, vanilla, butterscotch, cocoa, coffee
Highland Park Dark Origins.nose: Dusty baking spices and cocoa at first, cinnamon, vanilla, dates. Coffee cream Revels (possibly a couple of the orange ones too), a touch of blackcurrant/liquorice, plus butterscotch and an interplay between milk and dark chocolate.
Highland Park Dark Origins.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee
Highland Park Dark Origins.description:
Highland Park Dark Origins is a new core bottling that celebrates the early days of Magnus Eunson's illicit distilling on Orkney, back before the distillery was even founded in 1798. Magnus worked as a  butcher and church official by day, but by night he was a legendary whisky smuggler and distiller outwitting the exciseman.

To honour their hero (the Batman of the Orkney Islands, if you will), Highland Park have created a whisky with a suitably 'dark' character. Using 80% first-fill Sherry casks (20% refill) - 60% are first-fill European oak, with 20% being first-fill American oak - an exciting, spicy, chocolatey whisky has been produced.

Master Of Malt 60 Year Old Speyside.palate: Creamy, mouth-filling palate entry delivering a touch of chocolate and ground allspice. Quite tropical too - there’s a note of coconut, perhaps mango. An ethereal high-note akin to tomato stems. With time, it becomes quite herbal, with a potpourri-like character, sitting very nicely atop a solid core of rich, thick malt.
Master Of Malt 60 Year Old Speyside.name: Master Of Malt 60 Year Old Speyside
Master Of Malt 60 Year Old Speyside.notes: oak, mango, raisin, apple, nutmeg, allspice, butter, creamy, chocolate, custard, herbal, cocoa, molasses
Master Of Malt 60 Year Old Speyside.nose: Beautiful malt to the fore, with a sublime backing of nutmeg, cocoa butter and raisin. Gentle waves of soft white grapes, custard apples and golden syrup. Astonishingly refined oaken notes.
Master Of Malt 60 Year Old Speyside.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, coffee, feint
Master Of Malt 60 Year Old Speyside.description:
Our award-winning Secret Bottlings Series has raised the bar yet again with this extraordinary 60 (!) year old single malt Scotch whisky from a famous Speyside distillery. Our oldest bottling to date and one of the oldest whisky releases in history.

By not revealing the name of the distillery, we're able to offer this incredibly well-aged whisky from some of the finest stock for a fraction of the price that a release like this would usually command. In fact, it's an order of magnitude (or two) more reasonable than releases of a similar age, which now carry 5 or even 6 figure price tags! What you're paying for with Master of Malt 60 Year Old Speyside, of course, is the important bit - the liquid itself.

Jack Daniel's Silver Select.palate: Rich, thick palate with a big whack of sweet spices, vanilla, custard apples and pine resin. This develops on salt caramel and cedar.
Jack Daniel's Silver Select.name: Jack Daniel's Silver Select
Jack Daniel's Silver Select.notes: cedar, pine, citrus, fruit, pepper, spicy, cinnamon, spices, vanilla, caramel, custard, salt
Jack Daniel's Silver Select.nose: Zesty citrus and pepper on the nose, with hints of crème caramel, cooked banana, burnt sugar and cinnamon.
Jack Daniel's Silver Select.description: A gorgeous Tennessee whiskey from Jack Daniel's, Silver Select is bottled at higher strength and the result is plenty of rich sweetness and complexity. Each barrel is aged in a different location within the warehouse for a better maturation.

Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old.palate: Soft, supple. Sherry, nutty. A little sweetness, malty, juicy sultana. Slightly coastal.
Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old.name: Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old
Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old.description: This entry level Bunnahabhain bottling comes in a redesigned bottle. This 12 year old is lightly peated for an Islay single malt and consequently is a light, fresh dram. Now at the higher strength of 46.3% - for more complexity and flavour.

Bunnahabhain 2004 The Macphail's Colle.palate: Sweet, fresh melon and peaches. Creamy chocolate notes.
Bunnahabhain 2004 The Macphail's Colle.name: Bunnahabhain 2004   The Macphail's Collection (gordon And Macphail)
Bunnahabhain 2004 The Macphail's Colle.nose: White chocolate and vanilla, like a pudding you would get at a fancy restaurant. Bananas develop after a little while.
Bunnahabhain 2004 The Macphail's Colle.description: Distilled in 2004 and bottled in 2013 by Gordon and MacPhail for The MacPhail's Collection, this is a rather tempting sherry matured Bunnahabhain single malt Scotch whisky.

Midleton Barry Crockett Legacy.palate: Sweet tobacco leaves and ceda, sugared peels, toffee, honey softness, vanilla and boiled sweets.
Midleton Barry Crockett Legacy.name: Midleton Barry Crockett Legacy
Midleton Barry Crockett Legacy.notes: oak, citrus, cinnamon, barley, creamy, vanilla, toffee, floral, hay, honey
Midleton Barry Crockett Legacy.nose: Soft, sweet notes of barley, floral honey, rosemary, citrus, cut hay, Summer meadows and toffee apples.
Midleton Barry Crockett Legacy.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, feint
Midleton Barry Crockett Legacy.description: Released in 2011, Midleton's Barry Crockett edition was named after the distillery's master distiller, and it is aged in both bourbon and new American oak barrels! Very interesting indeed and a limited release of around 2,500 bottles per year.

Glendullan 1997 Connoisseurs Choice (g.palate: Defined sweetness with plenty of malt and spice.
Glendullan 1997 Connoisseurs Choice (g.name: Glendullan 1997   Connoisseurs Choice (gordon & Macphail)
Glendullan 1997 Connoisseurs Choice (g.nose: Sherried peels and allspice. Hints of dried hay and pepper.
Glendullan 1997 Connoisseurs Choice (g.description: This is a delicious 1997 vintage from the Glendullan distillery, bottled by the Elgin-based bottlers Gordon and MacPhail. Great value for money from the Connoisseurs Choice range.

Glencadam 12 Year Old 1999 (cask 6298).palate: Soft, sweet palate entry. Buttery toffee and gentle spices. Big vanilla notes, with peaches and sultanas.
Glencadam 12 Year Old 1999 (cask 6298).name: Glencadam 12 Year Old 1999 (cask 6298)   Provenance (douglas Laing)
Glencadam 12 Year Old 1999 (cask 6298).notes: orange, peach, spices, barley, vanilla, toffee
Glencadam 12 Year Old 1999 (cask 6298).nose: Fresh, fragrant aromas of soft barley malt and boiled sweets. Hints of herbs perhaps.
Glencadam 12 Year Old 1999 (cask 6298).description: This is a single cask Glencadam from the Provenance range - a selection of whiskies bottled to flaunt the effects of season on a finished spirit. This was distilled in Autumn 1997 before a 12 year maturation in a refill hogshead. It was then bottled in Summer 2010.

Glengoyne 2000 Millennium Clock.palate: Huge body and very rich with raisins, espresso and demerara sugar.
Glengoyne 2000 Millennium Clock.name: Glengoyne 2000 Millennium Clock
Glengoyne 2000 Millennium Clock.nose: Roasted coffee beans, heaps of dried fruit and mincemeat.
Glengoyne 2000 Millennium Clock.description: Released in 2000 to commemorate the turn of the millennium. This is cask strength single malt from the Glengoyne distillery, packaged in a grandfather clock.

Balvenie 14 Year Old Caribbean Cask.palate: Sweet vanilla forms a creamy palate with notes of apples and mangos with a hint of orange in the background.
Balvenie 14 Year Old Caribbean Cask.name: Balvenie 14 Year Old Caribbean Cask
Balvenie 14 Year Old Caribbean Cask.notes: oak, orange, fruit, fruity, mango, creamy, vanilla, toffee
Balvenie 14 Year Old Caribbean Cask.nose: The aroma is rich with notes of tropical fruits, namely passion fruit, and creamy toffee.
Balvenie 14 Year Old Caribbean Cask.description: This whisky has been matured for 14 years in traditional oak casks before being transferred to Caribbean rum casks to impart some extra flavour. This process has created a well-rounded and drinkable whisky with notes of fruit and vanilla.

Linkwood 14 Year Old 1997 Dimensions (.palate: Menthol surges over the palate with a herbal cacophony of basil and oregano.
Linkwood 14 Year Old 1997 Dimensions (.name: Linkwood 14 Year Old 1997   Dimensions (duncan Taylor)
Linkwood 14 Year Old 1997 Dimensions (.nose: Honeyed almonds, apple skins and vanilla pods.
Linkwood 14 Year Old 1997 Dimensions (.description: This is a fourteen year Linkwood bottled at 46%abv for Duncan Taylor's Dimensions 46 range.

Braeval 13 Year Old 1998 (signatory).palate: Initially this is light and sweet, with cigars and some cedar wood moving in slowly along with malt and vanilla notes.
Braeval 13 Year Old 1998 (signatory).name: Braeval 13 Year Old 1998 (signatory)
Braeval 13 Year Old 1998 (signatory).notes: wood, cedar, citrus, fruit, spice, vanilla, hay, flowers
Braeval 13 Year Old 1998 (signatory).nose: Dry grassy nose of hay and chaff. Digestive biscuits with a malty cereal note. Meadows, with wild grass and flowers. Sugared peel and citrus fruits.
Braeval 13 Year Old 1998 (signatory).description:
This Braeval has been bottled by Signatory at cask strength for their Vintage Collection. It's a vatting from two bourbon barrels, distilled before the distillery closed. 

Braeval was formerly known as the Braes of Glenlivet Distillery, and only re-started production in 2008. Obviously this was produced years before then, so this is one of the few single malts to be bottled under a different name to the one it was distilled under.

Teaninich 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 9323).palate: Spiced, warming palate entry with notes of oily spices, toffee apples, vanilla custard and fruit.
Teaninich 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 9323).name: Teaninich 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 9323)   Directors' Cut (douglas Laing)
Teaninich 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 9323).notes: oak, fruit, fruity, spices, spice, butter, vanilla, toffee, butterscotch, custard, honey
Teaninich 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 9323).nose: Clean, gristy, malty aromas. Hints of soft honey, butterscotch and spice.
Teaninich 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 9323).note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Teaninich 30 Year Old 1982 (cask 9323).description: Distilled at the Teaninich distillery in December 1982, this is a 30 year old, single cask Speyside malt. It was aged in a refill butt before bottling for the Directors Cut range in late 2012. A release of just 201 bottles.

Royal Brackla 11 Year Old 1999 Provena.palate: Juicy and rich with notes of barley malt, digestive biscuits, hints of cocoa, vanilla fudge and stewed pears.
Royal Brackla 11 Year Old 1999 Provena.name: Royal Brackla 11 Year Old 1999   Provenance (douglas Laing)
Royal Brackla 11 Year Old 1999 Provena.notes: wood, fruit, apple, berry, barley, vanilla, cocoa
Royal Brackla 11 Year Old 1999 Provena.nose: Aromatic and spiced with red berry fruits and apple wood.
Royal Brackla 11 Year Old 1999 Provena.description: An 11 year old Royal Brackla, distilled in the Autumn 1999 and aged in a single refill hogshead before bottling for the Provenance range in Autumn 2010.

Ardbeg 10 Year Old.palate: Sweet vanilla counterbalanced with lemon and lime followed by that surging Ardbeg smoke that we all know and love.
Ardbeg 10 Year Old.name: Ardbeg 10 Year Old
Ardbeg 10 Year Old.notes: citrus, fruit, lemon, peat, smoke, vanilla, caramel, salt, lead
Ardbeg 10 Year Old.nose: A ridge of vanilla leads to mountain of peat capped with citrus fruits and circled by clouds of sea spray.
Ardbeg 10 Year Old.description: Jim Murray's 2008 World Whisky of the Year! When Ardbeg 10 was released it was the first expression from the distillery not to be chill-filtered. It's a true classic from Islay, and a must have for any fan of single malt whisky.

Auchentoshan 18 Year Old Oloroso Sherry.palate: Sweet toffee developing with fruit. Berry fruits.
Auchentoshan 18 Year Old Oloroso Sherry.name: Auchentoshan 18 Year Old Oloroso Sherry
Auchentoshan 18 Year Old Oloroso Sherry.notes: oak, fruit, berry, spices, barley, vanilla, toffee, honey
Auchentoshan 18 Year Old Oloroso Sherry.nose: Rich vanilla and sweet spices. A flour quality works its way through cereal notes, a sweet rich tea biscuit and mixed dried peels, balanced with a refined oak.
Auchentoshan 18 Year Old Oloroso Sherry.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, vanilla, feint
Auchentoshan 18 Year Old Oloroso Sherry.description: A cask strength bottling of Lowland single malt matured in first fill and refill Oloroso sherry casks for 18 years. Auchentoshan produces triple distilled whisky that stands up superbly well against the might of sherry.

Balmenach 27 Year Old 1983 Old Malt Ca.palate: Barley and cereal notes with the faintest suggestion of smoke form the backbone of this aged Balmenach. Then there are raisins and spice gunning it towards the finish.
Balmenach 27 Year Old 1983 Old Malt Ca.name: Balmenach 27 Year Old 1983   Old Malt Cask (douglas Laing)
Balmenach 27 Year Old 1983 Old Malt Ca.notes: orange, fruit, raisin, apple, spice, smoke, barley, creamy, toffee, lead
Balmenach 27 Year Old 1983 Old Malt Ca.nose: The nose opens sweetly with treacle and glazed apple pie leading to richer dried fruits and orange peel.
Balmenach 27 Year Old 1983 Old Malt Ca.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Balmenach 27 Year Old 1983 Old Malt Ca.description:
This Balmenach packs a whopping twenty-seven years of aging in a refill hogshead cask. Balmenach is a distillery that rarely gets the attention it deserves, thankfully Douglas Laing have given it some prominence here.

The Old Malt Cask range began as a release of fifty bottlings in 1998 to commemorate Douglas Laing's fiftieth anniversary. Today they offer many, many more. All bottlings in the range are non-chill filtered and contain no naughty colouring.

Isle Of Jura Superstition.palate: Sweet and porridge-like. A cereal fest on the tongue, with hints of white pepper and black forest honey with hot buttered toast. Oily.
Isle Of Jura Superstition.name: Isle Of Jura Superstition
Isle Of Jura Superstition.notes: pepper, spice, peat, smoke, creamy, cream, honey
Isle Of Jura Superstition.nose: Gristy and quite like new make. This is a young whisky, though it offers up the same evocative smoke and heady malt that you’d expect from an older Jura. It’s quite sweet and creamy, and reminds us of Chantilly cream.
Isle Of Jura Superstition.description: Made up of whiskies aged for 13 years and 21 years, with 13 percent heavily peated malt. It turns out Stevie was wrong, Superstition is the way…

Imperial 16 Year Old 1995 The Octave (.palate: Thick and warming with notes of gingerbread, toasted almond, nuts in syrup and pecan pie. A little under-ripe apple note too.
Imperial 16 Year Old 1995 The Octave (.name: Imperial 16 Year Old 1995   The Octave (duncan Taylor)
Imperial 16 Year Old 1995 The Octave (.notes: apple, spices, nut, almond, nuts, toasted, vanilla
Imperial 16 Year Old 1995 The Octave (.nose: Grassy, green, zesty and tangy notes greet the nose with hints of vanilla, black olive and exotic spices.
Imperial 16 Year Old 1995 The Octave (.description: Distilled at Imperial in 1995, this was aged for 16 years before bottling by Duncan Taylor for their fabulous Octave range of whiskies finished in smaller "octave" casks for added pep and zing (also vim).

bruichladdich 20 year old flirtation 2nd.palate: Rounded and thick palate. Some honey sweetness, more fruit. Toffee apple and cinnamon.
bruichladdich 20 year old flirtation 2nd.name: bruichladdich 20 year old flirtation 2nd edition whisky
bruichladdich 20 year old flirtation 2nd.notes: oak, fruit, apple, berry, cinnamon, creamy, vanilla, toffee, honey
bruichladdich 20 year old flirtation 2nd.nose: Opens on creamy vanilla and fruit salad. A light touch of grape, more fruit, berries perhaps, a little oak.
bruichladdich 20 year old flirtation 2nd.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, feint
bruichladdich 20 year old flirtation 2nd.description: Mourvèdre is a strong, rich red grape, grown all over the world. This is a specially finished 20 year old from Bruichladdich.

Balvenie Tun 1401 Batch 2.palate: Oaky, rich and quite fruity, with nectarine, acacia honey and custard notes, hints of cocoa and walnut and a touch of apple sauce.
Balvenie Tun 1401 Batch 2.name: Balvenie Tun 1401   Batch 2
Balvenie Tun 1401 Batch 2.notes: wood, orange, fruit, fruity, zest, apple, spices, cinnamon, spice, marzipan, walnut, vanilla, caramel, custard, cocoa, leather, honey
Balvenie Tun 1401 Batch 2.nose: Sweet and rich on the nose with notes of tropical fruits, hints of coconut, a little spice, vanilla and marzipan. Touches of leather, dates and cinnamon, with rose petal jelly and barrel char.
Balvenie Tun 1401 Batch 2.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, vanilla, coffee, feint
Balvenie Tun 1401 Batch 2.description: The stunning second batch of Balvenie's Tun 1401, named after the favourite marrying tun of Balvenie's malt master, David Stewart. This is made using sherry and bourbon wood aged whiskies from the latter part of the 1960s up to the late 1980s.

Hibiki 12 Year Old 50cl.palate: Crushed almonds, stewed fruits, clove-studded oranges. Sherried malt and a subtle core of oak.
Hibiki 12 Year Old 50cl.name: Hibiki 12 Year Old 50cl
Hibiki 12 Year Old 50cl.notes: oak, orange, citrus, plum, fruit, apple, cinnamon, almond, honey
Hibiki 12 Year Old 50cl.nose: Juicy marmalade with real chunks of orange, cooked apples dusted with cinnamon, thick honey and plum wine.
Hibiki 12 Year Old 50cl.description: A 50cl bottling of Suntory's excellent Hibiki 12 Year Old blended Japanese whisky, including malts from Yamazaki and Hakushu distilleries.

Bowmore 16 Year Old 1994 Mission (murr.palate: Sweet, creamy and welll-rounded with notes of apricot, cherry, salt, burnt rubby and plum jam. Very interesting indeed.
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1994 Mission (murr.name: Bowmore 16 Year Old 1994   Mission (murray Mcdavid)
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1994 Mission (murr.notes: wood, cherry, plum, pepper, spice, creamy, hay, salt
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1994 Mission (murr.nose: Blackcurrant, seaweed, and singed hemp ropes on the nose. Cut hay, rapeseed oil, some cherry liqueur sweetness, and a little hint of pepper.
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1994 Mission (murr.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, flowers, mineral
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1994 Mission (murr.description: Distilled in 1994, this Bowmore was initially aged in sherry wood. It was selected by Murray McDavid, and taken to the Bruichladdich distillery, where it was reracked into none other than the finest Chateau Petrus wine casks! It was bottled in 2010, and there are 1,100 bottles.

Paul John 6 Year Old 2008 Single Cask.palate: Fresher, fruitier on the palate, with marmalade, red apples and greengages. Still retains the big peaty notes throughout, growing creamy with waves of vanilla. A drop of water brings out sugared dates and almonds.
Paul John 6 Year Old 2008 Single Cask.name: Paul John 6 Year Old 2008   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Paul John 6 Year Old 2008 Single Cask.notes: fruit, peat, smoky, almond, creamy, milk, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, salt
Paul John 6 Year Old 2008 Single Cask.nose: Opens with a combination of rich, bold, smoky peat and notes of barrel char, bringing an oak-y element to the nose. Salted caramel and cookie-dough ice-cream. Subtle touches of blackcurrant and lime peel peek out at points too.
Paul John 6 Year Old 2008 Single Cask.note categories: fruits, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Paul John 6 Year Old 2008 Single Cask.description: The first whisky entry in our Single Cask Series from a distillery that isn't in Scotland! This is a 6 year old Paul John single malt whisky from John Distilleries in Goa, India, matured in a single bourbon cask from December 2008 to March 2015. Very exciting indeed - big and smoky with peat, while maintaining a touch of freshness with fruit notes throughout.

Glenisla 32 Year Old 1977 Cask 19599 C.palate: Rich with cereals, vanilla, candy floss, apples and pears, green oak, charcoal, oily smoke and caramel.
Glenisla 32 Year Old 1977 Cask 19599 C.name: Glenisla 32 Year Old 1977 Cask 19599   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Glenisla 32 Year Old 1977 Cask 19599 C.notes: oak, orange, peat, smoke, vanilla, caramel, honey, musty
Glenisla 32 Year Old 1977 Cask 19599 C.nose: Aromatic, with notes of vanilla sweetness, orange blossom, manuka honey and hints of peat smoke. Quite a musty, coal-like peat.
Glenisla 32 Year Old 1977 Cask 19599 C.note categories: wood, fruits, earth, vanilla, feint, mineral
Glenisla 32 Year Old 1977 Cask 19599 C.description: Distilled at Glen Keith on the 7th July 1977, this was aged in a single hogshead for 32 years before it was bottled in 2009 by Signatory. Glenisla was an experimental peated whisky from Glen Keith, similar to Craigduff…

Macallan Diamond Jubilee 2012.palate: The palate is rich with citrus fruits and cardamom and clove spice notes.
Macallan Diamond Jubilee 2012.name: Macallan Diamond Jubilee 2012
Macallan Diamond Jubilee 2012.notes: orange, citrus, fruit, cloves, clove, spice, nutty
Macallan Diamond Jubilee 2012.nose: Candied orange peel, cloves and stem ginger with sweet mince pie notes following.
Macallan Diamond Jubilee 2012.description: This is a limited edition sherry-matured bottling of Macallan for the Queen’s Diamond Jubilee and suitably only 2012 bottles were made to commemorate the year. The casks selected were taken from relevant dates, for example the 6th of February (the date of the Queen’s accession) and the first week of June (when Jubilees tend to be celebrated). If this wasn’t enough it has been bottled at 52%abv as a reference to the year of the Queen’s coronation. Is that enough figures in one whisky?

Blair Athol 22 Year Old 1989 Cask 2928.palate: Punchy and spiced with big notes of oak, peppermint and wet leaves. Shades of copper, ginger in syrup and malt.
Blair Athol 22 Year Old 1989 Cask 2928.name: Blair Athol 22 Year Old 1989 Cask 2928   Dimensions (duncan Taylor)
Blair Athol 22 Year Old 1989 Cask 2928.notes: oak, spicy, spices, toasted, bread, creamy, butterscotch, toffee
Blair Athol 22 Year Old 1989 Cask 2928.nose: Toasted rye bread, buttery, notes of drying grapes, butterscotch, toffee, gingerbread and dough.
Blair Athol 22 Year Old 1989 Cask 2928.description: A spicy Speyside malt distilled at Blair Athol in May 1989. It was aged for 22 years in cask 2928 before bottling at natural cask strength in March 2012.

Speyside 13 Year Old 1999 (cask 9215).palate: Sweet palate entry with soft cinnamon and creamy vanilla custard. Grainy and rich.
Speyside 13 Year Old 1999 (cask 9215).name: Speyside 13 Year Old 1999 (cask 9215)   Provenance (douglas Laing)
Speyside 13 Year Old 1999 (cask 9215).notes: lemon, zest, cinnamon, spice, creamy, vanilla, custard, honey
Speyside 13 Year Old 1999 (cask 9215).nose: Fresh and grainy nose with a touch of spice and steamed pudding.
Speyside 13 Year Old 1999 (cask 9215).description: This is a 13 year old single cask from the Speyside distillery. It was distilled in the Winter of 1999 before a maturation in refill hogshead 9215. It was bottled for the Provenance range in Autumn 2012.

Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask Release VII.palate: Plum liqueur, chocolate, sherried peels, oak, hints of cocoa. Black pepper.
Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask Release VII.name: Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask Release VII
Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask Release VII.notes: oak, wood, cedar, plum, pepper, spicy, chocolate, toffee, cocoa, coffee, leather
Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask Release VII.nose: Cocoa, toffee and chocolate. Coffee beans, leather, plumwine, hints of cedar wood.
Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask Release VII.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask Release VII.description: The 7th release of 1961 Family Cask. A very old Glenfarclas, aged in cask 1325 (a sherry hogshead). This was bottled afted 50 years on the 25th May 2011. A release of 108 bottles.

Caol Ila 11 Year Old 1999 (signatory).palate: Perfectly balanced, custard, porridge oats, truffle oil, pine needles, toffee and tar.
Caol Ila 11 Year Old 1999 (signatory).name: Caol Ila 11 Year Old 1999 (signatory)
Caol Ila 11 Year Old 1999 (signatory).notes: oak, pine, lemon, apple, nutmeg, smoky, oat, toffee, custard, salt
Caol Ila 11 Year Old 1999 (signatory).nose: Smoky with charred oak, custard and freshly cut herbs. Quite buttery too, with hot apple crumble and a dusting of nutmeg.
Caol Ila 11 Year Old 1999 (signatory).note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, cereal, vanilla, mineral
Caol Ila 11 Year Old 1999 (signatory).description: Distilled at Caol Ila on the 15th September 1999 and aged in two hogsheads before bottling on the 8th April 2011. A release of 926 bottles.

Hakushu 25 Year Old.palate: A rich, sherried palate with wood smoke, linseed, rhubarb and custard sweets, raspberries and walnut. A hint of spearmint develops.
Hakushu 25 Year Old.name: Hakushu 25 Year Old
Hakushu 25 Year Old.notes: wood, oak, nutmeg, peat, smoky, smoke, nutty, walnut, toffee, custard, herbal
Hakushu 25 Year Old.nose: A smouldering, smoky nose with toffee apples, rancio, Armagnac, ginger and nutmeg.
Hakushu 25 Year Old.note categories: wood, spice, earth, nuts, vanilla, flowers
Hakushu 25 Year Old.description: A very rare and truly fabulous peated Japanese whisky from Hakushus. This 25 year old was awarded a Silver Medal at the Malt Maniac Awards in 2009, and whisky critic Jim Murray rated it 93 points out of a possible 100, saying he was "blown away" by it…

Knappogue Castle 16 Year Old Twin Wood.palate: Oak-y spice comes to the fore on the palate, with continued nutty chocolate notes and a touch of dried fruit.
Knappogue Castle 16 Year Old Twin Wood.name: Knappogue Castle 16 Year Old   Twin Wood
Knappogue Castle 16 Year Old Twin Wood.notes: wood, fruit, spice, nutty, chocolate, vanilla
Knappogue Castle 16 Year Old Twin Wood.nose: It's plenty malty, with a good balance of vanilla and dark chocolate coming through.
Knappogue Castle 16 Year Old Twin Wood.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, vanilla
Knappogue Castle 16 Year Old Twin Wood.description: Twin Wood is a 16 year old single malt from the Kappague Castle range, which was initially matured in bourbon barrels before being transferred over to casks seasoned with Oloroso Sherry for a finishing period. Very good value Irish whiskey, right here.

Glen Grant 31 Year Old 1964 Lost Bottl.palate: Beautiful delivery of sherry notes, with a core of nutmeg, cinnamon and clove. Thick berry fruits and hints of dried banana chips. Malty.
Glen Grant 31 Year Old 1964 Lost Bottl.name: Glen Grant 31 Year Old 1964   Lost Bottlings Series (master Of Malt)
Glen Grant 31 Year Old 1964 Lost Bottl.notes: wood, plum, fruit, berry, clove, spices, nutmeg, cinnamon, chocolate, cocoa
Glen Grant 31 Year Old 1964 Lost Bottl.nose: Heavily sherried, thick aromas of Cabernet Sauvignon and cassis. Hints of fresh plum and baking spices.
Glen Grant 31 Year Old 1964 Lost Bottl.description:
This is a rich, intense Speyside single malt, aged in top-quality sherry wood before bottling. It was distilled at Glen Grant in 1964 before a 31 year maturation. It was then bottled in October 1995 and comes from our Lost Bottlings Series - a range of whiskies bottled many years ago, affording connoisseurs the chance to try single malts from a bygone era of production.

"By 'eck! Sherry butts like this haven't been seen in Scotland for quite a while, believe me."- Jim Murray (97 Points)

Teaninich 28 Year Old 1983 Dimensions.palate: Lots of oomph and a nice sweetness. Rather malty, with some notes of sugared cereals, dried oranges, caramelized pastries. Some bold notes of over-baked cake, maple syrup, roasted peanut. Crispy praline and nougat.
Teaninich 28 Year Old 1983 Dimensions.name: Teaninich 28 Year Old 1983   Dimensions  (duncan Taylor)
Teaninich 28 Year Old 1983 Dimensions.notes: fruit, smoke, peanut, praline, creamy, caramel, roasted, honey
Teaninich 28 Year Old 1983 Dimensions.nose: Some rather unusual medicinal notes, bandages and camphor, mixing with quince jelly. Some beautiful notes of ripe apricots, greengages, light honey, crystallised chestnuts. Keeps developing on sweet white wine, dried oranges, camomile, with some whiffs of coal smoke and even something maritime. Subtle and delicate.
Teaninich 28 Year Old 1983 Dimensions.note categories: fruits, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Teaninich 28 Year Old 1983 Dimensions.description: The Dimension Collection from Duncan Taylor often throws up some outstanding whiskies and this 28-year-old Teaninich is a good example. This non-chill filtered single malt offers a superb, concentrated palate and really is thoroughly enjoyable.

Springbank 15 Year Old.palate: Quite full and rich. There are notes of creamy fruit salad and more exotic fruit notes. There is palpable mastication from the oaked tannins with a hint of spice.
Springbank 15 Year Old.name: Springbank 15 Year Old
Springbank 15 Year Old.notes: oak, fruit, pineapple, spice, nut, nuts, creamy, caramel, toffee, leather
Springbank 15 Year Old.nose: Fragrant with a certain richness. Notes of fruit salad and a hint of caramel, pineapple, guava and passion fruit lurk. There are notes of dried leather and old ropes. A hint of toffee sweetness and some granary toast.
Springbank 15 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Springbank 15 Year Old.description: A 15 year old from the Springbank distillery with plenty of sherry notes and spice, dried fruits and nuts.

Master Of Malt Islay Single Malt.palate: Rounded with dry notes of iodine amidst a beautiful butterscotch sweetness. Dry wood smoke, and hints of tarmac on a hot day, but gentle ones, mind.
Master Of Malt Islay Single Malt.name: Master Of Malt Islay Single Malt
Master Of Malt Islay Single Malt.nose: Southern coast of Islay on the nose! Big on classic cool wood smoke with sweet honey sweetness. Hints of sticking plasters, grist and maybe lemon sherbet?
Master Of Malt Islay Single Malt.description:
This is the Islay edition from our range of Secret Bottlings, now with a smart revamped label. The whisky in the bottle comes from a secret Islay distillery, and whilst we can't tell you exactly where it was made we can hint that it has a decidedly South Coast style...

The fact we don't reveal the distillery's true identity allows us to bottle top-quality single malt whisky at just a fraction of the usual price.

Auchroisk 1991 (berry Bros. & Rudd).palate: Soft and supple, like biting into a juicy nectarine, with honey, spices, and barley malt.
Auchroisk 1991 (berry Bros. & Rudd).name: Auchroisk 1991 (berry Bros. & Rudd)
Auchroisk 1991 (berry Bros. & Rudd).notes: oak, fruit, fruity, peach, berry, spices, barley, cream, honey
Auchroisk 1991 (berry Bros. & Rudd).nose: Soft and very fruity with notes of peaches and cream, apricots, soft malt and a light oak note. Slightly green.
Auchroisk 1991 (berry Bros. & Rudd).note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, feint
Auchroisk 1991 (berry Bros. & Rudd).description: Distilled in 1991 and aged in cask 16022, this is a phenomenally intense, rich Auchroisk, bottled by top wine merchants, Berry Brothers and Rudd.

Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask Release V.palate: Flavours of sherry-soaked fruit. Some light tannins are apparent here but this is a very fresh whisky; a lovely mix of sherry and Spanish oak.
Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask Release V.name: Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask Release V
Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask Release V.nose: Powerful rich nose of almonds and rich fruit cake.
Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask Release V.description: A great whisky from Glenfarclas's Family Cask range. This 1993 vintage has a lot of typical distillery characteristics, picked up from maturation in a sherry cask, and definitely benefits from the adddition of water.

Glenfarclas 1968 Family Cask Release VI.palate: Malty and intense, almost chocolatey with thick notes of espresso bean, calves leather and allspice, hints of smoked prune juice (such a think does exist!) and manuka honey.
Glenfarclas 1968 Family Cask Release VI.name: Glenfarclas 1968 Family Cask Release VI
Glenfarclas 1968 Family Cask Release VI.notes: fruit, pepper, nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice, toffee, espresso, leather, honey
Glenfarclas 1968 Family Cask Release VI.nose: Dark notes of sherry and malt, toffee apples, stewed fruit and prune, some black pepper, cinnamon and nutmeg.
Glenfarclas 1968 Family Cask Release VI.description: The sixth release of Glenfarclas's 1968 Family Cask was aged in a sherry cask for over 40 years before bottling in 2010 at natural cask strength. A rich, intense whisky with a lot of flavour and complexity.

Caol Ila 17 Year Old 1990 Mackillop's.palate: That spice again, wrapped in buttery soft caramel, and then the peat comes through with woody, saline citrus notes.
Caol Ila 17 Year Old 1990 Mackillop's.name: Caol Ila 17 Year Old 1990   Mackillop's Choice
Caol Ila 17 Year Old 1990 Mackillop's.notes: woody, citrus, lemon, cloves, pepper, spice, peat, smoke, vanilla, caramel
Caol Ila 17 Year Old 1990 Mackillop's.nose: Buttery, lemon notes typical of Caol Ila, with less typical spice from the sherry cask; cloves in particular, and vanilla with black pepper. Very soft smoke.
Caol Ila 17 Year Old 1990 Mackillop's.description: A Mackillop's Choice Caol Ila 17 Year Old, distilled on 8 February 1990 and  bottled in May 2007 at cask strength. It is, of course, non-chill filtered.

Auchentoshan Heartwood 1l.palate: Nuttier than the nose, it's got a core of hazelnut and almond, surrounded by chocolate buttons, apple and fresh ground coffee again.
Auchentoshan Heartwood 1l.name: Auchentoshan Heartwood 1l
Auchentoshan Heartwood 1l.notes: orange, citrus, fruit, apple, nutty, almond, hazelnut, chocolate, coffee, honey
Auchentoshan Heartwood 1l.nose: Fresh honey and candied orange peels, with hints of dark coffee and pear drops.
Auchentoshan Heartwood 1l.description: Released for travel retail, the Auchentoshan Heartwood is made with triple distilled single malt Scotch whisky which has been matured in both Oloroso Sherry casks and bourbon casks, resulting in a very well balanced expression from the Lowland distillery.

Port Ellen 30 Year Old 1982 Old And Ra.palate: Gingerbread dough and fresh squeezed lemon with a coastal saltiness.
Port Ellen 30 Year Old 1982 Old And Ra.name: Port Ellen 30 Year Old 1982   Old And Rare (douglas Laing)
Port Ellen 30 Year Old 1982 Old And Ra.notes: lemon, spice, peat, smoke, leather, saltiness
Port Ellen 30 Year Old 1982 Old And Ra.nose: A very zesty sherbet lemon aroma with hints of chamois leather and gentle peat smoke.
Port Ellen 30 Year Old 1982 Old And Ra.description: A marvellous and decidedly rare Port Ellen distilled in 1982 and aged for a massive 30 years in a single refill hogshead before bottling in 2012 for Douglas Laing's premium Old and Rare Platinum Selection.

Bunnahabhain 9 Year Old 2001 Cask 1763.palate: Peaty and sweet with notes of sweet Oloroso, sawdust, pine resin, toffee apples, slabs of warm peat and chili oil.
Bunnahabhain 9 Year Old 2001 Cask 1763.name: Bunnahabhain 9 Year Old 2001 Cask 1763   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Bunnahabhain 9 Year Old 2001 Cask 1763.notes: pine, pepper, spicy, chili, peat, smoke, toffee, hay, coffee, honey
Bunnahabhain 9 Year Old 2001 Cask 1763.nose: Peaty and spicy on the nose, almost like some of the more unusual Ardbegs we've come across. Hints of coffee beans, sherried peels, dates, pepper and Daim bars. A little lavender honey and smoke.
Bunnahabhain 9 Year Old 2001 Cask 1763.note categories: wood, spice, earth, vanilla, flowers, coffee, feint
Bunnahabhain 9 Year Old 2001 Cask 1763.description: This cask strength, single cask Bunnahabhain was distilled on the 21st September 2001 and it was aged in sherry butt 1763 for 9 years before bottling on the 11th July 2011. A release of 575 bottles.

Hibiki 17 Year Old.palate: Sweet and rich. There are crisp notes of mixed peels, raisin and custard with a little zest and plenty of oak.
Hibiki 17 Year Old.name: Hibiki 17 Year Old
Hibiki 17 Year Old.notes: oak, fruit, raisin, zest, smoke, nutty, custard, cocoa, honey
Hibiki 17 Year Old.nose: Quite full. There are notes of honey and wax, resin and oak. There are notes of gentle smoke and cacao, hints of cooked fruit and a nutty note.
Hibiki 17 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, earth, nuts, vanilla, coffee, feint
Hibiki 17 Year Old.description: This Japanese blend was awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine. Hibiki 17 year old is a superb whisky from Suntory.

Glenkinchie 1999 (bottled 2012) Amontill.palate: Warm, rich palate entry with soft sherry, hints of molasses and walnut. Marzipan develops. Oaky spices.
Glenkinchie 1999 (bottled 2012) Amontill.name: Glenkinchie 1999 (bottled 2012) Amontillado Finish   Distillers Edition
Glenkinchie 1999 (bottled 2012) Amontill.notes: oak, orange, fruit, fruity, peppery, spicy, spices, nutty, marzipan, walnut, molasses
Glenkinchie 1999 (bottled 2012) Amontill.nose: Peppery, spicy aromas. Orange peel, boiled sweets and a touch of oak.
Glenkinchie 1999 (bottled 2012) Amontill.description: Distilled in 1999, this is a delicious whisky from Glenkinchie, bottled for Diageo's Distillers Edition range. It was finished in tasty Amontillado sherry casks, and the result is an added fruity depth...

Kilchoman Machir Bay 2012 Release.palate: Oaky and bittersweet with black pepper, toffee apples, dark chocolate, aniseed and warm, spicy peat. Very complex, with a development of star anise.
Kilchoman Machir Bay 2012 Release.name: Kilchoman Machir Bay 2012 Release
Kilchoman Machir Bay 2012 Release.notes: citrus, lemon, zest, pepper, spicy, peat, chocolate, toffee, salty
Kilchoman Machir Bay 2012 Release.nose: Smoked and malty nose with notes of cured ham, oysters with lemon and red wine vinegar, a touch of TCP and citrus zest.
Kilchoman Machir Bay 2012 Release.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Kilchoman Machir Bay 2012 Release.description: Machir Bay is a gorgeous sherry-finished malt from Islay's newest distillery, Kilchoman. This was released in 2012 and is made up of 60% 3 year old, 35% 4 year old and 5% 5 year old whisky. All were aged in first fill bourbon barrels, before vatting and finishing in an Oloroso sherry butt for two months.

Glenfarclas 15 Year Old.palate: Raisins, more sherry, orange peel, walnuts, dates.
Glenfarclas 15 Year Old.name: Glenfarclas 15 Year Old
Glenfarclas 15 Year Old.nose: Intense, powerful sherry. Cream sherry, certainly – Pedro Ximenez? almost… a touch of peppermint? An almost rancio quality to this. Smells older than 15.
Glenfarclas 15 Year Old.description: An incredible dram from Glenfarclas, we can't say enough about it. It's a juicy, Christmas cake of a whisky, absolutely huge! This 15 year old matured in sherry wood, a superb malt which earned 95 points from Jim Murray. A lot of the whisky in this is clearly much older than 15 years, this is a really sherried dram and we love it.

Glenfarclas 1995 Family Cask Release VI.palate: Honey, peels, buttered granary toast, a little chocolate brownie, Oloroso and golden syrup.
Glenfarclas 1995 Family Cask Release VI.name: Glenfarclas 1995 Family Cask Release VI
Glenfarclas 1995 Family Cask Release VI.notes: oak, fruit, spices, chocolate, vanilla, custard, cocoa, honey
Glenfarclas 1995 Family Cask Release VI.nose: Sherry! Custard, peppercorns, vanilla spices, oak, a little treacle, maple syrup and stewed fruits.
Glenfarclas 1995 Family Cask Release VI.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Glenfarclas 1995 Family Cask Release VI.description: The sixth release of 1964 Family Cask from Glenfarclas. This release sees the whisky matured in sherry hogshead 6778 before bottling in 2010, and if you're into your rich, puckering, malty Speyside whisky it doesn't come much better than this!

Old Pulteney 12 Year Old.palate: Balanced with medium body. Musty, nutty, sultana, toffee, spices. Oak.
Old Pulteney 12 Year Old.name: Old Pulteney 12 Year Old
Old Pulteney 12 Year Old.notes: oak, spices, nutty, almond, toffee, musty
Old Pulteney 12 Year Old.nose: Crisp and clean. Great balance reveals notes of herbs and grist. Parsley, almond.
Old Pulteney 12 Year Old.description: Matured in ex-bourbon casks for 12 years, this Old Pulteney malt was a Double Gold winner at the 2006 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

Tormore Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisk.palate: Thick, vanilla-led palate entry with a solid core of woody spices (particularly nutmeg). Develops with dried raspberries and banana milk. A hint of pepper.
Tormore Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisk.name: Tormore   Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Tormore Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisk.notes: woody, berry, fruity, apple, pepper, spices, nutmeg, peppery, creamy, milk, herbal
Tormore Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisk.nose: Quite a herbal, rich nose with hints of peppermint and confectioner's sugar.  A touch of maple syrup, apple peel and creamy Greek yoghurt.
Tormore Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisk.description:
This is the first batch of Tormore single malt Scotch whisky from Tormore distillery, bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company. It comes with a wonderful graphic-novel-style label with a reference to the fact that Tormore is used in the Long John blend, and of course there is also a rather famous – though fictitious – pirate by the name of Long John! Accordingly, the label sees the distillery converted into a pirate ship, sailing the seven seas!

This is a release of 226 numbered bottles.

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Glenfarclas 12 Year Old.palate: Medium-bodied, with notes of date and walnut cake, Oloroso sherry and hints of earthy forest floor. A beautiful note of malt, with toffee apple and a touch of smoke.
