Glenfarclas 12 Year Old.name: Glenfarclas 12 Year Old
Glenfarclas 12 Year Old.notes: oak, pine, orange, fruit, apple, zest, cloves, spicy, cinnamon, allspice, earthy, smoke, walnut, creamy, toffee, honey
Glenfarclas 12 Year Old.nose: Light and creamy with a mix of supple, soft sherry and Manuka honey. Gentle and well-balanced, there are hints of smoke, rich oak, and a little pine resin.
Glenfarclas 12 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Glenfarclas 12 Year Old.description: Lots of sherry and fruit in this, Glenfarclas 12 was originally bottled for export and travel retail markets. In 2006, it was named the "Best Sherried Whisky" in the Single Malt World Cup, and in 2007 and 2008 it won Gold at the Stockholm Beer and Whisky Festival.

Caperdonich 17 Year Old 1995 Un Chillf.palate: A good malty body and well balanced with pine needle and sweet tea.
Caperdonich 17 Year Old 1995 Un Chillf.name: Caperdonich 17 Year Old 1995   Un Chillfiltered (signatory)
Caperdonich 17 Year Old 1995 Un Chillf.notes: pine, citrus, fruity, pepper, spicy, earthiness, earthy, honey
Caperdonich 17 Year Old 1995 Un Chillf.nose: Very malty, with notes of white pepper and a little earthy charcoal.
Caperdonich 17 Year Old 1995 Un Chillf.description: This is an un-chill-filtered bottling of seventeen year old caperdonich by independent bottler Signatory.

Smith's Glenlivet 1977.palate: The palate is remarkably fresh with Granny Smith apples and dark chocolate.
Smith's Glenlivet 1977.name: Smith's Glenlivet 1977
Smith's Glenlivet 1977.notes: apple, spices, nutmeg, cinnamon, spice, chocolate, vanilla, honey
Smith's Glenlivet 1977.nose: Apples with some honeyed vanilla and warm spices of cinnamon and nutmeg.
Smith's Glenlivet 1977.description: This is a 1977 vintage Glenlivet bottled by Gordon & MacPhail as part of their distillery label range.

Mortlach 12 Year Old 1997 Old Malt Cas.palate: Big, opens on malt, then develops with toffee, custard, apple strudel style gooey sultanas and a big hit of top quality, sweet spices.
Mortlach 12 Year Old 1997 Old Malt Cas.name: Mortlach 12 Year Old 1997   Old Malt Cask (douglas Laing)
Mortlach 12 Year Old 1997 Old Malt Cas.notes: oak, apple, spicy, nutmeg, cinnamon, spices, toffee, butterscotch, custard
Mortlach 12 Year Old 1997 Old Malt Cas.nose: Spicy and rich nose. Lots of nutmeg, sherry and cinnamon. A little sticky toffee pudding and some thick malty notes.
Mortlach 12 Year Old 1997 Old Malt Cas.description: A single cask Mortlach. This was distilled in September 1997 and aged for 12 years in sherry butt number 6074 before bottling in April 2010. A release of 330 bottles, bottled by Douglas Laing.

Glendronach 19 Year Old 1991 Olorosso Sh.palate: Curiously ‘younger’ than the 15 with a tad more berry fruit. There's orange here too with some faint Christmas spice.
Glendronach 19 Year Old 1991 Olorosso Sh.name: Glendronach 19 Year Old 1991 Olorosso Sherry Finish
Glendronach 19 Year Old 1991 Olorosso Sh.notes: orange, fruit, apple, berry, spice, earth, nutty, walnut
Glendronach 19 Year Old 1991 Olorosso Sh.nose: Malty, nutty notes. It’s also a tad grassier, with walnut skins and apple peelings. Picks up steam after a few minutes, with beautiful whiffs of wet earth and just hints of old roses. Keeps developing for a long time, more and more on roses and Turkish delights, which was unexpected.
Glendronach 19 Year Old 1991 Olorosso Sh.description: This is a single cask Glendronach, matured in an Oloroso sherry butt, and very nice it is too.

Dalmore 15 Year Old.palate: Medium, lovely delivery. Zesty orange, Blue Curaçao, chocolate. Winter spice, stem ginger in syrup. Hints of anise and a little hickory.
Dalmore 15 Year Old.name: Dalmore 15 Year Old
Dalmore 15 Year Old.notes: orange, zest, spice, smoky, barley, chocolate, espresso
Dalmore 15 Year Old.nose: A chocolate orange. Potpourri, perfumed. Fruitcake, sherry.
Dalmore 15 Year Old.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, cereal, chocolate, coffee
Dalmore 15 Year Old.description: The Dalmore 15 year old was first launched in 2007. Matured in matusalem, apostoles and amoroso sherry casks, it proffers all those winter spice, orange zest and chocolate notes characteristic of Dalmore.

Haig Club.palate: Toffee and vanilla with pleasant supporting oak notes. Fresh banana (neither overpowering nor artificial), a hint of nougat and honeycomb pieces.
Haig Club.name: Haig Club
Haig Club.notes: oak, orange, fruit, lemon, apple, mango, cinnamon, spice, praline, milk, vanilla, toffee
Haig Club.nose: It doesn't jump out at you, granted, but there's more here than meets the eye (/nose). Apple crumble, expressed lemon peel and a touch of mango. Millionaire's shortbread, banoffee pie, coconut milk, dried grass, orange Turkish delight and cardamom.
Haig Club.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, vanilla
Haig Club.description:
The much anticipated David Beckham endorsed single grain whisky, produced at Cameronbridge distillery. A combination of first-fill, rejuvenated and refill bourbon barrel-matured whiskies are used and Beckham, along with Simon Fuller, is very much involved in the development of the Haig Club brand.

The Haig dynasty meanwhile is the stuff of legend, with Robert Haig getting himself into trouble for distilling on the sabbath back in 1655! Cameronbridge was founded by John Haig in 1824, and a continuous still designed by Robert Stein (who was John's uncle) was soon installed at the site for the production of grain whisky, predating Aeneas Coffey's famous patent for his own version of the continuous still by a handful of years.

The grain whisky produced at Cameronbridge would naturally become integral to the well-loved Haig blended whiskies and now the Haig brand has been reinvented for a new generation and new markets. It may seem like a scary new world to some, but grain whisky is on the march, and Haig Club is at the very forefront.

North British Batch 2 (that Boutique Y.palate: Light treacle, green banana and a very subtle nod towards some exotic spices. Big, juicy clementine segments burst out on the mid palate.
North British Batch 2 (that Boutique Y.name: North British   Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
North British Batch 2 (that Boutique Y.notes: pine, orange, lemon, spices, almond, caramel
North British Batch 2 (that Boutique Y.nose: Candied peels, both orange and lemon. Continues with pecan pie, almonds, caramel and a hint of pine resin.
North British Batch 2 (that Boutique Y.description:
Yummy single grain Scotch whisky from the North British distillery, bottle by That Boutique-y Whisky Company. Their second batch of North British whisky, this is. Just like the first batch, it features a label showcasing a rather malevolent-seeming chap behind a hardwood desk, stroking a cat. He looks like he might be the head of a huge, potentially evil organisation, though the cat seems nonchalant and cats are always good judges of character. And anyway, there's probably no link between between the label and the whisky. We think. 

Batch 2 is a release of 75 bottles. 

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask.palate: Rich, oak. Sherry, toffee. Herbal, rooty.
Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask.name: Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask
Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask.notes: oak, fruit, peppery, spice, vanilla, toffee, herbal, cocoa
Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask.nose: Sherried, winter spice. Malt loaf. Peppery, tannic. Ash, cocoa, vanilla latte.
Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, vanilla, flowers, coffee
Glenfarclas 1993 Family Cask.description: A 1993 vintage, this Family Cask was a refill sherry butt. The whisky offers the characteristic Glenfarclas sherry flavour with plenty of fruit.

Tomatin Legacy Gift Pack With Two Glasse.palate: Cracked pepper and sweet barley with pineapple cube sweets. Waves of warming oak beneath.
Tomatin Legacy Gift Pack With Two Glasse.name: Tomatin Legacy Gift Pack With Two Glasses
Tomatin Legacy Gift Pack With Two Glasse.notes: oak, pine, lemon, pineapple, pepper, barley, vanilla
Tomatin Legacy Gift Pack With Two Glasse.nose: Lemon, panatella and pine forest. Slightly green with vanilla.
Tomatin Legacy Gift Pack With Two Glasse.description: A handsome little gift pack from the Tomatin distillery up in the Highlands. It features a full bottle of their Legacy single malt Scotch whisky, matured in both virgin oak and bourbon casks, as well as two branded glasses.

Ardbeg Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whisky.palate: Beautifully balanced palate entry with a rich wave of peat smoke, melding beautifully with sherry and dried herbs. Quite medicinal at times, with notes of chipotle chilli, treacle and sticky toffee apples.
Ardbeg Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whisky.name: Ardbeg   Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Ardbeg Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whisky.notes: oak, lemon, zest, peat, smoky, smoke, toffee
Ardbeg Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whisky.nose: Huge peat smoke and a wonderful mix of sticking plasters, lemon zest and a touch of dried apricot. A little sweet sherry lurks, with candy floss and big charred oak.
Ardbeg Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whisky.description:
This is the stunning Batch 3 of That Boutique-y Whisky Company's Ardbeg - it's a superb little whisky which flaunts the beautiful house style with more than a hint of sweet sherry too.

The label depicts the world's most famous Ardbeg collector, Geert Bero, the proprietor of the legendary Ardbeg Bar at Hotel Bero. He is shown here reaching up for the Spirit Purifier - the device responsible for Ardbeg's unique flavour.

This is a release of 170 bottles.

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic novel-style labels.

Redemption Rye Whiskey.palate: More dark spices, star anise, treacle and a hint of espresso.
Redemption Rye Whiskey.name: Redemption Rye Whiskey
Redemption Rye Whiskey.notes: oak, spiciness, spicy, allspice, spices, toasted, espresso
Redemption Rye Whiskey.nose: Very big and spicy (what did we expect?!), toasted oak, vegetal notes, allspice and anise.
Redemption Rye Whiskey.description: A straight rye whiskey made with a mashbill of 95% rye for intensity and spiciness. Aged for over 2 years and bottled at 46%, this is bold stuff! Absolutely perfect on its own or in a cocktail.

Benriach Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whis.palate: Big entry, Sherried character with oodles of vanilla, almond and nuts to savour.
Benriach Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whis.name: Benriach   Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Benriach Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whis.notes: oak, orange, peat, nuts, nut, almond, marzipan, barley, creamy, vanilla, cocoa, leather
Benriach Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whis.nose: Creamy porridge, orange slices, raspberries, marzipan and dignified oak.
Benriach Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whis.note categories: wood, fruits, earth, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Benriach Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whis.description:
No monkeying around, the third batch of BenRiach bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company is utterly bananas! If you're wondering why this chimp champ of a whisky is getting so many puns, it's because the label shows the origin of the phrase "Monkey Shoulder". You see, turning the barley on a traditional malting floor (like the one BenRiach has recently started using again) was a tough, labour intensive job that would sometimes result in the maltster developing a hunch, affectionately known as the aforementioned "Monkey Shoulder". 

This is a release of 103 chimply spectacular bottles. 

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, blended malts, blends and bourbons from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Sullivans Cove American Oak Cask.palate: The palate is fresh and enticing with subtle notes of citrus and broader tones of vanilla.
Sullivans Cove American Oak Cask.name: Sullivans Cove American Oak Cask
Sullivans Cove American Oak Cask.notes: citrus, nutty, nuttiness, hazelnut, oat, vanilla
Sullivans Cove American Oak Cask.nose: A real nuttiness emerges first completed with an amalgamation of cereal grain and oats.
Sullivans Cove American Oak Cask.description: Sullivan's Cove is made in the Tasmanian Distillery and is producing a single malt whisky in a Scotch style. This bottling has been matured in ex-Bourbon barrels and uses water pulled from the surrounding rainforest.

Glenfarclas 1985 Family Cask.palate: Thick, honey, nutty. Damson jam. Peppery.
Glenfarclas 1985 Family Cask.name: Glenfarclas 1985 Family Cask
Glenfarclas 1985 Family Cask.notes: oak, fruity, peppery, spice, nutty, creamy, honey
Glenfarclas 1985 Family Cask.nose: Cooked apples and pears. Touch of warm pastry, spice. Oak.
Glenfarclas 1985 Family Cask.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, feint
Glenfarclas 1985 Family Cask.description: This was distilled in 1985 and matured in a refill sherry hogshead. Released as a Family Cask in 2007, this single cask Glenfarclas is an elegant, fruity dram.

Port Ellen Batch 5 (that Boutique Y Wh.palate: Straight back into wonderful chamois leather, now alongside coconut nougat and some tropical fruit, perhaps some lightly barbecued papaya.
Port Ellen Batch 5 (that Boutique Y Wh.name: Port Ellen   Batch 5 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Port Ellen Batch 5 (that Boutique Y Wh.notes: oak, fruit, lemon, smoke, nutty, nuttiness, leather
Port Ellen Batch 5 (that Boutique Y Wh.nose: Gorgeous, coastal Islay notes, oily seaweed, tarry rope, nutty sea-swept oak. There's a hint of expressed lemon peel too, which gives depth, and classic Port Ellen chamois leather notes run right through the middle of everything.
Port Ellen Batch 5 (that Boutique Y Wh.description:
It's here. Phone people. Write letters. Open up windows and shout at things. Let the things know that it's here. But what is it? Batch 5 of Port Ellen single malt Scotch whisky, bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company, that's what. Despite the distillery closing its doors in 1983, Port Ellen still has a massive following of fans around the world. The label features Jon Beach from Fiddler's Whisky Bar, Port Ellen collector extraordinaire, looking wistfully off in the distance, holding a bag of sherbet lemons and chamois leather - some classic Port Ellen notes. There seems to be a couple of people on the shore too, what are they up to?

Just 89 bottles of these extremely rare bottles are available.

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, blended malts, blends and bourbons from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

The Wild Geese Classic Blend Irish Whisk.palate: A slow slide of sweet fresh flavours, reminiscent of cooled fruits and honey, with slight citric tendencies arriving alongside liquorice. Developing for a spirited, tart, late palate.
The Wild Geese Classic Blend Irish Whisk.name: The Wild Geese Classic Blend Irish Whiskey 50cl
The Wild Geese Classic Blend Irish Whisk.notes: oak, fruit, berry, spices, creamy, vanilla, custard, honey
The Wild Geese Classic Blend Irish Whisk.distillery: The Wild Geese Irish Whiskey And Spirits
The Wild Geese Classic Blend Irish Whisk.nose: Berries and bramble, smooth spices and young oak. There are hints of malt and vanilla on the edges.
The Wild Geese Classic Blend Irish Whisk.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, feint
The Wild Geese Classic Blend Irish Whisk.description: A mixture of double distilled single malt and grain whiskey from the Cooley distillery in County Louth aged bourbon casks. Superb and, as Jim Murray says “easy going”, whiskey with wonderful character.

Ardbeg Uigeadail.palate: Led by sweet, ripe fruit and black forest honey. A good helping of malt. The throne then usurped by a powerful peat and smoked barley.
Ardbeg Uigeadail.name: Ardbeg Uigeadail
Ardbeg Uigeadail.notes: fruit, peat, smoke, barley, caramel, coffee, espresso, honey
Ardbeg Uigeadail.nose: Multifaceted, notes of peat and little flourishes of dark sugar, freshly ground espresso beans, cereal notes and a most sophisticated tar.
Ardbeg Uigeadail.note categories: fruits, earth, cereal, vanilla, coffee, feint
Ardbeg Uigeadail.description: Uigeadail derives from the Scotch Gaelic for 'Dark and Mysterious Place' and is named for the Loch from whence Ardbeg draws its waters. Jim Murray's 2009 World Whisky of the Year, this cask-strength bottle exudes breathtaking balance.

Balcones 5th Anniversary Single Barrel B.palate: Big at 64.20% abv, but not at all 'spirity'. Treacle, oak and cracked pepper. A touch of caffè Americano.
Balcones 5th Anniversary Single Barrel B.name: Balcones 5th Anniversary Single Barrel Bourbon   1st Release
Balcones 5th Anniversary Single Barrel B.notes: oak, pepper, spicy, clove, vanilla, caramel, coffee
Balcones 5th Anniversary Single Barrel B.nose: Spicy rye and sugared sweetness give way to pecan, fragrant vanilla and a touch of geranium. A little water (not too much) reveals a fruitiness that was only hinted at before; ripe pear and dried apricot. Anise and clove too, beneath a core of caramel and pepper.
Balcones 5th Anniversary Single Barrel B.description:
STRICTLY 1 PER CUSTOMER

A special single barrel release from the craft distillery that brought us the first ever Texan whisky. This release marks 5 years since Chip Tate founded Balcones (which Chip and the chaps built from scratch!) and, as ever, it's a first...

It's the first full-size barrel of bourbon Balcones have ever produced and the first single barrel bourbon release in the state's history. It's also North Central Texas' first ever artisan bourbon. Moreover, it's completely delicious and has already picked up a slew of medals including a Double Gold at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition!

Just 10 bottles will be available in the UK, exclusively from Master of Malt.

To celebrate this tremendous milestone there will be a total of 4 single barrel releases from Balcones over the coming months, of which this is the first.

Highland Park 21 Year Old 1991 (cask 920.palate: Citrus fruits and caramel. Quite sweet with very soft smoke developing.
Highland Park 21 Year Old 1991 (cask 920.name: Highland Park 21 Year Old 1991 (cask 9200)   Directors' Cut (dounglas Laing)
Highland Park 21 Year Old 1991 (cask 920.notes: citrus, fruit, berry, cinnamon, peat, smoke, caramel, honey
Highland Park 21 Year Old 1991 (cask 920.nose: Dry grass and driftwood on the nose, with hints of manuka honey and red berry fruit. A little peat smoke and sea air.
Highland Park 21 Year Old 1991 (cask 920.description: This was distilled at the Highland Park distillery in February 1991. It was then aged for 21 years in a single cask (refill butt number 9200) before bottling for Douglas Laing's premier Director's Cut range in October 2012.

Lark Single Malt Cask Strength.palate: Big and oily. More than a hint of ginger, with apples, vanilla cream, pears and pastry. It's a very big whisky, and whilst not massively complex, more than compensates with a huge intensity of flavour.
Lark Single Malt Cask Strength.name: Lark Single Malt Cask Strength
Lark Single Malt Cask Strength.notes: spicy, nutmeg, spices, peat, cream, vanilla, toffee, honey
Lark Single Malt Cask Strength.nose: A sweet, rich, spicy nose with a good touch of nutmeg, gives way to vanilla, honey and spices. A little turmeric too perhaps.
Lark Single Malt Cask Strength.description: Awarded a Gold Medal at the 2011 World Whiskeys Masters, this cask strength whisky from the Tasmanian distillery, Lark, is a belter. Lots of rich notes of toffee and peat, this is a small batch product with oodles of charm!

Dewar's 18 Year Old Founders Reserve.palate: Medium, balanced, berry fruits, toasted barley.
Dewar's 18 Year Old Founders Reserve.name: Dewar's 18 Year Old Founders Reserve
Dewar's 18 Year Old Founders Reserve.notes: oak, orange, fruit, berry, zest, smoke, barley, toasted, flowers, honey
Dewar's 18 Year Old Founders Reserve.nose: Sandalwood, fresh fruit. Orange zest, cut flowers. Little smoke, honeyed sweetness.
Dewar's 18 Year Old Founders Reserve.note categories: wood, fruits, earth, cereal, flowers, feint
Dewar's 18 Year Old Founders Reserve.description: A long established, world renowned blend.

Ledaig 10 Year Old.palate: Medium-bodied and quite rich. There are notes of spice and smoke gathering above the charred oak. The peat is quiet and dry with a touch of black pepper and earth.
Ledaig 10 Year Old.name: Ledaig 10 Year Old
Ledaig 10 Year Old.notes: oak, pine, fruit, pepper, spice, earth, peat, smoky, smoke, nut, nuts, walnut, barley
Ledaig 10 Year Old.nose: Quite light and well-balanced. There is a very soft peat with a gentle smoke. Notes of barley and malt extract with walnut and pine oil and a hint of iodine with notes of dried fruit and nuts.
Ledaig 10 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, cereal
Ledaig 10 Year Old.description: A 10 year old from the Tobermory distillery on Mull, a Gold Medal winner at the 2008 International Wine and Spirits Competition.

Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Cube.palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass and a good hit of malt.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Cube.name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label   Porsche Cube
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Cube.notes: oak, cedar, citrus, plum, fruit, berry, spice, smoke, chocolate, toffee, floral, honey
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Cube.nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice and citrus.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Cube.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, feint
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Cube.description: Made by a collaboration of Johnnie Walker and the Porsche Design Studio. The incredible Cube is essentially the ultimate box for your Blue Label, splitting in half to form an ice bucket, whilst smartly holding 4 branded tumbler glasses, a pair of ice tongs and a bottle of Blue Label!

Balmenach 2004 Connoisseurs Choice (go.palate: Fruity palate with dried banana chips and hints of dried mint leaves. Buttery toffee, spice and biscuity malt at the core.
Balmenach 2004 Connoisseurs Choice (go.name: Balmenach 2004   Connoisseurs Choice (gordon & Macphail)
Balmenach 2004 Connoisseurs Choice (go.notes: fruity, allspice, spice, butter, caramel, toffee, salt
Balmenach 2004 Connoisseurs Choice (go.nose: Gentle, malty nose. Hints of dried grass, allspice, a little boiled sweet note.
Balmenach 2004 Connoisseurs Choice (go.description: This comes from Gordon and MacPhail's famous Connoisseurs Choice range, now at the higher bottling strength of 46%abv. It was distilled at the Balmenach distillery in 2004, and was matured in sherry casks before bottling in 2012.

Auchentoshan Three Wood.palate: Rich. Liqueur cherries in dark chocolate, more sherried fruit, ripe dark forest fruits, like a Black Forest Gateaux.
Auchentoshan Three Wood.name: Auchentoshan Three Wood
Auchentoshan Three Wood.notes: wood, cherries, cherry, fruit, chocolate, toffee
Auchentoshan Three Wood.nose: Cooked fruit, sherry, toffee, a rum-like quality and notes of Bas Armagnac distilled circa 1940.
Auchentoshan Three Wood.description: A Lowland single malt matured in 3 different casks, namely: Pedro Ximénez Sherry casks, bourbon casks and Oloroso Sherry. A distinctive triple distilled whisky from Auchentoshan.

Balvenie 21 Year Old Portwood Finish.palate: Surprisingly delicate. Abounding, yet fine. Her sublime mouth feel carries, masterfully
Balvenie 21 Year Old Portwood Finish.name: Balvenie 21 Year Old Portwood Finish
Balvenie 21 Year Old Portwood Finish.notes: wood, fruit, raisin, peach, smoke, floral, cocoa, honey
Balvenie 21 Year Old Portwood Finish.nose: Elegant. White peach and a faint puff of smoke.
Balvenie 21 Year Old Portwood Finish.note categories: wood, fruits, earth, flowers, coffee, feint
Balvenie 21 Year Old Portwood Finish.description: The flagship single malt from Balvenie's little group of Port Wood whiskies. This bottling was finished in thirty year old port pipes and is a veritable masterclass in poise and balance.

Master Of Malt Speyside Single Malt.palate: Rounded and soft with a sweet, malty flavour. Acacia honey, lemon sherbet and toasty oak hidden underneath.
Master Of Malt Speyside Single Malt.name: Master Of Malt Speyside Single Malt
Master Of Malt Speyside Single Malt.notes: oak, fruit, lemon, fruity, pepper, spices, butter, creamy, honey
Master Of Malt Speyside Single Malt.nose: Big on butter, fudge and sherry, with great oak integration and orangey notes. Madeira. A touch of white pepper, sultanas and apricots.
Master Of Malt Speyside Single Malt.description: Our creamy, fruity Speyside single malt. This little gem comes from our Secret Bottlings Series - a range of top-quality single malts from Scotland's best distilleries. The fact we don't announce the distillery on the label means we can offer this delicious whisky at just a fraction of the price it would be otherwise.

Old Hobart Overeem Bourbon Cask Matured.palate: Huge coconut, vanilla, caramelised apples and tuck shop sweets with a little water.
Old Hobart Overeem Bourbon Cask Matured.name: Old Hobart Overeem Bourbon Cask Matured (cask Strength) (cask OHD 065)
Old Hobart Overeem Bourbon Cask Matured.nose: Fresh and vibrant, green beans, foam bananas and molasses. Vanilla and caramel with a slightly green nut edge
Old Hobart Overeem Bourbon Cask Matured.description:
Chosen by a panel of tasters, which included our very own Ben and our competition winner Seamus as well as the Worlds's Best Spirits (formerly Caskstrength) chaps, this is the first bourbon cask matured Overeem single malt from Tasmania to be released. One of a dozen ex-Heaven Hill casks filled 5-6 years ago, cask #065 was the (quite incredible) pick of the bunch.

Just 50 bottles of this first single cask release are available, exclusively in the UK.

Craigellachie 11 Year Old 1999 Nc2 (du.palate: Cocoa, buttery biscuit base, hints of tropical fruit and various fresh flowers.
Craigellachie 11 Year Old 1999 Nc2 (du.name: Craigellachie 11 Year Old 1999   Nc2 (duncan Taylor)
Craigellachie 11 Year Old 1999 Nc2 (du.notes: fruit, apple, peppery, oat, caramel, floral, flowers, cocoa, honey
Craigellachie 11 Year Old 1999 Nc2 (du.nose: Oats and various sweet cereals. Apple peel, honey, pear juice and floral notes.
Craigellachie 11 Year Old 1999 Nc2 (du.note categories: fruits, spice, cereal, vanilla, flowers, coffee, feint
Craigellachie 11 Year Old 1999 Nc2 (du.description: This was distilled at the Craigellachie distillery in 1999 and aged for 11 years before it was bottled un-chillfiltered and without caramel colouring in 2011 for Duncan Taylor's NC2 range.

Bushmills Black Bush.name: Bushmills Black Bush
Bushmills Black Bush.distillery: The Old Bushmills Whisky Distillery Company
Bushmills Black Bush.description: Black Bush is a great blend from Bushmills, made up mostly of malt whiskey aged for 11 years in sherry casks before blending.

Nikka Taketsuru 21 Year Old.palate: Spices, black pepper, loads of tangy sherry, hints of turmeric and other spices. Then ground ginger, mixed peels, hints of marmalade.
Nikka Taketsuru 21 Year Old.name: Nikka Taketsuru 21 Year Old
Nikka Taketsuru 21 Year Old.notes: oak, pepper, spices, spice, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, espresso
Nikka Taketsuru 21 Year Old.nose: Plenty of oak influence with notes of prunes and soy sauce. Cocoa, espresso beans, almost a touch of anise.
Nikka Taketsuru 21 Year Old.description: Taketsuru 21 was crowned World's Best Blended Malt Whisky at the 2010 World Whiskies Awards. It really is a fabulous whisky, and for those of you who enjoyed the brilliant 17 year old this offers just a bit more richness, a little hint more chocolate and coffee.

Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old.palate: Dense, rich sherried notes perked up with a coastal saltiness. On a second wave roast chestnuts emerge and gentle wood spice.
Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old.name: Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old
Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old.notes: wood, nutmeg, spice, caramel, toffee, leathery, salt, saltiness, lead
Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old.nose: Salted caramel leading to sticky toffee pudding sprinkled with nutmeg. With time a leathery quality emerges.
Bunnahabhain 18 Year Old.description: In what will be seen as a positive move to whisky connoisseurs, Bunnahabhain have decided to bottle the 18 year old without chill-filtration and without colouring.

Tomatin 12 Year Old (40%).palate: Good body and quite sweet. There are notes of fudge and dark sugar, winter spice and a touch of vinosity, notes of toffee apple and Bramley peel with notes of dried herbs.
Tomatin 12 Year Old (40%).name: Tomatin 12 Year Old (40%)
Tomatin 12 Year Old (40%).notes: oak, fruity, apple, pepper, spice, barley, toasted, toffee, flowers
Tomatin 12 Year Old (40%).nose: Medium-bodied and well-balanced. There are notes of toasted cereals and barley. Hints of winter spice and buttery pepper emanating from the toasty oak. Hints of dark sugar and cut flowers with a note of malt extract, rum and apple peel.
Tomatin 12 Year Old (40%).note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, vanilla, flowers
Tomatin 12 Year Old (40%).description: This 12 year old was released in late 2003 to replace the 10 year old. A medium-bodied single malt from the Tomatin distillery.

Glenlossie 18 Year Old 1992 Un Chillfi.palate: Punchy and spicy with notes of black pepper, citrus and spices. A touch of Oloroso sherry, dates and walnut.
Glenlossie 18 Year Old 1992 Un Chillfi.name: Glenlossie 18 Year Old 1992   Un Chillfiltered (signatory)
Glenlossie 18 Year Old 1992 Un Chillfi.notes: citrus, spices, spicy, pepper, spice, walnut, butter
Glenlossie 18 Year Old 1992 Un Chillfi.nose: Coppery, with a leafy greenness, spices, tobacco sweetness, spice and butter. Very interesting indeed!
Glenlossie 18 Year Old 1992 Un Chillfi.description: A release of 727 numbered bottles of hogshead-matured Glenlossie, this was distilled in 1992 and bottled in 2011 by Signatory.

Paul John Single Cask Indian Whisky (cas.palate: Oily and mouth-coating with yet more gorgeous malt and molasses.
Paul John Single Cask Indian Whisky (cas.name: Paul John Single Cask Indian Whisky (cask P1 163)
Paul John Single Cask Indian Whisky (cas.nose: Thick, juicy barley and vanilla-rich bourbon. A waft of sea-salt and brown sugar comes in from the coast.
Paul John Single Cask Indian Whisky (cas.description: Single cask release of Indian single malt whisky from John Distilleries, made with unpeated barley and matured in bourbon barrels in Goa. Afterwards, it was bottled, with no chill-filtering or colouring, at cask strength - a sturdy 57% ABV.

Greenore 8 Year Old.palate: Sweet, smooth vanilla before spicy oak comes in. Touches of menthol and coconut ice.
Greenore 8 Year Old.name: Greenore 8 Year Old
Greenore 8 Year Old.notes: oak, fruit, lemon, spicy, toasted, milk, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, honey
Greenore 8 Year Old.nose: Lemon sponge, honeyed cereal, vanilla and a little caramel. Toasted oak, banana and tropical fruit. Fairly light, but full of flavour - very nice indeed!
Greenore 8 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Greenore 8 Year Old.description: An 8 year old single grain whiskey from Ireland! This won Gold (Best in Class) three years running at the International Wine and Spirits Competition between 2008 and 2010. Greenore is distilled at the Cooley distillery.

Islay 8 Year Old As We Get It (ian Mac.palate: Big and rich. Spices, supple peat, good sweetness.
Islay 8 Year Old As We Get It (ian Mac.name: Islay 8 Year Old   As We Get It (ian Macleod)
Islay 8 Year Old As We Get It (ian Mac.notes: oak, spices, peat, barley, toffee, herbal
Islay 8 Year Old As We Get It (ian Mac.nose: Quite sweet. Big on peat, toffee, barley. Crisp cereals, herbal.
Islay 8 Year Old As We Get It (ian Mac.note categories: wood, spice, earth, cereal, vanilla, flowers
Islay 8 Year Old As We Get It (ian Mac.description: An 8 year old, cask strength single malt from an unnamed Islay distillery. This has been left at cask strength, non chill-filtered so Ian Macleod bottle it "as they got it"…

Johnnie Walker Blue Label.palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass and a good hit of malt.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label.name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label
Johnnie Walker Blue Label.notes: oak, cedar, citrus, plum, fruit, berry, spice, smoke, chocolate, toffee, floral, honey
Johnnie Walker Blue Label.nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice and citrus.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, feint
Johnnie Walker Blue Label.description: Synonymous with the premium whisky blend. Blue Label is the rarest whisky in the Johnnie Walker stable.

Adnams Single Malt No 1.palate: Pepper and more bubblegum, white orchard fruit notes and blueberry, hint of cookie dough.
Adnams Single Malt No 1.name: Adnams Single Malt No 1
Adnams Single Malt No 1.notes: oak, cherries, cherry, fruit, fruity, pepper, spicy, chocolate, butterscotch, vanilla, caramel, honey
Adnams Single Malt No 1.nose: Oak, bubblegum, apricot, moving onto vanilla, butterscotch, still quite fruity. After adding a drop of water there’s kirsch and, yep, runny honey. Red and black cherries develop alongside a hint of red chilli and, increasingly, red rope liquorice.
Adnams Single Malt No 1.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Adnams Single Malt No 1.description:
Adnams first ever single malt whisky! That's right, there's a new English whisky producer on the block. Fresh from scooping up the IWSC Gin Trophy, the renowned beer producer has now officially added single malt as another string to their bow (it's a bow with lots of strings).

Matured for 3 years and 1 day in virgin French oak, capable of influencing the spirit more quickly, this unique whisky is a limited edition release that's bound to be popular. Sample Drams available to buy below!

Darkness! Tobermory 17 Year Old Oloroso.palate: Fruit again to the fore initially with some orange peel, quickly replaced by dark caramels, then into thick and rich nuttiness.
Darkness! Tobermory 17 Year Old Oloroso.name: Darkness! Tobermory 17 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish
Darkness! Tobermory 17 Year Old Oloroso.notes: wood, orange, fruit, nutty, nuttiness, walnut, caramel, honey
Darkness! Tobermory 17 Year Old Oloroso.nose: Raspberry ripple rice pudding, juicy blackcurrants and juicy malt. Full of life this one, with some walnut and honey notes below the surface.
Darkness! Tobermory 17 Year Old Oloroso.description: Hello Darkness! my old friend... This is a 17 year old Tobermory single malt Scotch whisky, which has enjoyed a finishing period in a specially coopered 50 litre oloroso Sherry cask. These tiny casks can increase the interaction between the wood and the whisky, resulting in brilliantly bold Sherried goodness - which we think pairs very well with Tobermory's tremendous unpeated Island single malt...

Auchroisk 10 Year Old 2002 Provenance.palate: Builds on thick, sweet, malted barley, manuka honey, calves leather and cinnamon.
Auchroisk 10 Year Old 2002 Provenance.name: Auchroisk 10 Year Old 2002   Provenance (douglas Laing)
Auchroisk 10 Year Old 2002 Provenance.notes: fruity, zest, apple, spicy, cinnamon, barley, vanilla, caramel, leather, honey
Auchroisk 10 Year Old 2002 Provenance.nose: Sweet, fresh and fruity nose with hints of apple blossom, zest and vanilla fudge.
Auchroisk 10 Year Old 2002 Provenance.description: Distilled at the Auchroisk distillery in Spring 2002, this was aged for 10 years in a single refill hogshead before bottling by Douglas Laing for their Provenance range in Winter 2012. Non-chillfiltered with no caramel colouring…

Chivas Regal 25 Year Old.palate: Soft and gentle but it builds with an elegant toffee-like character, very butter. Hints of boiled sweets, aniseed and custard.
Chivas Regal 25 Year Old.name: Chivas Regal 25 Year Old
Chivas Regal 25 Year Old.notes: fruit, berry, peach, earthy, nutty, almond, oat, butter, butterscotch, custard
Chivas Regal 25 Year Old.nose: Rich, nutty and thick with notes of malt and berry fruits, hints of liquorice, raspberries and sweet porridge oats.
Chivas Regal 25 Year Old.note categories: fruits, earth, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla
Chivas Regal 25 Year Old.description: Awarded 95 points in the 2010 Whisky Bible, Jim Murray rated this his Scotch Blend of Year in the 18 years and over category. Chivas Regal 25 year old is a delicious blend, with notes of peach and almond.

Jack Daniel's Sinatra Select.palate: Yummy butterscotch notes which turn into yummier caramel notes, rich and warm. Hints of orange zest and a subtle smokiness.
Jack Daniel's Sinatra Select.name: Jack Daniel's Sinatra Select
Jack Daniel's Sinatra Select.notes: wood, oak, orange, zest, smoky, butterscotch, vanilla, caramel, honey
Jack Daniel's Sinatra Select.nose: Soft honey, fresh apples and a bold oak note at the centre.
Jack Daniel's Sinatra Select.description:
Frank Sinatra was a long time fan of Jack Daniel's Tennessee Whiskey and was often seen sipping a glass of it on stage while singing 'Fly Me To The Moon' or 'My Way'. He even kept a stash of the classic whiskey on his private plane to enjoy while on the way to his next show, which would certainly beat a plastic cup of warm wine any day.

Jack Daniel's Sinatra Select has been created in honour of this friendship with Old Blue Eyes. The bold, smooth qualities of the Sinatra Select come from the specially made Sinatra barrels in which part of the whiskey was aged. Deep grooves were cut into the staves of the casks, increasing the amount of exposure the whiskey had to the wood. It is then married with Jack Daniel's Old No. 7 and bottled at 45% abv, which is how Sinatra would have enjoyed it back in the day. 

So put on a Sinatra LP, sip some Jack Daniel's Sinatra Select and raise a glass to the man with one of the best voices the world has ever known.

Ben Nevis 17 Year Old 1996 Single Cask.palate: Coffee beans and light hops, balanced by sweet malt, Parma Violets and red apple skin. Earthy, perhaps almost vegetal at its core.
Ben Nevis 17 Year Old 1996 Single Cask.name: Ben Nevis 17 Year Old 1996   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Ben Nevis 17 Year Old 1996 Single Cask.notes: orange, berry, fruity, apple, earthy, caramel, violets, coffee
Ben Nevis 17 Year Old 1996 Single Cask.nose: It opens with decadent crème caramel and sponge cake, before moving on to fragrant potpourri (with a good helping of lavender oil). Leave it in the glass and it develops fruity esters in the shape of wild berry ice-cream and flamed orange peel.
Ben Nevis 17 Year Old 1996 Single Cask.description:
Single cask Ben Nevis? Oh, go on then! This bold, beautiful Ben Nevis single malt Scotch whisky was drawn from a single refill bourbon hogshead which was home to the whisky for 17 years, from October 1996 to June 2014. It's been bottled at cask strength (a hearty 51.4% ABV) for our Single Cask Series. You'll definitely want to get your hands on one if you're a Ben Nevis buff, as it's a properly delicious dram of Highland whisky.

34 bottles were produced.

Glenfiddich 31 Year Old 1976 Vintage R.palate: Rich. Barley, floral. Tangerine, orange zest, fruit salad. Big oak.
Glenfiddich 31 Year Old 1976 Vintage R.name: Glenfiddich 31 Year Old 1976   Vintage Reserve
Glenfiddich 31 Year Old 1976 Vintage R.notes: oak, orange, fruit, fruity, zest, apple, peppery, spicy, spice, barley, floral
Glenfiddich 31 Year Old 1976 Vintage R.nose: Rich, rounded. Apple blossom, very floral. Fruity, dried peels. Calvados. Exotic spice, menthol, oak.
Glenfiddich 31 Year Old 1976 Vintage R.description: Cask No. 516, filled on 16th January 1976 and aged for 31 years before bottling. A wonderful Glenfiddich single cask, packaged in a beautiful presentation case.

Powers John's Lane Release 12 Year Old S.palate: Very smooth with vanilla, dry spice, chocolate and coffee. There is dark fruit here too, raisins and blackcurrants.
Powers John's Lane Release 12 Year Old S.name: Powers John's Lane Release 12 Year Old Single Pot Still
Powers John's Lane Release 12 Year Old S.notes: oak, fruit, raisin, spice, barley, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, leather
Powers John's Lane Release 12 Year Old S.nose: Barley, copper, fresh oak, leather, and juicy fruit.
Powers John's Lane Release 12 Year Old S.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Powers John's Lane Release 12 Year Old S.description: A single pot still release of Powers whisky. It's matured in a combination of bourbon and oloroso sherry casks, and named after the distillery where it was first made, now sadly closed.

Arran 2004 (bottled 2012) Orkney Bere Ba.palate: Apple peel and ground almond. Big oak, with a development of baking spices. Gooey malt core with potpourri.
Arran 2004 (bottled 2012) Orkney Bere Ba.name: Arran 2004 (bottled 2012) Orkney Bere Barley
Arran 2004 (bottled 2012) Orkney Bere Ba.notes: oak, fruit, apple, spices, almond, barley, creamy, honey
Arran 2004 (bottled 2012) Orkney Bere Ba.nose: Rich, creamy malt and dried grass. Hints of soft honey, a little cooked fruit and notes of chewy oak.
Arran 2004 (bottled 2012) Orkney Bere Ba.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, chocolate, feint
Arran 2004 (bottled 2012) Orkney Bere Ba.description: A wonderful 2004 vintage from the Isle of Arran distillery, this little gem was distilled using Bere barley (a very old strain of barley which has been used traditionally for centuries) grown on Orkney.

George T. Stagg Bourbon (2012 Release).palate: The palate is dominated by fresh ground coffee beans and candied citrus peel with a wave of vanilla rushing over it. The texture is simply huge, big beefy Bourbon through-and-through.
George T. Stagg Bourbon (2012 Release).name: George T. Stagg Bourbon (2012 Release)
George T. Stagg Bourbon (2012 Release).notes: citrus, peppery, spicy, spice, vanilla, coffee, lead
George T. Stagg Bourbon (2012 Release).nose: Big notes of maple and treacle leading to that spicy peppery Stagg quality with a generous dose of rye!
George T. Stagg Bourbon (2012 Release).description: It's here! This is the 2012 bottling of the acclaimed George T Stagg Bourbon from the Buffalo Trace distillery and boasts an incredible strength of 71.4% abv. This is a big, take-your-breath-away whiskey, deserving of its accolades.

Matisse 21 Year Old.palate: Tangy and fruity with notes of oak, crème caramel and rum spices. Hints of cold, sweet coffee, toffee apples and vanilla.
Matisse 21 Year Old.name: Matisse 21 Year Old
Matisse 21 Year Old.notes: oak, fruity, apple, spices, creamy, cream, vanilla, caramel, toffee, hay, coffee, honey
Matisse 21 Year Old.nose: Soft, sweet nose with notes of honey, peels, apple, cut hay and strawberries in cream.
Matisse 21 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, coffee, feint
Matisse 21 Year Old.description: A smooth 21 year old blend with a hint of toffee, vanilla and oak, Matisse 21 was awarded  86 points in the Jim Murray Whisky Bible. Jim describes it as "soft and alluring".

Bladnoch 15 Year Old Sheep Label.palate: Rich, lovely dryness. Chocolate orange, freshly ground coffee, malty, touch of peat.
Bladnoch 15 Year Old Sheep Label.name: Bladnoch 15 Year Old   Sheep Label
Bladnoch 15 Year Old Sheep Label.notes: orange, citrus, peat, chocolate, cocoa, coffee
Bladnoch 15 Year Old Sheep Label.nose: Medium. Unlit cigars, citrus; mandarin and orange. Cocoa dusting.
Bladnoch 15 Year Old Sheep Label.description: A more chocolate and coffee-rich bottling from the Lowland distillery. This 15 year old cask strength Bladnoch offering features the 'Sheep Label' and was hand labelled and bottled at the distillery.

Isle Of Jura 16 Year Old (diurachs' Own).palate: Oily and resinous with sweet tobacco, mixed nuts, clove, milk chocolate and violet. Rich and round.
Isle Of Jura 16 Year Old (diurachs' Own).name: Isle Of Jura 16 Year Old (diurachs' Own)
Isle Of Jura 16 Year Old (diurachs' Own).notes: oak, orange, apple, clove, spice, nut, nuts, creamy, milk, chocolate, floral
Isle Of Jura 16 Year Old (diurachs' Own).nose: Fragrant, slightly floral cereal, some minerality at first, becoming increasingly creamy with a hint of orange. Mixed nuts, redcurrant, green apple and finally dark chocolate and spice.
Isle Of Jura 16 Year Old (diurachs' Own).note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, flowers
Isle Of Jura 16 Year Old (diurachs' Own).description: This 16 year old from the Isle of Jura was a bronze medal winner at the 2004 International Wine and Spirits Competition.

Glen Scotia 16 Year Old.palate: Hints of lemon curd and notes of dried apricot. Gingerbread and seaspray. Quite an oily palate. Very spicy.
Glen Scotia 16 Year Old.name: Glen Scotia 16 Year Old
Glen Scotia 16 Year Old.notes: wood, fruit, lemon, spicy, barley, vanilla, custard, honey
Glen Scotia 16 Year Old.nose: Barley grist and hints of manuka honey. Cigar boxes, wood shavings. Lemon rind.
Glen Scotia 16 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, vanilla, feint
Glen Scotia 16 Year Old.description: Produced in Campbeltown at the Glen Scotia distillery, this was aged for 16 years in a bourbon cask before bottling. Very good stuff.

Kilchoman Inaugural Release.palate: Rich, oily. Malt, spices, raisins, apple peels, citrus, vanilla sweetness and barrel char.
Kilchoman Inaugural Release.name: Kilchoman Inaugural Release
Kilchoman Inaugural Release.notes: citrus, raisin, apple, spicy, spices, vanilla, caramel, toffee
Kilchoman Inaugural Release.nose: Very spicy and oily. Notes of coal tar, soot and creosote. Shoe polish, blackcurrant, aniseed, sultanas and toffee.
Kilchoman Inaugural Release.description: The very first ever release of single malt whisky from the Kilchoman distillery. This Inaugural Release was aged for between 2.5 and 3 years in bourbon casks, before being finished for 6 months in sherry casks. Very good indeed. Malt Advocate rated it with 92 points.

The Glenlivet 12 Year Old.palate: Apple cores, fresh and fruity trifle and creamy citrus.
The Glenlivet 12 Year Old.name: The Glenlivet 12 Year Old
The Glenlivet 12 Year Old.notes: citrus, fruit, apple, fruity, pineapple, cinnamon, almond, creamy, vanilla, honey
The Glenlivet 12 Year Old.nose: Sweet creamy vanilla, honey, pineapple, vanilla, pressed apples and a little cinnamon.
The Glenlivet 12 Year Old.note categories: fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, feint
The Glenlivet 12 Year Old.description: The entry level bottling from the illustrious Glenlivet distillery at Speyside's heart, aged for 12 years. The archetypal Speyside dram, honey and orchard fruit driven.

Benrinnes 1997 Connoisseurs Choice (go.palate: Advent calendar chocolate, milky and sweet. Slightly hot, though apple juice notes cool it down quickly.
Benrinnes 1997 Connoisseurs Choice (go.name: Benrinnes 1997   Connoisseurs Choice (gordon And Macphail)
Benrinnes 1997 Connoisseurs Choice (go.notes: oak, fruit, apple, nutty, milky, chocolate
Benrinnes 1997 Connoisseurs Choice (go.nose: A nutty nose. Cake icing and sharp kiwis.
Benrinnes 1997 Connoisseurs Choice (go.description: A Connoisseurs Choice bottling of Benrinnes single malt Scotch whisky, bottled by Gordon and MacPhail. It was distilled in 1997, matured in a mix of sherry butts and American oak casks and bottled in 2013.

Laphroaig 16 Year Old 1995 Cask 43 Cas.palate: Big, punchy attack with lots of spice, vanilla, iodine and smoke. An oaky, fruity palate with a lot of tangy, peppery smoke.
Laphroaig 16 Year Old 1995 Cask 43 Cas.name: Laphroaig 16 Year Old 1995 Cask 43   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Laphroaig 16 Year Old 1995 Cask 43 Cas.notes: plum, fruity, peppery, spicy, spice, peat, smoke, vanilla, toffee, salty
Laphroaig 16 Year Old 1995 Cask 43 Cas.nose: Salty and tangy. The metallic, saline tinge of fresh rock oysters from the coast of Islay. Sticking plasters, toffee apples and bonfire toffee. Plumes of smoke and malt.
Laphroaig 16 Year Old 1995 Cask 43 Cas.description: This Laphroaig was distilled on the 4th April 1995 and it was aged for 16 years in bourbon barrel 43 before it was bottled by Signatory on the 25th October 2011. A release of 221 decanter bottles.

Eagle Rare 17 Year Old (bottled 2005).palate: Gentle, crisp. Cigar boxes, spice. Black pepper, some char. Butterscotch, herbal.
Eagle Rare 17 Year Old (bottled 2005).name: Eagle Rare 17 Year Old (bottled 2005)
Eagle Rare 17 Year Old (bottled 2005).notes: fruity, pepper, spice, nutty, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee, herbal
Eagle Rare 17 Year Old (bottled 2005).nose: Fruity and sweet. Nutty, warm pastries, syrup.
Eagle Rare 17 Year Old (bottled 2005).description:
STRICTLY 1 PER CUSTOMER

An intense 17 year old from Buffalo Trace, Eagle Rare is much thicker than some of the other small batch releases from the distillery.

Highland Park Loki 15 Year Old (the Va.palate: A hit of sweet smoke from the peated cask maturation gives way to cinnamon, ginger and increasingly nutmeg with marmalade. Slippery. (No really!)
Highland Park Loki 15 Year Old (the Va.name: Highland Park Loki   15 Year Old (the Valhalla Collection)
Highland Park Loki 15 Year Old (the Va.notes: orange, lemon, raisin, zest, cloves, nutmeg, cinnamon, peat, smoke, marzipan, toasted, milk, chocolate, toffee, honey, salty
Highland Park Loki 15 Year Old (the Va.nose: Salty sea spray jumps out the glass at first before revealing candied orange peel and a more refined version of the balsamic note present in other Highland Parks. Buttery toffee, raisins and oatiness. Or is it actually waxy with hints of ginger? What was that about shape-shifting again? Stewed apples and lemon zest now... and lime... and a little honey...
Highland Park Loki 15 Year Old (the Va.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, feint, mineral
Highland Park Loki 15 Year Old (the Va.description:
The second release in Highland Park's Valhalla Collection following last year's Thor release. Loki is Thor's adoptive brother, a mischievous soul, possibly even a shape-shifter and certainly an enigmatic character.

Highland Park have sought to create a whisky that matches Loki's unique personality with this 15 year old single malt. Unusually, some heavily peated casks were used for part of the maturation.

Strictly one per customer

Ancnoc 1999.palate: A citrus-led single malt, sweet and brilliantly fruity.
Ancnoc 1999.name: Ancnoc 1999
Ancnoc 1999.nose: Sweet manuka honey with sugary lemon drops.
Ancnoc 1999.description: The 1999 vintage of anCnoc single malt Scotch whisky from the Knockdhu distillery comes from carefully selected sherry and bourbon cask and is bottled without chill-filtering or colouring. It's just naturally delicious Highland whisky.

Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year Old (stumpy).palate: Soft and balanced. The word “toasty” sums this bourbon up perfectly, but if we had to say more we’d add
Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year Old (stumpy).name: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year Old (stumpy)
Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year Old (stumpy).notes: oak, wood, cedar, fruit, apple, creamy, creaminess, chocolate, vanilla, caramel
Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year Old (stumpy).distillery: Old Rip Van Winkle Whiskey Distillery
Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year Old (stumpy).nose: Caramel, cedar wood, soft crystalline oak and beautiful toastiness. Vanilla creaminess, hints of white chocolate and a whiff of apple peel.
Old Rip Van Winkle 10 Year Old (stumpy).description: Old Rip Van Winkle 10 is a well-aged sour mash Kentucky bourbon, well rated by the Beverage Tasting Institute who awarded it 90 points.

Miyagikyo Non Age.palate: Green apple skin, almonds, lime and more pepper, with a touch of young malt here and there.
Miyagikyo Non Age.name: Miyagikyo Non Age
Miyagikyo Non Age.notes: oak, citrus, fruit, apple, pepper, spices, spice, almond
Miyagikyo Non Age.nose: Fresh orchard fruits and intense citrus, paired with cracked black pepper and oak-y, cinnamon-y spices.
Miyagikyo Non Age.description: A no age statement single malt whisky from the Miyagikyo distillery in the Miyagi Prefecture. Characteristic of their expressions, this Miyagikyo single malt features plenty of interplay between spice and sweet fruit notes - should serve as a good introduction to Japanese whisky.

Auchentoshan 18 Year Old.palate: Toasty vanilla, dark nuttiness, chestnut perhaps and something zesty, softening slightly after a time.
Auchentoshan 18 Year Old.name: Auchentoshan 18 Year Old
Auchentoshan 18 Year Old.notes: oak, spice, nutty, nuttiness, barley, chocolate, vanilla
Auchentoshan 18 Year Old.nose: Rife with toasty oak and vanilla spice. Chocolate cake and a lovely grassiness, damp, yet drying. Crystallized ginger.
Auchentoshan 18 Year Old.note categories: wood, spice, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla
Auchentoshan 18 Year Old.description: Launched in 2008, this 18 year old bottling of triple distilled, Lowland single malt whisky boasts a superb richness for a core-range bottling and was aged in American oak casks.

Lagavulin 16 Year Old.palate: Very thick and rich. A massive mouthful of malt and sherry with good fruity sweetness, but also a wonderful sweetness. Big, powerful peat and oak.
Lagavulin 16 Year Old.name: Lagavulin 16 Year Old
Lagavulin 16 Year Old.notes: oak, fruity, spicy, spices, peat, smoke, creamy, vanilla
Lagavulin 16 Year Old.nose: More like Lapsang Souchong tea than Lapsang Souchong! One of the smokiest noses from Islay. It's big, very, very concentrated, and redolent of iodine, sweet spices, good, mature sherry and creamy vanilla. Stunning.
Lagavulin 16 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla
Lagavulin 16 Year Old.description: A much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting dram. The 16 year old has become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.

Nikka Pure Malt Red.palate: Great fruitiness, buttery and clean with hints of cut herbs, sugar and spice.
Nikka Pure Malt Red.name: Nikka Pure Malt Red
Nikka Pure Malt Red.notes: fruit, fruity, spice, peanut, nutty, butter, creamy, herbal
Nikka Pure Malt Red.nose: Of the three Pure Malts, this is the fruity, clean and easy-going one. The nose is clean, fruity and quite nutty. It reminds us of that old American favourite – peanut butter and jelly on toast.
Nikka Pure Malt Red.description: Pure Malt Red is a Japanese blended malt in a charming looking bottle! This is made up of malt whisky from the Nikka distilleries Yoichi and Miyagikyo. The result is a fruit, creamy, buttery, and slightly herbal whisky.

Bunnahabhain 23 Year Old 1979 Lost Bot.palate: Gingernut biscuits and salt caramels meld with a core of lovely creamy malt. The whole thing is rather oily and thick, coating the palate with soft spices, double cream and honey.
Bunnahabhain 23 Year Old 1979 Lost Bot.name: Bunnahabhain 23 Year Old 1979   Lost Bottlings Series (master Of Malt)
Bunnahabhain 23 Year Old 1979 Lost Bot.notes: spicy, spices, nut, nuts, creamy, cream, caramel, coffee, espresso, roasted, honey, salt
Bunnahabhain 23 Year Old 1979 Lost Bot.nose: Hugely sherried nose with a core of Brazil nuts, freshly roasted espresso coffee beans and hints of moss on a Spring day.
Bunnahabhain 23 Year Old 1979 Lost Bot.note categories: spice, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint, mineral
Bunnahabhain 23 Year Old 1979 Lost Bot.description: A rich and beautifully dark Bunnahabhain which we presume was aged in a very good sherry cask. This stuff was distilled in 1979 and aged for 23 long years before bottling in October 2002. This superb malt comes from our Lost Bottlings Series - a range of whiskies bottled many years ago, offering whisky lovers a chance to try spirit from a bygone era of distillation.

Tomatin Legacy.palate: Cracked pepper and sweet barley with pineapple cube sweets. Waves of warming oak beneath.
Tomatin Legacy.name: Tomatin Legacy
Tomatin Legacy.notes: oak, pine, lemon, pineapple, pepper, barley, vanilla
Tomatin Legacy.nose: Lemon, panatella and pine forest. Slightly green with vanilla.
Tomatin Legacy.description: Tomatin distillery's new no-age-statement release uses virgin oak as well as bourbon casks. It provides a new entry level to the Tomatin range but the use of different casks make this a unique expression.

Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.3 Phecda S.palate: Werther's Original and sticky cinnamon rolls, with a core of juicy, honey'd barley. Oily on the mid-palate with peppery touches.
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.3 Phecda S.name: Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.3 Phecda Single Malt Whisky
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.3 Phecda S.notes: wood, oak, peppery, cinnamon, smoky, smoke, barley, coffee, honey, salty
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.3 Phecda S.nose: Opens with buttery brioche dipped in dark coffee, with touches of dried apricot in the mix. Leave it for a minute and it develops bold notes of bacon and wood smoke.
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.3 Phecda S.note categories: wood, spice, earth, cereal, coffee, feint, mineral
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.3 Phecda S.description:
The third release from Spirits of Hven's Seven Stars range is the Phecda single malt whisky, which has been matured in a combination of American and French oak casks, then bottled without chill-filtration or additional colours. A cracking organic single malt from the fantastic Hven distillery on the tiny Swedish island from which the distillery gets its name. 

Following on from Dubhe and Merak (the previous expressions in the Seven Stars series), the Phecda has been named after a shining star in the Ursa Major (or The Plough) constellation.

Penderyn Madeira Finish 1l.palate: Thick and sweet, spices, green, biscuity. Custard.
Penderyn Madeira Finish 1l.name: Penderyn Madeira Finish 1l
Penderyn Madeira Finish 1l.nose: Sweet, medium body. Herbal, vanilla, sweetness, resin, sultanas, toast. Over-ripe grape.
Penderyn Madeira Finish 1l.description: A full litre bottle of Welsh Whisky. Penderyn was named 2008's Micro Distillery Whisky of the Year. This is matured in bourbon barrels before a finish in Madeira casks.

Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky (70cl).palate: Sweet, fruity flavours of melon, grapefruit and thick syrup, balanced by crunchy biscuits and fresh vanilla.
Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky (70cl).name: Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky (70cl)
Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky (70cl).nose: Bourbon-like vanilla and corn notes with a herbal hint of Chamomile.
Nikka Coffey Grain Whisky (70cl).description: Using the two Coffey stills at the Miyagikyo distillery, which were imported from Scotland to Japan in 1963, Nikka have produced a number of single cask single grain whiskies from time to time over the years. This, however, is their larger release of wonderfully exotic single grain whisky. Now in a 70cl bottle! Hooray!

Spirit Of Hven Urania Single Malt Whisky.palate: An oily delivery, with ginger continuing on the palate, joined by thyme honey, liquorice and herbal hints.
Spirit Of Hven Urania Single Malt Whisky.name: Spirit Of Hven Urania Single Malt Whisky
Spirit Of Hven Urania Single Malt Whisky.notes: citrus, apple, peach, pepper, barley, vanilla, herbal, honey
Spirit Of Hven Urania Single Malt Whisky.nose: A core of fragrant cereal, surrounded by notes cracked black pepper, chopped ginger root, fresh peach and vanilla.
Spirit Of Hven Urania Single Malt Whisky.note categories: fruits, spice, cereal, vanilla, flowers, feint
Spirit Of Hven Urania Single Malt Whisky.description: Spirit of Hven's Urania was the first single malt whisky ever made on an island in the Kingdom of Sweden. Distilled on the island of Hven, situated in the Öresund Strait between Denmark and Sweden, Urania was made using barley from Scotland, Belgium and from the island of Hven itself. It was left to mature in casks from America, France and Spain before being hand-bottled without chill filtration or added colourings. The name "Urania" comes from the Muse of Astronomy in Greek mythology, who was also the daughter of Zeus and Mnemosyne.

Seagram's V.o..palate: Spicy and creamy, medium-bodied with honey, caramel and coffee. A touch of orange marmalade and pannacotta.
Seagram's V.o..name: Seagram's V.o.
Seagram's V.o..notes: oak, orange, lemon, spicy, creamy, caramel, coffee, honey
Seagram's V.o..distillery: Seagrams Branded Gin Whisky And Whiskey
Seagram's V.o..nose: Juicy, spicy rye grains, dried apricot, lemon curd, oak and gristy sweetness.
Seagram's V.o..note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Seagram's V.o..description: Seagram's VO is a classic Canadian whisky blend, made with spirit of at least 6 years of age. It is said the blend was created after a post-prandial conversation amongst the Seagram family; the letters "VO" might well stand for "very own", as in, their very own blend...

English Whisky Co. Chapter 15 20cl.palate: More lemongrass on the palate, along with toasted marshmallows and oak.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 15 20cl.name: English Whisky Co. Chapter 15 20cl
English Whisky Co. Chapter 15 20cl.notes: wood, oak, citrus, fruit, peat, toasted
English Whisky Co. Chapter 15 20cl.nose: Citrus fruits and lemongrass emerge first, with charred oak and wood fires following.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 15 20cl.description: A 20cl bottling of the English Whisky Company's Chapter 15 single malt whisky - a heavily peated expression distilled in June 2009 and bottled in September 2014 with no chill-filtration or additional colours.

Strathmill 21 Year Old 1991 Single Cas.palate: Intense cracked black peppercorn heat surprises after the delicate nose draws you in, a hint of apple crumble too. A little water reveals nutmeg, gentle oak and ground pepper.
Strathmill 21 Year Old 1991 Single Cas.name: Strathmill 21 Year Old 1991   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Strathmill 21 Year Old 1991 Single Cas.notes: oak, lemon, apple, pepper, nutmeg, nut, nuts, vanilla, floral, lead
Strathmill 21 Year Old 1991 Single Cas.nose: If approached carefully (it is 57.7% abv!), a wonderfully delicate, sweet, floral nose is revealed. Honeysuckle with supporting apple, grapefruit and a touch of Satsuma. Fragrant vanilla develops into buttery notes and Rich Tea fingers. There is lemon curd, dried coconut and papaya and a sprinkling of white pepper.
Strathmill 21 Year Old 1991 Single Cas.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, vanilla, flowers, mineral
Strathmill 21 Year Old 1991 Single Cas.description: A fantastic single cask Strathmill bottled at natural cask strength in May 2013 after a 21 year maturation period in cask 2534. A wonderfully delicate and complex nose leads into the more robust palate and delicious finish. Nothing added, nothing taken away.

Glenrothes 1969 (bottled 2008) The Mac.palate: Lots of spice, creamy, thick syrupy and rich.
Glenrothes 1969 (bottled 2008) The Mac.name: Glenrothes 1969 (bottled 2008)   The Macphail's Collection (gordon And Macphail)
Glenrothes 1969 (bottled 2008) The Mac.notes: oak, fruit, spicy, spice, creamy, toffee
Glenrothes 1969 (bottled 2008) The Mac.nose: Sherry, oak, toffee, dried fruits, Madeira.
Glenrothes 1969 (bottled 2008) The Mac.description: A 1969 vintage from the Glenrothes distillery in Speyside. Very spicy and rich, bottled by Gordon and MacPhail in 2008.

Teeling Single Malt.palate: An elegant expression, this. Well placed fruit, backed up with cinnamon and white pepper. A touch of dried flower petals along the way. Strawberries?
Teeling Single Malt.name: Teeling Single Malt
Teeling Single Malt.nose: Intense white grape juiciness on the nose, joined by fresh malt and Rolos, developing into white chocolate the longer it's in the glass.
Teeling Single Malt.description: The eagerly anticipated Teeling Single Malt Irish Whiskey, made with 100% malt whiskeys. A selection of five wine-cask-finished-whiskeys were used for this release (some of which were distilled back in 1991), including Sherry, Port, Madeira, White Burgundy and Cabernet Sauvignon. Exciting, delicious stuff from the Teeling chaps in Dublin.

Hakushu 12 Year Old.palate: Much more fruit on the palate, but it's but no means a sweet whisky. Still rich, herbaceous and grassy, with a waft of smoke along the way.
Hakushu 12 Year Old.name: Hakushu 12 Year Old
Hakushu 12 Year Old.notes: orange, fruit, smoke, nut, almond, barley, toasted, milk, chocolate, herbaceous
Hakushu 12 Year Old.nose: Toasted barley, seed & nut loaf, chopped almonds and a little bit of barrel char. Hints of milk chocolate and dried grass bring sweetness.
Hakushu 12 Year Old.note categories: fruits, earth, nuts, cereal, chocolate, flowers
Hakushu 12 Year Old.description: This whisky hails from the Japanese distillery of Hakushu set in a forest and was once twice the size with an east and west distillery on the site.

Dalwhinnie The Manager's Dram.palate: Barley and oats with a malty sweetness. A bit of leather cut with citrus, developing into softer baked fruit.
Dalwhinnie The Manager's Dram.name: Dalwhinnie The Manager's Dram
Dalwhinnie The Manager's Dram.notes: citrus, fruit, oat, barley, vanilla, leather, honey
Dalwhinnie The Manager's Dram.nose: Lots of vanilla, with a pure sugary sweetness. Beeswax and acacia honey and light lavender notes.
Dalwhinnie The Manager's Dram.description: From the highly esteemed Manager's Dram series of single malt releases. This delicious Dalwinnie was bottled at 57.5% abv and is non chill-filtered.

Mortlach 18 Year Old.palate: The decadent syrup and caramel notes develop on the palate, with oak, earthy tobacco and almonds adding depth. Tropical fruit notes give it a lively backbone.
Mortlach 18 Year Old.name: Mortlach 18 Year Old
Mortlach 18 Year Old.notes: oak, citrus, fruit, lemon, zest, spices, cinnamon, earthy, nutty, almond, mocha, caramel, toffee
Mortlach 18 Year Old.nose: Nutty at first, followed by vibrant spices - think ginger and cinnamon - paired with fresh green apples and lemon zest. Lyle's Golden Syrup and toffee pennies too.
Mortlach 18 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla
Mortlach 18 Year Old.description: Official bottlings of Mortlach have been few and far between in years past, but in 2014, that has changed. This is the 18 year old single malt Scotch whisky from Mortlach, released in 2014 as part of a new range from the distillery, alongside the Rare Old, the 25 Year Old and the travel retail exclusive Special Strength. Matured in a combination of Sherry and refill American oak casks, the Mortlach 18 Year Old is presented in a very striking bottle, with fancy metal framework at its base.

Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 Casks 310801 &.palate: Oily and rounded. Some tar-like notes, a hint of sticking plaster, honey and violets.
Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 Casks 310801 &.name: Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 Casks 310801 & 310806 (signatory)
Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 Casks 310801 &.notes: spicy, smoke, creamy, herbal, violets, honey, salty
Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 Casks 310801 &.nose: Herbal, creamy and sweet. Some oily, salty smoke, a touch of kippers, honey and malt.
Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 Casks 310801 &.note categories: spice, earth, chocolate, flowers, feint, mineral
Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 Casks 310801 &.description: This 12 year old Caol Ila was distilled on the 18th November 1999 and it was aged in two hogsheads (casks 310804 and 310806) before bottling by Signatory on the 12th December 2011. A release of 887 numbered bottles.

Bunnahabhain 13 Year Old 1997 (adelphi).palate: Thick, syrupy, with notes of seaweed, cinder toffee, marshmallows cooked over a bonfire and camphor.
Bunnahabhain 13 Year Old 1997 (adelphi).name: Bunnahabhain 13 Year Old 1997 (adelphi)
Bunnahabhain 13 Year Old 1997 (adelphi).notes: pepper, spicy, peat, peanut, butter, toffee, salty, salt
Bunnahabhain 13 Year Old 1997 (adelphi).nose: Rich and spicy with notes of smoked meats, granary toast, Reese's Peanut Butter Cups, hints of spent match, salt and pepper and malt.
Bunnahabhain 13 Year Old 1997 (adelphi).note categories: spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Bunnahabhain 13 Year Old 1997 (adelphi).description: This Bunnahabhain was distilled from peated malt in 1997 and aged for 13 years in a refill sherry cask before it was bottled by Adelphi. This was bottled in aid of the genesis research trust, and there are 369 bottles in total.

Tomintoul 21 Year Old.palate: Thick, mouth filling and very creamy, there are notes of toffee, vanilla, bourbon, raisins, rum spices and oak.
Tomintoul 21 Year Old.name: Tomintoul 21 Year Old
Tomintoul 21 Year Old.notes: oak, raisin, apple, spices, creamy, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee
Tomintoul 21 Year Old.nose: Creamy and sweet with notes of vanilla, toffee apple, butterscotch and malt.
Tomintoul 21 Year Old.description: A 21 year old from Tomintoul, and a relatively new addition to their line-up. This is very sweet and creamy and utterly delicious. It was released to replace the now discontinued 27 year old.

Glenglassaugh Revival.palate: Sweet, rounded and creamy. Oranges, plums, cherry and walnuts, chocolate, honey-mead, sherry and soft, spiced oak.
Glenglassaugh Revival.name: Glenglassaugh Revival
Glenglassaugh Revival.notes: oak, cherry, plum, berry, spices, earthy, nutty, walnut, creamy, milk, chocolate, caramel, toffee, honey
Glenglassaugh Revival.nose: Sweet caramel and toffee with notes of nutty sherry, milk chocolate and honey. Ripe plums, red berries and oranges. Caramelised sugar and earthy, charred oak.
Glenglassaugh Revival.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Glenglassaugh Revival.description:
This is the first chance to try whisky produced by the recently re-opened Glenglassaugh Distillery.
It was closed in 1986 but resumed production in 2008. This revival bottling is the first whisky to be made at the distillery since it reopened. Matured in a mixture of first and refill bourbon casks, this was finished for 6 months in first-fill oloroso sherry butts.

Tobermory Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whi.palate: Quite perfumed and intriguingly sweet with star fruit. Golden barley and just a touch of salinity.
Tobermory Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whi.name: Tobermory   Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Tobermory Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whi.notes: orange, fruit, peat, nutty, barley, floral
Tobermory Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whi.nose: The nose is sweet and nutty with plenty of sultanas and cereal, not unlike Just Right. Floral hints of geranium and oily cereals.
Tobermory Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whi.description:
This is the 3rd batch of Tobermory single malt from the distillery on the Isle of Mull bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company. It seems Mull has a rather famous visitor in the grassy hills around the colourful houses of Tobermory - it's none other than Alan Partridge! He's driven all the way to the Inner Hebrides island and hopefully ate enough Toblerone on the way so that we don't have to watch him eat that orange on the 'table' in his own unique/terrifying way. 

If you look in the background, you can see the anthropomorphic spirit of Ledaig, the name Tobermory uses for their peated whisky, flying off to Islay with his gigantic hammer. That's because this is a single malt from Tobermory, which is classically unpeated.

A release of 208 numbered bottles.

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, blended malts, blends and bourbons from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Hibiki 12 Year Old Gift Pack 50cl.palate: Crushed almonds, stewed fruits, clove-studded oranges. Sherried malt and a subtle core of oak.
Hibiki 12 Year Old Gift Pack 50cl.name: Hibiki 12 Year Old   Gift Pack 50cl
Hibiki 12 Year Old Gift Pack 50cl.notes: oak, orange, citrus, plum, fruit, apple, cinnamon, almond, honey
Hibiki 12 Year Old Gift Pack 50cl.nose: Juicy marmalade with real chunks of orange, cooked apples dusted with cinnamon, thick honey and plum wine.
Hibiki 12 Year Old Gift Pack 50cl.description: A fantastic gift pack containing a tasting glass alongside the excellent Hibiki 12 Year Old blended Japanese whisky, which already comes in the most handsome decanter bottle.

Ancnoc Rutter.palate: The apple now becomes fruity boiled sweets, and on into bubblegum, all sat on a cloud of smoke. Slightly chocolatey too.
Ancnoc Rutter.name: Ancnoc Rutter
Ancnoc Rutter.notes: lemon, apple, fruity, pineapple, spice, peat, smoky, smoke, nutty, nuttiness, oat, vanilla, leather
Ancnoc Rutter.nose: Yep, there's peat in there alright. Soon though, we're into lemon and nuttiness, then spice, Earl Gray tea, oat biscuits, and yes, pineapple chunks. Vanilla develops, as do green apple slices.
Ancnoc Rutter.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, nuts, cereal, vanilla, feint
Ancnoc Rutter.description: Distilled by Knockdhu in the Highlands, this is a peated anCnoc single malt Scotch whisky, one of the first from a new collection of peaty expressions made by the distillery. Peated to a level of 11.0 PPM (parts per million), the Rutter is the less peaty of the two first releases in the range. It is named after a type of spade used to size and separate peat blocks from one another.

Ardbeg Batch 6 (that Boutique Y Whisk.palate: Well rounded golden barley gives structure to the bold, peaty Ardbeg character we're all familiar with. Hints of orange, black pepper and fudge decorate the mid-palate.
Ardbeg Batch 6 (that Boutique Y Whisk.name: Ardbeg    Batch 6 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Ardbeg Batch 6 (that Boutique Y Whisk.notes: orange, pepper, peat, barley, toasted, creamy, vanilla
Ardbeg Batch 6 (that Boutique Y Whisk.nose: Creamy in its delivery of light vanilla and toasted barley, before making way for classic sticking plaster peat wafts. A little bit meaty, with oak-y elements coming through too.
Ardbeg Batch 6 (that Boutique Y Whisk.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, cereal, chocolate, vanilla
Ardbeg Batch 6 (that Boutique Y Whisk.description:
Whispered about in the halls in only hushed, excited voices, this is a much anticipated release - and it's here. The sixth batch of Ardbeg single malt Scotch whisky bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company. As ever, the label features famous collector Geert Bero reaching up to the Spirit Purifier, with our Peaty hiding away in the corner.

Batch 6 is a release of 58 bottles. 

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic novel-style labels.

Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.2 Merak Si.palate: Spiced up front, crushed black pepper and cinnamon joined by oily barley. It slowly turns sweet and juicy with a hint of citrus peels.
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.2 Merak Si.name: Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.2 Merak Single Malt Whisky
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.2 Merak Si.notes: oak, cherries, cherry, fruit, apple, citrus, pepper, cinnamon, smoke, barley, creamy, vanilla
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.2 Merak Si.nose: Candy apple and red fruit sweetness, followed by dark cherries, ginger and creamy vanilla. A drop of water unlocks some peaty smoke deep within.
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.2 Merak Si.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, cereal, chocolate, vanilla
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.2 Merak Si.description:
The second limited edition Swedish single malt whisky from the Spirit of Hven distillery, who plan to release five more whiskies in the Seven Stars series over the next five years. This expression is called Merak, named after one of the stars in Ursa Major constellation (AKA - the Big Dipper / AKA - the Plough). 

To create this single malt, Spirit of Hven used a mix of American, French and Spanish oak casks to mature their Organic certified spirit. Only 25 casks were blended together, after which it was bottled by hand with no chill-filtration and numbered.

"this is one which really commands attention. High quality stuff. Well done!"- Jim Murray (92.5 Points)

Talisker 10 Year Old.palate: Full bodied with huge plumes of smoke and volcanic, peppery peat. Intense.
Talisker 10 Year Old.name: Talisker 10 Year Old
Talisker 10 Year Old.notes: plum, apple, peppery, spice, peat, smoke, barley
Talisker 10 Year Old.nose: Thick, pungent smoke. Notes of kippers, seaweed, apple peels. Fresh and fragrant.
Talisker 10 Year Old.description: A classic Island dram from the Isle of Skye. Always highly rated, this was an Editor's Choice at Whisky Magazine. Lots of spice and fresh, tangy peat.

Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old 1997 Heavily Pe.palate: Big, peaty, lemony with pepper and almond oil.
Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old 1997 Heavily Pe.name: Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old 1997 Heavily Peated Casks 5342 & 5484   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old 1997 Heavily Pe.notes: pepper, spicy, peat, smoky, nutty, almond
Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old 1997 Heavily Pe.nose: Bourbon notes, but smoky with oily nutty notes, haddock chowder, almond, sweetness.
Bunnahabhain 12 Year Old 1997 Heavily Pe.description: This was distilled from heavily peated malt (unusual for a Bunnahabhain) on the 8th December 1997 and was aged for 12 years in hogsheads 5342 and 5484 before bottling on the 23rd June 2010 as part of a release of 551 bottles from Signatory's Cask Strength Collection.

Linkwood 20 Year Old 1991 The Octave (.palate: Thick and sherried, creamy notes of vanilla, peaches and peels. Stem ginger, candy floss and rye.
Linkwood 20 Year Old 1991 The Octave (.name: Linkwood 20 Year Old 1991   The Octave (duncan Taylor)
Linkwood 20 Year Old 1991 The Octave (.notes: orange, peach, spicy, spices, creamy, vanilla, coffee, honey
Linkwood 20 Year Old 1991 The Octave (.nose: Buttery and rich with spicy notes of pecan pie, maple syrup and coffee beans. A big slab of malt, a touch of sherry and orange peel.
Linkwood 20 Year Old 1991 The Octave (.note categories: fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Linkwood 20 Year Old 1991 The Octave (.description: A fine 20 year old Linkwood distilled in 1991 and bottled for Duncan Taylor's Octave range (which involved finishing the whisky in smaller "octave" casks for added excitement.

English Whisky Co. Chapter 11.palate: Good body, with very smoky malt, as well as Latakia pipe tobacco, peat, vanilla and ginger and aniseed. Big and powerful, some chili heat late palate.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 11.name: English Whisky Co. Chapter 11
English Whisky Co. Chapter 11.notes: wood, fruit, lemon, zest, chili, spicy, peat, smoky, vanilla, custard
English Whisky Co. Chapter 11.nose: Smoky and rich, with notes of spare ribs, liquorice and soft fruit. A touch of lemon zest, notes of custard and charcoal.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 11.description: The first ever heavily peated whisky from the English Whisky Company - the only distillery in England, based in the town of Norfolk.
