English Whisky Co. Chapter 14.palate: Crispy burnt sugar from the top of a crème brulee and soft fruits.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 14.name: English Whisky Co. Chapter 14
English Whisky Co. Chapter 14.nose: Fresh, flaky pastries, subtle oranges and dried fruits.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 14.description: Chapter 14 of English Whisky is a 5 year old unpeated single malt, distilled by St George's Distillery in Norfolk. Using whisky from four consecutive bourbon barrels (582 - 585), this limited edition, proudly English whisky is rather nice indeed.

Bunnahabhain 34 Year Old 1973 (jim Mcewa.palate: Very soft in terms of peat smoke. This has a heat though, like glowing embers, but only faint hints of smoke. Notes of Cognac rancio, perhaps a hint of two of porcini mushrooms, citrus, marmalade, almond.
Bunnahabhain 34 Year Old 1973 (jim Mcewa.name: Bunnahabhain 34 Year Old 1973 (jim Mcewan's Celtic Heartlands)
Bunnahabhain 34 Year Old 1973 (jim Mcewa.notes: citrus, fruit, spicy, peat, smoke, almond
Bunnahabhain 34 Year Old 1973 (jim Mcewa.nose: Incredibly rum-like aroma with notes of dark sugar. Then there are all sorts of cooked fruits, a bit like a rhubarb crumble, but with a really mature spicy edge. Then hints of over-ripe orchard fruits and their blossom.
Bunnahabhain 34 Year Old 1973 (jim Mcewa.description: A 34 year old Bunnahabhain selected by Jim McEwan (Master Distiller at Bruichladdich). The Celtic Heartlands range exhibits Jim's incredible originality when it comes to Scotch whisky, and this 1973 vintage (a release of 669 decanters, matured in refill sherry) is true testament to this.

The Naked Grouse.palate: Sherried and thick with notes of sultanas, sticky toffee pudding, raspberry jam, Victoria sponge, custard and crème caramel.
The Naked Grouse.name: The Naked Grouse
The Naked Grouse.notes: oak, cherry, peach, smoke, toffee, caramel, custard, cocoa
The Naked Grouse.nose: Smooth and oily with notes of cherry compote, buttered granary toast, malt, custard and peach.
The Naked Grouse.description: An interesting addition to the Famous Grouse range, this was aged in first fill sherry casks, and is based around malt whisky from Highland Park and Macallan. Packaged very simply, this is a superb value-for-money blend.

The Glendronach 14 Year Old Virgin Oak.palate: Banana, melon and coconut, tropical flavours layered over a spicy floor.
The Glendronach 14 Year Old Virgin Oak.name: The Glendronach 14 Year Old   Virgin Oak Finish
The Glendronach 14 Year Old Virgin Oak.notes: oak, fruit, cloves, spicy, cinnamon, cardamon, spice, toasted, coffee, roasted
The Glendronach 14 Year Old Virgin Oak.nose: Spicy; cardamon and cloves - then there is roasted coffee beans and toasted oak coming though with coconut husk.
The Glendronach 14 Year Old Virgin Oak.description: Glendronach finished in American virgin oak casks.

darkness benrinnes 15 year old pedro xim.palate: Big, sticky dried fruits, wedding cake with a little marzipan, unsweetened liquorice and bitter marmalade.
darkness benrinnes 15 year old pedro xim.name: darkness benrinnes 15 year old pedro ximenez cask finish whisky
darkness benrinnes 15 year old pedro xim.notes: oak, cherries, cherry, fruit, raisin, clove, spices, nut, marzipan, bread, creamy, toffee
darkness benrinnes 15 year old pedro xim.nose: Rich, deep oak alongside jammy fruit, greengages and nut oil. Soon you're into crème brûlée, prunes, Corinth raisins and hints of anise, sticky toffee pudding and bread dough.
darkness benrinnes 15 year old pedro xim.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla
darkness benrinnes 15 year old pedro xim.description: As Edward Teller probably once said, "When you come to the end of all the light you know, it's time to take the step into Darkness!". This intense Benrinnes was finished in fresh, first-fill Pedro Ximénez casks that were specially rebuilt to be just one tenth of the size of a standard butt for 3 months. The greatly increased surface area to volume ratio of these casks helped develop even greater richness and concentration in this magnificent Speyside nectar.

Longrow Peated.palate: Light and sweet with notes of green grapes and rhubarb, a great contrast to the nose. Then comes a big blast of smoke.
Longrow Peated.name: Longrow Peated
Longrow Peated.nose: Salt and a leathery smokiness come to the fore in a maritime combination, like a Harbourmaster's Jacket.
Longrow Peated.description: This is essentially the awesome Longrow C.V. bottling in new packaging, we're very glad it still features in the re-vamped range! Great value and great tasting!

Clynelish 15 Year Old 1997 (cask 6470) (.palate: Briny, slightly smoky palate with linseed oil and fresh peels. A touch of vanilla develops.
Clynelish 15 Year Old 1997 (cask 6470) (.name: Clynelish 15 Year Old 1997 (cask 6470) (berry Bros. & Rudd)
Clynelish 15 Year Old 1997 (cask 6470) (.notes: berry, spice, smoky, butter, vanilla, toffee, honey, salt
Clynelish 15 Year Old 1997 (cask 6470) (.nose: Apricots and beeswax, hints of manuka honey and salt butter. Just a touch of sea air.
Clynelish 15 Year Old 1997 (cask 6470) (.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, feint, mineral
Clynelish 15 Year Old 1997 (cask 6470) (.description: This is a delicious 1997 vintage Clynelish from noted London wine merchants Berry Brothers and Rudd. It was distilled in the Highlands and aged in a single cask (number 6470) for 15 years before bottling in 2012.

Glenfiddich 12 Year Old Toasted Oak Limi.name: Glenfiddich 12 Year Old Toasted Oak Limited Edition
Glenfiddich 12 Year Old Toasted Oak Limi.notes: oak, citrus, fruit, spices, floral, honey
Glenfiddich 12 Year Old Toasted Oak Limi.nose: Grain. Slightly floral, mineralic. Spirity, orchard fruit, malty, honey. Citrus develops.
Glenfiddich 12 Year Old Toasted Oak Limi.description: This special limited edition from Glenfiddich was matured in specially charred 195 litre bourbon barrels. This has added a lovely flavour to the 12 year old whisky.

Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Chil.palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass and a good hit of malt.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Chil.name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label   Porsche Chiller
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Chil.notes: oak, cedar, citrus, plum, fruit, berry, spice, smoke, chocolate, toffee, floral, honey
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Chil.nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice and citrus.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Chil.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, feint
Johnnie Walker Blue Label Porsche Chil.description: Made by a collaboration between Johnnie Walker and The Porsche Design Studio, this stunningly packaged bottle of Blue Label comes in a superb metal box which can be taken apart to form a bottle holder and an ice bucket. Very smart.

Glenrothes 19 Year Old 1990 Mission (m.palate: Rich and thick. A creamy note of dessert wine, with beautiful vanilla tones, stewed fruit, nutmeg, malt and creme caramel.
Glenrothes 19 Year Old 1990 Mission (m.name: Glenrothes 19 Year Old 1990   Mission (murray Mcdavid)
Glenrothes 19 Year Old 1990 Mission (m.notes: fruit, spices, nutmeg, cinnamon, creamy, vanilla, caramel, toffee, honey
Glenrothes 19 Year Old 1990 Mission (m.nose: Sweet, rich notes of gooey toffee, honey and cinnamon on the nose. Some overripe grapes, buttery toffee popcorn and cooked apples.
Glenrothes 19 Year Old 1990 Mission (m.description: A very special bottling from Murray McDavid. They took bourbon cask-aged Glenrothes, distilled in 1990, and brought it over to the Bruichladdich distillery, where it was reracked into Jurancon sweet wine casks. It was bottled in 2009, and there are just 525 bottles of this, at natural cask strength.

Ardbeg 1978.palate: Beautifully balanced herbal notes. Coffee beans. Cut hay, full-bodied. Woody.
Ardbeg 1978.name: Ardbeg 1978
Ardbeg 1978.notes: oak, wood, cedar, woody, spicy, spice, peat, smoke, vanilla, herbal, hay, coffee, espresso
Ardbeg 1978.nose: Full, slightly herbal. Notes of brine and peat smoke, espresso beans, fresh lime and cedar wood. Vanilla spice and a little toasty oak.
Ardbeg 1978.note categories: wood, spice, earth, vanilla, flowers, coffee
Ardbeg 1978.description: A rather rare release from Ardbeg, this 1978 vintage represents single malt from the prodigious Ileach distillery at its most balanced and poised. Superb.

Bruichladdich Waves.palate: Medium body, balanced. Dried seaweed, sweet barley, toffee, vanilla, honey freshly sliced oranges, fruit salad, a touch of smoke - a lot going on!
Bruichladdich Waves.name: Bruichladdich Waves
Bruichladdich Waves.notes: fruit, fruity, spice, smoke, barley, vanilla, toffee, floral, honey
Bruichladdich Waves.nose: Light, fresh. Perfumed, stemmy, floral. Dry grass, apples, slightly coastal.
Bruichladdich Waves.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, cereal, vanilla, flowers, feint
Bruichladdich Waves.description: A 2008 release from the Bruichladdich distillery and a light single malt. The name Waves suggests the notes of crisp, fresh fruits and a touch of light spice with a touch of typical 'Laddie coastal tones.

Penderyn With Two Tasting Glasses.palate: Thick and sweet, spices, green, biscuity. Custard.
Penderyn With Two Tasting Glasses.name: Penderyn With Two Tasting Glasses
Penderyn With Two Tasting Glasses.nose: Sweet, medium body. Herbal, vanilla, sweetness, resin, sultanas, toast. Over-ripe grape.
Penderyn With Two Tasting Glasses.description: A half bottle of Welsh single malt, matured in bourbon barrels and finished in Madeira casks. This comes with two Penderyn branded tasting glasses, made by Glencairn.

Edradour 13 Year Old 1997 Moscatel Cask.palate: Jammy with a slice of custard tart – this is just like dessert; buttery, biscuity as well, with the strawberry jam developing massively into the late palate.
Edradour 13 Year Old 1997 Moscatel Cask.name: Edradour 13 Year Old 1997 Moscatel Cask Finish   Straight From The Cask
Edradour 13 Year Old 1997 Moscatel Cask.nose: Very jammy – strawberry jam in particular, and in a big way. Think jam on warm spongecake; loads of syrupy sweetness. Has a pleasing musty edge to it, and it develops into wild strawberries.
Edradour 13 Year Old 1997 Moscatel Cask.description: Distilled on the 19th November 1997 and initially matured in a hogshead before reracking into a Moscatel sherry hogshead on the 2nd May 2007. A delicious whisky with berry fruit jam notes...

Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1978 14th Relea.palate: Nutty and full with rich peat and wood smoke. More of that chamois but it's always in support here, never the main event. Complex with some great European oak influence manifesting as dark jam and cocoa.
Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1978 14th Relea.name: Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1978   14th Release (2014 Special Release)
Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1978 14th Relea.notes: wood, oak, allspice, peat, smoky, smoke, nutty, nuttiness, cream, cocoa, leather
Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1978 14th Relea.nose: There's still a 'green' edge, like last year, with mossy peat alongside cream, but there's plenty different to enjoy here, especially a rich nuttiness and even a touch of jam. Time and/or water brought forth that familiar chamois leather and some coastal salinity.
Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1978 14th Relea.note categories: wood, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, coffee, feint
Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1978 14th Relea.description:
Strictly 1 Per Customer

Part of the 2014 Diageo Special Releases, this 35 year old Port Ellen single malt Scotch whisky was matured in a combination of refill American oak and European oak casks. A regular of the Special Releases, the whisky from the closed Port Ellen distillery on Islay is highly sought after and very rare indeed. 2,964 bottles were produced (and don't expect them to stick around for long).

Highland Journey Blended Malt Scotch Whi.palate: Surprisingly sweet at first, with a big slice of lemon drizzle cake up front. It then swiftly develops bold, spicy notes of cinnamon and cracked black pepper.
Highland Journey Blended Malt Scotch Whi.name: Highland Journey Blended Malt Scotch Whisky
Highland Journey Blended Malt Scotch Whi.notes: oak, lemon, apple, pepper, spicy, cinnamon, almond, barley, bread, vanilla, floral, honey
Highland Journey Blended Malt Scotch Whi.nose: Freshly baked brown bread, vanilla fudge, floral heather and red apple skin.
Highland Journey Blended Malt Scotch Whi.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, vanilla, flowers, feint
Highland Journey Blended Malt Scotch Whi.description: Highland Journey is a blended malt Scotch whisky from Hunter Laing, the company started by Stewart Laing after he and his brother Fred Laing went their separate ways in 2013. This bold blended malt is made with whiskies from a selection of Highland distilleries, which have been matured in both American oak and Spanish Sherry casks.

Glen Keith 16 Year Old 1995 (cask 171185.palate: Rich and oily, sweet vanilla custard, ripe plums, aniseed balls and a hint of turmeric. Very malty with citrus and spices.
Glen Keith 16 Year Old 1995 (cask 171185.name: Glen Keith 16 Year Old 1995 (cask 171185)   Un Chillfiltered (signatory)
Glen Keith 16 Year Old 1995 (cask 171185.notes: oak, citrus, plum, spices, vanilla, toffee, custard, hay
Glen Keith 16 Year Old 1995 (cask 171185.nose: Hay, dry grass, vanilla, menthol and oak. Fascinating and intense. Some herbs, bergamot and sage.
Glen Keith 16 Year Old 1995 (cask 171185.description: This Glen Keith was distilled in August 1995, and it was aged in a pair of hogsheads before bottling by Signatory in 2012.

Glenfarclas 105.palate: Silken, spicy and peppery oak. Almond, praline, hazelnut, dried peels, fruity. Touch of Armagnac, hint of rancio perhaps?
Glenfarclas 105.name: Glenfarclas 105
Glenfarclas 105.notes: oak, fruity, peppery, spicy, smoky, nutty, praline, almond, hazelnut, creamy, coffee, honey
Glenfarclas 105.nose: Great depth, sherry. Creamy and nutty. Honey on toast, touch of smoky coffee.
Glenfarclas 105.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, coffee, feint
Glenfarclas 105.description: Glenfarclas 105 is a superb cask strength whisky, really bold and punchy. In 2004, the Malt Maniacs rated this the best “Bang for your buck” whisky.

New Zealand 22 Year Old 1989.palate: Allspice and toffee apples. Thick malt. Becomes very spicy and oaky.
New Zealand 22 Year Old 1989.name: New Zealand 22 Year Old 1989
New Zealand 22 Year Old 1989.nose: Rich spices and digestive biscuits. Hints of banana loaf.
New Zealand 22 Year Old 1989.description: This is a rich, cask-strength whisky from Willowbank - a now-silent distillery on New Zealand's South Island. This was distilled in 1989 before a 22 year maturation in a single cask (number 58).

Strathmill 24 Year Old 1986 (adelphi).palate: Fruity and spiced with notes of star anise, red berry fruits, toffee and malt. There are hints of bitter oak, banana skins, turmeric and some green tea too.
Strathmill 24 Year Old 1986 (adelphi).name: Strathmill 24 Year Old 1986 (adelphi)
Strathmill 24 Year Old 1986 (adelphi).notes: oak, fruit, fruity, berry, toffee, honey
Strathmill 24 Year Old 1986 (adelphi).nose: Perfumed and fruity. Notes of figs, dates and sticky toffee pudding, hints of honey, herbs and even a tinge of lavender. Very interesting.
Strathmill 24 Year Old 1986 (adelphi).description: Distilled at Strathmill in 1986, this beautiful whisky was aged for 24 years in cask 10222 before bottling by Adelphi in 2011. This had an out-turn of 168 bottles, all at natural cask strength.

Macallan 18 Year Old The Gulf Buccanee.palate: Rich, spicy and warming with raisins, honey and dates. A little touch of sherry, buttery oak and coffee.
Macallan 18 Year Old The Gulf Buccanee.name: Macallan 18 Year Old   The Gulf Buccaneer
Macallan 18 Year Old The Gulf Buccanee.notes: wood, oak, raisin, pepper, spicy, smoke, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee, coffee, honey
Macallan 18 Year Old The Gulf Buccanee.nose: Malty with hints of sherried peels, vanilla, butterscotch and just a hint of smoke. Sticky and mouth-watering.
Macallan 18 Year Old The Gulf Buccanee.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, vanilla, coffee, feint
Macallan 18 Year Old The Gulf Buccanee.description: A superb cult whisky from Squadron Malts, featuring a cartoon of Saddam Hussein, and commemorating the Buccaneers in the Gulf. The whisky itself is an 18 year old, single cask Macallan, and there are just 96 numbered bottles!

Muckle Flugga Blended Malt.palate: Lovely interplay between oak and barley. Those sherry casks make themselves known subtly and delicately with a touch of dried peels and soft spices.
Muckle Flugga Blended Malt.name: Muckle Flugga Blended Malt
Muckle Flugga Blended Malt.notes: oak, fruity, spices, barley, herbal, honey
Muckle Flugga Blended Malt.nose: Hints of fruity honey and a little sherry on the nose. Toasty and faintly herbal.
Muckle Flugga Blended Malt.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, flowers, feint
Muckle Flugga Blended Malt.description: A truly fascinating whisky, Muckle Flugga is made by blending together six single malts which are then shipped to Unst, near the Muckle Flugga lighthouse (which was built by Robert Louis Stevenson's father in 1854) in the Shetlands. The whisky spends a year on the island, surviving the harsh seasons before being returned to the mainland for bottling.

Dalwhinnie 15 Year Old.palate: Malty. Walnuts steeped in manuka honey with vanilla sponge. Gentle smoke weaves its way through the cereal with a touch of spice.
Dalwhinnie 15 Year Old.name: Dalwhinnie 15 Year Old
Dalwhinnie 15 Year Old.notes: fruit, apple, spice, smoke, almond, walnut, vanilla, toffee, custard, floral, honey
Dalwhinnie 15 Year Old.nose: Aromatic, toffee, fruit salad, lush nectarine, custard. Floral, apple blossom, honeysuckle. Apple peels, pear, touch of smoke.
Dalwhinnie 15 Year Old.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, nuts, vanilla, flowers, feint
Dalwhinnie 15 Year Old.description: A great malt which Jim Murray awarded 95 points in his Whisky Bible, this is excellent value for money. The flavours are simple, but flawless, a clean, crisp 15 year old from the Dalwhinnie distillery, also part of Diageo's Classic Malts range.

The Hive 12 Year Old (wemyss Malts).palate: Creamy and supple, a lot of honey, dried apricot, manuka honey too in fact, granary toast, melted butter, toffee and sweet cinnamon.
The Hive 12 Year Old (wemyss Malts).name: The Hive 12 Year Old (wemyss Malts)
The Hive 12 Year Old (wemyss Malts).notes: nutmeg, cinnamon, allspice, smoke, butter, creamy, vanilla, toffee, honey
The Hive 12 Year Old (wemyss Malts).distillery: Wemyss Malts Branded Whisky And Gin
The Hive 12 Year Old (wemyss Malts).nose: Honeyed and malty, notes of sweet, creamy vanilla, dates, fudge, cooked apples, beeswax and a tinge of soft smoke.
The Hive 12 Year Old (wemyss Malts).description: The Hive is a delicious 12 year old blended malt whisky from Wemyss Malts, with a strong emphasis on honeyed, malty Speyside Scotch. Very tasty, this was awarded 93 points by Jim Murray in his 2012 Whisky Bible.

Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1977 Old And Ra.palate: Rich, salt caramel-led palate with big, fresh slabs of peat to the fore. Very citrus-rich, with a touch of mahogany, maple syrup and smouldering malt.
Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1977 Old And Ra.name: Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1977   Old And Rare Platinum (douglas Laing)
Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1977 Old And Ra.notes: citrus, lemon, zest, pepper, spice, peat, smoky, barley, leather, salt
Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1977 Old And Ra.nose: Rich notes of overripe grape and a little calves leather. Barley malt, hints of light citrus and intense spice.
Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1977 Old And Ra.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, cereal, feint, mineral
Port Ellen 35 Year Old 1977 Old And Ra.description: This is a fabulous old Port Ellen from Douglas Laing's stellar Old and Rare Platinum Selection. It was distilled in August 1977, some six years before the distillery shut its doors for good, and the whisky was aged in a single refill hogshead. It was bottled at natural cask strength in November 2012, and there are just 199 bottles available.

Mortlach Royal Wedding (gordon And Macph.palate: The palate  opens into a spectrum of spice, mulled wine and fruit cake before lower notes of coffee and nuts arrive.
Mortlach Royal Wedding (gordon And Macph.name: Mortlach Royal Wedding (gordon And Macphail)
Mortlach Royal Wedding (gordon And Macph.notes: fruit, spice, nut, nuts, chocolate, coffee, espresso, roasted
Mortlach Royal Wedding (gordon And Macph.nose: Plain chocolate, roasted coffee beans and Christmas cake.
Mortlach Royal Wedding (gordon And Macph.description: A special whisky from Mortlach, made up of spirit distilled in 1959 and 1960 to mark the royal wedding of Prince Andrew and Sarah Ferguson.

The Macallan Gold 1824 Series.palate: Citrus and boiled sweets rule the palate, along with hints of ginger and cinnamon, while soft oak tones reveal toasted apples.
The Macallan Gold 1824 Series.name: The Macallan Gold   1824 Series
The Macallan Gold 1824 Series.notes: oak, orange, citrus, lemon, zest, cinnamon, toasted, chocolate, vanilla, floral
The Macallan Gold 1824 Series.nose: This burnished gold spirit presents a lemon citrus nose, the orange peel and an interlacing sweetness that softens but doesn't eliminate the zest. A quiet note of vanilla is followed by dark chocolate - more assertive, yet not overly so - with a lingering floral and light oak notes.
The Macallan Gold 1824 Series.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, flowers
The Macallan Gold 1824 Series.description: This is the new no-age-statement Single Malt Scotch Whisky from the famous Speyside distillery of Macallan. Macallan's new range has done away with age-statements and instead focuses on the colour of the whisky. The concept being that the older the whisky is the darker it will be... Regardless of how true this really is, it's certainly a great whisky packed with assertive vanilla and citrus flavours.

Glen Ord 8 Year Old 2004 Provenance (d.palate: Light and fresh palate. Very sweet and creamy, with candied peels and orange zest.
Glen Ord 8 Year Old 2004 Provenance (d.name: Glen Ord 8 Year Old 2004   Provenance (douglas Laing)
Glen Ord 8 Year Old 2004 Provenance (d.notes: orange, fruity, zest, apple, butter, creamy, salt
Glen Ord 8 Year Old 2004 Provenance (d.nose: Fresh and fruity nose - apple peels, hints of Danish pastry and salted butter.
Glen Ord 8 Year Old 2004 Provenance (d.description: A light, fresh-tasting Glen Ord from Douglas Laing's Provenance range (a fabulous range which showcases the effects of season on whisky production), this was distilled in Autumn 2004 before an 8 year maturation in a single refill hogshead.

Balblair 2002 1st Release.palate: Victoria sponge without the jam, vanilla custard and a hint of wood-spice.
Balblair 2002 1st Release.name: Balblair 2002   1st Release
Balblair 2002 1st Release.nose: Sponge cake, vanilla, a lawn mown in the summer, icing sugar.
Balblair 2002 1st Release.description: Balblair bucked convention a few years ago by removing age statements from their whiskies and replaced them with vintages. The 2002 is replacing the 2001 as the entry level offering and offers delicious notes of sponge cake.

Cameron Brig.palate: Caramel, mixed peels, a touch of sherry, sultanas.
Cameron Brig.name: Cameron Brig
Cameron Brig.description: This single grain whisky was distilled at the Cameronbridge distillery in fife. A very light, gentle whisky.

Islay Mist Deluxe.name: Islay Mist Deluxe
Islay Mist Deluxe.notes: oak, peat, barley, creamy, creaminess, herbal
Islay Mist Deluxe.nose: Sweet, soft fudge, and all the inherent creaminess, slightly herbal.
Islay Mist Deluxe.description: The Islay Mist blend was first launched in the 1920s. Known for its good peating level which comes from malts like Laphroaig.

Brora 25 Year Old.palate: Very fruity, full, apple peels, pear, oily, nutty. Lemon grass, fennel, seaweed.
Brora 25 Year Old.name: Brora 25 Year Old
Brora 25 Year Old.notes: oak, lemon, fruity, apple, spice, smoky, smoke, nutty, almond, hazelnut, hay
Brora 25 Year Old.nose: Refined, dry grass, leafy. Truffle oil, almonds and hazelnuts. Winter spice, delicate smoke.
Brora 25 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, flowers
Brora 25 Year Old.description: A rare 25 year old release from the Brora distillery; less than 3,000 bottles were filled. This single malt was matured in American and European oak and exudes nutty, winter spice notes.

Kilchoman Sherry Cask Release.palate: An initial malty sweetness is followed by soft peaty, wood smoke aromas, mixed fruits and spice - cloves, nutmeg raisins and prunes.
Kilchoman Sherry Cask Release.name: Kilchoman Sherry Cask Release
Kilchoman Sherry Cask Release.notes: wood, fruit, raisin, cloves, nutmeg, spice, smoky, smoke
Kilchoman Sherry Cask Release.nose: Soft peaty aromas and a blend of soft fruits and spice.
Kilchoman Sherry Cask Release.description: This is the first sherry matured whisky from Kilchoman, and despite being a mere five years of age it's a very characterful dram from an Islay distillery that's producing some wonderful whisky.

Laphroaig 19 Year Old 1990 Cask 89 Cas.palate: Salinity and medicinal character dominate the palate, allowing only traces of that citrus to show through. Big gusts of smoke (from a smokehouse; meaty and intense), sweetness, like sweet-cured bacon.
Laphroaig 19 Year Old 1990 Cask 89 Cas.name: Laphroaig 19 Year Old 1990 Cask 89   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Laphroaig 19 Year Old 1990 Cask 89 Cas.nose: Iodine, kelp and sea spray. Sticking plasters, Deep Heat, hints of toffee sweetness, fishmonger notes, oily and tangy with hints of citrus. Very interesting indeed!
Laphroaig 19 Year Old 1990 Cask 89 Cas.description: This 19 year old, single cask Laphroaig was distilled on the 22nd October 1990 and aged in bourbon barrel number 89 before bottling on the 21st June 2010. A release of 246 decanters.

Reference Series I.palate: Barley and champagne, heading into bread and butter pudding territory. Dry Sherry too and some late sweetness.
Reference Series I.name: Reference Series I
Reference Series I.notes: citrus, apple, oat, barley, bread, butter, caramel, custard, herbal, honey
Reference Series I.nose: Perfumed malt, fresh citrus hints, menthol, custard and meatiness. Oats, thyme honey, Jelly Tots and apple juice.
Reference Series I.note categories: fruits, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, feint
Reference Series I.description:
What's all this awesomeness then? Why, it's is the first bottling from a new, delicious and educational brand of blended malts! As you move through the series from I, to II, to III, the proportion of older, exciting and super yummy whisky goes up, with all three releases being made up of the same whiskies, just in different quantities. Reference Series I has a core of youthful, clean blended malt and is top dressed with an older, more complex blended malt as well as a pair of incredible, well-aged single malts.

Extensions (I.1, I.2 etc.) then showcase different additional ingredients and techniques, a Sherry cask finish, or the addition of caramel, for example. This will allow you to refer back to the original 'control' whisky and appreciate exactly how these specific changes translate in your glass.

Read more about the Reference Series here on our blog.

Balblair 2003 1st Release.palate: Oranges and lemons, fresh and fruity. More honey? Yes indeed!
Balblair 2003 1st Release.name: Balblair 2003   1st Release
Balblair 2003 1st Release.notes: citrus, lemon, fruity, spicy, flowers, honey
Balblair 2003 1st Release.nose: Bright aromas of delicate flowers, light citrus blossom and a trickle of honey.
Balblair 2003 1st Release.description: A 2003 vintage single malt Scotch whisky from the Balblair distillery. They were matured in second fill bourbon casks until 2013 when the whisky was popped in Balblair's stylish bottles.

Hazelburn 10 Year Old.palate: Good mouth feel paired with bright notes of vanilla and Crunchie bars. More lively fruit notes underneath.
Hazelburn 10 Year Old.name: Hazelburn 10 Year Old
Hazelburn 10 Year Old.nose: Toffee apples, fresh honey and fragrant pears. Hints of vanilla.
Hazelburn 10 Year Old.description:
Part of the Hazelburn core range, this is a 10 year old bottling of Hazelburn single malt Scotch whisky from the Springbank distillery in the Campbeltown region. It is triple distilled, matured in bourbon casks and bottled at 46% ABV.

Hazelburn is one of three styles of whisky produced at Springbank, known for being triple distilled and unpeated, whereas Springbank single malt is distilled two-and-a-half times and is lightly peated, and Longrow single malt is twice distilled and heavily peated.

Ardbeg 10 Year Old Escape Pack With 2 \".palate: Sweet vanilla counterbalanced with lemon and lime followed by that surging Ardbeg smoke that we all know and love.
Ardbeg 10 Year Old Escape Pack With 2 \".name: Ardbeg 10 Year Old Escape Pack With 2 "shortie" Glasses
Ardbeg 10 Year Old Escape Pack With 2 \".notes: citrus, fruit, lemon, peat, smoke, vanilla, caramel, salt, lead
Ardbeg 10 Year Old Escape Pack With 2 \".nose: A ridge of vanilla leads to mountain of peat capped with citrus fruits and circled by clouds of sea spray.
Ardbeg 10 Year Old Escape Pack With 2 \".description: An awesome gift box from Ardbeg, featuring a 70cl bottle of their classic 10 year old expression, along with two "shortie" tasting glasses. No, they don't have a picture of Ardbeg's cheerful dog, Shortie, on them - they're just a little bit little. The gift box itself looks like it's struggling to contain all of the peaty Ardbeg goodness, or as if it was actually a finely rendered carbonite sculpture.

The Irishman Founder's Reserve.palate: Plenty rich with a glorious mouth-feel. More ripe fruits, paired with vanilla and cinnamon.
The Irishman Founder's Reserve.name: The Irishman Founder's Reserve
The Irishman Founder's Reserve.notes: fruit, peach, pepper, spicy, cinnamon, cream, vanilla
The Irishman Founder's Reserve.distillery: Walsh Whiskey Distillery Co Whiskeys And Liqueurs
The Irishman Founder's Reserve.nose: Peach Campino sweeties (they also made the strawberries and cream sweets), apples and a soft, spicy hint of white pepper.
The Irishman Founder's Reserve.description: A fabulous Irish blend of 70% single malt whiskey and 30% single pot still whiskey. After being triple distilled, the Irishman Founder's Reserve is aged in bourbon casks. Bernard Walsh, you should be proud!

Bunnahabhain Feis Ile 2013 Sgeul Na Ma.palate: Big and mouth coating with spicy, sherried pecans and salted peanuts.
Bunnahabhain Feis Ile 2013 Sgeul Na Ma.name: Bunnahabhain Feis Ile 2013   Sgeul Na Mara
Bunnahabhain Feis Ile 2013 Sgeul Na Ma.notes: orange, spicy, peanut, marzipan, chocolate, salt, saltiness
Bunnahabhain Feis Ile 2013 Sgeul Na Ma.nose: Christmas cake, marzipan, chocolate orange and a touch of sea air.
Bunnahabhain Feis Ile 2013 Sgeul Na Ma.description:
STRICTLY ONE PER CUSTOMER

Bunnahabhain's Fèis Ìle festival release is a delightfully sherried whisky bottled at 60.1% abv on 19th March 2013. Only 606 bottles were released, each hand signed by Distillery Manager Andrew Brown and Master Distiller Ian MacMillan. Sgeul Na Mara is Gaelic for 'Tales of the Sea'.

Craigellachie 2000 (berry Bros. & Rudd).palate: Well rounded and rich, with notes of malt and peach, a little toffee apple and gingernut biscuit.
Craigellachie 2000 (berry Bros. & Rudd).name: Craigellachie 2000 (berry Bros. & Rudd)
Craigellachie 2000 (berry Bros. & Rudd).notes: apple, peach, berry, smoke, hazelnut, barley, creamy, toffee
Craigellachie 2000 (berry Bros. & Rudd).nose: Hints of smoke atop a superbly biscuity, rich malt the likes of which are unique to Speyside whiskies of this age. Intense and quite sweet and creamy, with dried apricots developing.
Craigellachie 2000 (berry Bros. & Rudd).note categories: fruits, earth, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla
Craigellachie 2000 (berry Bros. & Rudd).description: This was distilled at Craigellachie in 2000 and it was bottled in 2011 by Berry Brothers and Rudd. Incredibly malty and biscuity!

Yoichi 10 Year Old Gift Pack With 2 Glas.palate: Oily and sweet, with peat smoke following swiftly afterwards. Light oak and developing fruit notes beneath.
Yoichi 10 Year Old Gift Pack With 2 Glas.name: Yoichi 10 Year Old Gift Pack With 2 Glasses
Yoichi 10 Year Old Gift Pack With 2 Glas.notes: oak, fruit, peach, nutmeg, spice, peat, smoke, vanilla, custard, floral
Yoichi 10 Year Old Gift Pack With 2 Glas.nose: Plenty of fruit notes - peach stands out in particular, ripe, vibrant and subtly floral. Then there's rich vanilla custard, peat smoke and a hint of nutmeg spice.
Yoichi 10 Year Old Gift Pack With 2 Glas.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, vanilla, flowers
Yoichi 10 Year Old Gift Pack With 2 Glas.description: A very well known and well loved Japanese single malt, the Yoichi 10 Year Old is a total classic. Plenty of fruit, plenty of vanilla and a deft touch of peat smoke running through it - marvellous stuff. This stylish gift pack comes with a 70cl bottle of Yoichi 10 Year Old and 2 branded tasting glasses.

The Glenlivet 12 Year Old (old Edition).palate: Thick and warm on the tongue with aniseed, dried peels and fudge. Very creamy, stewed apples develop.
The Glenlivet 12 Year Old (old Edition).name: The Glenlivet 12 Year Old (old Edition)
The Glenlivet 12 Year Old (old Edition).notes: oak, fruit, creamy, cream, vanilla, toffee, honey
The Glenlivet 12 Year Old (old Edition).nose: A full, rich nose with cream vanilla, warm pastry, toffee, fudge and a hint of aniseed. Toasty cereals and oak develop.
The Glenlivet 12 Year Old (old Edition).description:
This is an old edition of the lovely Glenlivet 12 year old. Aged in a mix of casks, this is a classic Speyside dram with oodles of honey and orchard fruit. Beautiful.

This is a rare, auction item and so there may be some light rusting to the inside of the tube.

Smooth Ambler Old Scout 10 Year Old Bour.palate: Light caramels and wood spices with an enjoyable interplay between rye and corn.
Smooth Ambler Old Scout 10 Year Old Bour.name: Smooth Ambler Old Scout 10 Year Old Bourbon
Smooth Ambler Old Scout 10 Year Old Bour.notes: wood, spiciness, spicy, spices, creamy, caramel
Smooth Ambler Old Scout 10 Year Old Bour.nose: Familiar cane sugar notes from the 7 year, but this is a touch more laid back and creamier on the nose.
Smooth Ambler Old Scout 10 Year Old Bour.description:
Part of the Old Scout range from Smooth Ambler, this 10 year old bourbon is rye-rich, well-aged and an absolute treat for long, sunny evenings. Bottled at 50% ABV, you can bet your bottom dollar this little beauty will be something to savour. 

The Smooth Ambler craft distillery in West Virginia is busy leaving their barrels of whiskey alone to mature. During this time, they have scouted out whiskey they admire and created a curated selection, dubbed Old Scout.

"one of the softest deliveries at this strength I have encountered for a good while... A spicy buzz rumbles and forms the backdrop to the slowest possible fade of the delivery; one of the most delicate and sophisticated bourbons of the year"- Jim Murray (95.5 Points)

Nikka Taketsuru 17 Year Old.palate: Spicy and rounded with vanilla, blood orange and a little chocolate.
Nikka Taketsuru 17 Year Old.name: Nikka Taketsuru 17 Year Old
Nikka Taketsuru 17 Year Old.notes: wood, oak, orange, fruit, fruity, berry, spicy, chocolate, vanilla, cocoa, honey
Nikka Taketsuru 17 Year Old.nose: Fresh and fruity with fruit salad, berries, sultanas and some other dried fruit, vanilla, fragrant wood and honey.
Nikka Taketsuru 17 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Nikka Taketsuru 17 Year Old.description: This is a great 17 year old blended malt named for Nikka's founder, the whisky-pilgrim Masataka Taketsuru.

Killyloch 36 Year Old 1967.palate: Medium. Crisp barley. Toasted oak. Spice.
Killyloch 36 Year Old 1967.name: Killyloch 36 Year Old 1967
Killyloch 36 Year Old 1967.notes: oak, citrus, lemon, peppery, spices, spice, barley, toasted
Killyloch 36 Year Old 1967.nose: Medium. Tangy citrus. Lemon marmalade. Pink grapefruit, verbena freshness.
Killyloch 36 Year Old 1967.description: A rare 36 year old from Glenflagler, this bottling is a vatting of the last six casks from the distillery, distilled in 1967.

Balvenie 12 Year Old Doublewood.palate: Sweet with good body. The bourbon characters develop; gentle spice with a little vanilla, a balancing peat lurking quietly in the substrata.
Balvenie 12 Year Old Doublewood.name: Balvenie 12 Year Old Doublewood
Balvenie 12 Year Old Doublewood.notes: wood, spicy, spice, peat, nutty, nuttiness, vanilla
Balvenie 12 Year Old Doublewood.description: Aged in ex-bourbon casks before being finished in sherry casks, Double Wood is an excellent example of what the Balvenie distillery can craft, even at 12 years.

Bruichladdich 1998 Manzanilla Sherry Cas.palate: Full, plenty of sweetness. Orange, melon, jammy, creamy vanilla. Nutty.
Bruichladdich 1998 Manzanilla Sherry Cas.name: Bruichladdich 1998 Manzanilla Sherry Cask Matured
Bruichladdich 1998 Manzanilla Sherry Cas.notes: oak, orange, fruit, nutty, almond, hazelnut, creamy, vanilla, herbal, coffee
Bruichladdich 1998 Manzanilla Sherry Cas.nose: Sherried, grapey. Fruit salad, honeydew melon. Oily, almond and hazelnut. Coffee. Cider, slightly herbal, faint hints of creosote.
Bruichladdich 1998 Manzanilla Sherry Cas.note categories: wood, fruits, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, coffee
Bruichladdich 1998 Manzanilla Sherry Cas.description: Just 6,000 bottle of this single malt were released. This was distilled in 1998 and matured for 10 years in Manzanilla dry sherry casks and the label features a rather dramatic 'Picasso esque' print of a bull.

Master Of Malt 50 Year Old Speyside (4th.palate: Pleasantly thick but not too much so. Wood spice, a hint of cumin and luxurious cigar box, coffee and caramel notes with just a touch of smoke.
Master Of Malt 50 Year Old Speyside (4th.name: Master Of Malt 50 Year Old Speyside (4th Edition)
Master Of Malt 50 Year Old Speyside (4th.notes: wood, fruit, raisin, apple, spices, nutmeg, cumin, spice, smoke, nut, nuts, barley, butterscotch, caramel, coffee, leather
Master Of Malt 50 Year Old Speyside (4th.nose: Exotic spices, apple that's just begun to caramelise and dried grapes. Coffee and leather develop, running into crème brûlée, golden barley and soft toffees. Rum and raisin surfaces too, along with more spices and butterscotch.
Master Of Malt 50 Year Old Speyside (4th.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, cereal, vanilla, coffee, feint
Master Of Malt 50 Year Old Speyside (4th.description: Our fifty year old Speyside Single Malt Scotch Whisky has reached its fourth edition! An exceptional champion of our Secret Bottling Series, the rich, complex and just down-right gorgeous fifty year old Speyside ripples with intense, incredible flavours. Worth waiting 50 years for? Absolutely!

English Whisky Co. Chapter 11 Cask Str.palate: Creamy, sweet and spicy with notes of oily peat smoke and custard. Some pannacotta, sultanas, and cloves develop.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 11 Cask Str.name: English Whisky Co. Chapter 11   Cask Strength
English Whisky Co. Chapter 11 Cask Str.notes: apple, cloves, spicy, peat, smoky, smoke, creamy, toffee, caramel, custard
English Whisky Co. Chapter 11 Cask Str.nose: Citrussy and smoky with notes of crème caramel, malt, spicy peat and a little toffee apple.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 11 Cask Str.description: This was distilled at St George's Distillery in Norfolk in March 2008, and it was aged in 4 casks (numbers 646, 647, 648 and 649) before bottling in May 2011. This is a heavily peated edition (the first ever heavily peated English whisky) and it was bottled at natural cask strength.

Loch Lomond Batch 2 (that Boutique Y W.palate: Good helpings of vanilla cream and caramelised apple, with a little bit of toasted-apple-crumble-toppings. Fresh oak comes through on the mid palate.
Loch Lomond Batch 2 (that Boutique Y W.name: Loch Lomond   Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Loch Lomond Batch 2 (that Boutique Y W.notes: oak, lemon, apple, spicy, cinnamon, cream, chocolate, vanilla, caramel
Loch Lomond Batch 2 (that Boutique Y W.nose: Doughnuts with powdered sugar, lemon meringue pie and chocolate truffles. Sounds sweet, but it's well balanced with notes of bread-'n'-butter and pencil shavings (like what the wizard said).
Loch Lomond Batch 2 (that Boutique Y W.description:
"Vanilla-sugar with pencil shavings?
This'll satisfy their cravings."

The second batch of Loch Lomond single grain Scotch whisky bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company has magicked itself into our hands! Loch Lomond are known for distilling not only grain whisky, but 8 different single malts - an impressive feat which may seem like magic to some. Perhaps it is magic and the label of the Boutique-y bottling is what the inside of Loch Lomond actually looks like. Oh, and it seems the wizard has a new incantation, or he's just working on a sweet rap verse. 

Batch 2 is a release of 91 bottles.

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, blended malts, blends and bourbons from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Caol Ila 12 Year Old.palate: Good body, oily, tar, elegant smoke. Hints of boiled sweets.
Caol Ila 12 Year Old.name: Caol Ila 12 Year Old
Caol Ila 12 Year Old.nose: Fresh, herbal. Rubbed peppermint leaves, stemmy, damp grass, smoky. Oily, cigar leaves, smoked ham, hickory.
Caol Ila 12 Year Old.description: This 12 year old is the entry level bottling from the Caol Ila distillery, launched in June of 2002 this expression is light and fresh with that distinctive Caol Ila smoke.

Isle Of Jura 35 Year Old 1976 (cask 888).palate: Pipe tobacco melds with calves leather, mahogany and fresh mint leaves. Honey and custard. A heavy dose of dried fruits.
Isle Of Jura 35 Year Old 1976 (cask 888).name: Isle Of Jura 35 Year Old 1976 (cask 888) (berry Bros. & Rudd)
Isle Of Jura 35 Year Old 1976 (cask 888).notes: fruit, berry, spicy, peat, smoke, toffee, custard, leather, honey
Isle Of Jura 35 Year Old 1976 (cask 888).nose: Dried apricot and cigar boxes. Hints of leather, peppermint and soft smoke. A very spicy aroma.
Isle Of Jura 35 Year Old 1976 (cask 888).description: A rich, dark single malt whisky from the Isle of Jura, this was distilled in 1976 before a 35 year maturation in a single cask (sherry hogshead number 888). It was bottled at cask-strength by Berry Brothers and Rudd.

Bunnahabhain 15 Year Old 1997 Heavily Pe.palate: Peat to the fore with warm and fruity sweet and sour sauce and lightly toasted pine nuts.
Bunnahabhain 15 Year Old 1997 Heavily Pe.name: Bunnahabhain 15 Year Old 1997 Heavily Peated   Un Chillfiltered (signatory)
Bunnahabhain 15 Year Old 1997 Heavily Pe.notes: pine, fruity, peat, smoky, nut, nuts, barley, toasted
Bunnahabhain 15 Year Old 1997 Heavily Pe.nose: Fragrant dune grasses and corroded shoreline chains. Barley.
Bunnahabhain 15 Year Old 1997 Heavily Pe.description: Made with heavily peated malt, this Bunnahabhain was aged for 15 years before being bottled by Signatory as part of their Un-Chillfiltered range.

Auchentoshan American Oak.palate: Bounty bars, more citrus peels and peaches. A little bit buttery, with golden barley and oak spice developing on the mid palate.
Auchentoshan American Oak.name: Auchentoshan American Oak
Auchentoshan American Oak.notes: oak, citrus, lemon, peach, spice, barley, cream, milk, chocolate, vanilla, toffee
Auchentoshan American Oak.nose: Oranges and lemons, toffee chunks and milk chocolate. Wafts of grassy air and clotted cream.
Auchentoshan American Oak.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla
Auchentoshan American Oak.description: From the Auchentoshan distillery in the Scottish Lowlands comes a triple distilled single malt Scotch whisky aged entirely in first fill American oak casks. A light, bright whisky with plenty of vanilla sweetness at its centre - great as an aperitif dram.

Dalmore 12 Year Old.palate: Notes of Seville marmalade and triple sec with winter spices and fruitcake. Zesty cocoa and milk chocolate.
Dalmore 12 Year Old.name: Dalmore 12 Year Old
Dalmore 12 Year Old.notes: orange, fruit, spices, spice, nutty, nuttiness, butter, milk, chocolate, cocoa, coffee, espresso
Dalmore 12 Year Old.nose: A warm coffee house in Seattle; roasting beans, the oily nuttiness in a fine espresso, there are little notes of malt and cereal and butter from the pastry counter with rich orange from the fruit bowl on the counter.
Dalmore 12 Year Old.description: Launched in late 2008 to replace the previous 12 year old, this single malt from the Dalmore distillery is a toasty, coffee-rich dram with beautifully spice notes and a thick mouthfeel. Very rich for a 12 year old.

FEW White Dog.palate: The flavour is reminiscent of cherry jam with a little ground pepper followed by a herbaceous quality.
FEW White Dog.name: FEW White Dog
FEW White Dog.notes: cherry, cherries, pepper, barley, vanilla, herbaceous
FEW White Dog.nose: The corn is very prevalent but the malted barley comes through with a certain elegance about it.
FEW White Dog.description:
This is a white whiskey (or white dog) from the FEW Spirits Distillery, white whiskey is un-aged and has a particularly rich character. This white whiskey is made of a mash of 70% corn, 20% wheat and 10% two row malt. Although this can be drunk neat it works excellently as a base spirit in many cocktails.

FEW Spirits hails from Evanston in the United States of America, a city that suffered Prohibition for over one hundred years thanks to many of its advocates hailing from its dry streets. Thankfully Evanston is now home to this excellent craft distillery which takes its name ironically from the initials of Frances Elizabeth Willard, a key figure in the Temperance Movement.

Clynelish 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.palate: Intense and spicy, coats the tongue in oily spice, notes of dried barley, stem ginger in golden syrup and chocolate raisins.
Clynelish 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.name: Clynelish 21 Year Old 1990   Dimensions (duncan Taylor)
Clynelish 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.notes: oak, raisin, apple, pepper, spicy, spice, hazelnut, barley, creamy, chocolate, vanilla, butterscotch, cocoa
Clynelish 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.nose: Sherried peels and creamy vanilla. A touch of prune, date and cocoa, notes of beeswax, black pepper and apple peels. Dry oak too.
Clynelish 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, coffee
Clynelish 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.description: A deep, tawny-coloured Clynelish, distilled in May 1990 and aged for 21 years in cask 3229 before bottling in 2012 by Duncan Taylor for their Dimensions range. A release of 161 numbered bottles.

darkness bruichladdich 12 year old pedro.palate: A solid palate of uncompromising dried fruits, spicy prunes and raisins, with a drying hint of salinity.
darkness bruichladdich 12 year old pedro.name: darkness bruichladdich 12 year old pedro ximenez cask finish whisky
darkness bruichladdich 12 year old pedro.nose: Quite musky and rather creamy at full strength, with farmyard notes up front followed by sweet prune, dried apricots and raw sugar.
darkness bruichladdich 12 year old pedro.description: 12 year old Bruichladdich single malt Scotch whisky, bottled for the Darkness! range after enjoying a finishing period in a specially coopered, 50 litre Pedro Ximénez cask. Such a small cask, but the significantly greater surface area to volume ratio means it has such a big influence on the whisky.

Ledaig 22 Year Old 1972 Lost Bottlings.palate: Dried apricot alongside agave nectar, gentle peat smoke and soft spices. Red berries appear late palate, with a hint of granary toast.
Ledaig 22 Year Old 1972 Lost Bottlings.name: Ledaig 22 Year Old 1972   Lost Bottlings Series (master Of Malt)
Ledaig 22 Year Old 1972 Lost Bottlings.notes: cherries, cherry, fruit, berry, spices, peat, smoky, smoke
Ledaig 22 Year Old 1972 Lost Bottlings.nose: Very subtle peat notes on the nose, with more than a hint of glacé cherries, redcurrant jelly and cassis. A little whisper of smoke.
Ledaig 22 Year Old 1972 Lost Bottlings.description: This is a very rare single malt from our Lost Bottlings Series - a range of whiskies bottled many years ago, offering whisky lovers the chance to try spirit from a bygone era. This is a Ledaig - a peated single malt from the Tobermory distillery on Mull. It was distilled in 1972 before a 22 year maturation, and it was bottled in October 1995.

Blair Athol 13 Year Old 1998 (berry Bros.palate: The palate is reminiscent of roasted chestnuts, stewing apples and plenty of cinnamon.
Blair Athol 13 Year Old 1998 (berry Bros.name: Blair Athol 13 Year Old 1998 (berry Bros. & Rudd)
Blair Athol 13 Year Old 1998 (berry Bros.notes: berry, spicy, cinnamon, spices, roasted, honey
Blair Athol 13 Year Old 1998 (berry Bros.nose: Honey, ginger and warm Christmas spices intermingle on the nose.
Blair Athol 13 Year Old 1998 (berry Bros.description: Blair Athol is one of Scotland's oldest distilleries having occupied its site since 1798. This whisky was bottled by Berry Brothers and Rudd at thirteen years old without chill filtration.

Glenrothes 1988 (bottled 2011).palate: Creamy, zesty and spicy palate which opens on sweet malt, Fruitcake, custard and just a hint of smoke.
Glenrothes 1988 (bottled 2011).name: Glenrothes 1988 (bottled 2011)
Glenrothes 1988 (bottled 2011).notes: oak, orange, fruit, fruity, zest, berry, spicy, nutmeg, allspice, smoke, creamy, vanilla, custard, musty
Glenrothes 1988 (bottled 2011).nose: Spicy and fruity with notes of Red apples, berry fruits, oak and vanilla. Some nutmeg, allspice and Madeira cake. Musty orange zest.
Glenrothes 1988 (bottled 2011).note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Glenrothes 1988 (bottled 2011).description: Described by Glenrothes' Brand Heritage Director, Ronnie Cox as "a fantastic reminder of how beautifully The Glenrothes ripens from vibrant, zesty youth to rich, full-bodied maturity." This is a fabulous whisky from Glenrothes, aged for more than 20 years in a mix of Spanish and American oak. The result is a classic Winter fireside dram!

Ichiro's Malt & Grain.palate: Toffee first and foremost, with notes of barley malt, gingerbread, tropical fruits, honeyed pipe tobacco lveas, black pepper, roasted chestnut and freshly cut hay.
Ichiro's Malt & Grain.name: Ichiro's Malt & Grain
Ichiro's Malt & Grain.notes: citrus, fruit, zest, peach, pepper, barley, cream, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee, hay, roasted, honey
Ichiro's Malt & Grain.nose: Peach and dried apricot, sweet butterscotch, vanilla cream, citrus zest, synthetic bananas and gooey malt.
Ichiro's Malt & Grain.note categories: fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, coffee, feint
Ichiro's Malt & Grain.description: A lovely blended whisky from Japan, created by Ichiro Akuto, the Japanese whisky extraordinaire. This particular gem is made with both malt and grain whisky from Japan as well as (possibly) some whisky from other countries too - the label describes it as "a worldwide blended whisky".

Jefferson's Bourbon.palate: Soft, warming and supple. Notes of sweet vanilla, spices, toffee, berry fruits, a touch of orange zest, spices and honey.
Jefferson's Bourbon.name: Jefferson's Bourbon
Jefferson's Bourbon.notes: oak, orange, fruit, berry, zest, spicy, spices, smoke, barley, creamy, vanilla, toffee, custard, honey
Jefferson's Bourbon.nose: Very crisp and fresh on the nose, lots of creamy vanilla and warm, spicy flavour. Notes of oak, toffee, hints of smoke.
Jefferson's Bourbon.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Jefferson's Bourbon.description: A limited release, small batch artisan bourbon. This is very unusual, and offers a thoroughly distinctive flavour profile, thanks to its 6 to 10 year ageing in very lightly charred (Number 1 char) barrels. Jefferson's bourbon is made with a mashbill of 60% corn, 30% rye and 10% malted barley.

Dalmore Tay Dram The Rivers Collection.palate: Thick, with cr?me brulee, smooth coffee and a dark chocolate bitterness. Orange marmalade with red berries and more baked fruit - pears.
Dalmore Tay Dram The Rivers Collection.name: Dalmore Tay Dram   The Rivers Collection 2012
Dalmore Tay Dram The Rivers Collection.notes: orange, fruit, berry, nut, nuts, chocolate, caramel, coffee, roasted
Dalmore Tay Dram The Rivers Collection.nose: Orange and menthol notes, with baked fruit and roasted nuts.
Dalmore Tay Dram The Rivers Collection.description:
A tasty Dalmore matured in bourbon and Oloroso sherry casks, the Tay Dram is part of the distillery's Rivers collection.

At least £4 from every eponymous bottle sold goes towards protecting four Scottish rivers, with the aim of raising £400,000 for conservation efforts.

Amrut Peated Single Malt Whisky.palate: Soooo fruity! Peat doesn't even get a look-in. Lots of malt, tart.
Amrut Peated Single Malt Whisky.name: Amrut Peated Single Malt Whisky
Amrut Peated Single Malt Whisky.nose: Sweet cure bacon, smoke, malt, sweet peat, touch of caramel.
Amrut Peated Single Malt Whisky.description: A great peated offering from India's Amrut, "from the land of the Great Himalayas". Jim Murray speaks very highly of this, giving it 94 points. Rich and intense.

Dalwhinnie 20 Year Old.palate: Perfumed, refined. Cherry, strawberry, sherry, sultana. Malt, oranges. Madeira.
Dalwhinnie 20 Year Old.name: Dalwhinnie 20 Year Old
Dalwhinnie 20 Year Old.notes: oak, cherry, fruit, spice, barley, espresso, honey
Dalwhinnie 20 Year Old.nose: Malty, buttery toasty, lashings of honey, barley. Stone fruits, nectarine. Touch of fragrant espresso.
Dalwhinnie 20 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, coffee, feint
Dalwhinnie 20 Year Old.description: A 20 year old from the Dalwhinnie distillery, just 4,200 bottles of this refill sherry matured whisky were released. The sherry notes are quite rich and the colour is indulgently deep.

Reference Series II.palate: Big, satisfying entry with plenty of classic Sherry influence, herbal and malty with cherries and chocolate.
Reference Series II.name: Reference Series II
Reference Series II.notes: oak, orange, cherry, cherries, pepper, barley, creamy, chocolate, herbal, honey
Reference Series II.nose: Juicy and honeyed with sweet barley and orange. Hugely buttery and quite meaty, extremely well-rounded. Nettle, buttercups, oak, cakey-ness and a little pepper.
Reference Series II.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, flowers, feint
Reference Series II.description:
Reference Series II, as well as being an excellent blended malt in its own right, is the second of three 'control' whiskies that increase in average age and complexity. Each of these three initial releases are made up of the same constituent parts, only in different quantities.

In this case, we have a blend of both youthful and older, richer blended malts, with a generous helping of old and very old single malts comprising over 20% of the blend. Extensions (II.1, II.2 etc.) then showcase different additional ingredients and techniques, allowing drinkers to refer back to the original control whisky and appreciate exactly how these specific changes translate in the glass.

Read more about the Reference Series here on our blog.

Nikka Super Whisky.palate: Rich and malty. This is a simple blend, but one of great quality and balance. Notes of orange zest, toffee and oak, with hints of peanut butter and cocoa.
Nikka Super Whisky.name: Nikka Super Whisky
Nikka Super Whisky.notes: oak, orange, fruit, zest, cloves, cinnamon, peanut, oat, butter, toffee, cocoa, honey
Nikka Super Whisky.nose: Malty, notes of cooked apples, porridge oats, pear, beeswax and honey.
Nikka Super Whisky.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Nikka Super Whisky.description: Blended whisky from Nikka. A very good blend all in all, with plenty of malt and dried fruit flavour.

Longmorn 21 Year Old 1991 Cask 9233 Ol.palate: Malty toffee, dried and fresh apricot, latte.
Longmorn 21 Year Old 1991 Cask 9233 Ol.name: Longmorn 21 Year Old 1991 Cask 9233   Old Malt Cask (douglas Laing)
Longmorn 21 Year Old 1991 Cask 9233 Ol.nose: Savoury porridge with cinnamon and cracked black pepper.
Longmorn 21 Year Old 1991 Cask 9233 Ol.description: This 21 year Longmorn was distilled in 1991 before being placed in cask 9233. It was bottled by Douglas Laing as part of their Old Malt Cask collection.

Bowmore 13 Year Old 1997 Old Malt Cask.palate: Peated and lightly ash-like with hints of pear juice, barley sugar, a little linseed oil and just a touch of sticking plasters.
Bowmore 13 Year Old 1997 Old Malt Cask.name: Bowmore 13 Year Old 1997   Old Malt Cask (douglas Laing)
Bowmore 13 Year Old 1997 Old Malt Cask.nose: An apple-led, aromatic nose with hints of salted butter and old ropes, a little gentle peat and juicy barley.
Bowmore 13 Year Old 1997 Old Malt Cask.description: A 13 year old Bowmore distilled in May 1997 and aged in a single refill hogshead before bottling by Douglas Laing in February 2011. This comes from the Old Malt Cask range, and there are just 297 bottles…

Glen Moray 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.palate: Menthol and cinnamon, thick malt, orange zest and toffee brittle. A touch of hay, porridge oats and pecans.
Glen Moray 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.name: Glen Moray 21 Year Old 1990   Dimensions (duncan Taylor)
Glen Moray 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.notes: orange, lemon, apple, zest, pepper, cinnamon, smoky, oat, toffee, hay
Glen Moray 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.nose: Smoky, rich nose with notes of coastal breeze, truffles and toffee apple.
Glen Moray 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, cereal, vanilla, flowers
Glen Moray 21 Year Old 1990 Dimensions.description: This was distilled at Glen Moray in November of 1990 and aged in cask 10297 for 21 years before bottling at natural cask strength by Duncan Taylor for their Dimensions range in 2012. A release of 196 bottles.

Bruichladdich 1970 (32 Year Old).palate: Great body, malted barley, oily and nutty. Thick honey, fruit.
Bruichladdich 1970 (32 Year Old).name: Bruichladdich 1970 (32 Year Old)
Bruichladdich 1970 (32 Year Old).notes: fruit, lemon, fruity, zest, apple, nutty, barley, toffee, honey
Bruichladdich 1970 (32 Year Old).nose: Rich and full. Boiled sweets, toffee, rubbed petals. Bramley apple, bruised pear. Peppermint, marmalade, lemon zest, Limoncello.
Bruichladdich 1970 (32 Year Old).description: A 32 year old bottling from the Bruichladdich distillery, this single malt was distilled in 1970 and has been solely matured in first fill American hogsheads and exudes some lovely ripe orchard fruit notes with honeyed sweetness.

Johnnie Walker Blue Label With Bill Ambe.palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass and a good hit of malt.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label With Bill Ambe.name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label With Bill Amberg Traveller Bag
Johnnie Walker Blue Label With Bill Ambe.notes: oak, cedar, citrus, plum, fruit, berry, spice, smoke, chocolate, toffee, floral, honey
Johnnie Walker Blue Label With Bill Ambe.nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice and citrus.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label With Bill Ambe.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, feint
Johnnie Walker Blue Label With Bill Ambe.description: Perfect for any lover of Johnnie Walker Blue Label. This is a very attractive blue traveler bag made by British luggage maker Bill Amberg. Very smart indeed!

Isle Of Arran 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 663.palate: Malty, thick palate with notes of citrus zest and digestive biscuits. Apple peel and allspice.
Isle Of Arran 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 663.name: Isle Of Arran 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 663   Dimensions (duncan Taylor)
Isle Of Arran 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 663.notes: oak, apple, zest, citrus, fruit, berry, fruity, allspice, barley, toasted, hay, honey
Isle Of Arran 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 663.nose: Hints of dried herbs and toasted barley. A very malty, inviting nose with a touch of berry fruit and hay.
Isle Of Arran 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 663.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, flowers, feint
Isle Of Arran 16 Year Old 1996 Cask 663.description: This was distilled at the Isle of Arran distillery in July 1996 before a 16 year maturation in a single cask (number 663). It was bottled for the Dimensions range from Duncan Taylor in October 2012. A release of 307 numbered bottles at natural cask strength.

Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask.palate: Mochaccino, cooked fruit, lovely sweetness, dry wood, dark rum, touch of smoke.
Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask.name: Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask
Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask.notes: wood, fruit, spice, smoke, toffee, herbal
Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask.nose: Aromatic, winter spice. Dark toffee. Peels, rich sherry, liqueur-like character
Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, vanilla, flowers
Glenfarclas 1971 Family Cask.description: This 1971 vintage Family Cask was matured in single cask 140, a sherry butt. An elegant, stone fruit laden Glenfarclas.	This was bottled on the 28th February 2007 as part of a release of 459 bottles.

Glenbridge 40 Year Old (aldi).palate: Sherry fruit, date, walnut, rye spice, bubblegum, dries slightly.
Glenbridge 40 Year Old (aldi).name: Glenbridge 40 Year Old (aldi)
Glenbridge 40 Year Old (aldi).nose: Sherry, Rancio, big fruit, Brazil nut shells, very pleasant indeed.
Glenbridge 40 Year Old (aldi).description: There has been an unbelievable level of hype about this whisky, and largely due to the fact it's quite an unusual thing! This, my friends, is Aldi's 40 year old whisky - Glenbridge 40! We tasted this with the whisky legend Jim Murray and we must say, it is staggeringly good! Sadly it is sold out pretty much everywhere, so if you're hankering for a great value-for-money 40 year old, why not try our own classic 40 year old whisky.

Glenglassaugh 30 Year Old.palate: Here we go again, more Sherry notes, but this time balanced with a bigger centre of spice, oak and chocolate. Freshly ground coffee comes into play near the end too, fragrant and rich.
Glenglassaugh 30 Year Old.name: Glenglassaugh 30 Year Old
Glenglassaugh 30 Year Old.notes: oak, fruit, raisin, spices, spice, nut, nuts, chocolate, coffee
Glenglassaugh 30 Year Old.nose: There just has to be some Sherry cask matured whisky in here, it's rich with sweet Sherry notes, dried fruit and simmering spices. Chewy toffees too, and well aged oak.
Glenglassaugh 30 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, chocolate, coffee
Glenglassaugh 30 Year Old.description: The Glenglassaugh 30 Year Old was the first release from the distillery after the new owners took the reins in 2013, and they certainly started off on the right foot. It is presented in a rather stunning teardrop decanter.

Isle Of Jura 1996 Boutique Barrel 2010.palate: Sweet and biscuity then thick layers of oak. Shifts into black treacle/fruit then real dryess coming from the spirit underneath emerges.
Isle Of Jura 1996 Boutique Barrel 2010.name: Isle Of Jura 1996 Boutique Barrel   2010 Feis Ile
Isle Of Jura 1996 Boutique Barrel 2010.nose: Rich. Cake mix, dry leaves, crisped cereal, then a long, sweet mix of date and supple leather, pea and ham soup (which isn't a bad thing) and cacao. Scented with dried rasps and amaro.
Isle Of Jura 1996 Boutique Barrel 2010.description: A special edition Jura released to celebrate the Islay whisky festival. Aged in a French Limousin oak cask which was chosen by a select group of Jura residents from the distillery's warehouses. It yielded an outturn of just 493 bottles. Bottled at cask strength and non chill-filtered.

Bowmore Macbeatha 4th Edition.palate: White pepper on the forepalate revels a smoky bonfire and saltiness toward the back. Still quite light and uplifting.
Bowmore Macbeatha 4th Edition.name: Bowmore Macbeatha   4th Edition
Bowmore Macbeatha 4th Edition.nose: Quite heavily peated for a Bowmore. Dried grass and heather. Biscuity and warm with a refreshing lightness.
Bowmore Macbeatha 4th Edition.description: A Bowmore from Kilchoman? Sort of... Kilchoman uses the MacBeatha name to market their single cask bottlings from other Islay distilleries. This is the fourth edition in the range, a single cask Bowmore bottled by normally available only at Kilchoman's distillery shop.

edradour 13 year old 1997 chateaneuf du.palate: Fruity and thick, like rhubarb crumble with hot, bubbling strawberry jam on a stove. Peppery, spicy and sweet. More of those dessert wine notes from the nose, almost like a sweet PX sherry. Lovely stuff, and quite mad!
edradour 13 year old 1997 chateaneuf du.name: edradour 13 year old 1997 chateaneuf du pape cask finish straight from the cask whisky
edradour 13 year old 1997 chateaneuf du.notes: wood, oak, fruit, fruity, berry, peppery, spicy, caramel, toffee, floral, honey
edradour 13 year old 1997 chateaneuf du.nose: Aromatic and intense with notes of dry oak, toffee, strawberry jam and dessert wine. Very curious. Wood sheds, some linseed oil and caramel.
edradour 13 year old 1997 chateaneuf du.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, vanilla, flowers, feint
edradour 13 year old 1997 chateaneuf du.description: This was distilled on the 19th November 1997, and it was filled into hogsheads. On the 2nd May 2007, it was reracked into a Chateauneuf du Pape hogshead, before it was bottled on the 18th April 2011. There are just 436 bottles of this cask strength, wine-finished Edradour. Loads of flavour, it reminds us of strawberry jam. Mmm!

Apple Pastry 1991 Wemyss Malts (linkwo.palate: Further twangs of green apples, now with a spicy dusting of nutmeg that grows from the centre.
Apple Pastry 1991 Wemyss Malts (linkwo.name: Apple Pastry 1991   Wemyss Malts (linkwood)
Apple Pastry 1991 Wemyss Malts (linkwo.nose: As luck would have it, there's a definite whiff of apple turn-overs, along with sugary sweets from the corner shop.
Apple Pastry 1991 Wemyss Malts (linkwo.description: Imagine popping into the bakery for a danish and coming out with a bottle of Apple Pastry, a spectacular single cask whisky from Wemyss. It's probably not going to happen, although you could pretend that we're a bakery because Master of Malt is short for Master of Malt Loaf and make that imagination a reality.

Ben Nevis 16 Year Old 1996 Old Malt Ca.palate: Honeyed, fruity palate entry. Big notes of barley, toffee apple and the vaguest whisper of smoke.
Ben Nevis 16 Year Old 1996 Old Malt Ca.name: Ben Nevis 16 Year Old 1996   Old Malt Cask (douglas Laing)
Ben Nevis 16 Year Old 1996 Old Malt Ca.notes: fruity, apple, spicy, allspice, smoke, barley, toffee, honey
Ben Nevis 16 Year Old 1996 Old Malt Ca.nose: Sticky toffee pudding and sherry. A little manuka honey, allspice and a touch of old brandy.
Ben Nevis 16 Year Old 1996 Old Malt Ca.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, cereal, vanilla, feint
Ben Nevis 16 Year Old 1996 Old Malt Ca.description: This was distilled at Ben Nevis in October 1996 before a 16 year maturation in a single sherry butt. It was bottled in October 2012 for Douglas Laing's stellar Old Malt Cask range. This is one of just 512 bottles from the cask.

Redbreast 15 Year Old.palate: Creamy and smooth, notes of cooked fruits, fried banana, orange groves, nutmeg, butterscotch and caramel lattes.
Redbreast 15 Year Old.name: Redbreast 15 Year Old
Redbreast 15 Year Old.notes: orange, citrus, fruit, fruity, nutmeg, creamy, butterscotch, caramel, custard, hay, honey
Redbreast 15 Year Old.nose: Fruity and tangy. Notes of zesty citrus, cut hay, guava, beeswax, manuka honey and tropical fruits.
Redbreast 15 Year Old.note categories: fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, feint
Redbreast 15 Year Old.description: A beautiful pure pot still whiskey (or "single pot still" as it's now officially known). Redbreast 15 is a rich, thick, sweet, pungent whiskey with loads of flavour and complexity - really good stuff!

Tomintoul 19 Year Old 1995 Single Cask.palate: Really bursts on the palate with whole walnut and dried apples. Developing juiciness with plenty of sultanas. Orange peels and a little bit of spicy cardamom.
Tomintoul 19 Year Old 1995 Single Cask.name: Tomintoul 19 Year Old 1995   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Tomintoul 19 Year Old 1995 Single Cask.notes: orange, pepper, spicy, cinnamon, spice, nutty, walnut, toasted, chocolate, honey
Tomintoul 19 Year Old 1995 Single Cask.nose: Quite light and fragrant, with toasted English muffins - one side buttered, the other with a thin layer of honey. It moves on to crunchy apples, which grow warmer and slightly stewed later. Cinnamon and white pepper spice.
Tomintoul 19 Year Old 1995 Single Cask.note categories: fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, chocolate, feint
Tomintoul 19 Year Old 1995 Single Cask.description: Yet another cracking single cask we've been lucky enough to bottle, this time from Tomintoul, pronounced 'Tom-in-Towel' (although it's best not to think about that for too long). Distilled on 1st May 1995, it filled 186 bottles at natural cask strength on 1st April 2015. No foolin'.

Tomintoul With A Peaty Tang 1l.palate: Quite rich and powerful. There are notes of toasted oak with notes of pepper and the smoke thereof. Notes of toasty cereals and supple peat. A wistful ash note builds.
Tomintoul With A Peaty Tang 1l.name: Tomintoul With A Peaty Tang 1l
Tomintoul With A Peaty Tang 1l.notes: wood, oak, pine, pepper, peat, smoke, barley, toasted
Tomintoul With A Peaty Tang 1l.nose: Full and pungent. There are notes of heather roots and wood smoke. A dark peat with notes of copper and pine oils with a touch of gentle sweetness from the barley malt.
Tomintoul With A Peaty Tang 1l.description: A one litre bottle of Tomintoul's peated single malt whisky that utilises the batch of heavily peated (55ppm) spirit the distillery produces each year.

Penderyn Red Flag (icons Of Wales).palate: Sweet, sherried palate with a herbal, honey-like backbone. Quite malty, with a wave of spices, marzipan and dried grass.
Penderyn Red Flag (icons Of Wales).name: Penderyn Red Flag (icons Of Wales)
Penderyn Red Flag (icons Of Wales).notes: spices, allspice, nutty, marzipan, creamy, caramel, herbal
Penderyn Red Flag (icons Of Wales).nose: Soft spices and dates. A little rhubarb crumble, allspice, a touch of caramel and dried herbs.
Penderyn Red Flag (icons Of Wales).description: This is a delicious Welsh whisky from Penderyn's Icons of Wales series. The Red Flag edition commemorates the first time a red flag was raised as a symbol of social protest, which took place over the execution of a miner - named Dic Penderyn - during the 1831 Merthyr Rising. The whisky is finished in Madeira wine casks before bottling.

Johnnie Walker Black Label + 2 Glasses.palate: Medium-bodied with sweet, creamy malt notes, juicy barley, custard, toffee apples, cherry bakewell tart and a tinge of sweet smoke.
Johnnie Walker Black Label + 2 Glasses.name: Johnnie Walker Black Label + 2 Glasses
Johnnie Walker Black Label + 2 Glasses.notes: oak, orange, cherry, fruit, zest, spices, smoky, smoke, barley, creamy, toffee, custard, honey
Johnnie Walker Black Label + 2 Glasses.nose: Redolent of sweet spices, maple syrup, granary toast, manuka honey, hints of smoke coming off of damp oak, a little tanginess and fruit.
Johnnie Walker Black Label + 2 Glasses.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Johnnie Walker Black Label + 2 Glasses.description: Johnnie Walker Black Label is a classic blend of 40 different whiskies, and it has a beautifully malty, slightly smoky flavour. One of the ultimate blends, this classic gift set contains two smart, Johnnie Walker-branded tumblers too!

Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (4th.palate: Syrupy, gooey toffee, apple peel, rolling tobacco, manuka honey and toffee popcorn. A handsomely sweet core of sherry and malt.
Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (4th.name: Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (4th Edition)
Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (4th.notes: apple, spicy, allspice, butterscotch, toffee, honey
Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (4th.nose: Malty and juicy. Hints of butterscotch, panna cotta, toffee apples and candy floss. A fabulous nose, with just a hint of apple crumble.
Master Of Malt 30 Year Old Speyside (4th.description: The 4th edition of our stunning (if we do say so ourselves) 30 year old single malt from a secret Speyside distillery. After a slightly lighter 3rd edition, this is a return to sherried form, boasting a rich, unctuous sherry flavour, and an intensely dark hue.

Glen Scotia 20 Year Old 1991 (signatory).palate: Thick, and wine-like, with notes of fruit again, particularly stone fruit, malt and dark brown sugar.
Glen Scotia 20 Year Old 1991 (signatory).name: Glen Scotia 20 Year Old 1991 (signatory)
Glen Scotia 20 Year Old 1991 (signatory).notes: fruit, spices, creamy, vanilla, toffee, coffee, molasses
Glen Scotia 20 Year Old 1991 (signatory).nose: Creamy with lots of vanilla and coffee. A touch of burnt sugar, with sweet cereals and orchard fruit. A hint of molasses too.
Glen Scotia 20 Year Old 1991 (signatory).note categories: fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, feint
Glen Scotia 20 Year Old 1991 (signatory).description: Distilled at Glen Scotia, on the 17th April 1991, this was aged for 20 years in two hogsheads, before bottling by Signatory on the 24th May 2011. A release of 407 bottles.

Clynelish 1995 Cask Strength (gordon A.palate: Malty and rich with thick notes of custard, almost a hint of licorice,, a touch of smoke, silky and then nutty.
Clynelish 1995 Cask Strength (gordon A.name: Clynelish 1995   Cask Strength (gordon And Macphail)
Clynelish 1995 Cask Strength (gordon A.notes: fruit, fruity, licorice, smoke, nutty, barley, vanilla, custard
Clynelish 1995 Cask Strength (gordon A.nose: Lots of barley malt, quite sweet with hints of the coast. Banana skins, hints of rum, tropical fruit, vanilla.
Clynelish 1995 Cask Strength (gordon A.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, nuts, cereal, vanilla
Clynelish 1995 Cask Strength (gordon A.description: A cask strength Clynelish, bottled by Gordon and MacPhail. This was matured in refill sherry casks and the bottlers describe it as being "Fresh with classic Highland style".

Smokehead The Rock Edition.palate: Big, puckering peat. Smoky, fruity sweetness, touch of sherry, sultana. Herbal.
Smokehead The Rock Edition.name: Smokehead   The Rock Edition
Smokehead The Rock Edition.notes: wood, fruit, fruity, peat, smoky, smoke, herbal
Smokehead The Rock Edition.nose: Smoke! Lapsang souchong. Cool wood smoke. Thick and full.
Smokehead The Rock Edition.description: A very special, dramatic-looking edition of Smokehead single malt featuring a debossed "Smokehead Skull". Hugely peaty and very well-packaged!

Talisker Port Ruighe.palate: Initial characteristic Talisker brine once again but much sweeter than usual. Thick and mouth coating like the Storm with chilli and a little chocolate orange. Increasingly smoky - much smokier than the nose suggests.
Talisker Port Ruighe.name: Talisker Port Ruighe
Talisker Port Ruighe.notes: wood, oak, orange, plum, smoky, smoke, chocolate, milk, mocha, cocoa
Talisker Port Ruighe.nose: After a wave of initial sea spray, the nose becomes more complex with Crayola crayons, orange pith and a touch of white chocolate. Demerara and even sticking plaster emerge briefly along with plummy, umeshu notes.
Talisker Port Ruighe.description: The second new no age statement release in quick succession following Talisker Storm in early 2013. Port Ruighe (pronounced Portree, as in the largest town on the Isle of Skye), is finished in Port casks after initial maturation in American and European Oak refill casks as well as casks that have been deeply charred especially.

Aberlour 18 Year Old 1993 Dimensions (.palate: Spicy and thick, citrus zest, grapefruit, lemon oil and marzipan.
Aberlour 18 Year Old 1993 Dimensions (.name: Aberlour 18 Year Old 1993   Dimensions (duncan Taylor)
Aberlour 18 Year Old 1993 Dimensions (.notes: citrus, lemon, fruity, zest, apple, pepper, spicy, peppery, cinnamon, marzipan, toffee, custard
Aberlour 18 Year Old 1993 Dimensions (.nose: Peppery and fruity nose with toffee apple, melon and custard. Some cereal sweetness, sherried peels and pepper.
Aberlour 18 Year Old 1993 Dimensions (.description: This single cask Aberlour was distilled in November 1993 and it was aged in cask 7371 for 18 years before bottling in November 2011. A release of 277 numbered bottles, bottled for Duncan Taylor's Dimensions series.

Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Year Old 199.palate: A rich, creamy and surprisingly mellow mouth-feel (even at 55.7% ABV!) brings the subdued citrus from the nose to the fore of the palate. This is joined by slightly medicinal peat, more oat cakes and toasted brioche. A drop of water brings out white grape notes too.
Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Year Old 199.name: Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Year Old 1998   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Year Old 199.notes: orange, citrus, apple, peat, oat, toasted, creamy, cream, custard
Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Year Old 199.nose: Crumbly oat cakes topped with lightly smoked cheese and green apple slices right from the get-go. It moves on to seaweed-y peat, honeydew melon, custard creams and a hint of orange oil.
Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Year Old 199.description: Heavily peated single malt Scotch whisky from the Tobermory distillery on the Isle of Mull, drawn from a single refill bourbon cask that was filled in 1998 and matured the whisky for 16 years. We've bottled this as part of our Single Cask range, and it's a top notch dram of coastal, peaty single malt. Get stuck in!

Springbank 18 Year Old Second Edition.palate: Big, spicy and gutsy, with notes of pepper, chilli, pine, aniseed, rich fruits, oily.
Springbank 18 Year Old Second Edition.name: Springbank 18 Year Old Second Edition
Springbank 18 Year Old Second Edition.notes: pine, fruit, fruity, berry, pepper, spicy, peppery, toasted, caramel, cocoa, salty
Springbank 18 Year Old Second Edition.nose: Berry fruits, toasted bananas, caramel, cocoa, peppery, fruity, coastal. Quite oily.
Springbank 18 Year Old Second Edition.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, vanilla, coffee, mineral
Springbank 18 Year Old Second Edition.description: The newly packaged 18 year old Springbank. This is the second edition, with a mauve label, and it was declared by the 2010 World Whiskies Awards to be Best Campbeltown Malt.

Edradour Ballechin #1 Burgundy Cask Matu.palate: Rich, pungent, smoke, thick slab of peat, soft and juicy fruits. Good oak. Latte.
Edradour Ballechin #1 Burgundy Cask Matu.name: Edradour Ballechin #1 Burgundy Cask Matured (the Discovery Series)
Edradour Ballechin #1 Burgundy Cask Matu.notes: oak, fruit, fruity, berry, peat, smoke, nutty, herbal, hay
