Edradour Ballechin #1 Burgundy Cask Matu.nose: Smoke. Hay, berries. Fruitcake. Hint of bitumen, nutty, oily, peat. Herbal.
Edradour Ballechin #1 Burgundy Cask Matu.description: Named for the now silent Ballechin distillery, of which little is known, Ballechin is also the recently-released peated range from Edradour, this bottling has been finished in Burgundy casks.

New Zealand 21 Year Old 1990.palate: Soft spices. Vanilla and creamy caramel. Haystacks and barley.
New Zealand 21 Year Old 1990.name: New Zealand 21 Year Old 1990
New Zealand 21 Year Old 1990.notes: pineapple, spices, barley, creamy, vanilla, caramel
New Zealand 21 Year Old 1990.nose: Toasty intense aromas. Hints of pineapple, rose petal jelly and herbs.
New Zealand 21 Year Old 1990.description: This was distilled at the Willowbank distillery on New Zealand's South Island in 1990. It was then aged for 21 years in cask 90 before bottling in September 2012 by The New Zealand Malt Whisky Company.

Glenfiddich 30 Year Old 2010 Release.palate: Very rich with a mix of dates, peels and nuts from the sherry barrel, and then a surge of vanilla sweetness and oak. Hints of blossom, mixed fruits.
Glenfiddich 30 Year Old 2010 Release.name: Glenfiddich 30 Year Old 2010 Release
Glenfiddich 30 Year Old 2010 Release.notes: wood, oak, fruit, nut, nuts, vanilla, toffee, cocoa, coffee, espresso, honey
Glenfiddich 30 Year Old 2010 Release.nose: Cocoa, espresso coffee, oak, malt, hints of very rich sherry. A perfect Glenfiddich, with predominance of sublime oak.
Glenfiddich 30 Year Old 2010 Release.note categories: wood, fruits, nuts, vanilla, coffee, feint
Glenfiddich 30 Year Old 2010 Release.description: A brand new edition of Glenfiddich 30, this was release in 2010 and comes in a stunning wooden box, as well as having a very stylish bottle. During its maturation (in Bourbon and Oloroso sherry casks) it was carefully watched over by the Glenfiddich Malt Master, and each bottle is now individually numbered.

Longrow 18 Year Old.palate: Peaty with notes of spicy. Very oily, with hints of orange zest, pepper and chili. Very "big". Kippers, smoked meats and honey.
Longrow 18 Year Old.name: Longrow 18 Year Old
Longrow 18 Year Old.notes: orange, apple, zest, pepper, spicy, chili, peat, earthy, smoke, oat, honey
Longrow 18 Year Old.nose: Apple peels, and smoke. Earthy peat, damp leaves, notes of truffle, woodshed, porridge oats and soot.
Longrow 18 Year Old.description: A double distilled, heavily peated single malt from Springbank, Longrow was first created as an experiment to make a peated whisky in Campbeltown, but today it has become very popular, thanks to its brazen, muscular character.

Green Spot Single Pot Still.palate: Spicy and soft, gentle bourbon oak, green woods, menthol, potpourri.
Green Spot Single Pot Still.name: Green Spot Single Pot Still
Green Spot Single Pot Still.notes: wood, oak, citrus, spicy, barley, creamy, vanilla
Green Spot Single Pot Still.nose: Hints of peppermint, malt, sweet barley, sugary porridge, creamy vanilla, papaya and citrus.
Green Spot Single Pot Still.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla
Green Spot Single Pot Still.description: A wonderful single pot still whiskey, Green Spot is fabulous stuff, and much loved by the critics.

Master Of Malt Lowland Single Malt.palate: Very floral - rose petals, apple blossom. It has a lift of ginger spice which perks up a soft core of fruit and barley. Very balanced and soft.
Master Of Malt Lowland Single Malt.name: Master Of Malt Lowland Single Malt
Master Of Malt Lowland Single Malt.notes: oak, fruit, fruity, apple, spice, praline, barley, floral
Master Of Malt Lowland Single Malt.nose: Youthful, very fruity... apple-like even, not dissimilar to Calvados. Very pleasing with sweet, thick notes of jam and praline.
Master Of Malt Lowland Single Malt.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, flowers
Master Of Malt Lowland Single Malt.description: This is the superb Lowland edition in our own range of Secret Bottlings, now newly repackaged. The spirit within was sourced from a secret, though rather famous, Lowland distillery. It flaunts the soft, floral style of the region, and because we don't reveal the distillery's name we can offer this whisky at just a fraction of the price it would be otherwise. Delicious!

mackinlays shackleton rare old highland.palate: Oily and mouth coating but perhaps lighter than expected if you take the time to really immerse yourself in the nose. Orange syrup sings through with that gorgeous peated Dalmore.
mackinlays shackleton rare old highland.name: mackinlays shackleton rare old highland malt the journey whisky
mackinlays shackleton rare old highland.notes: orange, apple, peat, bread, floral, coffee
mackinlays shackleton rare old highland.nose: Crushed apple again for sure, more floral notes too. Freshly baked crusty bread loaf,  lemonade. The more delicate top notes initially hide a complex mix of engine oil, Cornflakes, dumplings, kaffir lime and orange rind.
mackinlays shackleton rare old highland.description:
The 2007 discovery of whisky left in Antarctica by Sir Ernest Shackleton during his famous expedition in the early 1900s led to Richard 'The Nose' Paterson using all his skill and experience to recreate this historic whisky, raising £250,000 for the Antarctic Heritage Trust in the process.

Approached by the charity and Alexandra Shackleton (Ernest's grand-daughter) to produce a second edition of his blended malt to coincide with Tim Jarvis' Shackleton Epic (the first authentic re-enactment of Shackleton's extraordinary Antarctic survival journey of 1916), how could Paterson refuse?

Digging out another rare cask of Glen Mhor (an even older one, this time from 1980), as well as some heavily-peated Dalmore(!), he once again recreated the Shackleton whisky, also using malts from Glenfarclas, Mannochmore, Tamnavulin, Ben Nevis, Aultmore, Fettercairn, Pulteney and Jura.

The resulting masterpiece of blending offers something different, whilst clearly coming from the same lineage as his first lovingly recreated malt. A new and critically-acclaimed interpretation of a truly classic whisky.

Johnnie Walker Blue Label 1l.palate: Supple and balanced. Good toffee and hints of very wistful smoke. Chocolate, hints of grass and a good hit of malt.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label 1l.name: Johnnie Walker Blue Label 1l
Johnnie Walker Blue Label 1l.notes: oak, cedar, citrus, plum, fruit, berry, spice, smoke, chocolate, toffee, floral, honey
Johnnie Walker Blue Label 1l.nose: Fragrant with good body. Notes of oak, crisp spice, dried fruit, pastries. Berry fruits, aniseed, hints of cedar, a touch of spice and citrus.
Johnnie Walker Blue Label 1l.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, feint
Johnnie Walker Blue Label 1l.description: One of the true classic premium blends, Johnnie Walker Blue Label is a rich, malty, slightly peaty blended whisky made from 35 grain and malt whiskies aged for up to 60 years. This is the one litre version.

Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Bourbon C.palate: Almond butter, slightly sweetened with a a dollop of honey. Extra thick double cream, juicy barley and spicy cinnamon sticks. Water brings out comforting notes of salted toffee.
Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Bourbon C.name: Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Bourbon Cask   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Bourbon C.notes: berry, spicy, cinnamon, almond, barley, bread, butter, cream, vanilla, toffee, custard, honey, salt
Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Bourbon C.nose: Vanilla custard, sugary porridge dotted with just a few blueberries and Rolos. Many, many Rolos. Rye bread and touches of barrel char develop after a few minutes in the glass.
Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Bourbon C.note categories: fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, feint, mineral
Bruichladdich 12 Year Old 2002 Bourbon C.description:
From our Master of Malt Single Cask Series comes a brilliant first-fill bourbon cask matured Bruichladdich single malt Scotch whisky, presented at a generous 57.3% ABV. It was distilled on the isle of Islay in July 2002 and set aside to age until November 2014, when we bottled it at 12 years old. 

This superb single malt has been presented in bottles with innovative, air-tight glass closures, which eliminates the chance of cork taint affecting the whisky's flavour profile, and looks rather spiffy. And trust us, you want to experience the full flavour of this one, it's an absolute corker - no pun intended. 

These glass closures are experimental and we're looking for feedback on them - head over to our blog to leave your comments!

114 bottles were produced.

Linkwood 13 Year Old 1998 Un Chillfilt.palate: Thyme, notes of mint, butterscotch and thick, creamy malt. Simple but very enjoyable.
Linkwood 13 Year Old 1998 Un Chillfilt.name: Linkwood 13 Year Old 1998   Un Chillfiltered (signatory)
Linkwood 13 Year Old 1998 Un Chillfilt.nose: Crème caramel, Victoria sandwich, quince jelly, pepper and blackcurrant.
Linkwood 13 Year Old 1998 Un Chillfilt.description: This was distilled at Linkwood on the 5th November 1998. It was aged in bourbon barrels 11769 and 11770 for 13 years before bottling by Signatory on the 13th December 2011. A release of 918 numbered bottles.

Highland Park 24 Year Old 1990 Single.palate: Oaky, smoky bonfire embers continue on the palate. Red delicious apples with the peels still on. Pleasingly oily with a touch of ready salted crisps on the mid palate.
Highland Park 24 Year Old 1990 Single.name: Highland Park 24 Year Old 1990   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Highland Park 24 Year Old 1990 Single.notes: fruity, earth, smoky, smoke, walnut, cream, toffee, salt
Highland Park 24 Year Old 1990 Single.nose: Sweet sea breeze, complimented by buttered popcorn and a little damp earth (Jake says "Petrichor!"). Bonfire smoke, candied peels and perhaps a touch of mint ice cream.
Highland Park 24 Year Old 1990 Single.note categories: fruits, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Highland Park 24 Year Old 1990 Single.description: Oh yes, we've added a 24 year old Highland Park single malt Scotch whisky to our Single Cask Series. The legendary distillery on Orkney set aside this whisky to mature in a single second-fill bourbon cask in May 1990, and 24 years later we bottled it in September 2014 at 57.5% ABV. An absolute gem, this one - a coastal-whisky-lover's dream...

Glenfarclas 1969 Family Cask Release VI.palate: The palate is a thick, malty mouth-filling experience with notes of vanilla cream, butterscotch and rye bread. Hints of black pepper and allspice.
Glenfarclas 1969 Family Cask Release VI.name: Glenfarclas 1969 Family Cask Release VI
Glenfarclas 1969 Family Cask Release VI.notes: pepper, cinnamon, allspice, almond, hazelnut, bread, cream, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee
Glenfarclas 1969 Family Cask Release VI.nose: Sweet and luscious nose with notes of vanilla, almond and hazelnut. Hints of rosy red apples and malt.
Glenfarclas 1969 Family Cask Release VI.description: The sixth release of 1969 Family Cask from Glenfarclas, this time aged in a single sherry hogshead (number 3187) and bottled in 2010. Delicious stuff.

Benriach 32 Year Old 1979 (adelphi).palate: Fresh melon and vanilla ice cream then wood spice that develops warmer notes with the addition of water.
Benriach 32 Year Old 1979 (adelphi).name: Benriach 32 Year Old 1979 (adelphi)
Benriach 32 Year Old 1979 (adelphi).notes: wood, fruit, raisin, fruity, spicy, spice, cream, vanilla, leather, leathery
Benriach 32 Year Old 1979 (adelphi).nose: A fruity nose of dried fruit (notably raisin) and baskets of tropical fruit (particularly melon) with a distinct leathery quality in the background marking this dram's age.
Benriach 32 Year Old 1979 (adelphi).note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, feint
Benriach 32 Year Old 1979 (adelphi).description: Independent bottlers, Adelphi, have bottled this rather fantastic Benriach.

Highland Park Freya 15 Year Old (the V.palate: Woody and fragrant pear. Starfuit too. Smoke, orange peel and proper Turkish delight.
Highland Park Freya 15 Year Old (the V.name: Highland Park Freya   15 Year Old (the Valhalla Collection)
Highland Park Freya 15 Year Old (the V.notes: woody, pine, orange, fruity, peach, spices, smoky, smoke, chocolate, leather
Highland Park Freya 15 Year Old (the V.nose: Chamomile, orange, papaya, leather strips, grapefruit, peach, pine, pear skin, cardamom, fruity smoke and a touch of heather. White chocolate and freeze-dried strawberries.
Highland Park Freya 15 Year Old (the V.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, feint
Highland Park Freya 15 Year Old (the V.description:
STRICTLY 1 PER CUSTOMER

The third release in Highland Park's The Valhalla Collection is the Freya, a 15 year old single malt Scotch whisky named after the Norse Goddess of Love. Wise, sensitive and with a magical cloak of feathers that creates the Northern Lights above Orkney, Freya was a valiant protector of human souls. 

To match her personality, Highland Park have created a suitably sensual and delicious whisky with a hint of Orkney smoke to bear the Freya name.

Yamazaki 12 Year Old.palate: Smooth and soft with good sweetness and winter spice. A lovely citrus note develops with more tropical fruit notes and a little rum.
Yamazaki 12 Year Old.name: Yamazaki 12 Year Old
Yamazaki 12 Year Old.notes: citrus, fruit, zest, spice, nut, floral
Yamazaki 12 Year Old.nose: Good body with plenty of nut oils and zest, a pleasant floral character with a little tropical fruit and a rooty note.
Yamazaki 12 Year Old.description: This 12 year old from Yamazaki first came onto the market in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.

Edradour 11 Year Old 2000 Port Wood Fini.palate: The palate is smooth and creamy with broad red fruit flavours.
Edradour 11 Year Old 2000 Port Wood Fini.name: Edradour 11 Year Old 2000 Port Wood Finish   Straight From The Cask
Edradour 11 Year Old 2000 Port Wood Fini.nose: Red wine gums, toffee and macerated raspberries.
Edradour 11 Year Old 2000 Port Wood Fini.description: This is a portwood finished Edradour that has been aged for eleven years and bottled at natural cask strength.

Bowmore 16 Year Old 1990 Sherry Matured.palate: Perfume, fruity and sherried. Mochaccino, floral. Peat.
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1990 Sherry Matured.name: Bowmore 16 Year Old 1990 Sherry Matured
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1990 Sherry Matured.notes: woody, fruity, peat, smoky, floral, hay, coffee, espresso
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1990 Sherry Matured.nose: Dry sherry, woody. Smoky espresso, dry hay, phenols, bitumen.
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1990 Sherry Matured.description: A 1990 vintage from the Bowmore distillery, bottled at cask strength, this 16 year old was matured in Oloroso sherry casks and the sherry notes really shine through with enough strength to match up to the Bowmore characteristics.

Caperdonich 37 Year Old 1972 The Octav.palate: Very fruity and sweet. Estery even. Hints of iodine. Big on spices, berries.
Caperdonich 37 Year Old 1972 The Octav.name: Caperdonich 37 Year Old 1972   The Octave (duncan Taylor)
Caperdonich 37 Year Old 1972 The Octav.notes: citrus, fruit, fruity, berry, spicy, spices, herbal, hay
Caperdonich 37 Year Old 1972 The Octav.nose: Orchard fruits, Bramley apples, cut hay, herbal, citrus, tangy, rich.
Caperdonich 37 Year Old 1972 The Octav.description: A rare 1972 vintage from one of Scotland's lost distilleries. This was matured in a standard cask before a three month finish in a special sherry Octave. This gave the whisky some added richness. Bottled by Duncan Taylor.

Glenallachie 38 Year Old 1972 Cask 6498.palate: Complex, balanced. Plenty of sweet spice, chewy oak with all the requisite vanilla sweetness, a touch of
Glenallachie 38 Year Old 1972 Cask 6498.name: Glenallachie 38 Year Old 1972 Cask 6498   Old Malt Cask (douglas Laing)
Glenallachie 38 Year Old 1972 Cask 6498.notes: oak, apple, spice, butter, vanilla, toffee
Glenallachie 38 Year Old 1972 Cask 6498.nose: Aromatic and crisp with clean delivery of toffee apple on toast on hot granary toast - with a hint of melted butter.
Glenallachie 38 Year Old 1972 Cask 6498.description: This was distilled at the Glenallachie distillery in March of 1972 and aged for 38 years in cask 6498 (a refill butt) before bottling by Douglas Laing in August 2010. A release of 384 bottles.

Big Peat.palate: Simple, easy going, but delicious. Notes of heavy smoke, cut grass, peanut, spices and peat.
Big Peat.name: Big Peat
Big Peat.notes: cedar, spices, cinnamon, peat, smoke, peanut, almond, walnut, chocolate, coffee
Big Peat.nose: Warm slabs of tangy peat. Hints of chocolate, coffee and cedar with spices, walnuts and almond. A touch of cinnamon with oily smoke.
Big Peat.note categories: wood, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, coffee
Big Peat.description: A big bodied blended malt from Islay. It comprises malt whisky from Coal Ila, Bowmore, Ardbeg and Port Ellen. Big Peat is a great whisky with lots of peaty character.

The Glenlivet 35 Year Old 1977 (cask 857.palate: Incredibly sweet with notes of demerara sugar, barley and candied orange peel.
The Glenlivet 35 Year Old 1977 (cask 857.name: The Glenlivet 35 Year Old 1977 (cask 8574)   Directors' Cut (douglas Laing)
The Glenlivet 35 Year Old 1977 (cask 857.notes: orange, fruity, zest, barley, vanilla, leather, honey
The Glenlivet 35 Year Old 1977 (cask 857.nose: An aroma of Seville orange zest and Acacia honey forms a vibrantly fresh nose.
The Glenlivet 35 Year Old 1977 (cask 857.description: This is a Director's Cut bottling of a sherry cask Glenlivet bottled at 35 years of age by Douglas Laing. This is a fresh and fruity cask-strength bottling with great depth of flavour.

Aisla T'orten 105 Year Old 1906 Liquid.palate: Heaven is spelt “T-O-R-T-E-N”. This conjures up flavours from yesteryear. It is history in a glass. An eruption of rich calves’ leather and mahogany, it reminds me of that extraordinary feeling of stepping into the Sistine Chapel; it has a true sense of provenance. There is smoke, but it does not overstep its mark; there is thick, creamy malt, but it is not cloying; there is sherry, but the whisky is not too dry. There is an array of vanilla, exotic spices such as cardamom and nutmeg, there are hints of toffee, cut hay, and sweet chestnut. And these flavours continue to develop over the palate.
Aisla T'orten 105 Year Old 1906 Liquid.name: Aisla T'orten 105 Year Old 1906   Liquid History (master Of Malt)
Aisla T'orten 105 Year Old 1906 Liquid.notes: wood, oak, pepper, spices, nutmeg, smoke, walnut, creamy, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee, bouquet, hay, coffee, leather
Aisla T'orten 105 Year Old 1906 Liquid.nose: The most unique bouquet I’ve ever experienced. This whisky is robust, powerful, melodious, and utterly graceful. A sublime mix of heady Oloroso, caked with an oaked intensity which peaks on wood varnish, coffee beans, black pepper, potpourri and butterscotch. The malt is so muscular and the grains of the oak are so very well refined. I am completely blown away, I’m left speechless.
Aisla T'orten 105 Year Old 1906 Liquid.note categories: wood, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, coffee, feint
Aisla T'orten 105 Year Old 1906 Liquid.description:
OK everyone, we have to come clean! The miraculous discovery of this 105 year old whisky may have had something to do with its launch on April Fools’ Day 2011.

It’s also possible that some sneaky anagrams were used in some of the names in the story:

Allie Sisell (the discoverer of the cask): Lies, All Lies…

Aethenias Simonvent (the distillery’s founder): This is not even a name!

And there’s a good chance that if you rearrange the letters in Aisla T’Orten distillery you get: It’s not a real distillery.

To read more in the follow-up blog post  click here .

North British 20 Year Old 1994 Single.palate: Everything feels wider and clearer on the palate, tangibly bigger. Foam bananas, floral fudge, masses of vanilla, dried coconut. Sweet, a little spicy, just what the doctor ordered.
North British 20 Year Old 1994 Single.name: North British 20 Year Old 1994   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
North British 20 Year Old 1994 Single.nose: Fudge. Sweet fudge, and icing sugar and squished bananas and fudge. Some nutmeg, sure, a little lavender even, and delicious clotted cream fudge.
North British 20 Year Old 1994 Single.description: If this grain whisky had managed to Stay Another Day or two out of the cask before being filled, it would have seen Christmas 1994 before beginning its 20 year maturation in a refill bourbon barrel. Disgorged in April 2015, it's a joyous release of 115 bottles of textbook grain yumminess at a natural cask strength of 51.7% abv.

Darkness! Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Ye.palate: Robust, mouth coating peat that's all pervading. That's a good thing, like a warming peaty hug. Grapefruit too, and a touch of mandarin orange.
Darkness! Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Ye.name: Darkness! Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish
Darkness! Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Ye.notes: orange, fruit, berry, peat, oat, barley
Darkness! Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Ye.nose: Well, well. Peaty red Jelly Babies. Robinsons Fruit & Barley Summer Fruits. Freshly picked berries in a cardboard punnet.
Darkness! Tobermory Heavily Peated 16 Ye.description: An intense, Sherried, heavily peated 16 year old Tobermory single malt, bottled as part of the Darkness! range. This whisky was given a finishing period in a specially coopered, 50 litre Oloroso Sherry cask, bringing lip-smacking fruit notes to the table, blending excellently with the big, bold peat surging through its core.

English Whisky Co. Chapter 9.palate: Sweet and very rounded, almost a hint of white chocolate. Very interesting smoke, has a lovely heat to it, reminds us of striking up a match, so thick and creamy, and very, very malty. Notes of vanilla, and butterscotch angel delight.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 9.name: English Whisky Co. Chapter 9
English Whisky Co. Chapter 9.notes: nutmeg, peat, smoky, smoke, creamy, chocolate, vanilla, butterscotch, toffee, coffee
English Whisky Co. Chapter 9.nose: Oily and quite robust. Smoky bacon. Hints of sticking plasters, some toffee. A sort of Caol Ila nose, nice gristy sweetness. A touch tropical with a little papaya and coconut ice, then a hint of nougat.
English Whisky Co. Chapter 9.description: This is English whisky with a difference! This is the first ever peated English single malt, and it tastes incredible. Its power and balance belie its years. This was distilled in May 2007 and bottled in May 2010.

Macallan 1970 Speymalt (gordon & Macph.palate: Hot Christmas cake, bursting with delicious, warming spices.
Macallan 1970 Speymalt (gordon & Macph.name: Macallan 1970   Speymalt (gordon & Macphail)
Macallan 1970 Speymalt (gordon & Macph.nose: Sherried sweetness from the outset, with notes of spiced rum and a smattering of marzipan.
Macallan 1970 Speymalt (gordon & Macph.description: This 1970 Macallan single malt Scotch whisky, which was matured in a sherry butt, has been bottled by Gordon and MacPhail for their Speymalt series, a collection of whiskies which honour the fantastic distillery from Speyside.

Caol Ila 10 Year Old Unpeated Style (200.palate: Massive body, rich and oily (in true Caol Ila style), big tangy fruit notes, sweetness, punchy oak, citrus tang.
Caol Ila 10 Year Old Unpeated Style (200.name: Caol Ila 10 Year Old Unpeated Style (2009 Release)
Caol Ila 10 Year Old Unpeated Style (200.notes: woody, oak, citrus, fruit, fruity, pepper, spices, custard, herbal
Caol Ila 10 Year Old Unpeated Style (200.nose: Quite sweet and tangy. Fruity, custard, orchard fruits, citrus. Dry after a time.
Caol Ila 10 Year Old Unpeated Style (200.description: A punchy cask strength release, it's at 65.8%! This is an unpeated expression from the Caol Ila distillery. They make this stuff but once a year, and is matured in first fill bourbon barrels.

Blended Whisky #1 Batch 2 (that Boutiq.palate: Spicy with cinnamon sweeties as it opens. Develops a malty richness, complimented by runny honey and black cherry. A little bit of smoke appears on the mid-palate.
Blended Whisky #1 Batch 2 (that Boutiq.name: Blended Whisky #1   Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Blended Whisky #1 Batch 2 (that Boutiq.notes: orange, cherry, spicy, cinnamon, spices, smoke, herbaceous, coffee, honey
Blended Whisky #1 Batch 2 (that Boutiq.nose: Coffee beans, candied orange peels and a warming whiff of herbaceous tobacco. A touch of lilac and seaside fudge brings subtle sweetness after a minute. You may even catch a hint of cured ham...
Blended Whisky #1 Batch 2 (that Boutiq.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, flowers, coffee, feint
Blended Whisky #1 Batch 2 (that Boutiq.description:
The second batch of That Boutique-y Whisky Company's blended whisky number 1 - the World's Best Blended Whisky! (WWA 2015) The concept, as shown on the label, is deliciously smooth and round whisky, free from any pesky spiky bits.

This is a release of 417 bottles. 

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic novel-style labels.

Arran Premium Single Cask 1996 (cask 196.palate: Hazelnut and allspice, hints of peppermint and butterscotch. Mixed herbs, ground mixed nuts and caramel.
Arran Premium Single Cask 1996 (cask 196.name: Arran Premium Single Cask 1996 (cask 1963)   Sherry Cask
Arran Premium Single Cask 1996 (cask 196.notes: oak, fruit, berry, spices, allspice, nut, nuts, hazelnut, toasted, butterscotch, vanilla, caramel, custard, coffee
Arran Premium Single Cask 1996 (cask 196.nose: Rich sherried peels and fruit, a little vanilla custard, allspice, toasted oak and mixed herbs. Pralines.
Arran Premium Single Cask 1996 (cask 196.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, vanilla, coffee
Arran Premium Single Cask 1996 (cask 196.description: This was distilled at the Arran distillery on the 11th December 1996 before a maturation in a single sherry cask (number 1963). It was then bottled at cask-strength on the 1st October 2012 and is part of a release of just 237 numbered bottles.

Benriach 22 Year Old 1990 Tawny Port Pip.palate: Thick, rich palate with dried herbs and cracked black pepper. Hints of sage, cocoa and cherry.
Benriach 22 Year Old 1990 Tawny Port Pip.name: Benriach 22 Year Old 1990 Tawny Port Pipe
Benriach 22 Year Old 1990 Tawny Port Pip.notes: cherry, fruity, apple, pepper, spicy, spice, barley, cocoa
Benriach 22 Year Old 1990 Tawny Port Pip.nose: Fresh, spicy nose with a touch of cranberry, sticking plasters, boiled sweets and barley sugar.
Benriach 22 Year Old 1990 Tawny Port Pip.description: This is a 22 year old, single cask BenRiach which was distilled in 1990 and finished in a cask which previous held maturing tawny port. Very fruity and rich.

Strathisla 1965 (gordon & Macphail).palate: There is a fruitiness on the palate off-set with denser sweet sherry notes and an almost imperceptible hint of smoke.
Strathisla 1965 (gordon & Macphail).name: Strathisla 1965 (gordon & Macphail)
Strathisla 1965 (gordon & Macphail).nose: Toffee, vanilla and fleshy dried fruits with a hint of pineapple and thyme.
Strathisla 1965 (gordon & Macphail).description: This is 1965 Strathisla bottled by Gordon and MacPhail. Strathisla is predominately used in the Chivas Regal blend however the single malt is exceptional if you can find a bottle.

Arran Lochranza Reserve.palate: The salty sea air notes grow slightly on the palate, balanced with plenty of juicy citrus and sweet toffee pennies. Hints of oak spice.
Arran Lochranza Reserve.name: Arran Lochranza Reserve
Arran Lochranza Reserve.notes: oak, citrus, lemon, spice, barley, creamy, milk, chocolate, toffee, salty
Arran Lochranza Reserve.nose: Fresh green apples, lemon peels and a hint of milk chocolate. A touch of golden barley and sea breeze too.
Arran Lochranza Reserve.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Arran Lochranza Reserve.description: A citrus-y, light and elegant no-age-statement single malt Scotch whisky from the distillery on the Isle of Arran. The Lochranza Reserve replaced the Arran Original in mid-2014. The name comes from the village on the Isle of Arran where the distillery is located.

Longmorn 16 Year Old 1996 (cask 40779).palate: Big and citrusy, with soft malt, Sherbet lemons, custard, rhubarb crumble.
Longmorn 16 Year Old 1996 (cask 40779).name: Longmorn 16 Year Old 1996 (cask 40779)   (signatory)
Longmorn 16 Year Old 1996 (cask 40779).notes: oak, cedar, pine, citrus, lemon, fruity, custard
Longmorn 16 Year Old 1996 (cask 40779).nose: A fruity, aromatic nose with green apples, gooseberries, tangy, zesty citrus, tannic oak, cedar and pine resin.
Longmorn 16 Year Old 1996 (cask 40779).description: A 16 year old Longmorn distilled on the 7th March 1996, aged in a refill butt before bottling on the 23rd May 2012. A release of 887 bottles from Signatory.

Paul John Peated Select Cask.palate: More BBQ smoke, more sugar, more slightly damp earthy notes. Hints of tropical fruit and spice.
Paul John Peated Select Cask.name: Paul John Peated Select Cask
Paul John Peated Select Cask.notes: orange, fruit, spice, peat, earthy, smoke, walnut, barley, salt
Paul John Peated Select Cask.nose: Walnut, barley sugar sweets and classic earthy peat notes. A touch of salt.
Paul John Peated Select Cask.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, nuts, cereal, mineral
Paul John Peated Select Cask.description: Peated whisky from the Paul John range of single malts produced in Goa. This particular expression was matured in ex-bourbon barrels before being bottled at cask strength (a pleasing 55.5% ABV) without chill filtration. A prime example of the gorgeous whisky distilleries in India are producing.

Johnnie Walker Double Black.palate: Good body and very creamy with a sublimely malty core. It offers up a surprising level of peat smoke which works really well. Creamy sweetness, hints of soft wood smoke, salty butter, custard and cereal grains.
Johnnie Walker Double Black.name: Johnnie Walker Double Black
Johnnie Walker Double Black.notes: wood, citrus, pepper, peat, smoky, smoke, butter, creamy, vanilla, custard, salty
Johnnie Walker Double Black.nose: Slightly smoky and almost medicinal on the nose, it offers up hints of vanilla, a little tar, a touch of barbecue sauce, citrus and malt.
Johnnie Walker Double Black.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Johnnie Walker Double Black.description: A very special 2011 edition of Johnnie Walker's classic blend, Black Label. Double Black was originally released to the travel retail market, and it combines the rich, malty flavour of Black Label with slightly peatier whisky and casks that were more heavily charred. The result is a toasty, smoky whisky with Johnnie Walker's usual rich, malty core - very good indeed.

Craigellachie 8 Year Old 2006 Single C.palate: Continued meatiness, though not as prominent as on the nose. Green apple boiled sweeties and freshly popped popcorn (sweet, not buttered).
Craigellachie 8 Year Old 2006 Single C.name: Craigellachie 8 Year Old 2006   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Craigellachie 8 Year Old 2006 Single C.notes: oak, apple, smoke, barley, milk, chocolate, coffee
Craigellachie 8 Year Old 2006 Single C.nose: Milk chocolate buttons, coffee beans and blackberries. Wafts of golden barley and then some classic Craigellachie meatiness (think ham).
Craigellachie 8 Year Old 2006 Single C.note categories: wood, fruits, earth, cereal, chocolate, coffee
Craigellachie 8 Year Old 2006 Single C.description: A classic, meaty Craigellachie that perfectly showcases the distillery character, which is partly down to their use of traditional worm tub condensers. This single cask also exhibits impressive complexity for its years as well as plenty of flavoursome punch at a natural cask strength of 64.1%. Distilled in October 2006 and bottled in April 2015, it spent 8 years in a refill Sherry cask. Just 83 bottles are available.

bunnahabhain ceobanach whisky.palate: Maritime notes of sea-breeze and a touch of tarry rope. This is joined by wood spices, creamy citrus and peppery touches on the mid-palate.
bunnahabhain ceobanach whisky.name: bunnahabhain ceobanach whisky
bunnahabhain ceobanach whisky.notes: wood, citrus, lemon, peppery, spices, peat, earthy, smoky, creamy, vanilla
bunnahabhain ceobanach whisky.nose: The peat's not shy in this one - up-front earthy smokiness, with lemon peel, vanilla and buttery biscuits developing around it.
bunnahabhain ceobanach whisky.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla
bunnahabhain ceobanach whisky.description: For the Ceòbanach (pronounced 'kyaw-bin-och'), the Bunnahabhain distillers have taken inspiration from the days when the distillery used to produced heavily peated spirit. Meaning 'Smoky mist' in Scots Gaelic, Ceòbanach certainly packs a rich, smoky profile that classic Islay whisky fans will want to pay attention to. It was matured in ex-bourbon casks and bottled without chill-filtration.

Penderyn Madeira Finish.palate: Thick and sweet, spices, green, biscuity. Custard.
Penderyn Madeira Finish.name: Penderyn Madeira Finish
Penderyn Madeira Finish.nose: Sweet, medium body. Herbal, vanilla, sweetness, resin, sultanas, toast. Over-ripe grape.
Penderyn Madeira Finish.description: The core expression at the heart of the Penderyn range, this was finished in Madeira casks. A beautifully packaged Welsh whisky.

Nikka Whisky From The Barrel Cocktail Se.palate: Rich, creamy notes of Autumnal fruit, oak, cinnamon and crème caramel. A touch of smoke, notes of apple strudel and malt.
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel Cocktail Se.name: Nikka Whisky From The Barrel Cocktail Set
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel Cocktail Se.notes: oak, fruit, apple, pepper, spicy, cinnamon, allspice, smoke, creamy, caramel, toffee, floral
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel Cocktail Se.nose: Floral and fresh with notes of cinnamon and allspice, hints of light oak, punchy notes of pepper with a creamy caramel sweetness.
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel Cocktail Se.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, flowers
Nikka Whisky From The Barrel Cocktail Se.description: We've said it before - many times in fact - Nikka's Whisky from the Barrel is staggeringly good stuff, with just the right balance of toffee sweetness and rich malty flavour and a tinge of smoke for complexity and depth. Here it is in gift set format, complete with a handsome pourer and a cocktail glass.

Pig's Nose.palate: Creamy and sweet. Soft, gentle, quite gristy, rather oily and slightly coastal. Hints of salt.
Pig's Nose.name: Pig's Nose
Pig's Nose.notes: fruit, barley, creamy, caramel, salty, salt
Pig's Nose.nose: Gristy and youthful, some fruit, barley malt, porridge. Young but very sweet.
Pig's Nose.description: A great value, smooth 5 year old blended whisky from the creators of the 'Sheep Dip' range. It's as 'smooth as a pig's nose', it is. Created by Richard Paterson.

Longmorn 12 Year Old (gordon And Macph.palate: The spices develop on the palate, gaining a peppery quality. Fruit cake sits in the background, bursting with raisins and figs.
Longmorn 12 Year Old (gordon And Macph.name: Longmorn 12 Year Old   (gordon And Macphail)
Longmorn 12 Year Old (gordon And Macph.notes: fruit, raisin, fruity, peppery, spices, spice
Longmorn 12 Year Old (gordon And Macph.nose: The sherry cask maturation is felt right from the start with a richly intense nose, brimming with spice and fruity aromas. Cracking!
Longmorn 12 Year Old (gordon And Macph.description: A classic label for a classy whisky. This 12 year old Longmorn single malt Scotch whisky has been given a snazzy make-over by Gordon and MacPhail as part of their Distillery Labels series of independent bottlings. The whisky is matured in refill sherry butts.

Auchroisk 23 Year Old 1990 Single Cask.palate: Big; a full on whisky. Nutty and bold, cream sweetness with more vanilla.
Auchroisk 23 Year Old 1990 Single Cask.name: Auchroisk 23 Year Old 1990   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Auchroisk 23 Year Old 1990 Single Cask.nose: Vanilla and even crème brulée with big sweetness and malt.
Auchroisk 23 Year Old 1990 Single Cask.description: A relatively young distillery, Auchroisk was founded in 1972 and briefly produced whiskies under the name ‘The Singleton’.  Mainly used in blends, Auchroisk is rarely seen bottled as a Single Malt Scotch Whisky. This single cask was distilled in 1990 and aged for 22 years in a sherry hogshead (that was a bit leaky), the result was just 99 absolutely cracking bottles! Meaty and bold, this is a rare treat indeed.

Highland Park 18 Year Old.palate: Creamy and full with fruit conserves and espresso. A creaminess with cinnamon and allspice. Notes of toffee with thick black forest honey with a touch more citrus.
Highland Park 18 Year Old.name: Highland Park 18 Year Old
Highland Park 18 Year Old.notes: citrus, fruit, cinnamon, allspice, creamy, creaminess, toffee, floral, herbal, espresso, honey
Highland Park 18 Year Old.nose: A profusion of ripe floral notes and fresh blossom with a delectable fruit salad. Notes of honeyed exotic fruits with a little botrytis.
Highland Park 18 Year Old.note categories: fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, coffee, feint
Highland Park 18 Year Old.description: A superb 18 year old from the Highland Park distillery and a winner of a Gold Medal at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

Tullibardine 26 Year Old 1989 Single C.palate: Toasted cornflakes develops into crunchy Ryvita, then the fruitiness emerges with fresh mango. Soon enough, it becomes all about glorious baking spices.
Tullibardine 26 Year Old 1989 Single C.name: Tullibardine 26 Year Old 1989   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Tullibardine 26 Year Old 1989 Single C.notes: oak, citrus, fruit, fruity, mango, spicy, spices, toasted, bread
Tullibardine 26 Year Old 1989 Single C.nose: Cereal rich, Farley's Rusks, banana bread. Quite grassy and oily too, citrus, nettle tea. Pineapple-y marmalade develops, as does soft white-chocolate-chip cookies.
Tullibardine 26 Year Old 1989 Single C.description: We're proud to introduce a 26 year old Tullibardine single malt Scotch whisky to our very own Single Cask Series! Though Tullibardine doesn't come up in conversation all that often, we really think it should - they produce some fantastic Highland whisky, often big and rich in golden malt goodness and vibrant fruit. This 26 year old single cask bottling was distilled back in April 1989 and bottled in April 2015 at 53.7% ABV.

Glenfarclas 1974 Family Cask.palate: Honey, dried fruits, citrus, beeswax, oaky.
Glenfarclas 1974 Family Cask.name: Glenfarclas 1974 Family Cask
Glenfarclas 1974 Family Cask.notes: oak, citrus, fruit, spice, nutty, barley, toasted, caramel, herbal, honey
Glenfarclas 1974 Family Cask.nose: Rich, caramel, nutty. Gentle salinity. Caramel, mint.
Glenfarclas 1974 Family Cask.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, vanilla, flowers, feint
Glenfarclas 1974 Family Cask.description: A golden coloured whisky, this Family Cask was distilled in 1974 and matured in cask number 5786, a sherry butt.

Secret Distillery Number One Batch 1 (.palate: Rich palate entry. Notes of peppery oak and ground almond. Hints of pralines, dark chocolate and brandy butter. Very intense sherry notes. Spices develop.
Secret Distillery Number One Batch 1 (.name: Secret Distillery Number One   Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Secret Distillery Number One Batch 1 (.notes: oak, peppery, spices, smoke, nutty, almond, butter, chocolate, coffee
Secret Distillery Number One Batch 1 (.nose: Big, creaking oak and sherry on the nose. Hints of soft smoke, black coffee and dates. Very inviting!
Secret Distillery Number One Batch 1 (.note categories: wood, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, coffee
Secret Distillery Number One Batch 1 (.description:
This is a superb single malt whisky from one of Speyside's most famous distilleries, bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company. Whilst we can't tell you which distillery it is from, we can say that it is one known for its independence and for its massively sherried whiskies.

The label is adorned with a comic book-style illustration of a sneaky man breaking through the famous red doors of one of the distillery's warehouses to pinch maturing whisky from a cask!

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

This is Batch 1 - a release of 486 bottles.

Penderyn Madeira 41.palate: Light palate entry with hints of dried herbs and malt. A little Peach Melba.
Penderyn Madeira 41.name: Penderyn Madeira 41
Penderyn Madeira 41.nose: Rich, caramel-like aromas, with notes of soft sweetness, orange peel, vanilla and crackling spices.
Penderyn Madeira 41.description: This is a very interesting whisky from Penderyn - aged in bourbon casks initially and finished in Madeira wine casks, this was bottled at the lower strength of 41%abv, thus the name. An interesting experiment.

Glenturret 17 Year Old 1994 Old Malt C.palate: Nectarines and apricots at first before a big dose of toffee wanders on to the palate.
Glenturret 17 Year Old 1994 Old Malt C.name: Glenturret 17 Year Old 1994   Old Malt Cask  20cl (douglas Laing)
Glenturret 17 Year Old 1994 Old Malt C.notes: spice, nut, nuts, barley, toffee, leather
Glenturret 17 Year Old 1994 Old Malt C.nose: Soft leather, mixed nuts, malt and barley sugar.
Glenturret 17 Year Old 1994 Old Malt C.description:
This is a seventeen year old bottling of Glenturret by Douglas Laing's Old Malt Cask Range.

The Old Malt Cask range began as a release of fifty bottlings in 1998 to commemorate Douglas Laing's fiftieth anniversary. Today they offer many, many more. All bottlings in the range are non-chill filtered and contain no naughty colouring.

Brora Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisky.palate: Whoosh! Big sooty notes lead but there's still plenty of fruit to savour, more fruit salad, melon, orange, kiwi, balanced with salinity.
Brora Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisky.name: Brora   Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Brora Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisky.notes: orange, fruit, fruity, smoke, caramel, lead
Brora Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisky.nose: Vibrant and fruity at first, dried apricot, fruit salad with Tunnock's Caramel wafers. The grassy straw notes and hint of smoke you may expect are still very much here though, adding complexity, with greater coastal salinity and smoke developing in the glass.
Brora Batch 2 (that Boutique Y Whisky.description:
It is well known that whisky from the closed Brora distillery are the (wild)cat's pyjamas and rare as hen's teeth, which is why we're sure many ears will perk up at the sound of this: Batch 2 of Brora single malt bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company. Look, the fearsome cat on the label - a reference to Brora's intense, muscular flavour profile - is even cheering with excitement. Or is that anger? Why is smoke coming out of its nose like an enraged cartoon bull? Oh dear... We should run. Now. 

Batch 2 is a small release of just 42 bottles.

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, blended malts, blends and bourbons from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Br2 Elements Of Islay (bruichladdich).palate: The honeyed notes continue balanced by more apples and some cirtus with a fairly light peat.
Br2 Elements Of Islay (bruichladdich).name: Br2   Elements Of Islay (bruichladdich)
Br2 Elements Of Islay (bruichladdich).nose: Green apples and bananas on the nose with a good dollop of honey.
Br2 Elements Of Islay (bruichladdich).description: The second release from this distillery in the Elements of Islay range, Br2 carries on from the regular characteristics of the distillery with a fruity and honeyed dram.

Dalmore 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 7152).palate: Fruity and spiced. Cinnamon bagels, Seville marmalade and treacle.
Dalmore 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 7152).name: Dalmore 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 7152)   Directors' Cut (douglas Laing)
Dalmore 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 7152).notes: fruity, cinnamon, almond, barley, toasted, custard, coffee
Dalmore 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 7152).nose: Custard, stewed rhubarb, barley sugar, cinnamon and golden syrup. A little toasted almond.
Dalmore 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 7152).note categories: fruits, spice, nuts, cereal, vanilla, coffee
Dalmore 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 7152).description: A fabulous single cask Dalmore, distilled in April 1990 and aged in sherry butt DL7152 for 21 years before bottling in August of 2011. This comes from Douglas Laing's wonderful Director's Cut range, and there are just 297 bottles of the stuff…

Glenfarclas 1970 Family Cask.palate: Thick, chewy. Sherry. Fruit, ripe and lush. Rum spice. Pepper.
Glenfarclas 1970 Family Cask.name: Glenfarclas 1970 Family Cask
Glenfarclas 1970 Family Cask.notes: oak, fruit, fruity, allspice, pepper, spicy, cinnamon, spice, toasted
Glenfarclas 1970 Family Cask.nose: Rich, spicy. Thick, fruity malt loaf. Toasted cinnamon buns, rum. Stem ginger in syrup. Sherry, pepper.
Glenfarclas 1970 Family Cask.description: This Family Cask bottling was distilled in 1970 and matured in single cask number 566, a sherry butt. A powerful, darkly fruity Glenfarclas which was bottled on the 28th February 2007 as part of a release of 497 bottles.

The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 6.palate: Toffee apples and chamois leather. A drop of water here reveals thicker, chewy toffees, great mouthfeel, a generous sprinkling of nutmeg and a little cinnamon alongside praline, which becomes nut toffee or peanut crunch towards the tail.
The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 6.name: The Lost Distilleries Blend   Batch 6
The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 6.notes: oak, lemon, apple, nutmeg, cinnamon, smoke, peanut, nut, praline, nutty, vanilla, toffee, leather, honey, salt, lead
The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 6.nose: A little green apple and then manuka honey lead the way, with the depth of this blend soon becoming apparent. Grassy sand dunes, lemon, dried coconut and papaya develop, adding complexity to the bag of gorgeous vanilla fudge you now hold in your hand.
The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 6.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, vanilla, feint, mineral
The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 6.description:
A truly extraordinary award-winning series continues - behold, Batch 6 of the Lost Distilleries Blend. This spectacular blended Scotch whisky is produced solely using whiskies from some of the most renowned, though sadly closed, Scottish distilleries and the result is a dram that undoubtedly lives up to their lofty legacies. 

Batch 6 features malt whiskies from Mosstowie, Port Ellen, Glenisla, Imperial, Caperdonich, Glen Mhor and Brora, and grain whiskies from Port Dundas. All are ennobled and celebrated in their own right, with surviving stocks of their spirit becoming scarcer year on year. The Lost Distilleries Blend honours these gone-but-not-forgotten greats with impeccable balance and a sublime flavour profile worthy of their names. 

This is a limited release of 534 bottles.

The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 5.palate: Further complexity is revealed on a glorious palate of summer berries in vanilla cream, orange blossom water, caramelised red apples, warming, rich oak and a hint of the ocean as well as a touch of smoke.
The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 5.name: The Lost Distilleries Blend   Batch 5
The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 5.notes: oak, orange, fruit, lemon, berry, cinnamon, smoky, smoke, creamy, cream, vanilla, caramel, custard
The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 5.nose: Sea breeze is quickly joined by richness and a little fruit before a big dollop of creamy, vanilla flecked ice cream joins the party. Top notes of cut grass develop alongside caraway, a touch of ash and lemon cake as well as a small sprig of mint and dusting of cinnamon.
The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 5.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla
The Lost Distilleries Blend Batch 5.description:
The fifth batch of this superb and unique whisky from The Blended Whisky Company. Made exclusively using whiskies from some of the most renowned - though sadly now closed - distilleries in Scotland, this series is becoming legendary in itself.

Batch five contains malt whisky from Caperdonich, Rosebank, Imperial, Mosstowie, Brora and Port Ellen, with grain whisky coming from Port Dundas. Desired by enthusiasts and connoisseurs alike, the surviving stock from these distilleries is becoming ever scarcer. The Lost Distilleries Blend proudly exhibits balance and a flavour profile worthy of the illustrious distilleries that make it up.

This is a limited release of just 193 numbered bottles.

Bruichladdich Octomore 04.1.palate: Vanilla, sweet cereals, warm slabs of tangy peat, young maltiness and chili spice. Notes of Nutella spread as well as walnut loaf, caramelised bananas and dark chocolate.
Bruichladdich Octomore 04.1.name: Bruichladdich Octomore 04.1
Bruichladdich Octomore 04.1.notes: chili, spicy, spice, earth, peat, smoke, walnut, chocolate, vanilla, caramel, floral, cocoa
Bruichladdich Octomore 04.1.nose: Peat smoke, burning lavender, warm earth, sage, rosemary, floral notes, some sweetness, vanilla and cocoa.
Bruichladdich Octomore 04.1.note categories: spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, coffee
Bruichladdich Octomore 04.1.description: Peated to 167 PPM, Octomore 4.1 is an intense, unusual whisky from Bruichladdich which Jim Murray awarded a very impressive 92 points, commenting on its chocolate-rich flavour he described it as "Choctomore." As of late 2011, this is the peatiest whisky in the world!

Glenfarclas 1980 Family Cask.palate: Shortbread, buttery toffee. Good sweetness, herbal, cut hay.
Glenfarclas 1980 Family Cask.name: Glenfarclas 1980 Family Cask
Glenfarclas 1980 Family Cask.notes: oak, citrus, fruity, toffee, herbal, hay, leathery
Glenfarclas 1980 Family Cask.description: This Family Cask was distilled at Glenfarclas in 1980. The refill sherry butt has brought about a lovely sweetness, quite biscuity and malty.

Fettercairn 16 Year Old 1995 Old Malt.palate: Sweet and palate-coating with rum spices, madeira cake and hints of soft smoke. Oodles of melted chocolate and malt.
Fettercairn 16 Year Old 1995 Old Malt.name: Fettercairn 16 Year Old 1995   Old Malt Cask (douglas Laing)
Fettercairn 16 Year Old 1995 Old Malt.notes: oak, fruit, raisin, fruity, berry, spices, smoke, cream, chocolate, toffee
Fettercairn 16 Year Old 1995 Old Malt.nose: Fruity with toffee apples, rum and raisin ice cream, blueberry compote, sultanas and oak.
Fettercairn 16 Year Old 1995 Old Malt.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla
Fettercairn 16 Year Old 1995 Old Malt.description: A tasty single cask Fettercairn, distilled in November of 1995 and aged in a refill hogshead before bottling by Douglas Laing in 2011. A release of 314 bottles.

Macduff 2000 (bottled 2013) Connoisseu.palate: Green apple flesh, banana, citrus and a hint of oak.
Macduff 2000 (bottled 2013) Connoisseu.name: Macduff 2000 (bottled 2013)   Connoisseurs Choice (gordon & Macphail)
Macduff 2000 (bottled 2013) Connoisseu.notes: oak, citrus, mango, apple, peach, honey
Macduff 2000 (bottled 2013) Connoisseu.nose: Honey'd and light. Peach, liquorice and mango.
Macduff 2000 (bottled 2013) Connoisseu.description: Marvellous MacDuff single malt, released as part of the Connoisseurs Range from Gordon & MacPhail. This whisky was distilled in 2000 and aged in refill Sherry hogsheads until 2013.

Macallan 21 Year Old 1990 Directors' C.palate: Soft and juicy, with oodles of barley malt, menthol, charred oak, candy canes and nectarine.
Macallan 21 Year Old 1990 Directors' C.name: Macallan 21 Year Old 1990   Directors' Cut (douglas Laing)
Macallan 21 Year Old 1990 Directors' C.notes: oak, peppery, spicy, barley, vanilla, toffee, honey
Macallan 21 Year Old 1990 Directors' C.nose: Rich, thick honey, vanilla fudge and toffee apples. Dried peels, peppermint and light oak.
Macallan 21 Year Old 1990 Directors' C.description: A delicious single cask Macallan, distilled in 1990 and aged for 21 years in a refill hogshead before bottling in August of 2011 for Douglas Laing's Director's Cut range.

Miyagikyo 15 Year Old.palate: Malty, toffeyed, and generically fruity, this is a great session dram – not too heavy, and very pleasing.
Miyagikyo 15 Year Old.name: Miyagikyo 15 Year Old
Miyagikyo 15 Year Old.notes: fruity, apple, spices, spice, vanilla, toffee, floral
Miyagikyo 15 Year Old.nose: Very sweet with vanilla fudge, toffee apple and spice. A straightforward nose, without heaps of complexity, but very charming nonetheless.
Miyagikyo 15 Year Old.description: As you work your way along the Miyagikyo range, you witness the beautiful fruity, floral balance become fuller, and more complex. Jim Murray awarded this a whopping 92 points! It's an incredible malt...

The Macallan Amber 1824 Series.palate: Surprisingly thick and fruity compared to the nose. Golden sultanas, dates, apple peelings and a dusting of cinnamon. Cereal notes on the mid-palate, joined by mince pies with crumbly shortbread.
The Macallan Amber 1824 Series.name: The Macallan Amber   1824 Series
The Macallan Amber 1824 Series.notes: oak, lemon, raisin, fruity, apple, cinnamon, barley, milk, chocolate, vanilla
The Macallan Amber 1824 Series.nose: Soft aromatic vanilla, lemon and barley with hints of ginger. Milk chocolate buttons and hints of Sun-Maid Raisins.
The Macallan Amber 1824 Series.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla
The Macallan Amber 1824 Series.description: Amber is part of The Macallan's new no age statement range of Speyside single malts, which concentrates on colour. The theory is that by using 100% sherry casks and natural colour, the darker the whisky, the older and more complex.

Auchentoshan 44 Year Old 1966.palate: The mouth-feel is incredibly soft and sweet with honey and mead notes followed by a distant herbaceousness.
Auchentoshan 44 Year Old 1966.name: Auchentoshan 44 Year Old 1966
Auchentoshan 44 Year Old 1966.nose: A eucalyptus aroma emerges first followed by acacia honey and Christmas cake.
Auchentoshan 44 Year Old 1966.description: An Auchentoshan from the year England won the World Cup boasting an almighty forty-four years of ageing and presented in a beautiful bottle and box. Grand stuff!

Tyrconnell 10 Year Old Sherry Cask Finis.palate: Delectable and utterly decadent! This dessert in a glass with a hugely authentic note of wonderfully thick Fino sherry. Also hints of tarte tatin and custard.
Tyrconnell 10 Year Old Sherry Cask Finis.name: Tyrconnell 10 Year Old Sherry Cask Finish
Tyrconnell 10 Year Old Sherry Cask Finis.nose: Strong on sherry, it has a strong Fino feel to it, very grape-like, with notes of juicy raisins, golden berries, just a hint of mint.
Tyrconnell 10 Year Old Sherry Cask Finis.description: A 10 year old from the Cooley distillery and an Irish single malt, finished in sherry casks, this is a limited edition Tyrconnell.

Tomatin 40 Year Old 1967 (jim Mcewan's C.palate: Very, very smooth and rounded. Just fills the palate with notes of tropical fruits
Tomatin 40 Year Old 1967 (jim Mcewan's C.name: Tomatin 40 Year Old 1967 (jim Mcewan's Celtic Heartlands)
Tomatin 40 Year Old 1967 (jim Mcewan's C.notes: citrus, fruit, apple, pineapple, spicy, spices, smoke, nut, nuts, creamy, vanilla, caramel
Tomatin 40 Year Old 1967 (jim Mcewan's C.nose: Dark sugar, caramelised banana, vanilla, very creamy and rich. Then apple strudel, with all of those pastry notes, spices and sultanas. Hints of date and marmalade, and then a touch of cigar box. Really enticing, hints of grist too, and citrus, then a touch of smoke.
Tomatin 40 Year Old 1967 (jim Mcewan's C.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla
Tomatin 40 Year Old 1967 (jim Mcewan's C.description: A 40 year old from the Tomatin distillery, a really beautiful looking whisky, in a stunning decanter. This is part of the release five of the Celtic Heartlands range, and there are just 523 of these Tomatin decanters in the world!

Baker's 7 Year Old.palate: Nutty, with good grip. Plenty of tangy fruit with vanilla spice and rounded char.
Baker's 7 Year Old.name: Baker's 7 Year Old
Baker's 7 Year Old.notes: fruit, fruity, spice, nutty, vanilla, caramel, toffee, coffee
Baker's 7 Year Old.nose: Fruity, caramel, toffee, dark fruit, spice.
Baker's 7 Year Old.description: An excellent small batch bourbon, named for the grand nephew of Jim Beam, Baker Beam. This is a well-aged expression which makes use of a special strain of jug yeast which the Beam family have made use of for over 60 years.

the yamazaki single malt whisky distille.palate: The dried berries remain lively on the palate (it even develops some raspberry notes along the way), but they're dialled back a bit to make room for light oak, white peach and a small amount of spice.
the yamazaki single malt whisky distille.name: the yamazaki single malt whisky distillers reserve whisky
the yamazaki single malt whisky distille.notes: oak, fruit, berry, peach, spicy, cinnamon, spice, vanilla, floral
the yamazaki single malt whisky distille.nose: Classic Yamazaki strawberries and dried fruits with floral notes coming from the Mizunara cask whisky. Fragrant sandalwood and maybe coconut. Certainly a whisky where you could get lost in its nose!
the yamazaki single malt whisky distille.description: Released in Spring 2014, this is one of two Distiller's Reserve single malt whiskies from Suntory in Japan. This single malt from the Yamazaki distillery is jam-packed with superb red berry notes, gained from the whisky being matured in Bordeaux wine casks and Sherry casks. It also features malt matured in Mizunara casks, adding subtle fragrant oak notes.

Glenlivet 30 Year Old 1981 Cask 9457 C.palate: Prunes and brandy butter. Hints of cocoa, black pepper and blackberry jam. Hints of mixed herbs.
Glenlivet 30 Year Old 1981 Cask 9457 C.name: Glenlivet 30 Year Old 1981 Cask 9457   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Glenlivet 30 Year Old 1981 Cask 9457 C.notes: raisin, pepper, spicy, allspice, butter, cocoa, leather
Glenlivet 30 Year Old 1981 Cask 9457 C.nose: Sweet overripe grapes and leather. Notes of port wine, sherry and allspice. Cigar leaves and Corinth raisins.
Glenlivet 30 Year Old 1981 Cask 9457 C.description: This was distilled at the Glenlivet distillery on the 5th November 1981 before a 30 year maturation in a single cask (sherry hogshead number 9457). It was bottled for Signatory's Cask Strength Collection in February 2012.

The Irishman Single Malt Irish Whiskey.palate: A classic pudding of peaches and cream with a sprinkling of crushed up biscuits and almonds.
The Irishman Single Malt Irish Whiskey.name: The Irishman Single Malt Irish Whiskey
The Irishman Single Malt Irish Whiskey.notes: oak, fruity, peach, almond, cream, vanilla
The Irishman Single Malt Irish Whiskey.distillery: Walsh Whiskey Distillery Co Whiskeys And Liqueurs
The Irishman Single Malt Irish Whiskey.nose: Light and fruity on the nose. A little hint of liquorice pops up, as does crumbly vanilla fudge.
The Irishman Single Malt Irish Whiskey.description: The Irishman Single Malt Irish Whiskey comes, surprisingly, from Ireland. It's a triple distilled expression which is aged in both sherry and bourbon casks for over 10 years before bottling.

Basil Hayden's 75cl.palate: Gentle and rounded. Poised rye spice tingling through notes of winter berries.
Basil Hayden's 75cl.name: Basil Hayden's 75cl
Basil Hayden's 75cl.nose: Crisp, fresh. Spiced. Rooty, floral. Solid hit of rye.
Basil Hayden's 75cl.description: An 8 year old small batch bourbon. This was named for Jim Beam's historic Master Distiller, Basil Hayden Sr who, in 1796, created a bourbon with a mashbill whose base was of corn, with a mix of small grains for added spice.

Ardmore 25 Year Old.palate: A fruity and rich mouthfeel with brandied cherries, fruit, oak, oily smoke.
Ardmore 25 Year Old.name: Ardmore 25 Year Old
Ardmore 25 Year Old.notes: oak, cherries, cherry, fruit, fruity, berry, smoke, almond
Ardmore 25 Year Old.nose: Almond and hints of smoke, dark and rich fruit, dried peels, berries, malt.
Ardmore 25 Year Old.description: A cask strength 25 year old from Ardmore, this is sure to be a crowd pleaser and also offers plenty of peatiness, which makes this more like a traditional aged Speyside malt.

Dalmore 18 Year Old 1990 Cask Strength.palate: Gloriously fruity and rich. We’re getting stewed fruits with more of that ginger, curry spices, pears poached in syrup, a hint of dried chili.
Dalmore 18 Year Old 1990 Cask Strength.name: Dalmore 18 Year Old 1990   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Dalmore 18 Year Old 1990 Cask Strength.nose: Jamaica ginger cake, bitters, a light touch of tangy sherry.
Dalmore 18 Year Old 1990 Cask Strength.description: Some delicious single cask Dalmore! This was distilled on the 11th September 1990 and matured for 18 years in sherry butt number 9413. Bottled at cask strength on the 22nd October 2008 by Signatory, a release of just 621 bottles.

Invergordon 23 Year Old 1991 Single Ca.palate: A refreshing burst of more red fruit opens the palate, soon developing notes of rosewater. This is paired with dark chocolate and a touch of red chili pepper.
Invergordon 23 Year Old 1991 Single Ca.name: Invergordon 23 Year Old 1991   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Invergordon 23 Year Old 1991 Single Ca.notes: oak, cherries, cherry, fruit, berry, pepper, spices, chili, chocolate
Invergordon 23 Year Old 1991 Single Ca.nose: It's a red berry bonanza! Plump raspberries, baked strawberries and black forest gateaux with plenty of cherries. Give it a minute for oak spices and Mr. Kipling Angel Slices to shine through.
Invergordon 23 Year Old 1991 Single Ca.description: Glorious, well-Sherried Invergordon single grain Scotch whisky, presented as part of our very own Single Cask Series. This was distilled by Invergordon in April 1991 and was left to mature in a refill Sherry hogshead for 23 long years, until it was bottled in July 2014. If you're a fan of old grain whiskies, this will be right up your street. This is a release of 82 bottles, presented at 52.8% ABV.

The Glendronach 31 Year Old Grandeur.palate: Incredibly smooth, thick and syrupy; chocolate cake, treacle tart, winter spice, sultanas and candied orange peel.
The Glendronach 31 Year Old Grandeur.name: The Glendronach 31 Year Old   Grandeur
The Glendronach 31 Year Old Grandeur.notes: orange, berry, spice, almond, chocolate, milk, mocha, coffee
The Glendronach 31 Year Old Grandeur.nose: Heaps of plain and milk chocolate, sherried trifle and rich mocha tones. Next there is old spice, stewed berries and treacle.
The Glendronach 31 Year Old Grandeur.description: Beautifully packaged and hand numbered, the Glendronach Grandeur has been aged in oloroso sherry casks for over thirty years in Glendronach's dunnage warehouses.

Jameson Select Reserve Small Batch.palate: Thick and full on the palate, with an intense, unctuous creaminess, alongside dates, walnuts and peels. Good peach and coconut notes, and a little cinnamon.
Jameson Select Reserve Small Batch.name: Jameson Select Reserve Small Batch
Jameson Select Reserve Small Batch.notes: fruit, fruity, peach, nutmeg, cinnamon, walnut, creamy, creaminess
Jameson Select Reserve Small Batch.distillery: John Jameson And Son Branded Whiskey
Jameson Select Reserve Small Batch.nose: Rich and fruity with notes of tropical fruits, coconut, nectarines in yoghurt, guava and a thick core of sweet cereals.
Jameson Select Reserve Small Batch.description: AKA Black Barrel - a super release from Jameson, with a high proportion of Irish pot still whiskey as well as small batch grain. The result is an increased body and level of richness when compared to the core expression. It's aged in double charred first fill bourbon casks (black barrels). Well worth a look...

Bowmore 12 Year Old.palate: Lovely and rounded, honeyed even, initially. Vanilla, perfumed smoke and coastal elements develop. Dark Peat. Blossom, oily sweetness.
Bowmore 12 Year Old.name: Bowmore 12 Year Old
Bowmore 12 Year Old.notes: orange, citrus, lemon, fruity, zest, peat, smoky, smoke, vanilla, floral, hay, honey
Bowmore 12 Year Old.nose: Coastal smoke and ash soon make way for bergamot, orange zest, lemon slices and some hay before becoming rather floral, heather smoke now competing with the ash.
Bowmore 12 Year Old.description: The heart of the Bowmore range, the 12 year old exhibits some beautiful coastal notes with a gentle peat, it is the balance that the floral element presents that makes this a great entry bottling for Bowmore.

Balvenie 12 Year Old Single Barrel Fir.palate: A complex, thick palate with allspice and toffee apples. Cooked fruit and baking spices, hints of sponge cake and creamy caramel.
Balvenie 12 Year Old Single Barrel Fir.name: Balvenie 12 Year Old Single Barrel   First Fill
Balvenie 12 Year Old Single Barrel Fir.notes: oak, fruit, spices, allspice, spice, toasted, creamy, vanilla, caramel, toffee, coffee
Balvenie 12 Year Old Single Barrel Fir.nose: Toasted, sweet nose with all kinds of charred oak and spice. Hints of maple syrup and allspice, a little vanilla and sweet coffee.
Balvenie 12 Year Old Single Barrel Fir.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, coffee
Balvenie 12 Year Old Single Barrel Fir.description: Released in 2013, Balvenie's Single Barrel First Fill was matured in first-fill bourbon casks for at least 12 years before bottling. These are limited edition bottlings, with each bottle being one of no more than 300 drawn from a single cask. Each is also hand-numbered and labelled with the cask reference number. A deliciously creamy, vanilla-rich whisky from Balvenie.

Glendronach 19 Year Old 1993.palate: Date and walnut loaf, manuka honey, oaky, potpourri, figs, Greek yoghurt, black pepper.
Glendronach 19 Year Old 1993.name: Glendronach 19 Year Old 1993
Glendronach 19 Year Old 1993.notes: fruit, raisin, pepper, cinnamon, walnut, butterscotch, custard, coffee, honey
Glendronach 19 Year Old 1993.nose: Honeyed peels, notes of raisins, butterscotch, custard, stewed fruits, cinnamon and a little walnut loaf.
Glendronach 19 Year Old 1993.note categories: fruits, spice, nuts, vanilla, coffee, feint
Glendronach 19 Year Old 1993.description: A tasty 19 year old, cask-strength Glendronach, distilled in 1993 and aged in an Oloroso sherry butt before bottling in 2012. This is the second UK-only release with just 673 bottles all told.

Ardbeg Feis Ile 2011.palate: An explosion floods over the palate, and it gives up intense notes of prunes, tangy plums, warm pastries and thick smoke. Hints of burnt sugar too, with just a little citric tanginess late palate.
Ardbeg Feis Ile 2011.name: Ardbeg Feis Ile 2011
Ardbeg Feis Ile 2011.nose: Really thick and rich. There’s an incredible amount going on, all of which is underpinned by this meaty, BBQ smoke. There’s some of the Ardbeg citrus, but mostly you’re greeted with aromas of tar, black treacle, smoked prune juice and sweet sherry.
Ardbeg Feis Ile 2011.description: Ardbeg's absolutely amazing Feis Ile bottling, bottled in 2011. This very rare Ardbeg was distilled in 1998 and aged in two Pedro Ximenez butts (making this the closest thing you'll ever get to a finished whisky from Ardbeg!). Genuinely one of the best whiskies we've ever tasted.

Edradour 10 Year Old.palate: Cloying, seductive murkiness. Rum, barley, toasted almonds. Some may find themselves lost in the mêlée, not quite enough method to the madness.
Edradour 10 Year Old.name: Edradour 10 Year Old
Edradour 10 Year Old.nose: Medium, great complexity. Thoroughly fruity, sherry, sweetness, alluring vanilla.
Edradour 10 Year Old.description: Edradour is one of Scotland's smallest distilleries and at the heart of the range, this 10 year old Eastern Highlander is a rather unique single malt, a decidedly rum-like dram with a thick mouthfeel.

Glenfarclas 1987 Family Cask.name: Glenfarclas 1987 Family Cask
Glenfarclas 1987 Family Cask.nose: Fruity, floral. Homemade conserves, Cut herbs, grassy, almond. A hint of bitumen?
Glenfarclas 1987 Family Cask.description: This was distilled in 1987 and matured in a refill sherry hogshead before release in 2007 as part of the Glenfarclas Family Cask collection.

Dalmore King Alexander III.palate: Medium, rounded. Winter berries, spice, zesty orange. Liqueurs emerge; Gran Marnier, kirsch and Frangelico.
Dalmore King Alexander III.name: Dalmore King Alexander III
Dalmore King Alexander III.notes: oak, orange, fruit, fruity, zest, berry, peppery, spice, barley, creamy, chocolate, vanilla
Dalmore King Alexander III.nose: Malty and utterly Dalmore. Seville orange zest, Parfait Amour, malty cereal, barley and chocolate. Creamy vanilla fudge, tropical fruit with a vaguely vinous quality.
Dalmore King Alexander III.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, cereal, chocolate, vanilla
Dalmore King Alexander III.description: A sextuple-wood bottling from Dalmore. This auspiciously-named dram was matured in wine, Madeira, Sherry, Marsala, Kentucky bourbon and Port casks. King Alexander III is a rich, fruity Highland single malt.

Clynelish 23 Year Old 1988 Dimensions.palate: Notes of green apples and bananas with hints of barley and sweet peat smoke.
Clynelish 23 Year Old 1988 Dimensions.name: Clynelish 23 Year Old 1988   Dimensions (duncan Taylor)
Clynelish 23 Year Old 1988 Dimensions.notes: citrus, fruity, zest, spice, peat, smoke, barley, honey, salt
Clynelish 23 Year Old 1988 Dimensions.nose: Coastal and oily at first but then a waxy fruity quality emerges with  barley sweets and light spice.
Clynelish 23 Year Old 1988 Dimensions.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, cereal, feint, mineral
Clynelish 23 Year Old 1988 Dimensions.description:
This is a twenty-three year old Clynelish bottled by independent bottler Duncan Taylor for their Dimensions range.

Clynelish is distilled in the town of Brora where the famous Brora whisky was distilled until 1983.

Glenturret 32 Year Old 1979 (cask 1445).palate: Soft malt, with soy sauce and black olives to the fore. Quite tangy, with a little stewed rhubarb. Orange rinds.
Glenturret 32 Year Old 1979 (cask 1445).name: Glenturret 32 Year Old 1979 (cask 1445)   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Glenturret 32 Year Old 1979 (cask 1445).nose: Metallic aromas, with hints of furniture wax, old leather and a little over-ripe grape. Hints of rancio, somehow!
Glenturret 32 Year Old 1979 (cask 1445).description: This is a hogshead-matured Glenturret which was distilled on the 21st December 1979 and aged in cask 1445 for 32 years before bottling. There are just 255 numbered bottles of this, from Signatory's Cask Strength Collection.

Highland Park 17 Year Old 1990 The Coo.palate: Peat and honey followed by citrus zest and fresh fruit.
Highland Park 17 Year Old 1990 The Coo.name: Highland Park 17 Year Old 1990   The Coopers Choice (the Vintage Malt Whisky Co.)
Highland Park 17 Year Old 1990 The Coo.notes: citrus, fruit, zest, cinnamon, spice, peat, smoky, vanilla, honey
Highland Park 17 Year Old 1990 The Coo.nose: Vanilla and clover honey followed by fresh cut herbs and heathery peat.
Highland Park 17 Year Old 1990 The Coo.description: This is a seventeen year old Highland Park bottled by Cooper's Choice in 2007.

New Zealand 23 Year Old 1988.palate: Thick with malt and sweetness. Banana, black pepper and allspice. Candied orange.
New Zealand 23 Year Old 1988.name: New Zealand 23 Year Old 1988
New Zealand 23 Year Old 1988.notes: orange, pepper, spicy, allspice, toasted, creamy, vanilla, caramel
New Zealand 23 Year Old 1988.nose: Spicy, rich aromas. Creamy caramel. A little vanilla, dried banana chips and apricots.
New Zealand 23 Year Old 1988.description: This is a single cask, cask-strength single malt whisky from the Willowbank distillery on New Zealand's South Island. It was distilled in 1988 and aged for 23 years in cask 72.

Bruichladdich 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 893.palate: Rich, creamy palate with candied peels and vanilla. Allspice, a hint of smoke.
Bruichladdich 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 893.name: Bruichladdich 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 8937)   Directors' Cut (douglas Laing)
Bruichladdich 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 893.notes: spicy, allspice, spice, peat, smoke, creamy, vanilla, honey
Bruichladdich 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 893.nose: Spicy and rich nose with sweet sherry, manuka honey and a little vanilla.
Bruichladdich 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 893.description: This was distilled at the Bruichladdich distillery in October 1990 before a 21 year maturation in a single cask (refill sherry butt number 8837). It was bottled for the Directors Cut range in 2012, and there are just 255 bottles available, all at natural cask strength.

Bunnahabhain 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 19).palate: Thick, rich palate with creamy malt and a big sherry note. Soft smoke and salted caramels.
Bunnahabhain 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 19).name: Bunnahabhain 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 19) (berry Bros. & Rudd)
Bunnahabhain 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 19).notes: fruity, berry, spice, smoke, nutty, almond, walnut, creamy, caramel, coffee, salt
Bunnahabhain 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 19).nose: Nutty, fruity aromas with creamy ground almonds, sweet coffee and walnut.
Bunnahabhain 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 19).note categories: fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, coffee, mineral
Bunnahabhain 21 Year Old 1990 (cask 19).description: This was distilled at the Bunnahabhain distillery in 1990 before a 21 year maturation in a single cask (number 19). It was bottled by Berry Brothers and Rudd in 2012, and it comes without chill-filtration or caramel-colouring.

Bruichladdich 1984.palate: Soft sweetness, touch of dry oak, vanilla spice, peppery, cocoa.
Bruichladdich 1984.name: Bruichladdich 1984
Bruichladdich 1984.notes: oak, fruit, allspice, spices, spicy, peppery, spice, vanilla, toffee, cocoa
Bruichladdich 1984.nose: Fresh, leafy. Allspice, vanilla, soft toffee, coastal.
Bruichladdich 1984.description: A limited edition 1984 vintage from the Bruichladdich distillery, this single malt exudes Bruichladdich's coastal qualities with notes of fruit and beautiful dry spices.

Glenfiddich 15 Year Old Solera Reserve.palate: A rush of creamy sweetness. It’s soft, despite its strength. Very sweet on the palate, with more than a hint of Refreshers (the chews, not the tablet version).
Glenfiddich 15 Year Old Solera Reserve.name: Glenfiddich 15 Year Old Solera Reserve   Combination Padlock PR
Glenfiddich 15 Year Old Solera Reserve.notes: wood, fruit, fruity, nutty, almond, hazelnut, creamy, vanilla, caramel, floral
Glenfiddich 15 Year Old Solera Reserve.nose: A gloriously rich barrage of ripe Pink lady apples, followed by sweet hints of acetone, vanilla and stewed fruits. The orchard fruit and floral nature reminds us a little of Yamazaki 10 and then we’re onto sweet nutty notes; first we get Almond Baklavas, then caramelised hazelnuts, and a hint of amaretto.
Glenfiddich 15 Year Old Solera Reserve.note categories: wood, fruits, nuts, chocolate, vanilla, flowers
Glenfiddich 15 Year Old Solera Reserve.description:
Many moons ago, in August of 2010, we received a curious email from Glenfiddich, which read simply "we're sending you something." How very exciting we thought, and sure enough, a wooden box arrived, fitted with a combination padlock. Sadly the padlock wasn't up to scratch, so we broke into it and found a bottle of cask strength 15 year old Solera reserve. 

There were some clues and other excitement, and it was all in aid of promoting the Glenfiddich Online Warehouse. You can read our full post here. As you can see, some of the bottle mysteriously vanished before we took the photo! We decided to dram it, so you can try samples of it. It really is a lovely whisky.

Bruichladdich 21 Year Old Oloroso Cask F.palate: Vanilla, caramel, fruit salad, exotic fruits too, sherry.
Bruichladdich 21 Year Old Oloroso Cask F.name: Bruichladdich 21 Year Old Oloroso Cask Finish
Bruichladdich 21 Year Old Oloroso Cask F.nose: Thick, supple sherry. Dried fruits, barley. Juicy. Nutty.
Bruichladdich 21 Year Old Oloroso Cask F.description: This Bruichladdich was matured for 21 years in top quality Oloroso sherry casks.

Highland Park Batch 3 (that Boutique Y.palate: Wonderfully juicy up front with fresh orchard fruits. This is backed up again by smoke, though complimented by floral touches too. Good helpings of spice on the mid palate.
Highland Park Batch 3 (that Boutique Y.name: Highland Park   Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Highland Park Batch 3 (that Boutique Y.notes: wood, fruit, spice, smoke, toasted, cream, floral, honey
Highland Park Batch 3 (that Boutique Y.nose: Raspberries dipped in honey, clotted cream and buttered toasted. This is swiftly joined by bundles of warming, exciting smoke.
Highland Park Batch 3 (that Boutique Y.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, cereal, chocolate, flowers, feint
Highland Park Batch 3 (that Boutique Y.description:
This right here is the third batch of Highland Park single malt Scotch whisky bottled by That Boutique-y Whisky Company. Guess who's back with a brand new pair of bloomers to chuck up a tree? That's right, Charlemange has returned to pop some clothes up in the trees of the woods of Overasselt for good luck, and he's brought the whole Maltstock 2012 crew again! Also, that cheeky little balloon is still chilling out in the corner...

This is a release of 27 bottles. 

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic novel-style labels.

Dailuaine 16 Year Old Flora And Fauna.palate: Medium body, clean. Malt, estery fruit. Sherry. Nutty.
Dailuaine 16 Year Old Flora And Fauna.name: Dailuaine 16 Year Old   Flora And Fauna
Dailuaine 16 Year Old Flora And Fauna.notes: oak, fruit, spice, smoke, nutty, almond, barley
Dailuaine 16 Year Old Flora And Fauna.nose: Cereals, barley sugars, sherry. Fruitcake, oily, nutty.
Dailuaine 16 Year Old Flora And Fauna.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, cereal
Dailuaine 16 Year Old Flora And Fauna.description: A Flora and Fauna official release from the Dailuaine distillery, a 16 year old single malt which has been sherry matured for thick fruitcake notes with winter spice, a great digestive.

Teeling Single Grain.palate: There's treacle on the palate, but it's light and buttery with dried cranberry developing.
Teeling Single Grain.name: Teeling Single Grain
Teeling Single Grain.notes: fruit, apple, spicy, spice, milk, vanilla, custard, floral, honey
Teeling Single Grain.nose: Honeyed apple flesh and red grape, sweet and slightly floral with fragrant vanilla and spice, evaporated milk and brown sugar.
Teeling Single Grain.note categories: fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, feint
Teeling Single Grain.description: Irish single grain whiskey from Teeling! There are only an elite few Irish single grain whiskies out there at the moment, but Teeling went ahead and made theirs unique by maturing it in Californian Cabernet Sauvignon casks.
