Deliciously sweet with a good deal of spice and fruit hide within the Teeling Single Grain.

Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask.palate: Spicy. Oak, vanilla. Tight, sherry, crystallized fruit. Sherry.
Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask.name: Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask
Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask.notes: oak, fruit, spicy, spice, barley, vanilla, toffee
Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask.nose: The nose is ripe and rich. Sherried, fruit. Aniseed, crème de cassis. Toffee.
Glenfarclas 1961 Family Cask.description: A very Christmas spice rich Glenfarclas, this was distilled in 1961 and matured in single cask 4913, a sherry hogshead, before bottling as part of the 2007 released Family Cask collection.

Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2013 Release.palate: Sweet wine, a little thin. Some old rich wood develops (as well as damp wood?) and clove.
Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2013 Release.name: Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2013 Release
Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2013 Release.notes: wood, lemon, raisin, clove, spices, peat
Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2013 Release.nose: Soy, a little honeycomb polish, burnt raisins, flour and even mushroom. Perhaps a hint of lemon.
Kilchoman Loch Gorm 2013 Release.description: The first release of Kilchoman's Loch Gorm single malt Scotch whisky, distilled at the Islay farm distillery and fully matured in ex-sherry casks for 5 years before being bottled. Rather interestingly, it was matured for most of the time in Oloroso butts, but was given a finishing period in Oloroso sherry hogsheads for an added depth of flavour. Limited to 10,000 bottles worldwide.

Benromach 10 Year Old.palate: Barley, slightly herbal, a little fruit, grassy. Big on malt, ground ginger.
Benromach 10 Year Old.name: Benromach 10 Year Old
Benromach 10 Year Old.notes: oak, pine, fruit, fruity, spices, barley, herbal
Benromach 10 Year Old.nose: Dry, barley, big on malt and oak. Dry pine, fruity. A tad spirity. Sweet spices after a time and a hint of puckering prune from the sherry cask and maple fudge.
Benromach 10 Year Old.description: The newly released 10 year old from Gordon and MacPhail's Benromach distillery. This was matured for the first nine years in 4/5 bourbon and 1/5 sherry casks before a year in sherry casks.

Bowmore 37 Year Old 1968.palate: Oaked, menthol develops, herbal with berry fruits.
Bowmore 37 Year Old 1968.name: Bowmore 37 Year Old 1968
Bowmore 37 Year Old 1968.notes: woody, oak, pine, citrus, fruit, berry, spicy, cream, herbal
Bowmore 37 Year Old 1968.nose: Woody, cooked fruit, esters. Eucalyptol and citrus. Truffle oil, touch of cream.
Bowmore 37 Year Old 1968.description: A 37 year old offering from Bowmore, matured in ex-bourbon casks and presents a rare bottling from an outturn of just 708 bottles. A spicy, oily, slightly vegetal whisky of excellent depth.

Ben Nevis 12 Year Old 1998 Provenance.palate: Spiced and sweet, notes of stewed fruits, manuka honey, big barley notes and rhubarb crumble.
Ben Nevis 12 Year Old 1998 Provenance.name: Ben Nevis 12 Year Old 1998   Provenance (douglas Laing)
Ben Nevis 12 Year Old 1998 Provenance.notes: fruit, fruity, pepper, barley, toffee, honey
Ben Nevis 12 Year Old 1998 Provenance.nose: Fresh and fruity, aromatic with notes of freshly cut fruit, pepper and digestive biscuits.
Ben Nevis 12 Year Old 1998 Provenance.description: This was distilled at the Ben Nevis distillery in Autumn 1998. It was aged for 12 years in refill hogshead 7432 and bottled in Summer of 2011 for the Provenance range.

Miltonduff 12 Year Old 1998 Provenance.palate: Biscuity and rich, soft peat smoke mixed with rose petal jelly, rum spice and grist.
Miltonduff 12 Year Old 1998 Provenance.name: Miltonduff 12 Year Old 1998   Provenance (douglas Laing)
Miltonduff 12 Year Old 1998 Provenance.notes: apple, spice, peat, smoky, smoke, butterscotch, coffee
Miltonduff 12 Year Old 1998 Provenance.nose: Gently smoky nose, with notes of sweet butterscotch, cooked apple a touch of potpourri.
Miltonduff 12 Year Old 1998 Provenance.description: A 1998 vintage Miltonduff, distilled during the Winter. It was then aged for 12 years in a refill hogshead before bottling in Winter 2010. This was bottled for the Provenance range from Douglas Laing.

Aberfeldy Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.palate: Creamy, cereal-lined palate entry with a macadamia nut character and a dusting of freshly ground black pepper. All the time there is a thick, malty core. Hints of juicy sultanas too.
Aberfeldy Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.name: Aberfeldy   Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Aberfeldy Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.notes: pepper, spice, nut, oat, barley, creamy, honey
Aberfeldy Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.nose: The nose offers up rich notes of runny honey and golden syrup, followed up by a mix of sweet cereals
Aberfeldy Batch 1 (that Boutique Y Whi.description:
This is the first batch of the gloriously malty, cereal-rich Aberfeldy from That Boutique-y Whisky Company. The label for this features a wonderful illustration of the renowned whisky writer Ian Buxton. Ian lives right behind Aberfeldy, and here we see him panning for gold in the distillery's water source - the Pitlie Burn!

This is a release of just 155 numbered bottles.

‘That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, blended malts, blends and bourbons from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

Edradour 10 Year Old 2002 (cask 462) S.palate: Mouth filling, slightly waxy and malty. Corinth raisins, mince pies with Bramley apple in them.
Edradour 10 Year Old 2002 (cask 462) S.name: Edradour 10 Year Old 2002 (cask 462)   Straight From The Cask
Edradour 10 Year Old 2002 (cask 462) S.notes: wood, oak, raisin, apple, spices, nutmeg, spice
Edradour 10 Year Old 2002 (cask 462) S.nose: Lovely notes of sherry and spice, dark jams, strawberries, nutmeg, apple and raspberry crumble.
Edradour 10 Year Old 2002 (cask 462) S.description:
A release of 971 bottles from Edradour's Straight from the Cask range, it was aged for a period of 10 years in sherry butt 462. As ever, this 50cl bottle comes in a handsome wooden case.

Distilled on 13th December 2002 and bottled on 18th February 2013.

Bowmore 8 Year Old 1999 Feis Ile 2008.palate: Thick and spicy with fiery peat smoke, hints of chamomile tea, a melange of fruits, a little cocoa, espresso beans, bitter oak and tangy cranberries.
Bowmore 8 Year Old 1999 Feis Ile 2008.name: Bowmore 8 Year Old 1999   Feis Ile 2008
Bowmore 8 Year Old 1999 Feis Ile 2008.notes: oak, fruit, berry, spicy, peat, smoke, caramel, toffee, cocoa, espresso
Bowmore 8 Year Old 1999 Feis Ile 2008.nose: Lots of muscular, brazen smoke, along with dried berry fruits, hints of salinity, toffee apples, caramelised sugar, woodsmoke, iodine and hints of cocoa.
Bowmore 8 Year Old 1999 Feis Ile 2008.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, vanilla, coffee
Bowmore 8 Year Old 1999 Feis Ile 2008.description: This was distilled at Bowmore on the 14th June 1999, and it was aged in Limousin oak in warehouse 5 for 8 years before bottling for the 2008 Feis Ile. A release of 800 numbered bottles, fabulous stuff.

Yoichi 10 Year Old.palate: Oily and sweet, with peat smoke following swiftly afterwards. Light oak and developing fruit notes beneath.
Yoichi 10 Year Old.name: Yoichi 10 Year Old
Yoichi 10 Year Old.notes: oak, fruit, peach, nutmeg, spice, peat, smoke, vanilla, custard, floral
Yoichi 10 Year Old.nose: Plenty of fruit notes - peach stands out in particular, ripe, vibrant and subtly floral. Then there's rich vanilla custard, peat smoke and a hint of nutmeg spice.
Yoichi 10 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, vanilla, flowers
Yoichi 10 Year Old.description: A very well made single malt from Japan, Yoichi is the jewel in Nikka's crown, their 10 year old offering notes of vanilla and fruit. One batch of this received 93 points in the Jim Murray Whisky Bible.

Bowmore 29 Year Old 1982.palate: Rich and spicy with notes of jalapeno and musty orange peel. Some bitter oak, some oily smoke, and pine resin.
Bowmore 29 Year Old 1982.name: Bowmore 29 Year Old 1982
Bowmore 29 Year Old 1982.notes: wood, oak, pine, orange, fruit, lemon, berry, spicy, smoke, toffee, floral, violets, leather, salt, musty
Bowmore 29 Year Old 1982.nose: Loads of those classic Bowmore floral notes. In a similar vein to our own bottling of Bowmore, we pick up parma violets in this one, and all kinds of interesting herbal/floral flavours. A little salt spray note, with tart lemon and berry fruits, and a hint of musty oak.
Bowmore 29 Year Old 1982.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, vanilla, flowers, feint, mineral
Bowmore 29 Year Old 1982.description: An astounding 2011 edition from Bowmore. This was distilled in 1982, and comes packaged in a very handsome wooden box, with its own leather strap. Each bottle comes with a certificate of authenticity signed by Bowmore's manager, Eddie MacAffer.

Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.1 Dubhe Si.palate: Black pepper, greengages, vanilla, a dusting of cocoa just before a wave of peat and oak.
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.1 Dubhe Si.name: Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.1 Dubhe Single Malt Whisky
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.1 Dubhe Si.notes: oak, apple, pepper, peat, vanilla, cocoa
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.1 Dubhe Si.nose: Vanilla, Maraschino, red apple and drying grass that's just catching in the sun.
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.1 Dubhe Si.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, vanilla, coffee
Spirit Of Hven Seven Stars No.1 Dubhe Si.description:
The Spirit of Hven distillery was the first to produce an island single malt whisky in Sweden, with the island of Ven or 'Hven' being situated in the Öresund Strait between Denmark and Sweden. Established in 2008, it is also only the third legal pot still distillery ever built in Sweden.

Dubhe is named after the second brightest star in the Big Dipper, and is the first of 7 limited edition whiskies they plan to release over the next 7 years. Maturation takes place in American, Spanish and French oak, no chill filtration takes place and each product is bottled by hand, numbered and signed.

Cask Islay (a. D. Rattray).palate: Fresh orange and honeyed barley notes, surrounded by peat smoke. Quite oily. A hint of crumbly sea-side fudge glows in the centre.
Cask Islay (a. D. Rattray).name: Cask Islay (a. D. Rattray)
Cask Islay (a. D. Rattray).notes: orange, fruit, apple, peat, smoky, smoke, barley, honey
Cask Islay (a. D. Rattray).nose: Rich peat, candied orange peels and a light breeze of coastal air.
Cask Islay (a. D. Rattray).description: Cask Islay is a small batch single malt Scotch whisky from an unnamed Islay distillery, bottled by A. D. Rattray, who have a bit of a history with excellent independent bottlings. This tasty rascal was matured in a mix of ex-bourbon barrels and ex-sherry hogsheads, but who did it come from? Mystery! Suspense! Yummy, smoky whisky laden with fruit notes! Cask Islay has got it all!

Arran 10 Year Old With 2 Glasses.palate: Sweet. Quite malty, digestive biscuits, followed by green fruits and Cox's apple peel.
Arran 10 Year Old With 2 Glasses.name: Arran 10 Year Old With 2 Glasses
Arran 10 Year Old With 2 Glasses.nose: Herbal, biscuity, hedgerow greenness and dried grass, like a long English summer's afternoon.
Arran 10 Year Old With 2 Glasses.description: A bottle of Arran's excellent 10 year old single malt Scotch whisky complete with 2 handsome glasses! A gift pack to make anyone smile!

Laphroaig 11 Year Old 2000 Premier Bar.palate: An oily, well-rounded palate with a mix of sticking plasters, burning heather roots and caramel sweetness. Nutmeg develops late palate.
Laphroaig 11 Year Old 2000 Premier Bar.name: Laphroaig 11 Year Old 2000   Premier Barrel (douglas Laing)
Laphroaig 11 Year Old 2000 Premier Bar.notes: nutmeg, peat, smoke, caramel, honey, molasses
Laphroaig 11 Year Old 2000 Premier Bar.nose: Popcorn and oily smoke on the nose, notes of Black Forest honey, molasses and soft, chewy peat.
Laphroaig 11 Year Old 2000 Premier Bar.description: An 11 year old Laphroaig, distilled in 2000 and aged in a single cask before bottling for Douglas Laing's smart-looking Premier Barrel range. A release of just 384 hand-filled decanters.

Blanton's Special Reserve.palate: Light, balanced, gentles spices, toffee. Dried peels.
Blanton's Special Reserve.name: Blanton's Special Reserve
Blanton's Special Reserve.nose: Spiced. Grainy sweetness. Buttery, fruity tang.
Blanton's Special Reserve.description: Special Reserve is a lower strength single barrel bourbon from Blanton's. Each bottle is hand-filled, hand-labeled, hand-sealed and individually numbered.

Bowmore Darkest.palate: Oaky and malty. Hazelnut, barley, toffee apples, spices, Oloroso sherry. Hints of rum spice, aniseed and granary toast with melted salty butter.
Bowmore Darkest.name: Bowmore Darkest
Bowmore Darkest.notes: fruity, spices, nutmeg, cinnamon, spice, peat, smoke, nutty, hazelnut, barley, butter, caramel, toffee, floral, salty, salt
Bowmore Darkest.nose: Perfumed, salty, notes of Oloroso sherry, peat smoke, blackcurrants and aniseed. Nutty, floral.
Bowmore Darkest.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, nuts, cereal, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, mineral
Bowmore Darkest.description: A rich, sherry-matured Bowmore. Very similar to the world famous Black Bowmore, though much younger. Very intense and fruity.

Longmorn 1997 (berry Bros. & Rudd).palate: Creamy and rich with notes of fruit and black pepper, some apple, a touch of sherry and vanilla.
Longmorn 1997 (berry Bros. & Rudd).name: Longmorn 1997 (berry Bros. & Rudd)
Longmorn 1997 (berry Bros. & Rudd).notes: fruit, apple, berry, pepper, spices, creamy, vanilla, caramel, toffee, honey
Longmorn 1997 (berry Bros. & Rudd).nose: Apple peel, toffee and pears, with notes of parsley and caramel. Some vanilla, a little beeswax and buttered granary toast.
Longmorn 1997 (berry Bros. & Rudd).description: This was distilled in 1997 at Longmorn and aged in cask 163309 before bottling in 2011 by Berry Brothers and Rudd. This is a complex, full-bodied and aromatic whisky, with honeyed, malty flavour.

Glenturret 31 Year Old 1979 Cask Stren.palate: Floor polish, beeswax and brown sugar with thick molasses. Heavy lavender notes with other dried flowers - quite dry.
Glenturret 31 Year Old 1979 Cask Stren.name: Glenturret 31 Year Old 1979   Cask Strength Collection (signatory)
Glenturret 31 Year Old 1979 Cask Stren.notes: pepper, nut, nuts, floral, hay, flowers, leather, molasses
Glenturret 31 Year Old 1979 Cask Stren.nose: Nuts and hay, burnt lawn with thick brown sugar notes and almost treacly whiffs.
Glenturret 31 Year Old 1979 Cask Stren.description: A 1979 vintage single cask whisky from Glenturret, a malt which provides the backbone of Famous Grouse. This was bottled in 2011 by Signatory as part of their Cask Strength Collection.

Eagle Rare 10 Year Old 75cl.palate: Supple, rounded. Fruit and fudge, spicy vanilla. Mixed conserves.
Eagle Rare 10 Year Old 75cl.name: Eagle Rare 10 Year Old 75cl
Eagle Rare 10 Year Old 75cl.notes: citrus, fruit, spicy, smoky, vanilla, leather
Eagle Rare 10 Year Old 75cl.nose: Thick, spicy. Sharp citrus, stewed fruits. Mochaccino, seed cake and leather.
Eagle Rare 10 Year Old 75cl.description: Eagle Rare is a great single barrel bourbon from the Buffalo Trace distillery. This 10 year old expression was very well-rated by Spirit Journal's F Paul Pacult.

allt a bhainne 19 year old 1991 cask 109.palate: Rich and intense with notes of toffee apple and powerful oak, hints of bitter sweetness and spice.
allt a bhainne 19 year old 1991 cask 109.name: allt a bhainne 19 year old 1991 cask 109436 cask strength collection signatory whisky
allt a bhainne 19 year old 1991 cask 109.notes: oak, fruit, apple, pepper, spice, butter, cream, vanilla, toffee, hay, salty
allt a bhainne 19 year old 1991 cask 109.nose: Cut hay and star anise with notes of tropical fruit, vanilla cream and pepper.
allt a bhainne 19 year old 1991 cask 109.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, mineral
allt a bhainne 19 year old 1991 cask 109.description: Distilled at Allt-a-Bhainne on the 23rd September 1991, this was aged for 19 years in a single hogshead before bottling on the 11th March 2011. A release of 256 bottles.

Bowmore 16 Year Old 1992 Bordeaux Wine C.palate: Spicy smoke and peat with real power, as with a lot of wine finishes it is all in the mouth feel. Thick oiliness, supple fruit, oaked dryness, perhaps, not quite pungent enough in respect to the power of the peat.
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1992 Bordeaux Wine C.name: Bowmore 16 Year Old 1992 Bordeaux Wine Cask Finish
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1992 Bordeaux Wine C.notes: wood, oak, fruit, spicy, peat, smoke, coffee
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1992 Bordeaux Wine C.nose: Aromatic, powerful. There is strong evidence of the cask finish, sumptuous claret notes, with rich wood and good texture yet everything coexists nicely as the peat smoke shines with intensity, yet poise.
Bowmore 16 Year Old 1992 Bordeaux Wine C.description: A cask strength release from the Islay distillery, Bowmore. This 'Claret' finish whisky has been matured for 16 years, with a finish in a Bordeaux Wine Cask - the label is emblazoned, accordingly, with a bunch of grapes.

Aultmore 5 Year Old 2009 Single Cask (.palate: White chocolate, ripe raspberry, lime peel with a dusting of icing sugar. Waxy red apple persists throughout, even after adding a drop of water, which brings out more vanilla and a subtle mineral note. Maybe even a hint of spicy green chillies...
Aultmore 5 Year Old 2009 Single Cask (.name: Aultmore 5 Year Old 2009   Single Cask (master Of Malt)
Aultmore 5 Year Old 2009 Single Cask (.notes: oak, wood, cedar, apple, spicy, nutmeg, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Aultmore 5 Year Old 2009 Single Cask (.nose: Opening notes of old fashioned coconut ice, blueberry muffins with a lot of vanilla in the dough and some pear eau de vie. This develops into filo pastry, red Jelly Tots and charred oak.
Aultmore 5 Year Old 2009 Single Cask (.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, vanilla, mineral
Aultmore 5 Year Old 2009 Single Cask (.description: This isn't the first time we've bottled a 5 year old Aultmore for our Single Cask Series, nor is it the first time that whisky from this distillery has shown so well at such a relatively young age. No coincidence there. Distilled in May 2009 and bottled in April 2015, this bottling says "age ain't nothing but a number". Other numbers include 65.4, the natural cask strength abv, and 122, the number of bottles produced.

Highland Park 12 Year Old.palate: Rather full with a pleasant subtlety to the depths. Lurking somewhere in the substratum a grilled orange lies. Notes of granary toast and green tea with jasmine. A touch of sweetness.
Highland Park 12 Year Old.name: Highland Park 12 Year Old
Highland Park 12 Year Old.notes: wood, orange, citrus, spicy, creamy, cream, floral, honey
Highland Park 12 Year Old.nose: Fresh, clean and very aromatic. Floral notes abound the senses with a light grassiness. Notes of creamy manuka honey and a touch of juicy citrus with cream and a well-balanced sweetness.
Highland Park 12 Year Old.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, chocolate, flowers, feint
Highland Park 12 Year Old.description: The entry level bottling from Scotland's most northerly distillery, Highland Park, aged for 12 years with plenty of citrus and green notes.

Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.palate: Buttery and very rum-like in the mouth. Candy floss sweetness, caramel richness, and the softest, juiciest oak imaginable.
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.name: Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbon 15 Year Old
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.notes: wood, oak, fruit, berry, pepper, spices, nutty, nuttiness, caramel, toffee
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.distillery: Old Rip Van Winkle Whiskey Distillery
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.nose: Wood, but so very balanced with nuttiness, toffee and a rum-like complexity, that it’s just perfect. Wood shavings, hints of dried berry fruits, and a faint shade of pepper provide a mouth-watering aroma…
Pappy Van Winkle's Family Reserve Bourbo.description: A well aged whiskey from Old Rip Van Winkle, this bottling of Family Reserve has been aged for 15 years in heavily charred barrels, there is a high wheat con10t in the mashbill.

Kilchoman 100% Islay Cask Strength.palate: Big and very oily. Sweet spices, and the most fantastically emotive blast of wood smoke, peppermint oil, sticking plasters and sweet, creamy vanilla and apple strudel. Maybe even a dash of ground walnut.
Kilchoman 100% Islay Cask Strength.name: Kilchoman 100% Islay Cask Strength
Kilchoman 100% Islay Cask Strength.notes: oak, wood, cedar, pine, woody, apple, spicy, cinnamon, spices, peat, smoke, walnut, creamy, vanilla
Kilchoman 100% Islay Cask Strength.nose: Linseed oil, cold wood ash, whiffs of the coast and hints of banana and Ovaltine! It develops and becomes more woody, but not necessarily oak. Instead, we get cedar and hints of pine and just a dab of TCP.
Kilchoman 100% Islay Cask Strength.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, nuts, chocolate, vanilla
Kilchoman 100% Islay Cask Strength.description: The first ever 100% Islay release from Kilchoman, this is the incredibly rare natural cask strength edition. It was bottled from casks 100 thru' 103/08, and there are 1,060 numbered bottles, each coming in a very handsome wooden box.

clynelish 15 year old 1997 strictly limi.palate: Malt core with hints of sherry and allspice. Dried banana chips and starchiness.
clynelish 15 year old 1997 strictly limi.name: clynelish 15 year old 1997 strictly limited carn mor whisky
clynelish 15 year old 1997 strictly limi.notes: fruit, pineapple, allspice, spice, barley, butter, salt
clynelish 15 year old 1997 strictly limi.nose: Cooked fruit and pineapple. Hints of barley malt, salt butter and spice.
clynelish 15 year old 1997 strictly limi.description: This Clynelish comes from Carn Mor's Strictly Limited range. It was distilled in 1997 and aged in hogsheads for 15 years before bottling in 2012. A release of 605 bottles from two casks.

Bushmills 21 Year Old.palate: Chewy, dates, pecans, grapes and mango.
Bushmills 21 Year Old.name: Bushmills 21 Year Old
Bushmills 21 Year Old.distillery: The Old Bushmills Whisky Distillery Company
Bushmills 21 Year Old.nose: Rich toffee, honey, spiced fruit notes and dark mocha.
Bushmills 21 Year Old.description: An exquisite Irish whiskey, matured in a mixture of Oloroso Sherry and Bourbon casks, before a two year marrying period spent in Madeira casks. Produced in limited numbers, each bottle is numbered.

Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 (signatory).palate: Oily and rounded. Some tarmac-like notes, sticking plasters, iodine, manuka honey and parma violets.
Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 (signatory).name: Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 (signatory)
Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 (signatory).nose: Herbal, buttery and sweet. Some fish oil, salinity, bonfire smoke, a bit of heather honey and soft malt.
Caol Ila 12 Year Old 1999 (signatory).description: This 12 year old Caol Ila was distilled on the 12th November 1999 and it was aged in two hogsheads before bottling by Signatory on the 12th December 2011.

Caperdonich Batch 3 (that Boutique Y W.palate: The palate is medium-bodied with sooty charcoal notes, menthol and apple sauce. Then a deeper character of raisins, grapes and home-made rhubarb crumble emerge with a scattering of cinnamon.
Caperdonich Batch 3 (that Boutique Y W.name: Caperdonich   Batch 3 (that Boutique Y Whisky Company)
Caperdonich Batch 3 (that Boutique Y W.notes: fruit, raisin, apple, spicy, nutmeg, cinnamon, spice, peat, smoky, smoke, butterscotch, leather, lead
Caperdonich Batch 3 (that Boutique Y W.nose: The nose is heathery initially with a charcoal smokiness seeping through with a hint of nutmeg following. Beyond this there are notes of stewing orchard fruits, butterscotch and soft calve's leather.
Caperdonich Batch 3 (that Boutique Y W.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, vanilla, feint, mineral
Caperdonich Batch 3 (that Boutique Y W.description:
This is Batch 3 of That Boutique-y Whisky Company's Caperdonich, bottled at 45.7% abv with a cult graphic-novel-style label featuring the legendary pipe that supposedly ran between Caperdonich and its sister distillery, Glen Grant. Allegedly the pipe was removed because locals were drilling into it to steal the whisky. Whether this is true or not is debatable, but the whisky from the now closed distillery of Caperdonich is really rather good for sure - as you can see in this limited release from That Boutique-y Whisky Company.

"A quality malt which is not only complex but displays a near perfect weight."- Jim Murray (94 Points)
'That Boutique-y Whisky Company' bottles single malts, single grains, bourbons, blended malts and blends from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.

120 numbered bottles were produced.

Caol Ila Feis Ile 2009.palate: Stem ginger, toffee, salinity and sweet smoke. Old ropes, salty butter, freshly cut hay and pepper.
Caol Ila Feis Ile 2009.name: Caol Ila Feis Ile 2009
Caol Ila Feis Ile 2009.notes: oak, citrus, apple, pepper, spicy, spices, smoke, butter, toffee, herbal, hay, honey, salty
Caol Ila Feis Ile 2009.nose: A very interesting, spicy and rather herbal nose for a Caol Ila. Hints of aniseed, taragon, maybe even turmeric, alongside seaweed, buttery toffee, citrus, manuka honey and smoke on sea air.
Caol Ila Feis Ile 2009.note categories: wood, fruits, spice, earth, chocolate, vanilla, flowers, feint, mineral
Caol Ila Feis Ile 2009.description: A beautiful Caol Ila, filled into cask on the 18th December 1996, and aged for 12 years in European oak sherry cask 19313 before being hand selected by Billy Stitchell for the 2009 Feis Ile.

Timorous Beastie.palate: Dried fruits, green apples and anise. Sweet grist and malt loaf. Pebble beaches and more heather on the mid palate.
Timorous Beastie.name: Timorous Beastie
Timorous Beastie.notes: fruit, cinnamon, peat, bread, creamy, honey
Timorous Beastie.nose: Acacia honey, creamy boiled sweeties (the strawberry flavour), dried apricots and white grapes. There's a good whack of Sherry influence in here too! A whiff of coastal air and classic Highland heather, too.
Timorous Beastie.note categories: fruits, spice, earth, cereal, chocolate, feint
Timorous Beastie.description: Joining the ranks of Big Peat and Scallywag is Douglas Laing's Timorous Beastie, a blended malt made entirely of Highland whiskies from distilleries such as Dalmore, Glen Garioch, Glengoyne and more. The name is a nod to the Robert Burns poem 'To a Mouse' and to Burns' wit, as though the mouse in the poem is a timid little thing, this whisky is nothing of the sort!
